choices: Go to the left to see the other inmates
Take a shortcut through the darkside
Stow away on Lockette (she has laundry room duty today)
1.content:
It's been sixth months since you first came to the monster prison known as Under Gloom. Six long months. But it feels like you've been trapped for years. This prison was a living nightmare. For one, it was full of monsters that were all titanic, all of them were at least 300 feet tall and were all women. You couldn't stand monsters and this prison was unfair towards humans because eating humans wasn't considered a crime. Most humans that came here were either eaten by fellow inmates or by the guards.

You remember how you got into this awful mess. A mummy giantess, harmless to humans was hired to play the monster in a kaiju film being shot in your town and she had accidentally stepped on your car. You had a reputation in your town for getting into scraps with your neighbors for even the most minor things and couldn't take the monster mummy's accidental damage to your car laying down, tracked her down and set her skirt on fire. You remember her screaming as she was forced to take off her clothes and bandages.

Unfortunately for you, the giantess mummy pressed charges and you were sent to a prison near her home town of Fearfield. Under Gloom was nearly escape proof but that didn't mean you weren't going to try. At this moment, it was early in the morning, around three o'clock and your cell mate was still asleep. Lockette was a Loch Ness monster girl who unlike you was willing to serve her time. But you could not take another day in this nightmare room.

You were in the same cell as Lockette because most other monsters would've eaten you. Most monsters in Under Gloom preyed on humans. As such, the bars on the cell were designed to be so small that no human could get out. Not that it was necessary considering the bloodthirsty guards, but warden Destiny, that gargoyle hag, she didn't like taking chances, especially since you have tried to escape so many times, she hates you the most of any inmate in this prison.

But what the overgrown lawn ornament didn't know was that you had managed to wear away one of the bars on your cell from the back with one of Lockette's shed scales and were able to break it. "I told that hag I was going to get out of here." As you break down the bar, you realize you need a plan. You had to escape somehow. You needed a destination
1.title: Planning a Breakout

choices: Cornelia spots you before you can do anything
11.content:
You run to the left. There were some fellow inmates who might be of some use to you. They weren't carnivores. You don't think. Although you hate monsters, these ones might be of some use. "Now which one of these giant freaks can I trick into helping me escape.

There were four monsters down this hall that looked interesting. First was Ariel the gremlin. She was arrested for stripping machines of their parts and was always tinkering with whatever she could find in the prison in order to escape. At 300ft tall she was one of the shortest monsters in Under Gloom but she was very smart.

Second was Bebe, a cheshire cat girl who was in for jewel theft. She used to have a small hourglass figure, but she's been working out a lot and had a figure that put a heavyweight wrestler's to shame, but still looked female. Bebe was fond of humans and found you attractive, but you thought the idea of a human monster couple was disgusting. But you could probably coerce her into breaking out.

Then there was Priscilla, an orc sorceress who was arrested for impersonating a doctor. She was stilled in potions and elixirs but you didn't know where she'd get the material. But perhaps one of her spells could help you escape. They certainly didn't seem to be doing her much good.

Lastly there was Darcy the boggart, a green ghost that looked like she was made of gas with plants growing on her back. She did nothing but sit and zone out into space. You didn't even know what she was in for.

But there was one monster you didn't want to see you. Cornelia the argus, a silver skinned giantess with eyes all over her body. That girl was a squealer who reported any would be escapees to Destiny and you were the only one to know it. Last time you tried to escape by going down the trash chute and Cornelia ratted you out for a freakin' pizza. Destiny put you on tray cleaning duty for one month straight and it was all that hundred eyed snitch's fault.

You had to find an inmate to help you but you had to do it without Cornelia seeing you. But who do you check up on?
11.title: Fellow Inmates

111.content:
You then decided to go check up on Ariel, the tinkerer germlin. She seems to be a good one, even though none of her inventions worked at all, she knows how to invent. You then go into her room just before that son of a (BEEPING) bitch known as Cornelia spots you, and then you notice inside the room that a germlin is making something for her next escape plan. "Decided to go simple this time, pick the lock, then sneak on out of here."

"Hello?" you asked the germlin, and then she turns to see you. "Well I am impressed uh... Wade. How did you managed to get in here?" Ariel asked nicely just as she comes to you. "So, no luck escaping ha?" you replied to her.

"Yeah, guess crime doesn't pay out, but I shall be out of prison one day." the Germlin yells out with all of her determination to get out as fast as possible, and then she then tests her new invention to pick the lock of the door, but somehow the door is tight, and Ariel's invention broke. "CRAP!!!!!!!" Ariel yells in furstration. "Maybe you can help me escape and I can help you in return?" you asked her, and then for some crazy reason, she starts to laugh outloud.

"You think I am going to trust a human like you to escape?" Ariel mocked for a second and you are scared for a moment as you have no idea what she would do to you.
111.title: What a lucky day.

choices: "...throw me into the trash, I can be carried out."
"...Start a fight with one of the inmates or guards, it'll distract them."
"...Slip me into the showers, I can get down the drain there."
112.content:
You made your way down the alignment of cells, unnoticed, which was a good thing. You eventually reached the cell of the monster you were just thinking about, Bebe. The bars to other cells were big enough just for you to slip through easily, and you enter her cell. She was sitting on the ground doing push-ups, her toned body rippling with each movement.

"Bebe!" You whispered, but you doubted she heard you, the cheshire girl was in the zone.

"Bebe!" You repeated, a little louder this time. Still, no reply from her.

"BEBE!!!" This time you shouted, and her cat ears perked up. She stopped doing push-ups, now standing up to her full 400 foot-tall height of pure muscle and fur, making you feel very intimidated and small. She turned around, her giant footpaws pounding against the ground in her movement before she looked down.

"...Wade?"

"Yes." You said, looking quite annoyed as you crossed your arms. Her wide eyes immediately lit up with cheer as she bent down and licked you, purring the entire time. "Wade! How did you get out of your cell?"

"Long story, pussycat. I just need your help for the rest of my breakout."

"You're trying again?"

You nodded.

"And you need my help?" She sounded absolutely ecstatic.

"....Yes." You said with a sigh. "Look, I need you to..."
112.title: Bebe the buff cheshire cat

choices: Bebe misses and tosses you into an unknown cell
Destiny comes in and catches you
1121.content:
Bebe lets out a purr and gives an uneasy look. "I don't know about that Wade. You tried to escape through the trash before remember? It didn't work." "But this time," you mutter. "Nobody knows about it but the two of us. That garbage chute over there is my ticket out of this horrible place." Bebe considers this and then wags her tail. "But if I throw you down there I might not ever see you again, and you lasted a lot longer than all my other human friends in here. I don't want you to leave me."

Bebe presses you tight against her abs and you let out a grunt. This pussycat was too attached to you, like a cat that wouldn't go away. But you knew exactly what to say to get the cheshire cat giantess to go along with it. "Don't worry Bebe," I said. "Once the guards realize I've escaped, they'll be looking elsewhere, I'll sneak into leather lips' office and steal the key to get that collar off of you." Bebe tugged on the collar Destiny fitted on her, the one that prevented her from turning invisible like the rest of her species. Even with her enhanced strength she couldn't break it.

She then lets out a purr and rubs you against her cheek much to your disgust. "Good luck," she says. "I'll try my best." Bebe steps out and reached her hand out in between the bars of her cell and swings it around with you in her hand. You have to crouch down to avoid getting dizzy but you give a smug smile. You managed to trick that dumb muscle cat girl into helping you. Bebe then tosses you and you get ready to escape down the trash chute.

But is you plan successful?
1121.title: Trashed

choices: The chute takes you down deeper into a new area...
11211.content:
With a powerful toss befitting her muscular form, Bebe successfully sent you flying through the air, and you flew with style, arms flailing and everything. In your line of dizzied vision, you look forward, the wide mouth of the garbage chute swallowing you up quickly into the darkness. Yes! You were out of here! You free-falled through the wide chute, the smell of garbage everywhere, even some of it stuck to the side.

So what happens next?
11211.title: Down the Chute

choices: A secret prisoner, one so large and powerful a mountain had to be built on her
An underground city of ghoul and skeleton monsters
112112.content:
Where does it lead to?

(The first option is up to Spiral-And-Twist to decide)
112112.title: The chute takes you down deeper into a new area...

choices: Empousa, a demigoddess monster that was part goat and had vampiric traits
1121121.content:
You fell for the longest time, but t hings began to get...stranger. The smell of garbage began to be replaced with the smell of decay and something very, very old. It seemed to get darker, and the temperature took a significant drop, making you shiver. Eventually you landed in a pile of rotten food and discarded trash the prison had thrown out. You rolled out of it until you hit solid ground, the feeling of rock underneath your boots.

"...Where am I?" You ask yourself, your voice echoing all around. This place was new. Was it part of Under Gloom? It appeared to be a cave, massive in scope and size, the occasional sound of water dripping somewhere and the echo of your footsteps the only noise. Great, just great. You had somehow ended up even deeper underground! How would you ever get out now? You couldn't climb back up the chute, it was too slippery to even get a foothold. You guessed you would have to explore this cave for an exit. It has to lead somewhere, right?

You began walking, each step taking you deeper and deeper into the seemingly bottomless pit, and you couldn't quite shake the feeling that you were being watched. The air was filled with a creeping terror, one that made your skin crawl and gave you a feeling that you were not safe, not at all.

Finally, you ran into something. It was ridiculously huge, a giant wall that somewhat felt like skin, scales, and fur at the same time. At your touch, the wall moved, and you jumped back. It wasn't a wall, it was a massive fingertip, one that dwarfed even the tallest monster in Under Gloom. What had you stumbled upon?!
1121121.title: The Darkest of Depths

11211211.content:
“What’s this? Dinner?”

You grasped your ears in pain, reeling from the powerful feminine voice as it shook the cavern about you. Your ears still ringing, you slowly looked up the gargantuan fingertip and followed it to its source.

“Disrespectful insects. Do they really expect to fill me up on something so puny? I can barely see it.”

Your ears rang once again, but you continued to look up, wishing you hadn’t.

Sitting cross-legged before you was a…. well giant didn’t do respect. What term could apply to something that dwarfed Destiny herself?

You looked up, and up, and up. The titan (no that still didn’t do justice) had goat legs and hands covered in fur that spanned what must have been several football fields.

“What is it anyway? Some kind of tick? Too small to be an insect. Let’s take a closer look.”

You grip your ears yet again. Turn it down you colossal bitch, you scream in your head. However, you dare not say it out loud as you are awestruck by the face leaning down over you and filling your entire field of view and beyond.

The lower half of the colossus is doubtless goat. But the face is almost human. And stunning! A pale face with serene sapphire eyes that seemed to sparkle as they squinted at you. Her hair was long, messy and unkempt, like yours. However, her hair, like her eyes was blue in color. It was probably the most beautiful face you’ve ever seen and had you seen her in a bar at your own size, you would be all over her in a heartbeat.

But she wasn’t your size. She wasn’t human. And this wasn’t a bar. You were miles under the most awful prison known to monsters and human alike, trapped with the single largest monster you had ever seen. Her fingernails and pupils dwarfed any monster in the prison. And if she could stand in the cavern, instead of forced to sit, she may very well be larger than Under Gloom itself. And from what you could make of her dialogue, she was expecting dinner. Which at the moment, meant you.

“What a strange little thing. It appears to walk on two legs like a monster, but it’s much too small for that.”

The mighty beast sighed and reared back up to her cross-legged position. You could no longer see her face, hidden by the swell of her breasts under her ripped robe.

“Well, beggars can’t be choosers, I suppose. Even a demigoddess. Come here little morsel.”

The ground under you shook as her vast hand literally went under the tiny portion of rock upon which you stood and rose into the sky with you in the center of her palm. You fell to the ground and were pressed down against her flesh from the speed at which you were being lifted. You gritted your teeth, and shut your eyes, trying not to black out.

When you finally stopped, you opened your eyes and found yourself staring into her eye, looking down on you cowering in her palm. The look in that eye appeared almost pitiful. She had you totally in her power and she knew it.

“Before you become part of me little insect, I would know one thing.” At least she was whispering now, though that still hurt his lobes a little. “What are you? In all my time here, I have never received a meal so unfilling.”

The hand lowered down in front of her cavernous mouth. To your horror, her teeth were pointed and sharp fangs, reminding you that for her beauty, she was not human. A massive tongue licked her lips, anticipating your insertion.

Shit. Shit. Shit. What could you do? You had no possible means to fight back. Hiding from Cree was bad enough, but you couldn’t hide from this giant lady. All you could do was talk.

“I’m uh… I’m Wade.”

Even at your size, your voice echoed throughout the cavern, allowing her to hear you. It came out as a frightened squeak. Understandable given your predicament.

“Wade? What is a Wade? I’ve never heard of such a species. Are all Wades so small?”

“Err, no…. ma’am. My name is Wade. I’m a human. And we’re all this size.”

“A human? I am still unfamiliar with such animals. I saw no such insects when I had my freedom.”

“We uh… we made contact with the monster world about 5 centuries ago. Surely….”

“Ah. Now I see. You are a new addition to the society those insects above have formed. Tell me, how do you fare amongst the rest of the rabble? Surely it is a constant struggle, forever on the run, forever hunted. Remarkable any of you remain.”

You smile at the thought that someone could consider the monsters above insects.

“Well there are monsters who do try to eat us, but some of us live among them in the open.”

Truth is, you hated pretty much all monsters with few exceptions, but if you were fully honest right now, that could get you eaten that much sooner.

“You find ways to live together?” The giant half goat lady raised an eyebrow and smirked. “Quite hard to believe. I would love to see that.”

“How have you not seen that? I mean, how long have you been in here?”

She pursed her massive lips.

“Unknown. I lost count. All I know is it has been over 2,000 years.”

You gasped in shock.

“What? How is that possible? I mean. You look way too good to be that old!”

You quickly blushed as you realized what had come out of your mouth. But it was too late to take it back. Fortunately, she didn’t seem to mind.

“My mother was for all accounts a goddess. Or so I’ve heard. I never knew her. But I was seen as such by all, revered, and feared for my size, my strength, and my agelessness. I lived for centuries even before I was betrayed and eventually imprisoned here. This mountain and the prison of Under Gloom were built atop to imprison me. Every now and then, they’ll throw down some poor soul who I can drain. But the nerve of them to send one so small and feeble to satisfy me! If I could see them face to face….”

“Woah, woah. Hang on. They didn’t send me. I’m not food!”

“To me everything is food, micro man. Why else would you be here?”

“I…” You began to panic as her hand brought you closer to her maw. “Wait. Drain?”

“Yes, drain. I drain their blood.”

“Like... like a vampire?”

“Yes. Like a vampire. Although given my size, I usually end up chewing them. Or, if they’re small enough,” she licked her lips again. “Down the hatch. Alive and screaming.”

“Oh, no.” Your knees began to wobble. You gave up all attempts at acting brave and fell to your knees with tears, your hands clasped in prayer to the living goddess. “Please! Look, I wasn’t sent down here. I just wanted to escape Under Gloom. Please! I’m a prisoner, like you!”

She pulled back her hand and raised you before her eye again. She looked down upon you as you sat down on your knees, sobbing.

“A prisoner? You? How does such a teeny tiny man end up in an all-female prison populated by such “large” monsters?” She smirked when she said large.

“I uh... I set a mummy on fire.”

She stared at you for some time, before laughing, her voice shaking the entire cavern and causing rocks to fall from the ceiling. You stumbled about and actually fell off the side of her hand.

You screamed as you fell through the air, eventually landing on top of a soft bouncy surface. You looked around and up at the goddess’ face. As she stared down at you and laughed again, you blushed as you realized where you had landed.

The creature leaned forward, continuing to laugh as you fell forward onto her palm again. She looked down at you in her hand, rested on her knee, while you craned your head up at her face far above. Higher than skyscrapers.

“Perhaps you are unfit to be food.”

“Yes! Yes! I’m far too small!” You shouted, abandoning all pride.

“Hmmm. Yes, you are. Far too insignificant. I doubt you even did what you claim. Something like you setting fire to a mummy? Absurd.”

“Yes! I’m harmless! Pathetic! I can’t do anything!” You felt your last semblance of pride slip away as she appeared to nod.

“Very well, insect. You get to live. For now. But you are the only company I have had in all this time. I expect you to remain entertaining.”

“Err, right. Of course! I can be engaging!” You gave a fake smile, hoping to hide your fear.

“Oh, and insect? Call me Empousa.”

Dear god, you thought. Please get me out of here.
11211211.title: Empousa, a demigoddess monster that was part go...

11212.content:
As you fly through the air, you think that you are finally going to be able to escape from Under Gloom once and for all. "Stupid cat," you think to yourself. "Like I'm really going to come back for that lovesick moron. Once I'm down the chute, it's smooth sailing from here on in." That's what you think but unfortunately, you are tossed too high and hit the wall above the trash chute with a grunt. You land on the floor where an oblivious Icy comes by with a broom and pushes you down the hallway right before Cree comes walking by and unknowingly kicks you into the air. You yell before you bounce off of Clover's trunk as the grootslang bends over. While you're flying through the air, you are heading back to your own cell when you see Destiny walk by. The gargoyle giantess bends over to take a look into your cell and you bounce off of the gargoyle's rump before you land with a crash in another cell.

You hit the floor and struggle to get up. You moan in pain because it was a rather nasty fall. You step a few feet forward and then you yell because you fall through a hole too small to matter much to a monster but big enough for you to fall through. You fall into a new jail cell on the next floor down and give a groan. "Drat!" you yell before wincing in pain. "I can't believe it! I'm stuck in another jail cell! Thanks a lot Bebe!" That's when you look around and realize that this cell is surprisingly dark. You give a deep gulp. "Oh no." You say.

Just your luck that you happened to land in a Dark Side cell. Those were the cells that were used to hold the worst criminals that committed the most atrocious and terrifying crimes. They had no hope of ever getting out of Under Gloom and were generally destructive and nasty. Mariah, Ursula, Yuri, Arethusa and Persephone. All five of the Dark Siders you knew about were evil to the core and wouldn't hesitate to devour any human unlucky or stupid enough to stumble into their cell. However, this was a part of the Dark Side that was on a different level, which meant there were outlaws here you had never seen before. All you knew for sure is that you didn't want to be here for when whoever lives here wakes up.

Unfortunately, as you run towards the cell door, you ache in pain because you hadn't fully healed from your fall. To make matters worse, you hear footsteps. The Dark Sider you have never met before had awoken from her sleep and was looking down on you. But who was she?
11212.title: The Unknown Cell

choices: "Sorry kitty, but I need to get back to my cell."
1122.content:
Bebe considers your request for a moment before saying "But if you escape, I''ll never see you again. Plus, even if you manage to get outside, there's still the matter of getting down the mountain. Did you even think of that?"

You mentally kick yourself. You had been so focused on getting outside the prison, that you never thought of the next step of your plan. You didn't really care about never seeing Bebe again. As far as you're concerned, she's just a tool.

"Tell you what." Says Bebe "How about we both escape together? Tomorrow at breakfast, I'll start a riot to distract the guards, then we'll break into Destiny's office, and steal the key to this damned collar. Once we do that, I'll put you in my pocket and turn invisible, then we just walk out the front door unnoticed. I'll climb down the mountain with you, and we're home free!"

You have to give Bebe some credit. That was a pretty clever plan. Why hadn't you thought of that. You were still disgusted by the thought of being together with her, but you could always ditch her once you get back to the human world. "Alright kitten, you got a deal."

You turn to go back to your cell, but Bebe blocks your path with her hand. "Wade, um, would you mind spending the night with me?" You really don't want to sleep with Bebe, but if you refuse, she might not help you escape. What do you do?
1122.title: I Have a Better Idea

11221.content:
You really don't want to spend the night with this lovesick pussycat, but it's not like you have much of a choice. You let out a groan. “Alright. But only until the plan is put in action.” Bebe lets out a squee and presses you against her abs as you grunt in pain. “Great,” you think to yourself. “All will be well until Demona sees that I’m not in my cell and throws another one of her hissy fits.” Then again, you still have no choice and are forced to sleep on a pile of Bebe’s shed, purple and pink fur in the corner of the prison cell. However, once you fall asleep, Bebe opens one eye and reveals that she was wide awake.

Bebe springs up with catlike tread and giggles to herself. “Oh goodie,” says the Cheshire cat giantess. “He’s asleep. Now that I have him, I’m going to insure that I have him forever.” Bebe holds out her hand and sprouts her retractable claws in order to slit her mattress before she reached inside and took out a strange magenta potion contained in a vial shaped like an hourglass. Bebe let out a sigh as she held up the potion. “I was waiting to use this potion until I got out, but oh well.”

 The potion in question was a potion created by Priscilla using materials she had managed to smuggle into the prison under the guards’ and Destiny’s nose. It was a potion created that would make the drinker more desirable to members of the opposite sex by altering their body and coating them with a very powerful pheromone. Priscilla intended to use it in order to seduce one of the guards into allowing her to escape. However, she forgot that all the guards in the prison were female and the only one she knew was gay was already married and was forced to abandon the plan. Since Priscilla had no use for the potion, she sneaked it to Bebe in the prison cafeteria and the Cheshire giantess was saving it for when she finally had Wade in her clutches.

“Now,” said Bebe. “To remember what Priscilla told me about this potion. She said that it was extremely powerful and I should only take enough of it to... Oh heck. I finally have the man I want and there's no way that I'm letting him get away now." Bebe uncorks the vial and sniffs the pink smoke that comes out, causing her eyes to widen and dilate. "Oh my," says Bebe. "Pungent stuff. That must mean it will work. Bottoms up." Bebe put the vial to the mouth and begun to drink it as if it were soda pop. However, she had to stop and put the potion away when she heard footsteps. Destiny was walking by doing the rounds. Fortunately for Bebe, Destiny paid her no heed.

"That was close," thought Bebe to herself. "Now for... whoa..." Bebe grunted and held her chest as her prison uniform was starting to tear apart. She was growing bigger at a rapid rate and smiled as she saw her sleeves disintegrate. "Oh yes. Ooh!" Bebe's breasts begun to bounce and shake as they were getting bigger and rounder. The same could be said for her rear end that was growing so large that it pressed against the bars of the cell and started to bend them while at the same time pushing up her hair. Bebe was smiling from cheek to cheek as the cell bars bent.

The sound woke you up and before you could say a single word, you look up and see that Bebe's breasts and butt cheeks would weigh as much as anvils at this point and that Bebe herself was now...
11221.title: Bebe Thinks Big

choices: The plan goes off without a hitch, and you go down the drain
Bebe doesn't want to give you up
Somebody else in the showers notices you
1123.content:
Bebe purred even louder, almost giggling. "Oh Wade, you just want to see me out of my prison uniform and my fur wet."

You mentally gagged, but kept it inside. "Uhh...yeah. That's a bonus perk, pussycat."

If a giant cheshire cat could blush, you knew she would be right now. You had this escape in the bag.

"Alright Wade...I'll help you out." Bebe reached up and placed you atop of her head, motioning for you to hide in the thick fur of her ears. You did so, and waited.

"Guards!" Bebe called out, tapping on her iron bars, specifically reinforced to match her great strength. "I would like to head to the showers, I need a little cat bath." One of the guards grunted and opened up her cell, escorting her, and unknowingly you, to the showers.
1123.title: "...Slip me into the showers"

choices: In another drain where Destiny is surprised to see you there.
11231.content:
“Oh fuck yeah, I am now getting out of here.” You said with pure excitement as your plan actually worked. With Bebe with you, this plan is sure to completely work, and it did. You are being escorted to the shows. Bebe knew that this was great for you, as now, you will be able to escape back into the real world and get your life completely back. “Oh yeah!” you said to yourself.

The monsters escorts Bebe to the showers, and it seems like any normal shower area for prisoners as you can expect. You got the towels, you got the timer, you got all that other crap, and then the guards leave her alone. Right after the guards left, Bebe then grabs you from her head, and brings you to the ground. You couldn’t believe it right before your very eyes, you were about to finally escape prison. Just as the guards leave, Bebe opens the drain for you, and then she proceeds to tell you this. “It worked, just use the water to guide you out of the prison, see ya.” Bebe said, and then you slide on the water and prepare for the ride of your life as you now go down into the drain just as Bebe showers herself.

It was a pure thrill ride in the drain, you are riding on a stream of water as you race through the pipelines in a fast speed. “OH YEAH… I AM OUT OF PRISON FOR GOOD BITCHES!!!!!!!!!!!!!!” you screamed out in pure thrill just as you ride the water waves all the way down. It was a pure ride, the adrenaline of the speed of which you go through the pipeline was incredible, and you had pretty good skills on evading obstacles, so it was even easier for you, but one things for sure, you are now finally out of here, and that is a thank god thank for sure.

But the question is, where do you end up?
11231.title: Hasta las vista prison!

choices: Octavia the Kraken, in for Counterfeiting
Clair the Wyvern, in for Assault
112312.content:
You fall out of the pipeline and land in what appears to be a giant sink with a big splash. "What the?!" yells a familiar voice. "Oh no!" you yell. You look up to see Warden Destiny washing dishes and from the look on her face she's surprised and angry to see you.

You inhale deeply and try to swim down the drain only to find out that it's plugged. You try pulling the drain plug but the enormous gargoyle warden reaches in with her clawed fingernails. She gives you a glare before gritting her teeth. "I don't know how you got out of your cell Wade," says the titanic warden. "Or how you got in my sink, but you're in a lot of trouble." "Blah, blah, blah," you mutter. "Get a life Demona."

Destiny squeezes you and you let out a weak scream as she nearly crushes your lungs. "This is the 38th time you've tried to escape. Perhaps I'm the one doing something wrong. I think I'll move you up one level, new guards, new inmates, and even more difficult for you to escape."

You gulp as Destiny takes you up to the next level in Under Gloom above your own. One of the guards is a a purple ogre girl who is sleeping on the job before Destiny lets out a hiss to wake her up. "Oh!" yells the ogress. "Warden Sirtis, I..." "That's the sixth time I caught you sleeping on the job this week Odette," says Destiny in a warning tone. "You seem to forget how fragile this job is. I've got the most troublesome prisoner in all of Under Gloom ready for his new cellmate.

Odette salutes Destiny before Destiny walks up to a cell and glares. "I feel sorry for Lockette," says Destiny. "It must've been hard for her to have a cellmate like you. I hope this new one can handle you." Destiny tosses you into the cell with a grunt and then you look up to see your new cellmate.

Question is... who is she?
112312.title: Escape Failed

choices: Give you a potion that makes you invisible.
Cast a spell that makes you even smaller, easier to slip out unnoticed.
Transform you into the warden for a few minutes.
113.content:
One of the inmates came to mind, Priscilla. You had very little interaction with her before, but you knew she was pretty handy with spells and potions, that's what winded her up in this joint. Perhaps her knowledge of such could aid in your escape?

You carefully made your way down the hall towards her cell, slipping in unnoticed. You had always been good at sneaking around. The orc giantess was sitting on her thin mattress in the corner, grumbling to herself in her sleep. A table sat on the other side of the room, but it was too high up for you to see if there was anything on it. You approached the bed and climbed it, reaching Priscilla's pale face and jabbing her in the nose. Her giant eye flickered open to stare down at you, annoyed.

"Wade." She boomed, nearly blowing you away with her voice. "The only human in this rothole. What do you want, disturbing my sleep?"

"I need your help gettin' outta here, Priscilla." You said, hopping off the bed to the floor so you wouldn't get crushed by her movements. She got up, slamming both feet down beside you, towering overhead.

"And why would I help you?"

"Because...I can get you out too. Once I'm out, I'll send some of my boys to come back and help you." You lied right through your teeth. You severely doubted there was even a human team that would dare step foot in here.

"..."

"C'mon, you can trust me."

"...Alright." She knelt down, lifting up her matress carefully and discreetly, making sure no guards were patrolling outside. A whole stash of herbs, spices, potion bottles, and glowing runes greeted you.

"I've been smuggling in some supplies. I could scrounge together something to help you."

Priscilla can...
113.title: Priscilla, the orc sorceress

1131.content:
Priscilla grabs together a few herbs and spices and mixes them together. "Okay Wade," she says. "I'm going to make an invisibility potion. It will make you invisible just long enough to escape from this rathole." "Well hurry up and make the potion already!" you yell impatiently. The potion bubbles as Priscilla picks out some more herbs. "Patience, Wade," she says. "This is delicate work. Rushing the potion could have a different effect than dis..." Priscilla accidentally spills some sap into the potion and causes it to let out a flash of smoke.

You both cough before the smoke clears and then you hear a sound of claws scraping the floor. "What the hell was that kooky noise!?" yells a familiar voice. You let out a scream. "Cree!" you yell. Priscilla gives a nervous look and starts adding the ingredients more rapidly, causing the potion to bubble. "Oh crap," she mutters. "Oh crap, oh crap! If Cree sees this stash, our goose is cooked." "Hurry! Hurry! Hurry!" You yell.

Priscilla holds the potion as it keeps leaking out bubbles and turns pitch black. "Oh crap." She says. "Wade, I'm not sure if this invisible potion will even work." "Just hurry up and pour it on me!" you yell. "I do not want to see what a were hyena looks like from the inside." You hear evil laughter and then you look to see a hyena shaped shadow approaching.

Acting fast, Priscilla spills the potion all over you and makes you gag and spit out some of it. Suddenly you feel your body twitching. This was it, hopefully you'd be invisible, just in time for Cree to show up!
1131.title: Notion of the Potion

11312.content:
Looking down at yourself as the effects of the potion take hold, you expected to be unable to see your own body, but you were stunned to see that you were still visible! What was more, you felt an odd weight on your back and at the base of your spin.

"Damnit!" you shout, your wings flaring angrily.

Wait...wings?!

Needing a look at yourself, you stare at your reflection in one of the empty potion bottles and your jaw dropped. You were horrified to see that your hands had changed into four-taloned fingers, your legs end in three-taloned toes, and a long prehensile tail. Your hair was now white, your eyes were red with a pure white iris and pupil, your skin had turned a dark purple/indigo shade, and you had large, bat-like wings coming from your back that had pale lilac membranes.

You were a...a...

NO!

You'd been turned into a monster! And not just ANY monster, but the one you hated most: a gargoyle!

This couldn't be true! That damned orc! She'd...! DAMNIT! You glare up at Priscilla, you're too outranged to even speak. You duck behind one of the legs of Priscilla's bed, feeling she deserved WHATEVER Cree did to her.

Speaking of...

"Well, well, well...what do we have here? Contraband magics?! You are SO in trouble!" Cree's voice cackled and you heard the cell door open and Priscilla backed up in terror as you heard knuckles cracking and Cree stepped into the cell.

"NO! PLEASE, NO!" the orc wailed as Cree laughed before you heard a loud crashing sound. You dared to peak out from your hiding spot and saw that the Werehyena had knocked Priscilla to the ground and was looming over her and raised her foot to start stomping.

You sneered. Dumb orc deserved it for turning you into a monster. You tried to carefully sneak out of the cell, but kept tripping over your new tail. As you heard the sound of Pricilla's bones--most likely her ribs--you freeze.

Why did you feel so...guilty?

She was a monster, furthermore, the orc had turned you into one yourself! But..as you see the alarm button above you on the wall opposite the cells, you start thinking that you can't beat Cree in a straight up fight, but you had a feeling about who could.

Gah! You shake your head. This wasn't like you! But you were already moving. Your new claws and strength easily punctured the wall and you climbed up it hand and foot like a ladder...huh, if you didn't hate gargoyles so much, you'd be glad this was so useful...until you reach the underside of the alarm and slash a hole in the bottom and climb into it.

It takes you a few risky minutes and attempts but eventually....

BRRRRRIIIIINNNNNGGGGGG!

Gah! You clamp your clawed hands to your ears as the alarm went off, alerting to gards to rush to this section of the prison. You thrash in agony from the massive noise and fall through the hole you made and crash to the floor, your skull ringing and leaving you disoriented.

Over the alarm, you hear Cree's voice shout "SHIT!"

A huge figure swoops over you and through the halls and quickly lands in front of Priscilla's cell. You can't hear what was being said but as your hearing started coming back a little, you hear outraged shouting.

"Planting contraband in the cells to have an excuse to beat on the prisoners?! Cree! That's IT!" a voice you knew better than anyone shouted and then the sounds of a struggle and then the rest of the prison staff arrive.

"...Belladonna! get your butt in gear and paralyze Cree with your stinger already!" Destiny grunts.

A short scuffle later, a poisoned and immobilized werehyena is dragged off and Icy, the new girl harpy, is carrying Priscilla towards Under Gloom's medical ward.

By the time they pass, you were feeling well enough to stand and walk, even though your head hurt and made seeing straight almost impossible and your wings feel a little funny from your crashing...must have landed on them when you hit the floor...

As you stumble through the hall, almost drunkenly, you hear Destiny ranting furiously to herself, even as you make out a massive, blurry, cyan object making its way towards you. "...Corruption and officer brutality, in my prison...! Of all the...! URAGH! I won't stand for it! Cree was supposed to be a deterrent! Scare the inmates into obeying the prison rules, but she's a damned sadistic loose cannon!...What I wanna know is why the alarm went off..." Destiny muttered.

Destiny's foot comes down and you flinch. The good news is that she didn't squish you, the bad news: you were stuck between her talons.

"...Huh? What was that?!" you hear the voice of your nemesis say from above you
11312.title: Gag-goyle

113121.content:
You struggle to get out from between Destiny's toes as the gargoyle giantess lowered her head and raises her foot to eye level. "Huh?" asks Destiny. "What is that?" Destiny takes two of her clawed fingers and pulls you out from between her toes as you grunt. Destiny raises you up to her enormous eye and looks at you in surprise. "What the...?! That's has got to be...." Suddenly Destiny's eyes widen and you notice she gets a dizzy look on her face.

You fold your wings in an attempt to hide your face, hoping Destiny wouldn't recognize you. This was not a good day. First you got turned into the one critter you hate the most and now the person who hates you the the most and vice versa has you in her hands. What did you do to deserve this? Besides all the stuff you did that is.

But then suddenly Destiny smiles lustfully at you and does the one thing that you never expected to see her do... she smiled. And what made it more frightening was that it wasn't a malicious smile. The only thing scarier than mad Destiny is not-mad Destiny when she should be mad Destiny.

Destiny instead lets out a lustful growl and you look down to see her tail shaking. "Why, hello there," your nemesis says. "I don't recall seeing you around Fearfield." That's when it hit you and your jaw drops as you feel like you're gonna have a heart attack. Was Destiny in love with you! Not possible. Even if you were a gargoyle now, Destiny HATES men. You heard after her previous boyfriend left her after impregnating her, she became a burning misandrist, which is probably why she has such an awful temper. That potion must've contained gargoyle pheromones. That settled it, you were in hell.

"I'm Destiny by the way," says Destiny as she smiles down at you. "What's your name little man?" Well, you could go with Thailog given that you look like him now, but you highly doubt that's a real name among monsters. You needed to think fast. "Uh," you say nervously. "I'm... I'm Lennox." Destiny smiles at that. "How Shakespearian. I like it." You let out a sigh of relief. This was a nightmare. You'd rather be eaten by Cree or Clover than have to endure this.

"Say," says Destiny. "You're rather small for a gargoyle. I have a niece whose undersized but at least she's the size of a monster. I've never seen a human-sized gargoyle before." You let out a gulp, but Destiny smiles and shrugs her shoulders. "It doesn't matter. I like what I see." You're now very afraid. What if she kisses you? You'd take Belladonna's poison over that anyway. You're screwed.

Suddenly, Belladonna's voice comes out. "Destiny!" she yells. "There's something weird with this alarm." Destiny grits her teeth. "Damn that Belladonna. She really knows how to ruin a moment. Sorry Lennox. I gotta check this out." Then she smiles lustfully that scares you. "But I know where to keep you until then."

With that Destiny places you in her...
113121.title: Ironic Hell

choices: You head out for the hall
1132.content:
"Alright..." Priscilla said after some time examining the materials in front of her, tapping her chin. "I believe I have just enough juice left in the ol' wand to cast a spell on you."

You looked up at her worriedly. "What kind of spell?" You asked cautiously.

"One that can get you outta here in no time." The female orc reached into the pile and pulled out what appeared to be just a long twig, but you knew it was anything but. Most objects in the monster were much more than they appeared on the surface. You believed that to be her wand.

"Here's what I was thinking," Priscilla went up, tapping her wand against the floor, sending a small shower of magical sparks flying. "I cast a miniaturization spell upon you. I've seen that being small has helped you survive so far in here, so being smaller will help you sneak out. I was thinking possibly like a grain of sand, or even a speck of dust would work."

"Wait a minute, hold the phone! You want to shrink me?! I'm already toy-sized compared to you giant monsters!"

"A toy can still be spotted. But don't worry, the spell has a time limit. In 24 hours, you'll be your normal, human-sized self and out in the free world in no time."

"...fine."

"Alright." Priscilla raised the wand over your hand and began to twirl it slowly, muttering words underneath her breath. "Man of flesh and bone, to be free from the stone, smaller ye must be, barely able to be seen...."

Finally Priscilla tapped you on the head with the tip of the wand, sending a magical course of energy to surge through your body. You could feel it, as if it was almost a tingling wave. When you opened your eyes, you found the world around you to be growing, but you knew it was the exact opposite. Priscilla in front of you, already huge, seemed to be expanding to titanic heights.

You eventually stopped when the dirt gathered on the floor seemed as big as boulders to you.
1132.title: Down You Go

choices: She goes back on her word
She has a plan to get you out
11321.content:
Suddenly a shadow came over you, two monumental fingertips that blotted out the sky descending at a rapid pace. You found yourself pinched between the two walls of skin, being raised miles and miles into the air, only to meet Priscilla's gargantuan eye that enacted like the sun itself.

"Impressive." She boomed, her voice even more thunderous than before, forcing you to cover your ears.

"You're barely a speck. I did pretty good on that spell, even if I was a bit rusty from being in here."

"Blah,blah,blah. Just get me outta here now!" You shouted up.
11321.title: Priscilla picks you up

choices: She flicks you off her finger and into the halls
113211.content:
"Hm? Oh, yes. About that. I may have told you a little fib."

"What?!" you shouted to her.

The orc sat her colossal behind on the side of her bed, making it creak loudly.

"The good news is you're going to be much more durable at this size. You'll actually be able to survive things you couldn't at your normal height. The bad news is that I lied about this wearing off in 24 hours. You're going to be stuck this size. Permanently."

"WHAT THE HELL?!"

Priscilla rolled her eyes. "Come on, Wade. "Bring back a human team to break me out?" Do you really think I'm that stupid? Consider this your punishment for trying to deceive me. And for interrupting my sleep. Good luck escaping."

You fumed so angrily that steam could've come out of your ears. "Now you listen hear you bloated, disgusting stupid sorceress! You turn me back to my normal height right this instance or I swear I will devote every waking moment of my life to making your existence a living nightmare! Fix me you fat sack of garbage! You festering pile of waste!"

Priscilla smiled in amusement at your ineffectual threats coming out as tiny squeaks.

"Well, if you're going to be like that," she said...
113211.title: She goes back on her word

1132111.content:
"I'll just have to remind you of your place in life."

"What are you talking about? My place is-" Your voice caught in your throat as she reached down with her free hand and removed her pants.

She grinned maliciously and lowered her hand with you in the center down to her now exposed nether regions. You gazed in shock and awe at the entrance to her nether regions, sprawled out before your speck of a body.

"What do you think? I can't send you back to your old prison or Destiny will have my head. Not a bad replacement, eh? Especially considering your deceit."

"Wait. Wait. No! Stop!"

"Sorry dear. I can't hear you. You're just too small now. That's ok. I don't need to hear you. Only feel you."

She began lowering you towards the massive hole, pushing you through the field of bush through to the fleshy epicenter.

You screamed and kicked and clawed as best you could, but to no avail. She forced you in with no effort on her part.

Priscilla let out a mighty sigh as she put you in your new prison. She gave a little shake and gasped in pleasure when she felt your tiny body shake about.

"Well, who would have thought it. Even at that size, I can still feel you Wade. Guess you're good for something after all, huh?"

She laid back in her bed and grinned at the thought of what you were going through.

"Get used to it darling. From this point on, you're mine for the rest of your "short" life." She giggled at her pun and laid down to sleep.

You on the other hand could do anything but sleep in your hot moist prison. You may have shrunk, but the fire that drove you remained as hot as ever. Your smaller size and increased durability may prove useful in escaping Under Gloom, but you had to get out of here before Priscilla woke up.
1132111.title: She keeps you for herself

choices: She slips you into her cleavage and heads for the yard
She'll sneak you onto a passing guard
113212.content:
"Calm down, you'll get out...as long as you promise to back me up later." She threatened, now all the more intimidating with her vaster and grander size.

You gulped. "Yeah...sure. Got any plans?"

"..."
113212.title: She has a plan to get you out

1132122.content:
Priscilla grinned, her lips curling upwards across Wades entire field of vision. "Why did I agree to this..." he muttered to himself, struggling to stand on top of the oily surface of Priscilla's stadium-like finger. Simply waltzing out of here was not an option. He'd need a ride. "So, Priscilla, what are we-"

"Your ride's here." she says, her hot breath washing over you as you struggle to turn around to face your 'ride', not entirely sure what she means by ride until you notice her fingers are primed for a big flick. "Wait, Priscilla, don't, please-" and in an instant, your world is out of control as you soar through the unimaginably tall bars out towards whoever you have the misfortune of being forced to ride with. As Priscilla's chuckles fill the air, you re-orient yourself as you begin to descend towards your target and realize you're falling towards...
1132122.title: She'll sneak you onto a passing guard

11321221.content:
You look down in your shrunken form and gasp. You could see a reddish pink forest atop a light blue mountain. The only monster that could be was Warden Destiny herself. "Oh no!" you think to yourself. That was the worst possible monster you could land on. You flail your hands as you go down, but then you realize something. You were shrunken to the size of a speck of dust. Destiny was already titanic seeing as she was the biggest monster in the entire prison. There's no way she'd see you.

But right now you look down and see that Destiny is dressed in a rather skimpy outfit typical for a gargoyle and as you come down, the gargoyle goddess is bending over and leaning to inspect a cell.

It is at this moment you land in Destiny's...
11321221.title: It Must Be Destiny

choices: ...her office, in the center of the prison. Crap.
...towards your cell to check on you. Double crap!
113212211.content:
As you look down at the ginormous Gargoyle that you wished you'd have been able to avoid, you finally realize where you're headed. Just your luck that Destiny decided to wear a revealing outfit today. You're not sure if you should scream in joy or pure terror...probably terror. As you land with a thud, bouncing off the surface as if it were made of rubber, you struggle to stabilize yourself as you began uncontrollably tumbling down her "hills"...although "mountains" would be a more apt term, all things considered.

Meanwhile, far, far above you, Destiny snaps upwards to the sound of Priscilla's laughter, as she struggles to contain herself. "Hey! What's so funny, prisoner?" she barked, her movements causing you much more trouble down below, as Priscilla began laughing even harder, covering her mouth in an attempt to stop but failing miserably. Destiny just shook her head and began walking away, the sounds of the laughter growing even more distant. What did that Orc find so hilarious? Whatever the case, Destiny couldn't bother trying to figure it out. She had much more important things to do than worry about the musings of a prisoner. Maybe she'd check on that spineless flea Wade? If he managed to escape again, oh, the hell he'll pay...

Ironically you're even smaller then a flea at the moment in comparison to Destiny's body, as her large bodies gigantic movements (and subsequent breast-related earthquakes) made it difficult for you to avoid throwing up right there. But, finally, you come to a stop as you reached the lip of her bra and held on for dear life, finally taking in the sheer size difference of everything around you. Destiny was monstrously huge before...but now she was god like. From your vantage point, she expanded upwards for miles and miles, and that was only a small fraction of the rest of her body! Although you hate to admit it, you need Destiny if you have any hope of getting out of this hellhole. You just had to hope she'd carry you near an exit or something, and you'd be able to do the rest yourself.

Unfortunately for you, as you finally stop gazing at the titaness and take in the gigantic, disorienting surroundings around you, you realize with trepidation that Destiny isn't going near any sort of exit. No, she's heading for...
113212211.title: Cleavage

11321222.content: You fall toward one of the guards passing by and land on her body. Because of how minuscule you are, she has no idea that it was you. As you stand up, you realize the guard that you landed on is none other than...
11321222.title: The Guard

choices: Lay Low at an Empty Apartment
113212221.content:
Your eyes widen because you are surrounded by a forest of golden brown fur covered in black spots. You look up and see long dark red hair and then you realize that the "ground" below you is very fleshy and squishy, making it clear you were on a very obese monster. Horror comes to you as you realize that the monster you were on was Cree Macbeth-Nile, the most vicious and fiendish of the guards. Cree was an obese 800ft tall werehyena who unlike the other guards, preferred to go to work naked. You guess her fat ass was too big to fit in any of the guard uniforms. You hated Cree because she was the most sadistic of the guards and took way too much pleasure in manhandling the prisoners that got out of line. She was also a bloodthirsty man-eater who made it clear that she would devour you the first chance she got. It didn't help that she was always laughing insanely and that drove you nuts.

You could not be anymore thankful that you were shrunk to 1 inch tall. Cree would never be able to find you for the next 24 hours. You just have to bide your time for the right opportunity. But as you sigh to yourself in relief, you notice something. Cree isn't laughing like she always does. Instead, she seems stressed out and is letting out a groan to herself. "Huh?" you ask. Cree then walks by Belladonna who is grumbling to herself. "Plan," muttered Belladonna. "I need a plan. I want to be warden instead of the warden." Cree let out a groan. "Belladonna," she said. "Quit your complaining. I've got enough headaches for one day." Belladonna gives an angry look. "My, aren't we in a nasty mood today."

Cree just growled before Icy flew overhead and noticed her in a bad mood. "What's eating you, Cree?" asked Icy. Cree let out a sigh. "Aurelia and I were invited to the wedding of a friend of mine from high school," said the werehyena giantess. "The problem is, it's in Dreadberry." You shiver as Cree mentioned Aurelia. Aurelia was Cree's wife. Aurelia was a teal-furred werejackal 200ft shorter than her mate with rose-colored hair. The most noticeable thing about the Egyptian jackal giantess was that she was blind in one eye that was colored pure red and disfigured. You had heard that Aurelia was just as much a nasty human chomping fiend as Cree. In contrast to Cree, Aurelia was very skinny.

"So what's the problem?" asked Icy. Cree let out a sigh. "We'll have to stay with Summer." "Summer?" you ask to yourself. "Oh," said Icy. "You mean your younger sister." You gasp. Cree had a sister!? You imagine what a horrifying beast she must've been. Cree growled and nodded her head. "Summer hates Aurelia and the feeling is mutual. Aurelia is outright vexed with me because when we go to Dreadberry, we'll have to stay in Summer's house. It's not my fault that my kid sister is a narrow-minded creep." You can't help but laugh. Looks like the sister-in-laws would kill each other if left alone too long."

Cree lets out a sigh and continues work. That's when you realize that Dreadberry is several areas far away from Fearfield and Under Gloom. If you tagged along, you might be able to get too far away for Destiny to find you. But then again, you had no idea what kind of monsters lived in Dreadberry. Maybe it would be a better idea to wait until Cree and Aurelia leave for their trip and lay low in their empty apartment until you figure out how to get out of Fearfield.

What's your best option?
113212221.title: On the Hyena's Back

choices: You wind up in a cell
You reach a small crack in the wall and go through that
11322.content:
The spell worked! Without even waiting to thank Priscilla, you doubted she could even hear you now with your new and smaller size, let alone see you. You'd probably send her a gift basket or something once you were out and safely residing in a human town, free of monsters. Your minute self ran for a couple of minutes, easily slipping past the bars, in which the spaces between them seemed miles-spanning to you.

You were now out in the hallway, the area much too large and almost impossible for you to fathom, but you would get out of this damnable prison. You had twenty-four hours until the shrink spell wore off, so that was plenty of time to escape. You didn't know which direction to go in, so you just randomly picked and went off.
11322.title: You head out for the hall

113221.content:
"Whew this place is big...much bigger than before..." You mutter to yourself as you run down this endlessly huge hallway. Most of the area was indiscernible now thanks to your much more diminutive stature, and you had no idea if you were going forward down the hall or even towards a wall. Luckily, no guards had even spotted you yet. Priscilla was right, the spell worked perfectly.

The scenery shifted a bit as you passed by some grey monuments, and you guessed those were iron bars. Crud, you managed to end up inside a cell of a monster inmate. You would turn around and leave, but a minor draft of wind blew you even deeper into the cell, carrying your light body easily. As you looked around, you began to take stock. What cell had your microscopically shrunken self arrived in?
113221.title: You wind up in a cell

choices: She slips you down her uniform
1132211.content:
You see several pieces of fur on the ground. They appeared to be both pink and purple strands of fur and you realize who's cell you're in. "You have got to be kidding me." You were in the cell of Bebe, the Cheshire Cat. She had a body that could put the most bulky human wrestler to shame and was crazy about you. Bebe loved humans, especially men and was very fond of you.

But in your opinion, she was dumb muscle that could easily be manipulated, but now you were so small she was basically a planet to you. You look up to see the cat woman was asleep in her bed, scratching away at that collar Destiny fit on her. It was itching her and prevented her from turning invisible like her species could. Old blueberry buns cut no corners when it came to making sure escape was impossible.

You try to walk away but then you see that you're surround by strands of fur the size of trees and you're forced to climb over one of the hairs, but then Bebe's ears begin to twitch and she lets out a feline mew as she gets up and rubs her eyes. She scans the floor and before you know what hit you, the Cheshire giantess spots you.

"WADE!" she yells in joy as she jumps to the ground, her large muscular body creating a loud shockwave that knocks you off your microscopic feet. Then you see Bebe's moon sized eye looking on on you and you hear her purr. "Yay, you got out again. Oh, thank goodness. I thought Cree would've gotten you. She's been extra ravenous lately." You let out a groan. "Good to see you too Bebe." You mutter sarcastically. Then Bebe realizes something. "Hey? Wait a minute, I knew you humans are tiny compared to monsters, but you're smaller than I remembered.

"That's because Priscilla shrunk me so I could escape. It's going to wear off in twenty four hours so I've got to get out of here fast." But before you can do anything Bebe puts a claw in front of you. It's ten times larger than a skyscraper at your current height. "Uh, uh, uh," says Bebe as she scoops you up in her finger claw and shows that grin her species is best known for. "You're not going anywhere until we have a little fun." The cat giantess giggles and you're in utter horror.

"Oh no." You moan quietly so she can't hear you.

What does Bebe do with your shrunken form?
1132211.title: Cheshire Situation

choices: She keeps you in there for a while
You tumble further down her suit
11322111.content:
You clung with all of your might to Bebe's monumental clawtip, the cheshire cat's giggling thundering all around you and making you wish that you had earplugs right about now. "Bebe! Put me down! I'm so close to getting outta here!" You shout upwards to her face so high above.

"Oh Wade...your voice is even cuter now that you're tinier! In fact, your entire self is even cuter! I just can't let you go, not yet."

You almost stumbled and fell off as she began to move her claw upwards, and you could make out a destination. Two massive globes strained against her prison uniform, outlining a line of cleavage that would make the grand canyon appear insignificant in size. Slowly the massive catgirl raised you over her titanic breasts, gently tipping her claw downwards. You tried to hold on, but eventually gravity had to take over, and you found yourself free-falling through the air towards the muscular chest of this dumb pussycat.

You landed with an "oomph!" after falling what seemed like several miles or more, wedged tightly between two walls of purple fur that pressed in on you, smushing your whole body against them.

"Aww...don't you look nice, all snuggled in my chest."

"Bebe...let me go."You shouted up, but your voice was muffled against the soft fur and skin.
11322111.title: A World of Pink and Purple

choices: You manage to land in her naval
113221112.content: How much farther down you travel this titanic catwoman?
113221112.title: You tumble further down her suit
