I've got a customer for you, except this one isn't a Dark Sider. You remember Wade? I've finally given up on him! He does nothing but insult me and the other monsters and try to break out. No, I am not overreacting, I'm fed up with this human ruining the sanctity of Under Gloom. Got it. Thank you. He'll be seeing you soon."

Destiny then lifts up the coffee cup and glares at you before she pins you under her finger. "Maybe now you'll wish you were nicer to monsters. Doris will execute you in front of the rest of the prison. An irredeemable lout like you won't be missed." You spit at Destiny but at this point it does no good. "I'd save my breath to pray if I were you Wade Wilson, because you're going to be executed..."
11323122122212.title: A Date with the Executioner

113231221222121.content:
The next morning, all of the inmates are in the prison courtyard, with Destiny and Doris standing at the head of the crowd, a miniature gallows held in Doris' palm. Destiny is holding you in her own palm, your hands and feet chained.

"Let this serve as a lesson to all of you." Destiny says "You keep pushing me, and it won't end well for you, especially for people like this little maggot." You try to deliver one last insult to Destiny, but your mouth is gagged by a strip of cloth.

Destiny hands you to Doris, and as she slips the noose around d your neck, Destiny removes your gag. "Any last words?" She says. You scowl up at her " Yeah, after I'm dead, bury me face down so the world can kiss my ass!"

Destiny doesn't say anything, instead she nods to Doris, who flips a tiny lever on the minature gallows, and the floor beneath you suddenly drops away. For a split second, you drop down and instantly come to a stop. The rope immediately tightens, and it squeezes the your throat shut. You struggle for about a minute, before everything goes black.

For a brief moment, you feel kind of peaceful, then you suddenly feel yourself laying on a hard surface, and someone nudgeing you with their foot. You open your eyes to see you are now in a white empty void, with a pale, bald human man dressed in a black suit standing before you.

"I wondered when i'd be seeing you, Wade Wilson."

"Who the hell are you?"

" I think you know. Frankly I'm surprised you lasted as long as you did, I thought for sure you would have died by being crushed or eaten by the guards, but instead you piss off the warden so much, she decides to execute you."

"So I'm dead?"

The man nods. "What is this place?" "This is Limbo, a place between heaven and hell. Normally, someone with your record would go straight to old man Satan, and I can't believe i'm saying this, but you of all people have someone up there watching out for you."

"And who would that be?"

"Just the woman who birthed you, fed you, clothed you and raised you."

At those words, a tear comes to your eye. " You mean..." The man chuckles " I guess it's true what they say, even bad men love their mamas. Anyway, the only reason i'm doing this is because I owe her a favor. You now have three options, I can take you to judgement, send you back to earth as a wandering spirit, or you can be reborn."

"What do you mean reborn?"

"Reincarnation. Though there's no telling what you'll be reborn as. You could be a woman, a monster, or an insect for all you know. Oh, and you'll have no memories of your previous life. So, what'll it be?
113231221222121.title: Appointment with the Gallows

1132312212221212.content:
"I guess I should clarify what I mean by Wandering Spirit, before you choose it." The bald man said. He then cleared his throat and started monologuing. "Wade, if you were to choose this option you will become a spectre, unable to be seen, touched and heard by mortal but capable of interacting with them, to a certain extent that. You will forever be bound to the mortal world, unable to enter heaven or hell. You will be able to close the distance between galaxies in seconds, you will be able to visit strange and alien places that man was never meant to visit. Long after the sun has swallowed the earth, long after humanity and monsters have ceased to exist and long after the end of time, you will still be "alive". After finishing his monologue, the bald man found out that you had zoned out, far too bored to listen to him. "Wade Wilson" he said, attracting your attention. "Are you ready to begin an eternal journey of discovery and revelation?"

"Yeah that sounds great and all... But can I spy on naked women without them noticing?"

" *sigh* Of course you can Wade... of course you can..." with those words the man in the black suit lifted up his hand and snapped his fingers. Within an instant the white void disappeared, and you materialised in...
1132312212221212.title: Wandering spirit

1132312212221213.content:
you hesitated of which one chose, after a while you make a decision "I'll take the reincarnation" the man raises an eyebrow surprised about your decision "are your sure remember you can be anything including a monster" he said "yeah I'm conscious about that but it's my decision anyways" you say whit a faint smile "as you wish" he said before everything went black you feel a intense pain in your head like it was you were begin twisted.......

**************************************************
you wake up in a forest you don't know who are you and where are you, only that you feel a lot of pain you tried to stand but it's hard you have the feeling that it's your first time walking in your legs....like those where alien for you, you tried to take balance by taking support of a tree close to you you take a few steps when you saw a lake you approach to it and see your reflection and you saw a.............
1132312212221213.title: Reincarnation

11323122122212131.content:
You look and see that you are a female werewolf, a mildly hourglass-shaped blue-furred werewolf with red and brown highlights in her fur. You had no memory of your previously life as the criminal Wade. Because of your mother's love, you had been given another chance and you were now a female monster. There you remember who you were now and who you had been for the previous 23 years.

Your new name was Wanda Talbot and you were a werewolf working as a cop in Fearfield. You were injured in a police chase and it caused you amnesia. But fortunately it was temporary. Now, this was your new life. As you look down, you see you are in a hospital garb and then you hear footsteps. Somebody is coming and from the sounds of it, they're coming in quick. You then see the doctor, a kappa with purple tattoos over his body and he's smiling at you.

"Good morning, Ms. Talbot," he says. "You are free to go home now. Your partner is waiting outside." You nod your head and smile before putting your clothes back on. "Thank you very much, Dr. Zenigame." You shake hands with the doctor and then you walk out of the hospital room to find another cop waiting for you. This policewoman was a gargoyle and from the looks of it, she resembled Destiny's daughter, Fate, except she had a turquoise greenish blue skin and reddish membranes on her wings. She was reading the newspaper when she noticed you.

"Wanda," she says. "Oh thank the heavens that you're alright." You give a laugh. "I'm fine, Chance. It will take more than a car crash to kill me." Chance gave a scoff. "You almost did a very good job of that yourself, partner. You nearly destroyed yourself chasing Fang Grunewald the other day." You shake your head and get in the car as Chance starts to drive.

"What were you reading anyway." Chance takes a sip of coffee before she answers. "Well," she says. "This will make you laugh. I was reading an article on past lives. They say that some people who do their best to be good are trying to make up for the bad deeds they committed in past lives. Do you ever think that maybe the reason why you became a cop was because you were a criminal in a past life." You give a scoff and laugh. "No. I was raised much better than to be a criminal." Chance smiles but then gives a serious look.

"You know my grandmother?" You raise an eyebrow. "You mean the one that used to be a prison warden. Oh. Every time this year she gets real depressed. Why is that?" Chance lets out a sigh. "You see, Wanda. Today marks the 23rd anniversary of the death of that criminal who was always driving her crazy. He made her so apoplectic that she finally snapped and sentenced him to death. However, I think part of her misses him. Heck, even my grandfather finally coming back to make amends didn't do anything for her." You nod your head. Chance's grandmother was a gargoyle named Destiny. You heard that she used to have a fiery temper but 23 years ago she mellowed out and then after 4 years, she decided she didn't want to be the warden anymore and retired.

Chance let out a sigh. "And in a few weeks, it'll be her birthday. I'd like to do something to cheer her up." You give a smile. "Well," you say. "Wait'll she meets me. I'll bet I'll cheer her up for sure."

Where does Chance go from here?
11323122122212131.title: Goodbye Wade, Hello Wanda

choices: In a city, suffering her attack!
1132312212222.content:
(Warning... she is going to be a underage look-a-like character, but don't let her looks fool you)

"I really thought of it... and now, I have the perfect reason to move you to the most scariest cellmate in all of the Monster World... ever heard of Sakuya?!" Destiny said, and you just went from you crazy happy, to instantly feared. You have heard of Sakuya, she is a driddler, half human, half spider. Her appearance is of course (from my idea) a young girl, about 10-12, with pale skin, black hair... and a nice complexion, and even a black bikini, but don't let that fool you. She is a black spider as well with her other half of the body (sorry if I ain't good in explaining monsters) but she has a history unlike any other.

She has broken pretty much every law imaginable to monsters' and humans' exstiance. She has killed thousands of humans in illegal kaiju attacks, murdered 100s of monsters, and so many more crimes imaginable that why she wasn't even given the death penalty is just amazing. Normally she would be there, but instead... they play her in a dream device that lets her live out her remainder of her life in a dream, and if you die in that dream, you die for real. The device also connects to any human as well, so they also suffered her wrath as well!

Destniy connects you to the device and then you go into a deep sleep, and then.. she said... "Sleep dreams, I hope you don't die!" Destiny said, and then... it happened!

Where do you wake up now?
1132312212222.title: Sleep dreams!

choices: Sakuya wraps you in her webbing and uses you as a yoyo
11323122122221.content:
You wake up and smell something horrible. You have to grab your face. You try to get up, but for some reason you can't budge your legs. You look to see you're tangled in a spider web. As you're shaking, you see that there were scraps of dinosaur meat, cakes and cookies that were all rotten. You hear eating noises and slight screaming and then a giant half eaten cupcake lands to your side.

You look up to see more spider webs, brightly colored and at the tip of one of the webs was the monster Sakuya. She was biting into cakes, candy and dinosaur meat before throwing the scraps away as she grabbing onto her hair. "So much food and no flavor! I can't taste anything sweet anymore! Curse you Destiny! Is this how you treat a fellow monster?" Sakuya screams and tosses yet another chocolate cake and it lands in the web you're in, causing it to jiggle as you scream.

Sakuya then stands up on all eight of her spider legs because she heard your yelling. She crawls down to your level and you start to sweat as the drider hisses at you. "So Warden Destiny has given me a cellmate. A human cellmate! I hate humans! Hate them!" Sakuya screams again and you shake your arms. "N-Now don't do anything rash. I hate Destiny too. She's worse than Demona ever could be. Perhaps I could get you out and we could get revenge on..." "Nobody tells me what to do!" yells Sakuya.

Sakuya stomps on you and causes you pain. The thinness of her spider legs and the fact you're in a web suspended in the air is the only reason the pressure hasn't killed you. "Now, what should I do?" asks Sakuya. "That gargoyle tyrant has finally decided to give me a toy. What should I do now?"
11323122122221.title: Spider's Lair

113231222.content: What other depraved thoughts of breaking your will could she have?
113231222.title: Something Else

choices: The guards, there's someone else breaking out
Belladonna, what is she up too?
the REAL Destiny and she is not amused
1133.content:
Priscilla reached under her mattress and took out a strange bubbling potion and then reaches down her cleavage to take out a handful of long pinkish red hair. You've seen that hair before, but where. Priscilla takes a deep breath. "Now," she says. "Step out of the cell Wade." You do so and Priscilla puts the hair into the potion to make it bubble more violently. "This is an imposter poster I've been working on for some time. I've also been cutting out Warden Destiny's hair when she wasn't looking.

You gag in disgust. "Why would you want that blue battle axe's hair." Priscilla shakes her head and lets out a sigh. "Because its the key ingredient. Once I pour this potion on you, it will turn you into Warden Destiny for twenty minutes. You gag even louder. "Me, turn into that gargoyle? I hate Destiny! That old bat is determined to make my life a living hell. I'd like to see someone take a hammer to her skull. Why don't you take that potion yourself?

"Because it wouldn't make sense for Destiny to be locked in here. The warden can move through the prison without any suspicion. Now hold still." Priscilla reaches her hand outside of the bars and pours the potion onto you as you begin to twitch and turn bright blue. You scream as your fingers turn to claws and your feet turn to talons as you sprout a tail. Your body becomes more hourglass shaped and you grow a pair of breasts as horns sprout on your forehead. Then you start to grow bigger and bigger until you're even taller than Priscilla. Your hair becomes pinkish red, curly and then extends past your back as you sprout bat like wings and grow fangs.

When the transformation is complete, you look at your clawed hands and gasp before you grope your own new breasts and feel around your lower waist with a look of despair. "I feel like I need to shower," you mumble in disgust. 'In acid!" Priscilla gives a smile that shows her fangs. "It worked. Now hurry. You only have twenty minutes to get out before the potion wears off. And don't forget our deal."

"Oh I won't forget," you say as you walk away with a sly look on your face. "Stupid orc." As much as you hate to admit it, temporarily turning into a clone of Warden Destiny was a blessing in disguise. Little does Priscilla know, you have no intention of coming back for her. This was your ticket out of this rot hole. Since you looked exactly like Destiny, the inmates and staff will never be able to tell that the sole human in the prison was escaping. Of course, you had to get out before the spell wore off.

But as you're making your way down the halls, you hear somebody coming. You flinch slightly and then you remember that you're turned into a clone of Destiny and the guards will never know you're Wade. You decide to remain cool. You'll have to pretend to be Destiny because somebody is coming, but who...?
1133.title: Dressed as the Enemy

11331.content:
You recongize to two people coming towards you as guards Cree and Simone. From the looks of it, they were not happy. You tried to ignore them and walk past, but Cree stops you.

"Warden Destiny, good to see you. We have a problem." Cree says. You have to keep yourself from gagging when she calls you Destiny.

"What's wrong?" You say, your voice a perfect copy of Destiny's.

"It's Arethusa. We don't know how, but she managed to sneak in enough materials to blow a hole in her cell wall and escape." Cree explains.

That gets your attention. If that happened, the guards would be too busy to notice two Destiny's. You'd be able to walk out even easier now.

"That's not good." You lie. "I'm sure she couldn't have gotten far."

"Well, that's not all. It seems the human Wade has escaped as well. We're still looking for him." Cree continues. It takes all your willpower to keep from laughing, so you fake a growl.

"Again? He's getting crafty. Find him now." You say, trying not to smile.

"Yes, Warden." Cree says. Then she and Simone walk away. Once they are out of sight, you grin madly and head for the exit.

A few minutes later, you're outside the building. You breath in deeply, happy that you are finally out of that hell hole. Now you just need to wait 2 more minutes and you can be human again. So you lean against a nearby tree and wait. Eventually, 2 minutes pass and...
11331.title: Double Escape

choices: Wade will only become human once he accepts monsters
He will be stuck in the body of his most hated enemy
113312.content:
You look down at your body, awaiting the change. Nothing was happening. Your body was not getting warm, your body was not changing shape; nothing. "What the heck?!" You look all over this body, expecting the change to occur somewhere. You decided that maybe the potion needed more time, so you decided to give it more time.

About ten minutes later, nothing happened. You were starting to get pissed. You wanted to ask Priscilla why this was, but you just escaped out of Under Gloom. Was getting out of this body worth the risk being caught? Against your emotions, a tiny bit of logic managed to peak the answer: no. You turned and headed off and away from this dump. You cursed almost the entire way because of that damn orc.

However, Priscilla had this planned entirely. She knew deep down that even if she gave Wade an escape, she knew that he would never help her. So she decided to put more of a curse onto him by using that potion. Because of that potion...
113312.title: Stuck

1133122.content:
You would spend the rest of your life as Destiny. Priscilla had made it so that the curse on the potion could never be broken. You would have to find a way to life out your life as the one person you hated more than any other.

After about an hour of walking, you came to a realization: you currently had no place to stay. You couldn't risk going to Destiny's house, and there was no way you would be able to fit in your old home. You had to find someplace to stay and soon, since it was beginning to get dark. Eventually, after walking some more, you come across a small motel. You walk into the lobby. Behind the desk was a fairly pretty (for a monster) oni woman who looked like she was 8 months pregnant. She was reading a magazine. You ring the bell to get her attention. When she looks at you, she seems surprised.

"Oh, you must be Destiny. You're the prison warden right?" She asked in a slight Russian accent.

"Yeah." You tell her. "Listen, my house is being fumigated. Do you mind if I take a room tonight?" This was a lie, but you had no other ideas at the moment.

"No problem." The oni replied as she reached for a key and gave it to you. "Room 302. And don't worry about the price. Since your doing a service at that prison, it's on the house."

You thanked her and left for your room. You thought that being like this had one perk: free shit.

You head to your room and enter. It was small, but comfortable. You immediatly reach for the phone. You need to call the prison and find a way to talk to Priscilla to figure this out. Before you can dial the number, there is a knock on the door. You go and look through the peephole. On the other side of the door is...
1133122.title: A New Destiny

choices: Before you dial, you see something on the wall
11331221.content:
To your confusion, the oni who gave you the room was on the other side of the door. You opened the dor to let her in. As you did, you finally got a good look at the woman.

She stood around 100 feet shorter than you. She had short black hair, purple eyes, and blue skin. She was 8 months pregnant, and it really showed. Her breasts were around F-cups and her hips were really wide. But the focus was her belly. It was like a beach ball attached to her stomach. You also saw she was wearing skimpy black underwear.

"Um, can I help you?" You ask, not interested in her at all and annoyed at the intrusion.

"Sorry, we really didn't get to introduce ourselves. My name is Sandy." The oni replied.

"Hi." You say, confused. "My name is Wa- I mean Destiny."

"Nice to meet you." She replies, her tone rather seductive.

"Um, it was good to meet you too?" You say, unsure as you begin to close the door. But she pushes her way into your room.

"But we can get to know each other more." She tells you before shutting the door.

"Shouldn't you head back to your office? I'm sure your husband is waiting for you." You tell her, really not interested in dealing with her right now and kinda worried.

"I'm not married." She says. "I got knocked up in a one night stand. And don't worry. I'm not due for another 100 years." That's right. Oni's had much longer gestation periods.

"Look, I'm sorry, but I'm really tired and have a call to make." You say, trying to get her to leave.

"Maybe I can help with that. You know, I love a woman in power." She says.

At this point you're getting frustrated. Then you get an idea.

"Look, I'm tired. Let me make my call and go to bed, and tomorrow, maybe I'll... take you to breakfast." You say, trying not to puke at the thought of dating a monster.

Sandy poutes. "Fine. I'll see you tomorrow." She says heading for the door and winking at you before leaving.

You shudder, but get back to the task at hand. You need to find out why your not changing back into a human. You pick up the phone to decide who to call. You could call the prison to talk to Priscilla, but the real Destiny might pick up, and you can't risk that. On the other hand, there was a library that specialized in spellbooks. They might have something.

After thinking for a minute, you decide to call...
11331221.title: One Flirty Oni

113312212.content:
Deciding that you didn't want to risk getting the real Destiny on the other line, you decide to call the library. You went there once before you were arrested and saw a shelf full of spellbooks. Maybe one of them would help you. You dial the number and, after 3 rings, you hear a voice on the other end.

"Scream Town Library, Ororo Parker speaking." The woman on the other end said.

"Hello, I'm Wa- Destiny Sirtis, warden of Under Gloom prison. I'm calling because-" You start before you are interrupted.

"Oh, Ms. Sirtis. Good timing. I was just about to call you. We finally got a copy of Stone Heart. You can come sign it out anytime."

You had heard of that. It was a new bestseller. It was set 200 years ago and is about two female gargoyles who fall in love but were seperated by their social class. You never read since you hated monsters, but you heard it was good.

"Um, thanks. Hey, do you still have those spell books?"

"Yes, why?"

"I was wondering if I could borrow one. About transformation, specifically."

"Yeah, we did have one book on that topic, but it was stolen a week ago. We're still trying to find it."

'Damn it' you thought. "Well, if you find it, can you let me know?"

"No problem. Why do you need it?"

'Crap!' "Um, I'm having trouble with an inmate and want to turn her into a lamp. So she won't try to escape again."

"Alright, we'll let you know. And come down anytime to pick up Stone Heart."

"Thanks. Goodbye." You say before hanging up. That pissed you off. The one book that could help you was stolen. Now what? You were too tired to think about it tonight, so you fell on the bed and went to sleep.

The next morning, you woke up to a sea of blue. You realized you were staring at Sandy's massive breasts.

"Morning~." Sandy said. "You promised to take me to breakfast."

"I did, didn't I? Go get dressed." You say.

An hour later, you were both at a small restaraunt near the motel. You were not happy at taking a monster on a date, but most likely, she wouldn't leave you alone otherwise, so you had no choice. As you entered the restaraunt, you saw a familiar face. It was...
113312212.title: The Library

113312213.content:
Before you had a chance to dial a number, something caught your attention. The picture on the wall was slightly crooked, and behind it, you saw a camera. Your eyes widened. Was that oni spying on you. Forgetting the phone for a moment, you left the room and went to the office. Sandy was behind the desk.

She looked up and smiled when she saw you. "Destiny! Good to-"

"Save it." You cut her off. "Something is fishy here and I want to know why."

"Alright, fine." Sandy said, "My name isn't really Sandy. It's August. I change my name a lot because I hate my name. Sandy is my current one."

That was not what you wanted to know. "Not that. The camera."

"Oh that," August replied. "Yeah, this place used to be a movie studio. There are hidden cameras all over."

That was what you wanted to know. "And you didn't get rid of them why?"

"I didn't have the time?"

She's lying to you. Maybe being Destiny could actually help here. "You'd better tell me the truth, or I'm busting you."

Does Sandy/August tell the truth to you?
113312213.title: Smile, you're on camera

choices: Someone walks in before you can answer.
11331222.content:
You break out in a sweat when you see that the person on the other side is Arethusa, the mad explosives expert who escaped at the same time as you. You lock all of the doors bolt in a vain attempt to stop her, but she burns the door to ash. She advances towards you, a meanacing grin on her face.

"Well, well, if it isn't the battleaxe who locked me up. What are you doing in a dump like this?" She asked, venom dripping from her voice.

You are clearly not ready to deal with her, so you try to tell her the truth. "Hey, wait a minute. I'm not Destiny. It's Wade. I just got turned into Destiny."

Arethusa just laughs. "Oh that's rich. Looks like old Demon finally flipped." She says.

"I'm serious. I am Wade. I can-" You don't get a chance to finish your sentance before Arethusa punches you in the face. You fall to the ground, a small bit of blood in your mouth.

"You can what? Prove it? I doubt youl be able to speak after this." She says before kicking you in the ribs.

You can't think through the pain. You rack your brain for a way to prove it is you. Then you get an idea.

"On the first day I got thrown in Under Gloom, I was passed by your cell. You managed to grab me and pull me in. Destiny didn't hear your threat, but you said "If I ever find you in my cell, I'll finally be able to enjoy..."

"...Roasted Human Criminal." Arethusa finishes. "Holy crap, it is you, Wade. What the hell happened?"

"Priscilla gave me a potion that turned me into Destiny to escape. It was only supposed to work for 20 minutes, but it's been 8 hours and I haven't changed back. I'm starting to think I got tricked. I need to get in touch with Priscilla to find out what she did." You explain.

"I'm having a hard time believing this, but this is just too rich." Arethusa says. "Do you need my help in any way?"

Do you need Arethusa's help?
11331222.title: An Unexpected Visitor

11331223.content:
On the other side of the door was the one person you never wanted to see right now: the REAL Destiny. And from the looks of it, she is beyond furious. You lock the door in hope that she won't get in, but she breaks the door down. The two of you stare at each other.

"Hey, Demona." You say, actually a little worried for once, "You're probably wondering why I'm you. Well-" You start before the real Destiny grabs you by the throat.

"Oh I know why." She says, the veins in her neck visible. "You thought you would be clever and turn into me to break out. But your not so clever. Priscilla told me everything. After a little threatening. She also told me that she put a curse on that potion. It makes so that you will be stuck as me for the rest of your miserable life."

"WHAT?!" You yell, furious. "That traitorous-. When I get my hands on her, I'll-" You were so mad you couldn't think straight. You were going to spend the rest of your life as the one person you hated. You were going to rant more, but Destiny squeezed you neck harder. You thought she was really going to choke you to death.

"QUIET!" She yells. Then, to your concern, she smiles. "Heh. This might actually work out. You hate me more then anyone, so what better punishment then spending the rest of your worthless, pathetic life as me? Of course, your name can't be Destiny. So how about Wendy? And you look too much like me. But that can be fixed."

At this point, you were actually scared. Destiny was HAPPY that you were her? There was no way that could be good. And that sadistic grin she had only amplified that concern.

"What are you going to do? Scar me? Break these horns?" You asked, voice shaking.

"The horns, yes, but scarring you is too easy. No, I have a better idea. You ever heard of Lactose Overload Syndrome?"
"No."

"It's a medical condition that only affects werewolves, succubi, and gargoyles. It makes their breasts grow insanely large and fills those breasts to the absolute brim with milk. But as a side effect, they can never lactate it. EVER. Normally, it only shows up as a genetic mutation, but there are ways to give it to someone. So come with me."

She drags you out of the room and to the lobby, where the oni is still reading.

"Ms. Destiny, good to see-" She starts, before seeing there are two Destiny's now. "I didn't know you had a twin."

"Yeah. But she signed in under my name. Her name is actually Wendy Sirtis. Right?" She said, glaring at you.

"Uh, yeah. Sorry about that." You say, freaked out.

Destiny signs you out of the motel and forces you into her car. She then drives off.

"Taking me back to Under Gloom?" You saying, trying to be mocking. "Won't they be confused at two Destiny's"

"Oh, we're not going to Under Gloom. I'm going to give you Lactose Overload Syndrome so people won't confuse us. And I know just the place."

Where is Destiny taking you?
11331223.title: Double Trouble

113312231.content:
You looked out of the cars window and saw that you were driving into Scream Town. The place was known for the fact that monsters and humans lived in harmony. That idea angered you. Destiny pulled onto a street that looked like it was in perpetual autumn and drove to a large building. The sign out front said "Scream Town Library".

Destiny got out of the car and pulled you out of your seat. The two of you walk up to the library, Destiny holding your tail (you still had trouble accepting that you had a tail) so you didn't escape. You both enter and Destiny walks up to the librarian, who was a wereboar. The librarian turned to face you.

"Oh, Ms. Sirtis. I didn't know you were-" the librarian started before she saw you. "Um, when did you get a twin?"

"Oh, Wendy? She went on a trip a few years ago and just came back." Destiny lied. "Ororo, do you still have that body change spell book? I need it so that no one confuses me with Wendy here."

"Yeah, it's in the spell book section. You'll need the key to it though." Ororo replied before giving her an old key.

"Thank you." Destiny said before starting for the spellbook section.

"Since you're here, that copy of Stone Heart you asked for came in." Ororo told her.

"Oh, thank you. I've been looking forward to it. I'll pick it up on my way back." Destiny replied.

Pulling your tail, Destiny drags you to the spell book section. There were a few books behind a locked case. Destiny used the key and opened the case, then pulled out a grey book. She opened it and began flipping through.

"Let's see here. Medical conditions... wing atrophy, tail rot, stone crack... aha! Lactose Overload Syndrome." Destiny then began speaking in a language you never heard before. The book glowed, then stopped. You were confused for a moment, then you felt a warmth in your chest. You looked down and saw that your breasts had begun to grow. Not just grow, but you could feel them filling up too.

"What did you do to me, Demona?" You asked angerly, breasts still swelling.

"It's simple. Since your a female gargoyle now, that means you can have LOS. And as long as I keep this book open, those new breasts of your are going to keep growing." Destiny explained.

You were seething with rage. Not only were you trapped in the body of the one woman you hated, but were being given oversized boobs too.

Your breasts continued to swell. Eventually, Destiny shut the book, stopping the growth. You look and see that Destiny made your breasts grow to the size of...
113312231.title: Spelling Time!

1133122311.content:
You could only gasp in horror as you looked to your new chest, the size of yoga balls. You lifted a hand to touch them, only for them to jiggle in response. You held back a small moan and blush as you glare daggers at Destiny, "What the hell?! Why did you make them this big?!"

"If you're going to be stuck like me, you need to look different" she spoke as she looked for another book.

"How about you find a book that doesn't make me look like freaking DEMONA!"

Destiny growled at you, "You want those to be even bigger?!" You shook your head, "Than stay silent!" Destiny grabbed a couple of books from the shelves, "These should help."

"What are those?" you asked with anger dripping from your voice.

"Oh...something that will help tell us apart." She opened one of them, but what would it do?
1133122311.title: Not Done Yet

113312231122.content:
The next book Destiny opened caused her to force her grasp on one of your horns. She again, spoke the language you had no clue about. And again, you felt warmth in your body. But thankfully it was not in your now massive breasts. No, now it was on your head. You felt your head grow heavier, and from a small reflective surface in the room you saw it; your horns were growing. "What the hell?!" you shouted.

"I lied when I said I was going to break your horns" she spoke. "But not let's see how you will deal with a little more weight."

She pressed her two fingers against your skull, right before the first set of horns. Another pair son grew, making a total of four. Destiny's hand stayed there, for your reach couldn't go past your breasts. She eventually let go, but your head felt heavy. The four horns on your head looked as thick as lightposts and about two feet long. "Can I leave before this living nightmare becomes even more like hell?" But the smile on Destiny's face said otherwise. Before you could even think about it, she rushed over and locked the door. "Oh no" she spoke back. "I think two more changes to you ought to make the difference. Now what...?"
113312231122.title: Growing

1133122312.content:
Destiny made sure to make you huge. Each breast was the size of a bean bag chair, but significantly heavier due to the milk inside them. You were having trouble standing up due to their sheer weight.

"Great, so your idea of having people tell us apart is to turn me into a cow. Great." You say, annoyed.

"No, cows can be milked. You cannot." Destiny replied in a smug tone. "Now, just a few more things."

She flipped through the book again and said some more words you could't understand. You could feel your hair shorten and your horns grow smaller. When that was done, she went to another page and made your tail longer. Then, she changed your hair color to silver. Finally, she chaged you eye color to grey.

"Well, I think that covers your changes." Destiny said, putting the book back. "And I have to admit, as much as I hate you, you make a damn sexy gargoyle."

"I would rip of your wings if I could." You reply, still bent over due to your breasts.

Destiny led you out of the library, thanking Ororo on the way, and put you in the back of her car (you couldn't fit up front anymore). Then she got in and drove off.

A few hours later, you saw that you had arrived at Destiny's house.

"Why the hell are we here?" You ask.
"Because I don't want you leaving my sight, so until I can figure out what to do with you, Wendy, you're staying with me." She says while getting out. She pulls you out of the back and leads you up to her front door.

"Alright, you'd better behave in my house. If you don't were going back to the library and I'm making those jugs of yours even bigger. Got it?"

Before you can answer, the front door opens. Right in the doorway is Destiny's daughter, Fate. She looks at Destiny, and then at you.

"Uh, Mom. What's going on?" She asks, clearly confused.

What is Destiny's answer?
1133122312.title: Meet Wendy Sirtis

11331223122.content:
"Fate, do you remember that inmate Wade? The one who keeps trying to escape and I want to turn into paste with a steamroller?" Destiny asks Fate.

"Yeah?" Fate replies, confused.

"You're looking at him." Destiny replies before pointing to you.

Fate looks at you, then Destiny, then you again. "Uh..." Clearly, brain.exe has stopped working.

"This is going to take some explaining..." Destiny says, annoyed before dragging you into the house.
--------------------------------------
A few hours later, Destiny explained everything to Fate and told her what she was going to do. She was going to see if she could find you a job, so she wanted to Fate to watch you while she was gone so you didn't try to escape. Not that you could.

About an hour after she had flown away, you and Fate were sitting in the living room of Destiny's house. You were not happy.

"So, Priscilla turned you into my mom so you could escape, but made it so you could never turn back?" Fate asked you.

"Yes! Demona already told you that!" You yell. You try to jump up, but your boobs stopped you.

"I'm just confirming. I can see mom made you look different. Did she put implants in you?" Fate asks.

"No she..." You trail off, embaressed for once in your life.

"She...?"
"She gave me Lactose Overload Syndrome." You say in a quiet voice.

"She what?"

"SHE GAVE ME LACTOSE OVERLOAD SYNDROME FROM A SPELL BOOK!" You yell, cheeks red.

Fate started laughing. Fantastic.

And just to make things worse, Destiny walked in at that moment.

"What's so funny?" She asked Fate.

"Wade said- Wade said you gave him Lactose Overload Syndromehaha!" Fate said trying to breath.

"Guess that is funny." Destiny says before turning to you. "Anyway, I found you three jobs, Wendy."

"Really?" You say, skeptical. How could she do that in an hour?

"Yes. Here are your options:

"First, you could work from here. There's an environmental group that have a website and they need a webmaster.

"Second, Grimmly Lodge becomes Grimlly Spa and Health Resort in the summer for women with LOS and they need a new desk clerk."

"Those sound awful." You say. "Third option can't be worse."

"Third option is Laiteux de Musique. It's a strip club owned by Breccia Stone and specializes in LOS. Don't worry, it's a classy joint and there's absolutely no touching or... other activities allowed. If those rules get broken, the rule breaker's thrown out and banned"

You had to open your fat mouth.

"So, which is it?"

You run straight down the hallway looking around. "So long suckers," you say. "I'm out of here." As you run down, you see human skeletons littering the hall as you continue to run. You couldn't stop. All the guards in this prison were carnivores and you knew on your level there were four guards that you weren't fond of.

First was Cree, the werehyena. That bloated bitch was a borderline psychopath who got a kick out of brutalizing any prisoner that tries to escape. You think she took the job mainly to beat people up. But you definitely didn't want to run into her as she was especially dangerous to humans. They were her favorite snack and she always had her tongue sticking out as she looked for any opportunity to catch humans.

Second was Clover, a grootslang, a type of monster resembling a reptilian elephant with a snake for a trunk. She wasn't as psychotic as Cree but she and Cree were deadly rivals when it came to capturing and eating humans. You once saw her spew human bones out of her trunk.

Third wasn't so bad. Simone, the Nue the Nue. That giant monkey never spoke and only shrieked. However, she doesn't eat humans as much as the other guards and prefers fruit. But she will report you right to warden Destiny if she doesn't choose to eat you. But in that case, eating would be preferred

Fourth was the snow bird harpy Icy. She was a new guard and very clumsy and ditzy so you had a chance to get away from her. But she is not any nicer than Clover or Cree and her ice powers froze humans on contact into meaty popsicles.

Sometimes vice warden Belladonna herself came to patrol the halls. You couldn't worry about which one would show up, because you were almost home free.
