"CRAP!" you muttered just as the giant evil radical grizzly bear known as Ursula opens her eyes to see you. She immediately gets aggressive and wakes up on the spot, and while you tried to run, she immediately roared and knocked you off your feet, and then you screamed in terror just as Ursula come towards you with alot of anger in her eye. "As much as I hate humans, I hate fairies even more." she smirked just as she corners you and grabs you. "I hope you aren't sent from a fairy."

"No, I ain't... I am Wade, and I am trying to escape this prison." you pleaded to her, and then Ursula smiles evilly. "I have an idea, why not you escape from here, into my mouth, because as much I like dead fairy food, humans are the best to eat, and I love a good screaming human, especially children, but you aren't a children, but you should still taste very good for me." Ursula said before she opens your mouth and attempts to eat you, and then you screamed.

"IF WE BREAK OUT TOGETHER, I WILL HELP YOU KILL THAT FAIRY GOVERNER!" Wade screamed for a plea. Does Ursula buy it?
133.title: Radical Deal!

1331.content:
As you're finished pleading, you look down at Ursula's deadly maw. The grizzly werebear giantess's teeth are like giant yellow stalactites stained with blood at the bottom, with some pieces of decaying flesh and bones stuck between them. It looked like Ursula was going to eat you, but then the bear giantess let out a growl before she held you up to her empty eye socket, forcing you to close your eyes at the sight of something really nasty.

"I'll let you live for now, human," says Ursula as you look down at her big black lips. "As a matter of fact, I'm not the only one of the Fairy-Tailers stuck in this hellhole prison. The governor is afraid of me. She knows that she is a cruel, mischievous creature that needs to be eradicated. Fairies, leprechauns, carbuncles, kelpies, all the fair folk exist to spread misery and pain. Which is why I intend to shower the world with their blue blood."

Spoken like a true radical fruitcake. You've come across those punks before in human prisons. "In return for my mercy, you will go to the uppermost floors of Under Gloom. On the 6th, 7th and 8th floors there is each a member of my gang who has been incarcerated in the Dark Side as well as myself. You will free each one of them." Ursula then reached into her jumpsuit and pulled something out of her love tunnel that made you look in fear.

It appeared to be a bottle with a parchment inside. Ursula smashes the bottle at the side of the cell wall and then hands the paper to you. "This is a list with pictures of every member of my gang. You will free the three indicated by the numbers on their ID picture. Double cross me and you will perish in my intestines."

Ursula roars at you before placing you on the ground outside of her cell. This was just great. Now you had to bring along not just one, but four criminals out with you. But you had to act fast. If you betrayed Ursula, she'd devour you. You unroll the parchment to see that there was a large array of monster faces from different species. Some had Xs draw over them, implying that they had been killed. But three faces had numbers written on them; 6, 7 and 8 to indicate which floor of the prison they were on. Apparently Ursula keeps tabs of everyone who works for her.

The question is, who to spring first?

(Note: The species and name of Ursula's accomplices depend on the writer. This is a spot to put in OCs. Please give a name, species and criminal record to justify why they are spending the rest of their lives in Under Gloom)
1331.title: Deal With the Devil Bear

choices: I break out of prison, I find a way to break you and the dark side inmates out!
I break you out, and I become your slave for life!
You come up with the deal!
134.content:
Oh boy, your day has been made alot worse as you are now in the room of Arethusa, the mad bomber dragon, the one with orange brown scales, ram like horns and long blonde hair. And to make things even worse, she was awaken at the very moment, and she was furious and mad as she was ramming the door like crazy, and you were scared and shock to death as her fury was bad. "I want the fuck out you bitches.... if I have to I will kill all of you!" Arethusa roared just as she prepares to breath fire, (her bars are made out of steel and are invincible to flames) and then you did this.

"Uh.... hi!" you said shyly and scared to her, and then she instantly turns and sees your small form, and then her rage exploded as if she was a ture terrorist. "You have alot of nerve you tiny human, coming to my cell to fuck with me. Well I ain't taking oyur fucking shit, that's for sure... and if you think that I am going to get all cuddly with you fucking humans.... well you got another thing coming, in fact... I may just attack Earth next." Arethusa snapped at you furiously just as she breaths fire near you, and then... you were scared, and perhaps ready to die right then. Arethusa sure had you cornered, and you didn't even think about moving a muscle, as if you did... you would be dead in an instant.

"What if I make a deal with you?" you asked her scared... "I am trying to get out of prison, and... perhaps I can cut out a deal with you."

"Really... I am interesting in hearing your idea." Arethusa said (for a moment) calming herself. "Go on..."
134.title: A flaming hot day, a rotten deal!

I got students ready to bomb the place right now
1343.content:
“What if I were to break you and myself out like I am about to do right now, why not you can be my apprentice in the bombing business? Just imagine all sorts of chaos you can make anywhere you can think of, heck… maybe you can get back at that Destiny bitch for locking your sorry ass in prison every single time you try to escape. Especially when the crime, didn’t warrant the time you had coming here and suffering your life just pondering about everything you know and love about. Your job, your friends, your family, etc.” Arethusa thought about for you to think of.

Man, it seems like a great idea to do, but it would make a lot of people mad if you decide to become a terrorist to terrorize people and etc. But at the same time though, maybe it can be great to get back on people and monsters that have wronged you in your life, especially Destiny right here, for locking your sorry ass up and ruining your life with work and etc, and after some thought, you agree.

“Alright, you got yourself a new student in the business of bombing.” You agreed to her, and then she comes down to shake your hands.

“Say… how are we getting out?” you ask her.
1343.title: My student in the bombing business?

13432.content:
“Oh, I got friends that are just ready to break me, you, and all of the other monsters out of this place of a prison right at this very moment. They brought me a few things to help out with this escape.” Arethusa tells you just as she brings out some sort of a communicator device right then and shows it to you, and then she activates it and tells a command. “Alright students, it’s showtime.” She says.

“For what?” you asked, and then you notice that the bombs were going off everywhere, and then the area just blacks out, and you scream, but Arethusa covers your mouth as she grabs you. “Don’t worry, everything is going to be alright.” She said to keep you calm, and then the door suddenly opens, and she makes a run for it with you in her hands. In the hallway, the prisoners were making an escape and started to overcome the guards with whatever their monster abilities can provide for them. It was a riot as they were monsters grabbing guns and lots of shooting going on right then, but for Arethusa, it was music to her ears.

“That’s what I call an escape plan, let’s go.” Arethusa said just as she flies with her wings straight outside of the prison. Man it’s a big riot, as monsters are just exiting the prison, and the guards (even Destiny) are being overpowered as well. It was a true blood bath, and you seem to be liking it. “Great, now that will teach her, say… when we will be doing the bomb business teaching, you know I am smaller than everyone?” you asked her.

“Trust me, you will know in time.” Arethusa replied just as she goes out of her way and flies away from the prison.

What P.O.V. do we go to now?
13432.title: It's showtime!

choices: The guards show up: they need Arethusa's help
13433.title: Something else

134331.content:
Before you and Arethusa could do anything, the cell door opened. You turned and saw Cree and Icy walk in, followed by Destiny. You mentally sighed.

"Arethusa, we need-" Destiny begin, before she saw you. Her eye twitched. She looked like she was about to yell, but Icy stopped her.

"Destiny, there isn't any time to deal with Wade." Icy said.

"Fine." Destiny said. She then turned back to Arethusa. "We have a problem. Someone's set up an explosive down in the boiler room. We know it wasn't you, but you're the only person in this prison who would know how to defuse one, so unfortunately, we need your help."

"What's in it for me?" Arethusa asked.

"Not getting blown into tiny chunks." Destiny replied.

Arethusa shook her head and sighed. "Not enough, but I'm guessing we don't have time for this."

"We don't. Come on." Destiny said. "And Icy, bring Wade. I don't want him trying to escape while we're busy."

Icy nodded and grabbed you. She then dumped you in her pocket and followed Destiny and Cree, who were holding Arethusa.

About 20 minutes later, Icy stopped and pulled you out of her pocket. You saw that you were in the boiler room. And next to the prison boiler was the explosive. It looked like...
134331.title: An Explosive Threat

choices: A blinking light and a keyboard
1343312.content:
You're looking at the thing from every angle you can think of, and you still can't tell where it starts or ends. It's just a mess of wires, devices, and explosives. You can also see it's behind a thick sheet of glass. Just looking at it hurts your head.

Arethusa whistles. "Well, someone's a fan of my work. This are all devices I've used over the years. And that glass is enchanted. No way of breaking it." She says. "How'd you find it?"

Cree stepped up. "I came down here to stoke the boiler when I saw the explosive. I ran up to get Destiny, and she grabbed Icy to get you."

Arethusa looks at the glass, and sees something. "There's an opening. It looks like a human can fit."

Everyone turns to look at you.

"Oh crap." You say.

Before you can protest, Arethusa grabs you and shoves you through the opening. You land on one of the devices.

"Wade, can you here me?" Arethusa asks.

"Yes, and why'd you do that?" You ask back.

"Because only you can fit. Wade, you need to defuse this. If you don't we all die." Arethusa says.

"Why should I?" You ask, still angry.

"Because if you don't, we all get torn apart by the explosion. That includes you. NOW GO!" Destiny yells.

You roll your eyes. "Fine. What are these devices?"

"Those are the triggers. You need to tell me what you see exactly. Then I can give you the instructions on how to defuse that trigger." Arethusa explains.

"Is there a timer?" Icy asks.

"No. These devices don't use those. They go off if you defuse them incorrectly." Arethusa answers. She turns back to the explosive. "Wade! Can you see anything?"

"Yes!" You reply. "I see..."
1343312.title: Better Get Going

13433121.content:
(Note: I do not know Morse code, so this picture will be important for this chapter: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/c...)

"There's a computer keyboard, and a blinking red light. The light either blinks quickly, or stays on for a bit." You yell.

"Damn it! That's the Morse Code trigger. Got to put in the right word, otherwise, boom!" Arethusa says, clearly unhappy. "Does anyone in the prison know Morse code?"

Destiny shakes her head. "Not to my knowledge. But we do have a Morse code sheet in the break lounge."

You blink in confusion. "And why would you have that, Demona?"

Destiny growls. "In case some jackass like you learns it and tries to use it to escape. Icy, run to the lounge and grab the sheet."

Icy nods and races off. After only a few minutes, she comes back with the sheet and passes it to Destiny.

"Good. Wade, I need you to tell me how the light is blinking. If it's a short blink, yell "Dot". If it's a long blink, yell "Dash." There will be a short pause. Got it?" Arethusa says.

"Yeah, yeah, I got it." You say. You look at the light. "Dash, dot, dot. Dot. Dot, dot, dash, dot. Dot, dot, dash. Dot, dot, dot. Dot. That's it."

Arethusa looks through the sheet. "OK, Wade, that spells "DEFUSE". Enter that."

You enter DEFUSE into the keyboard. There's a beep. The light changes color.

"The light's blue now, is that good?" You ask.

Is it good?
13433121.title: Morse Code? Crap.

135.title: This is not going to be pretty!

14.content:
You figure that Lockette your cellmate might be your ticket out of this mess. The Loch Ness monster girl was still sleeping, so you decided to go back into the cell and stow away on her pant leg where she can't see you just as she's about to awake. Lockette held up her head and let out a yawn as she stretched her long neck. The first thing your cellmate does is look all around to see you missing.

Lockette lets out a sigh and looks at that gap you made to escape the bars. "So he went through with it," she said. "He's going to end up in Clover or Cree's belly. I just know it. Not all monsters are as friendly to humans as me. Couldn't he just pay his debt to society like I'm doing?" You let out a huff. That was easy for her to say. She didn't have to spend years in a prison for monsters the size of skyscrapers and besides, she was getting out in a few months.

It was there there was a loud banging on the cell door, nearly deafening you. A guard was doing it. The guard in question was that Nue Simone. That darn monkey was chattering loudly and let out a monkey like screech as Lockette got up. "I'm coming Simone," moaned Lockette. "Keep your snake tail on." Simone jumps up and makes more monkey noises as Lockette walks out of the cell. Simone holds onto Lockette's shoulder to make sure Lockette didn't try to escape.

Not that she wouldn't. In your opinion she was too stupid to put up a fight. "That stupid monkey hasn't realized I've escaped," you thought to yourself. "Now I can blow this join." Soon Lockette reaches the laundry room where she's taking the dirtied up jumpsuits to put into the machine as a guard you don't know watches her. This guard was a saber toothed weretiger woman that was half-asleep but still keeping an eye on Lockette. It would only make sense there were a few guards on each floor. There were just four you knew on your own floor.

You had to make your move now while Lockette was loading the washing machine. You had to think fast about how you were going to escape. You were on the ground floor, there was only one guard who was half asleep and nobody knew you got out of your cell. You're on a pile of jumpsuits looking for a way out. Something could still go wrong, but you were almost out of this nightmare hole
14.title: Laundry Room Lockette

142.content:
As Lockette was throwing the orange and blue jumpsuits into the washing machine, a shadow is cast over the laundry room that causes the other monsters in the room, including the sabertooth guard to freeze in fear. It was a familiar tall shadow with leathery bat like wings. There was only one monster that it could possibly be, Warden Destiny herself. Destiny walks into the room and the sabertooth immediately springs out of her seat. "Eyes awake," says Destiny. "Fearfield isn't paying you to loaf off."

Destiny walks forward and one troll inmate has the gall to give her the finger. Destiny turns around and then grabs the troll girl by the neck as she yells. "I'd watch myself if I were you," says Destiny. "You've got a long ways to go to get out of here. Don't make it any harder for yourself." The troll woman nods her head in fear before Destiny drops her into a pile of dirty jumpsuits and gestures to her that she's watching her. "Bitch." You think to yourself.

However, when Destiny turns to a shaking Lockette, she just gives a smile. "Lockette," says Destiny. "Congratulations are in order." "Th-They are?" asks Lockette scared and confused. Destiny smiles again at Lockette. "You're a model prisoner, Lockette. Which is more than I can say about that vermin roommate of yours." Since Destiny couldn't see you, you give her both fingers. "What I mean to say," says Destiny to Lockette. "You're a free girl, Lockette. You've been released for good behavior." Lockette is surprised to hear that and Destiny extends her hand. "Th-Thank you, Warden." Says Lockette as she shakes hands with the gargoyle woman.

That sucked. Destiny was letting Lockette go while you were left here to rot. Well, you weren't sticking around. You decide that while Destiny is distracted, you'd skeedaddle. But before you could get any farther, Destiny brings her foot down and traps you between her talons. "No use, Wade," says Destiny with a voice full of venom. "I knew you were going to try to escape somehow." "You anus!" you yell up to Destiny. Destiny squeezes her toes and makes you scream before picking you up. She gives you a glare and shows you her fangs. "You know," says Destiny. "You're getting predictable, Wade." "Then why not release me too? I don't belong in this freak hotel."

Destiny gives a glare as Lockette looks on in worry. "Please, don't hurt him." Destiny lets out a sigh. "Why should you care what happens to this piece of garbage?" Destiny asks Lockette. "He's been nothing but verbally abusive to you since you became cellmates and he never listened to you. Your kindness was wasted on him. You're a free woman, Lockette, you don't have to concern yourself with scum like Wade any more."

With that Destiny stomps out. "You know, Wade," says Destiny. "This is too convenient. With Lockette out of Under Gloom, I'm going to have to relocate you. You'll have a new cellmate by the time the day is over." Destiny then gives an evil laugh that would make Demona herself blush. Something told you, you caught her on a bad day as she escorts you to the...
142.title: Lockette Makes Parole

1421.content:
Destiny escorts you to all the way to the 5th floor and you pass all sorts of monsters that were locked up tight and banging on their cell doors and screaming. "Quit your whining!" yells Destiny. "You have nobody to blame but yourselves for being locked up here, so take it with a grain of salt!"

You then notice that some of the walls on this floor seemed to be splattered in blood. That was not a good sign. Exactly what kind of monster was the guard on this level. You hear more screaming and then you see a long necked and horned shadow with that appeared to be carrying a club of some kind. She tossed a handful of screaming human inmates in her mouth from the looks of it and appeared to chew on them before swallowing.

The shadowed figure then walked forward. She was a bright blue sea monster that had a golden underbelly and long horns. She looked like an evil version of Lockette. "Wade," says Destiny. "I'd like you to meet Quebec. She's an ogopogo and chief guard on level five." You saw Quebec was holding up a large mace of some kind and she looked at you with a hiss. "Any inmate that tries to break out under Quebec's watch," says Destiny with a smirk. "Gets clobbered."

This was just great, before you even have a chance to complain, Destiny unceremoniously tosses you into a cell. "What the hell, Demona!" you yell. "You can't do this to me you big blue..." "Language Wade," says Destiny impatiently. "I'll leave him to you, Quebec." Quebec hisses and nods her head before she and Destiny walk off in different directions. This was just great, breaking out of Under Gloom was now going to be harder than ever.

It was about to get worse because you feel vibrations and look up to see your new cellmate coming forward and she was...
1421.title: 5th Floor

14211.content:
...a kitsune. Of all the creatures to be stuck with. You thought they were so smug with their shape shifting.

This kitsune in particular was around 750 feet tall. She had red hair in a ponytail and red eyes. You could see her fox ears and teeth poking out. She had eight red tails behind her. She had an hourglass figure, with a huge pair of breasts. Her prison jumpsuit had a hard time containing them. Around her neck was an electronic collar.

"You must be my new cell mate." The kitsune said. To your surprise, she was using Lockette's voice. "Name's Elaine. Nice to meet you."

"Like it matters to me." You tell her.

"You're Wade, right? The guy who's always trying to escape?" She asked you, now sounding like Yuri.

"So? What of it?" You replied curtly, trying to look at anything but her. You wound up looking at her breasts by mistake. She noticed this.

"Like my boobs? They cost me quite a fortune." So her breasts were fake. She must be pretty vain.

"The hell are you in for?" You ask.

"I'm a pretty good identity thief. I've swiped quite a bit of money in my life. I've bought things from new cars to new art to new boobs. But then I tried to steal Destiny's identity and use it at a bank. A bank she was at at the same time." She told you in Cree's voice.

"Old Demona losing her identity would be good. Then she might lose her job, and I can get out of here." You tell her.

"Maybe I can help." She said.

"Really? How?" You reply.

"This collar keeps me from shape shifting, but I can still change my voice, as I've been demonstrating. I can get you out of here. But you'd have to do something for me."

You had no intention of holding up a deal, but you could use her help. "What do you want?"

"I want you to help me..."
14211.title: Woman of Many Voices

142111.content:
Once she said what she wanted, you were intrigued. You didn't want to help her, but seeing old Demona lose her identity would be amazing. The sweet revenge you so wanted on her.

"Alright, what do you need me to do?" You ask.

"There's a keyhole on this collar. If you can get in and fiddle with the collar, it should disable it. Then I can become Destiny, and get us both out." Elaine explained.

"Sounds easy enough." You tell her. You only planned on getting yourself out, but Elaine was your best bet.

Elaine picked you up and put you near the collar's keyhole. You went into the collar and started pulling wires out. Eventually, you heard a beep.

"That's it. It's off. You can come out now." You hear Elaine say. You jump out of the collar onto Elaine's shoulder. She removes the collar (it must have gotten unlocked in the process) and, before your eyes, transforms into an exact copy of Destiny, even down to her clothes. She walked over to the door.

"Hey, I need help in here." Elaine said in Destiny's voice. You heard footsteps coming over to the cell. Then you saw Icy walk up. Quickly, you hide behind Elaine/Destiny's ear.

"Destiny? What happened?" Icy asked.

"Elaine managed to trick me and locked me in here. I don't know where she is right now. You need to get me out of here." Elaine told Icy. Normally, a guard would not believe this, but Icy was new, so she wasn't used to the place yet. Which meant she was tricked rather easily.

Icy opened the cell door and let Elaine/Destiny out. "There you go. Are you alright?" She asked.

"I am now." Elaine replied, before headbutting Icy, knocking her out. She then dragged Icy into the cell and locked it.

"There we go. We're out of the cell and now we just need to get out of the prison." Elaine told you. As much as you hated to admit it, that was impressive.

Elaine starts walking down the hall to the elevator. When she reached it, she called it. "Just a few more floors and we will be-." She started to say before the doors opened. Someone was in the elevator. That person was...
142111.title: A Change of Face

1421112.content:
Inside the elevator was none other than Belladonna, a yellow-skinned manticore woman with bright hair and a yellow gladiator style outfit with a spiked belt. Belladonna Solanacaea was the vice warden of Under Gloom which made her as hazardous as Destiny. You quickly hide behind Elaine (still in the form of Destiny)'s hair as Elaine looks at Belladonna in surprise. Belladonna appears to be equally surprised.

"Destiny?" asks Belladonna. "How the heck did you get to the 5th floor so quickly from the 8th floor?" "Uh," mutters Elaine still in Destiny's voice. "I took the stairs." You cross your fingers and hope Belladonna falls for the lie, which against all odds, she does. "Makes sense." She said. Elaine entered the elevator and you breathe a sigh of relief only to cover your mouth. You weren't out of the woods yet. Belladonna seems skeptical.

"Didn't you say you relocated Wade to level five after releasing Lockette?" asks Belladonna. Elaine clears her throat and gives a snarl as she tries to fake Destiny's anger. Though she can't quite make her eyes turn bright red like Destiny's. "That little bastard," says Elaine through fake anger. "I don't know why I don't feed him to the Wendigo on floor three." You almost get mad but you have to remind yourself that Elaine is only pretending to be Destiny.

However, Belladonna raises an eyebrow and begins to think to herself. "Wendigo on floor three?" asks Belladonna. "There isn't a wendigo on the third floor. Hell, there isn't a wendigo in the entire prison. What the flying f...? Wait a minute? Isn't there a shapeshifting kitsune on the fifth floor? I wonder." Belladonna stares at "Destiny" and you begin to sweat as you hide behind your accomplice's hair.

"You're in a surprisingly good mood today." Says Belladonna to Elaine. "Well," says Elaine nervously. "Doctor's orders. Stress is a poison you know." This didn't sound good, Belladonna wasn't 100% sure that it wasn't Destiny she was talking to, but she was already suspicious. "You know, Destiny, a new restaurant opened down the street from the Daily Tombstone where Fate works." "Oh," says Elaine. "How nice." "Yeah," says Belladonna. "Latin cuisine. I hear they make a pretty good jalapeño salad." Elaine gives a face of disgust and sticks out her tongue. "Jalapeños? Gross. Belladonna, you know gargoyles and jalapeños don't mix."

Belladonna's eyes pop and you let out a gulp. The jig was up, Belladonna knew that Elaine wasn't Destiny. While it's true that gargoyles as a species usually don't like jalapeños, Destiny and her daughter do. You know for a fact that jalapeños are Destiny's favorite food. Belladonna knows that Elaine is an imposter and then the elevator stops at the ground floor as Elaine walks out.

You can only pray that Belladonna choses this as an opportunity to get Destiny in trouble and usurp her, or you and Elaine are toast.
1421112.title: Belladonna. Damn

choices: The two of you make it out with no problems
Talia has to fight her way through the guards
You have a run in with Destiny
14212.content:
Towering above you was a woman that looked almost human, except for her long and pointy ears. She bright yellow, almost golden hair, and a blue tattoo in the shape of a V that went from her chin to her eyes. She stared down at you with a curious look.

"Who are you?"

"Who wants to know?"

Suddenly the woman's eyes glow a shining white, and her voice becomes distorted. "Do not test our patience, mortal." You hate to admit it, but you were actually intimidated by this woman when she did that. "I ask you again, what is your name?"

"It's Wade."

Her eyes stop glowing, and her voice returns to normal. "Oh yeah, I've heard of you. You're that human that's always getting under the warden's skin." She picks you up and holds you in her palm. "What are you?" You ask "You look mostly human except for the ears."

"I'm an elf. Talia's the name. What are you in for?"

"Arson. You?"

"Mass murder."

You almost gasp when you hear that. You may be a criminal, but you've never actually killed anyone. She continues " Or at least, that was the official charge. I told them it was self defense, but they wouldn't believe me. Honestly, it wasn't my fault, Selakimdor was only protecting me."

"Who the hell is Selakimdor?"

"The ancient spirit that shares my body. We were attacked by a bunch of thugs, and he just took over and slaughtered them. When the police saw what we had done, they thought we murdered them. But enough about me, what do you say we bust out of here?"

"Why would you help me escape?"

"Because I know you want to get out of here as much as me. Since were cell mates, I might as well get you out of here too. Watch this."

Talia goes up to the door of her cell and calls out "Guard!" Quebec comes up to the door, and the instant she's close enough, Talia reaches out and places her hand on Quebec's face. Talia's hand glows the same bright white as her eyes did for a moment before she removes her hand, revealing that Quebec's eyes were now glowing white too. "Go to the contraband store room, and get my stuff." Talia commands. As though in a trance, Quebec does so, returning about ten minutes later carrying a dark green tunic and cape, as well as a sword.

As Talia puts on her gear, you ask "What was that?" "Sharing your body with an ancient warrior spirit has it's advantages, such as mind control. Now let's go." Strapping her sword across her back, Talia places you on her shoulder, commands Quebec to open her cell, and begins sneaking out of Under Gloom.
14212.title: Meet Talia the Elf

1422.content:
Destiny brings you up to the 6th floor of the prison. You had heard that this floor was pretty sparse: despite having 18 cells, there were only 2 inmates. You didn't know anything about the inmates, so you might have a chance to trick them into helping you. You also heard that this floor was watched by a new guard, so that might be good too.

Destiny brings you to the guard room on this floor, where the guard was watching a monitor. Hearing the door open, the guard got up and turned towards you. The woman was 980 feet tall. She had pitch white skin and long, black hair covering her face. You could just barely see her black eyes. She had an athletic build, but you saw that her breasts were enormous. They wee straining her uniform.

"Wade, I want you to meet Aria Tazel. She's an Onryo, and she'll be your guard now. She was a cop in life, so escaping her will not be easy." Destiny tells you.

"Hello, Wade." Aria says, in a soft tone. "I've heard all about you. Don't think you can get past me."

"We'll see." You say in a smug tone.

"Don't get your hopes up, Wade." Destiny warns you. "Where do you want to put him, Aria?"

Aria thinks for a moment. "I going to..."
1422.title: The Empty Floor

14221.content:
"Wade here will go in cell 14. I'm sure Janice will enjoy the company." Aria says.

"Oh, Janice. Here that Wade, your survival chances just became 50/50." Destiny says smugly.

Before you could reply, Aria walked over to cell 7 and opened it. Destiny then walked over and dumped you in.

"Have fun, you little ass." Destiny said before shutting the cell door.

You were about to yell, but then you heard breathing from behind you. Turning, you saw who you had been dumped with.

The woman was a succubus, about 844 feet tall. She had snow white skin and was slightly chubby. Her breasts looked as big as monster sized bean bag chairs, so you guessed she had Lactose Overload Syndrome. But that was not what caught your attention.

What caught your attention was her face. It reminded you of that comic book villain, Two-Face. The right half of her face was normal, with her snow white skin, a green eye, long, straight black hair, and half of her lips covered in black liptstick. The left half, however, was a nightmare. It was horrifically burned, red and ashy black and looking like hamburger meat, to the point where you could see part of her jaw. Her left eye was milky white, and the left half of her hair was short and white. Looking down, you saw that her left arm was burned as well. What the hell happened to her?

Hell, her inmate uniform was split too. The right half was a typical uniform, but the left half was torn and burned.

"So, I get stuck with Lady Two-Face here, huh?" You say, trying not to look at the left half of Janice's face.

She looks down at you. "So you're Wade?" She asks in a smooth Italian accent. She turned her head so you could only see the right half. "I've heard a lot about you. On one hand, I could just leave you be, let you try to escape..."

Suddenly, her head snapped the other way, only showing the burned half of her face. "On the other hand, I could smash you into paste right now and save Destiny the trouble." She said, her voice now gravelly and missing her accent.

You were confused. What was this girls problem? "Why don't you just let me escape, melty-face?" You ask smugly.

Glaring at you, Janice pulls out something. You see that it's a coin. The side you see has a smiling succubus on it. "Heads, I leave you alone..." She says in her smooth voice. She then turns the coin over. The other side has a succubus with a completely burned face. "Tails, I make you my personal servant."

On that, she flips the coin. It spins in the air for a moment, then falls. Janice catches it. She looks at it, then shows it to you. It landed on...
14221.title: Two Faced

choices: Ends her shift and heads home
14223.content:
"I'm going to keep him with me." Aria finally answers. "From what I've heard, he's managed to slip out of his cell many times because there's no specific guard watching it. If I keep him with me at all times, there's less of a chance that he'll escape."

"Sounds good. But how are you going to keep him with you?" Destiny asks.

Smiling, Aria walks over to her desk and pulls out something. Coming back, she shows it to you and Destiny. It was a choker with a cage in the middle.

"I had a friend make this in case I ever had to deal with our human inmate." Aria says.

"Excellent." Destiny replies before handing you to Aria. Immediatly, Aria puts you in the chokers cage and locks it before, to your shock, eating the key.

"Why would you eat something made of metal? And why would you eat the only key to this thing?" You ask.

"I'm an onryo. Eating non-food items doesn't bother me. And I have a spare, but I'm not telling you where it is. Not that it matters, since you're not leaving that cage. And don't think of picking the lock or breaking the bars. That lock can only be opened with the key, and those bars are made of enchanted orichalcum, one of the few unbreakable metals." Aria explains.

"You've thought of everything, haven't you?" Destiny says.

"When I was alive, I had to deal with punks like this. So I've seen all the tricks and know how to counter them." Aria replies.

"Ah. Well, good luck with him. You'll need it." Destiny says before leaving.

"Better get comfortable, Wade. You're going to be here for a long time." Aria tells you.

"Yeah right. I'll be out of here in no time." You say, confidently.

"I doubt it." Aria says.

What does Aria do now?
14223.title: 'Round the Clock Watch

142233.content:
Aria looks over at a nearby clock. "Huh. Looks like my shifts up. Time to head home, I guess."

"Great, just leave me here and..." You being before being cut off by Aria's laughing.

"Nice try. You're staying with me AT ALL TIMES. That means you're coming home with me." Aria tells you.

'Damn it!' You think to yourself.

Aria heads for the stairs and goes to the first floor. She then heads for Destiny's office.

"Hey, Destiny. My shifts over so I'm heading home. I'm bringing Wade with me so I can keep him in my sight." Aria tells her.

"Suit yourself." Destiny says.

"Don't worry. No one has escaped under my watch." Aria says. "See you tomorrow."

With that, Aria heads out of the prison and gets in her car, with you still in her choker. She starts drving for her home.

"You really think you can keep me locked up? I'm sure I'll find someway out." You say in a smug tone.

"Hah. Like that's going to happen. You are not leaving my sight ever. Besides, my home's not too bad." Aria replies

Eventually, Aria pulls up to a two-story house. Aria gets out and walks up to the front door. She unlocks it and goes in, giving you a view of her home. And the first thing you see is...
142233.title: Welcome Home

1422332.content:
Before you could insult Aria's taste in decor, you heard footsteps coming towards you. You look and groan when another onryo walked into the front hall.

This onryo was 100 feet shorter than Aria, but had similar chalky skin and black hair framing her face, with black eyes behind it. But while Aria was athletic with huge breasts, this onryo was rather fat. She'd probably weigh 500 pounds if she was human sized.
"Hey, you're home. I was just about to get supper started." The new onryo said before seeing you in the choker. "Did you bring work home with you?"

"Kinda. This is Wade. He's an inmate I'm keeping an eye on. Wade, I'd like you to meet my daughter, Jez." Aria introduced you.

"Great, a whole FAMILY to deal with. I'm guessing I'm meeting the dad next." You say.

"Sadly, my husband passed away some years ago." Aria tells you.

"How does a ghost pass away?" You ask.

"He was a werewolf. And we actually don't know how he died. All we know is that it was an illness." Aria explained.

"Mom, I thought we agreed. Dad's in a better place, and he wouldn't want us to dwell on his memory." Jez said.

"Right, sorry. Let's change the topic." Aria said. "I still need to get some stuff for the party. Is there anything else we need?"

"Just a cake. That's pretty much it." Jez replied. You were confused.

"Human is lost here. Why did you go from dead husbands to parties?" You ask.

"Jez's 26th birthday is in a few days." Aria answered. "We're getting things ready."

"Fantastic. More monsters to be around. Did I die and go to a personal Hell or something?"

"He's going to be fun to have around." Jez said. "Oh, Lily's coming over for supper. Is that alright?"

"That's perfect." Aria said.

"Seriously? One more monster? What did I do to deserve such torment? And who is Lily anyway?" You shout to the heavens, as if expecting an answer from there. Instead, Aria answered you.

"Lily is Jez's girlfriend. She's a great person. She also has Lactose Overload Syndrome from what Jez tells me." Aria says.
On that, you heard the doorbell.

"Oh, that must be her!" Aria says before turning quickly to open the door, sending you crashing the bottom of the choker-cage. On the other side of the door was a...
1422332.title: Meet the Family

14223321.content:
When you were younger, you were told the concept of Past Lives, of who you were and that bad deeds in past lives would be punished in the next. You had to wonder exactly what you did in a past life for fate to hate you so much, because on the other side of Aria's door was a gargoyle.

The woman was about the same height as Jez, and had purple stone skin, green eyes, and blue and pink hair in a bob cut. She was athletic like Aria, and her breasts were just as big too. She had small wings and a medium tail. Her clothes were clearly punk.

"Hi Lily." Aria said to the gargoyle.

"Hello Ms. Tazel." Lily replied. Then she noticed you. "Who's this? Your new boyfriend?"

Before you could shout any curse words at her, Aria spoke up. "No. He's a prisoner at Under Gloom. He was put under my watch by the warden because he tried to escape. Wade, this is Lily Keller."

"Feh." You reply.

"Sorry, from what I hear, he hates monsters." Aria says. "Come on in."

Lily smiles and walks through the front door. As she does, you hear her breasts sloshing. Aria did say she had Lactose Overload Syndrome, which made her breasts massive and full of milk that she can't remove. The sound annoyed you.

"So, supper's going to be ready in a few minutes. Why don't you wait in the living room?" Aria tells Lily. Lily does just that as Aria heads into the kitchen. Once she gets there, she flicks the choker-cage, sending you rattling around.

"What was that for?" You ask.

"Lily is a very nice girl and Jez loves her. I expect you to treat her and my daughter with respect. If you don't, I will drop you down the garbage disposal. Got it?" Aria threatens you.

"Not making promises." You smugly reply. Maybe this could help. If Aria drops you down the garbage disposal, and if you avoid being chopped up, you could go through the pipes and escape. You smiled at that.

You just needed to insult the right person, but who?
14223321.title: A Threat, or An Escape Chance?

142233211.content:
You decided that since you hated gargoyles, you would insult Lily. This was going to be a lot of fun.
-------------------------
Later, at the dinner table, Aria, Jez, and Lily were seated, with you still in Aria's choker cage, which was set on the table. You looked and were honestly surprised to see they were eating normal food. No bugs or humans.

"Thought you monsters ate awful food." You say.

"I used to be human, so I know human food. And while Jez was born an Onryo, I want to show her what humans eat and do." Aria explains.

You roll your eyes. At least you don't have to deal with that awful smell of bugs.

"So, Wade," Lily starts. "Why were you locked up?"

"None of your business, blimp boobs." You say.

Jez and Aria glare at you, but to your confusion, Lily just shrugs.

"Eh, heard it before. Too many times to count." She says.

You frown. This was going to be harder then you thought.

"So, Lily, Jez says you work in a music shop?" Aria asks, ignoring you for now.

"Yup. Mummette's Music Pyramid. I work in the punk rock department." Lily says happily.

"I saw that place once." You say. "I'm surprised you can fit those airbags through the front door."

"Wade..." Aria growls.

"I use the back door. It's meant for the workers, since a majority of them are obese. It's wide enough for me." Lily says back.

"Yeah, well I bet people can't here the music over those jugs. The sloshing must be really annoying." You fire back.

"It was at first. But then I started to use that to my advantage, making my boobs slosh with the music. It draws in a lot of customers. In fact, that's how I met Jez."

You are getting annoyed. This chick is hard to annoy. You really need to step up your A game.

"You must be considered a freak by your family with those tits." You say.

"Are you kidding? My whole family has a history of LOS. In fact, I'm the smallest in my family. You want huge, you should see my sister. In fact..." She trails of to start thinking.

"Wade, I'm warning you." Aria growls.

You grin. "Like I'm scared of you." You say. Just then, you see a hand pick up the cage. The hand belongs to...
142233211.title: Let the Insults Begin

143.content:
As you're trying to figure out how to escape, without even looking, Lockette grabs the pile of clothes you're standing on and you yell. "Hey! What are you." You fall between several black and white striped jumpsuits and see that the Loch Ness giantess is walking up to the washing machine. "Lockette!" you yell. "You big stupid sea serpent! Drop the clothes right now!"

But your cellmate doesn't hear you and deposits the dirty clothes into the machine. As she shuts the door, you're sealed inside with the scent of monster sweat and several other smells you'd rather not imagine. It reeks in there. You even feel light headed as you realize you're standing on a giant sock. You walk up to the washing machine door and pound on it. "Lockette! You idiot! Get me out of there!" Suddenly you hear a noise that sounds like running water and soon, the washing machine is filling up. "Oh no!" you yell.

Before you can do anything, the washing machine fills up and you are submerged. You swim to the door and pound on it as you try to scream underwater, but then things get worse because the machine spins at high speed and you're tossed around in a circular current among the dirty laundry. You scream and outside Lockette hears you but doesn't know it's you. "What is that noise?" she asks. The saber tooth weretigress guard just shrugs her shoulders as Lockette gets back to laundry work.

Inside you're getting tossed around so fast you feel like you're going to drown in the washer machine. As you hold your neck, you look and see a face in front of the door to the washing machine but you can't make it out until you're dragged in closer by the current to see that it's the face of....
143.title: Spin Cycle

1431.content:
Lockette... the humanoid plesiosaur with a long neck, long indigo hair and fins for ears opens the the door and sees that it was you that was screaming in the washer, and she pulls you out. "Wade... are you alright?" Lockette asked you... but you started to scream and yell in anger, as Lockette was just flatout stupid to your commands, especially when you are trying to guide her in the right direction of all of this mess. Lockette wants to pay her debt to society, you are so busy trying to escape that she doesn't even bother about you.

"You freaking idiot.... Jesus mother god damn fucking Christ sake.... why am I paired up with such a retarted monster just like Lockette?" you cursed out to yourself, completely angry that your escape plan is sure to fail, as now they are some movement heading towards the washer room. Who is it?
1431.title: Lockette

14311.content:
"Why that little malcontent!" yells a familiar voice. "He got out again! That's the thirty-eighth time! Oh, this time I'm going to castrate him! Good thing I know where to look for him. No doubt that rat hitched a ride on Lockette. Why I stuck him with the most model prisoner in Under Gloom. After I deal with that Wade Wilson I'm getting my head examined."
