Destiny growled at Lockette and pushed her into the wall as Clover and Cree looked in horror right before Destiny's flaming hair lit up again.

By this point the spirit of wrath had mutated Destiny into a red hulking beast resembling a cross between a gargoyle, a demon and a dinosaur and she was so utterly mad that her footsteps were leaving burn marks in the floor as she walked by. Suddenly, Destiny's ears begun to twitch and she gave a hiss as she turned her head and looked into the cell of a trembling Mariah. Destiny growled and then stomped into the cell and you had to close your eyes as Destiny pummels Mariah who cries uncontrollably from the beating. “I wasn’t even doing anything!” “DON’T THINK I DON’T KNOW WHAT YOU’RE THINKING!!” Destiny finishes by slamming the centauress butt first into the cell walls where Mariah’s hindquarters are stuck. Mariah struggles to pull herself free as Destiny walks out of the door and slams it shut with the centaur along with it.

“This is getting worse,” says Clover. “The inmates are getting punished even when they’re not doing anything.” Cree gives a whimper. “And when they do, we get punished as well. My mouth is still sore from when Destiny beat on me. Aurelia had to put my dinner in the blender.” Clover gave a trumpet and a hiss. “You like, don’t know how easy you have it. They don’t make dentures for tusks. If my teeth get broken then I’ll never get a man. Cree, you’re lucky you’re already married.” Suddenly, both Clover and Cree froze in place and Destiny glared at them.

“I DON’T PAY YOU TO GOSSIP YOU BLATHERING FAT CANTALOUPE! GET BACK TO WORK OR I’LL TIE YOUR NOSE IN A KNOT!” Clover screamed and ran off crying before Destiny glared at Cree who whimpered and scurried away on all fours. Destiny was about to scream at Cree next but then she heard the sound of a punch clock and then turned around to see Simone trying to sneak away from the punch clock as she gave a wimpy sounding monkey shriek. “SIMONE!” yelled Destiny as her flaming hair erupted again. “YOU’RE 15 MINUTES LATE! I EXPECT CONTROL AND DISCIPLINE IN MY PRISON! WHAT IF AN INMATE GOT LOOSE IN YOUR TURF AND YOU DIDN’T REACH THEM IN TIME!” Simone was too scared to shriek and then Destiny proceeded to beat the everloving snot out of her as you tremble. “I’ve created a monster.” You say. Destiny was driven so berserk by that evil spirit of rage that not even the guards were safe.

Even Doris the executioner was there and she was scared to death. “That’s it,” says the gryphon. “I’m going to see if Belladonna needs a friend in Aquaslab. I’m not even going to hand in my resignation to that walking Mt. Vesuvius. I’m getting the heck out of here.” Doris immediately ran to her locker and emptied everything out of it into a bag, up to including a rubber ducky with horns. She zipped her bag and flew off as Cree and Clover gulped. “Even the executioner has abandoned us. We’re doomed.” Cree then gasped as she looked out the window. “Oh no.” She said. Outside the window was Aurelia and she was walking right into Under Gloom and from the looks of it, she was pissed.

Aria floats in front of Aurelia, still holding her throat in pain as the jackal giantess walks into the prison. “It isn’t visiting hours, Aurelia,” says Aria with worry in her tone. “You don’t want to...” Aurelia just pushes Aria to the side and gives a growl. “Yes, I do.” Aurelia walks through the prison as Cree runs down to intercept her wife. “Aurelia! What the hell are you doing here?!” “I’m giving that tomato-haired temper tantrum a piece of my mind for how she’s been treating you lately.” Cree looks in horror. “Believe me, Aurelia,” says the werehyena. “You don’t want to run into Destiny.” “Oh yes I do,” says Aurelia. “Nobody beats up on my wife and gets away with it.” Cree looks in terror as her mate walks forward and then there’s a stomping sound.

Destiny comes down, more pissed than ever, skin bright red, spikes and teeth as sharp as knives, horns like a demon and her flaming hair burning so bright that the walls were starting to melt and char. You look at Aurelia in your cage and then step back in fear as Destiny growls at the jackal giantess. “CREE! WHAT IS YOUR WIFE DOING HERE?! I THOUGHT I TOLD YOU THAT ONLY STAFF WAS ALLOWED IN THIS WAY!” Cree cowers in front of Destiny but an angry Aurelia just steps forward. “Listen here, Demona,” says Aurelia with a voice full of spite. “Warden or no warden, I will not tolerate an abusive boss, especially if said abusive boss employs my wife. It was not Cree’s fault that Ariel escaped and even if it was, you had no right to beat her senseless.” Destiny’s hair begins to burn brighter as her eyes glow orange-yellow.

“In fact,” says Aurelia. “You’ve been acting like a complete jerk lately! I don’t know how anyone could stand being around somebody who’s always as angry as you are! I’ll bet it’s eating you up inside and you think you have to let it out on everyone around you! I can’t even figure out how your own daughter could stand to be around somebody like you! If I had somebody as mean as you in my family, I wouldn’t want anything to do with them!” Destiny’s skin turns brighter and you actually begin to prey as her veins erupt on her body from Aurelia.

“Let’s see,” says Aurelia. “You were fat in high school, the only man you let get close to you abandoned you and then there’s the daughter out of wedlock. And let’s not forget somebody keeps pointing out your resemblance to a cartoon character. A lot of things to emotionally corner you and the only thing you can do is unleash that rage. Kind of pathetic when you think about it.” Destiny growls loudly as she holds her claws and Cree is petrified with fear as she looks on. “Aurelia,” mutters Cree. “Please stop.” “Shut up, Cree,” says Aurelia sternly. “As for you, you gargoyle witch, I already called Kate Rowling and I’ll see you in court for employee harassment!” Destiny gives a snort but Aurelia barks back at her and starts to growl herself and even bites Destiny as Destiny growls. "Aurelia!" yells Cree. "Get out of there!"

But Aurelia is much too bad. There is a look of pure anger in her one good eye and she holds her own claws out as she seems to prepare to fight Destiny.

What happens next?
1532212131212212.title: Where Tempers Dare

153221213121222.content:
To your complete surprise, it was Destiny on the ground with Aria standing victorious. As you looked, you saw that Destiny was actually back to normal. But any joy you may have had instantly went down the toilet when you saw Aria.

Aria's skin was now blood red, her hair had turned into flames, she now had the extreme muscle size Destiny did, and her breasts had shot up several cup sizes. Spikes had grown out of her arms, her teeth had become shark-like, and her eyes were now bloodshot with red irises. She was snarling like a dog. You were now freaked out. Aria was possessed by Wrath now.

"Call me a f**king cow, will you?" Aria said, her voice now gravelly. "Anyone who calls me a cow is in for hell." She then turned to look at you and Clover. To your horror, she grinned madly. She then picked up the battered Destiny and threw her at you two.

"We're making changes around her." Aria said. "From now on, since Destiny's in no condition, I'm taking over as Warden." As she said that, you realized something: unlike when Destiny, who was always screaming when possessed, Aria was much quieter, almost in a sinister whisper. But you knew she was furious.

"I'll be in MY office." Aria said, putting emphasis on 'my'. "Distrub me, and die." She then walked off.

At that point, Destiny woke up and looked at you two. "Clover, Wade..." She said weakly. "Where was I the past week?"

"We need to get you to the Doctor." Clover said, picking up Destiny.

Who do we follow now?
153221213121222.title: The Angry Onryo

1532212131212221.content:
Clover takes Destiny to the Doctor who puts a damp cloth on the gargoyle whose skin is turning pale as she groans. "I wish I was dead," mutters Destiny. "I feel awful." Clover looks in concern at the Doctor. "Is she going to be alright, Doc?" The Doctor chatters her mouth. "Given how long she was possessed by Wrath and how it was removed from her body, she's going to be really sick for days. She won't be able to move for quite some time." Destiny lets out a groan. "What happened?" she asks. You give a scoff. "You seriously don't remember!? You were possessed by the evil spirit of wrath and you were lashing out at everybody like a sentient volcano!"

Destiny actually looks disturbed at that notion. "Oh my. Did anyone get hurt." Clover scoffs. "Like, ye-ah! Me for one! You beat the hell out of anyone who so much as annoyed you. You even hit Fate when she tried to calm you down." Destiny gives a look of horror. "I did WHAT!?" She then groans in absolute pain. "Nobody was safe," says the Doctor. "You even beat the stuffing out of the guards and ripped out Shelly's shell. I was 'fraid you were gonna rip me 'ead off." Destiny gives a cough and looks around as her body is aching. "Where's Belladonna?" "She transferred to Aquaslab," says the Doctor. "After how much you abused her under the influence of Wrath, she decided your job wasn't worth usurping." Destiny scoffs. "Like a rat from a sinking ship."

Destiny then groans as her body begins to ache and throb. "But how come Aria got possessed?" you ask. "Well," says the Doctor. "These evil spirits can be tricky. They enter a person's body and force 'em to indulge in their respective sin. But somebody who already highlights the sin might be more susceptible to it. Wrath was attracted to Destiny because of her already frankly horrible temper. But when Aria lost her temper back there, she became even more angry than Destiny and Wrath possessed her next." Clover gives a snort. "From one tyrant to the next." You sit in your cage and gulp. This wasn't looking good.

Suddenly, Cree and Simone burst in, scared as heck. "Cree?" asks Clover. "Simone? What's going on?" Destiny grunts as Cree and Simone grab hold of her and Simone grabs your cage with her tail. "Warden's orders," says Cree. "Aria wants us to put Destiny and Wade in the Pit." You give a gulp. "What!?" yells Clover. "Cree! That's mutiny! Destiny's the warden!" "Well, at the moment, I'm more afraid of Aria than I am of Destiny." You could not believe it. You and Destiny were both being hauled off to the pit.

Meanwhile, there's a visitor making her way to Under Gloom. But who is it?
1532212131212221.title: The Infirmary

choices: Skip to Tomorrow with Fate and Beth at the Library
A Reporter Overhears the Conversation and Goes to Under Gloom to Investigate
153221213122.content:
The next day, Fate was still shaken up about what she saw of her mother the day before and was shivering as she put on her security uniform to go to work. "Sure," she thought to herself. "Being a prison warden is a successful job, and I know that she's too stubborn to take time off and I guess Wade's bad behavior is no help. But yesterday. Ouch. I couldn't believe it. Mom has never been that cranked before. This sounds like more than mere stress." As Fate was flying to work, she looked out towards Under Gloom and she was wondering if Destiny was still livid.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Soon, Fate had arrived at the Daily Tombstone, where she worked as a security guard. She was taking her tray to a table and was with a fellow guard. This guard was a behemoth, a monster resembling, a giant dragon-like hippopotamus. The behemoth was as big and fat as Fate and had tan-yellow skin, long light brown hair and what looked like a skull tattoo on her right butt cheek. Fate and her behemoth friend sat down at the table and immediately dug in to several burgers but while the behemoth was shoveling away, Fate was eating rather slowly and nervously. “Something bothering you, Fate?” asked the behemoth woman.

Fate let out a sigh. “It’s my mom, Beth,” said Fate. “Yesterday she was totally pissed.” Beth just rolls her eyes before shoving some fries down her large mouth. “So what else is new?” “This was different,” says Fate. “She was literally burning with rage. I actually saw her rip an attempted escapee’s tail off and throw it in the garbage.” Beth slurps a milkshake before letting out a loud belch as she answers. “Whoa,” she says. “That’s harsh.” “It gets worse,” says Fate through a mouth full of fries. “She beat on Cree and Clover for it.” As Fate drinks her own shake, Beth raises an eyebrow. “That’s not like Destiny. Sure, she’s an ill-tempered, man-hating crank but she’s not abusive.” “It gets worse,” says Fate with a slight belch. “Afterwards, she made the inmates wash their uniforms in bedpans.” “Fate,” says Beth as she shoves pterodactyl nuggets into her mouth. “I’m eating.”

Fate lets out a moan as she plays with her straw. “She even looked different. She was bigger and beefier, her skin was blood red and her hair was on fire.” Beth lets out a gag on her burger. “Oh my gosh,” says Beth. “Fate, you ever heard of the eight deadly sins?” “Eight?” asks Fate as she devours a hotdog. “I thought there were only seven.” “You ever heard of the sometimes y rule. This is the sometimes despair rule.” “Despair is a sin?” “You’re missing my point. For each of the eight sins, there is an evil spirit that corresponds to the sin. These spirits merge with the souls of a victim and force them to feed the sin, thereby indulging in it. It sounds to me like your mom somehow got possessed by the sin of wrath.” “Oh geez,” moans Fate. “And she had a nasty temper before. We’ve got to do something.”

Beth lets out another belch before speaking. “I think I might know how to fix the problem. Tomorrow, Lexi is hiring a couple of new guards in the event neither of us can make it to work. We can go to the library and maybe find a way to exorcise that evil spirit.”

What happens now?
153221213122.title: Fate Chance

15322122.content: Alright, well Shelly has another potion that even she doesn't about. Think you'll get lucky with that?
15322122.title: Nah

153221221.content:
"What is that?" You ask Shelly as she pulls out a human sized vial with a cork in it. It's full of a blue liquid.

"This is... um... this is... uh... I'm going to be honest, I actually don't know what this does. But I can bet it will help you." Shelly says.

That did not fill you with confidence. She outright admitted she had no idea what it was. But it was your best bet right now. "If that thing can get me out if here, I'll take it." You say.

"Great." Shelly says before handing you the vial.

You manage to slip it into your pocket before the cell door opens. Destiny walks in with Cree behind her. She looks down and sees you.

"Hi, Demona." You say in a smug tone.

Destiny just glares at you before picking you up and taking you back to your cell. She throws you in harsly and shuts the door. Luckily, you land on Lockette's stomach.

"Tried to escape again, Wade?" She asked as you climb down.

"Can it. I still have a chance." You say as you pull the vial out. Luckily, it didn't break.

"What is that?" Lockette asked.

"No stinking clue. But it might help me get out." You answer before popping the cork and drinking the potion inside.

"Wade, is that a good idea?"

You finish the potion and look at her. "Be quiet. This is going to-" You start to say. Then your eyes go wide and you pass out.
--------------------------------------
When you came too, you immediatly knew something was wrong. Because the first thing you saw was your body in the infirmary. Your body was out cold. You also registered that you were much higher up that usual. Did that potion kill you? You happen to look to your left and see a mirror. What you saw IN it, however, shocked you. Instead of yourself, you saw another person who was at the prison. The person was...
153221221.title: The Unknown Potion

1532212211.content:
You were horrified at what you saw. In the mirror was Destiny, the one person you hated most. You were having a hard time believing this, so you raised your right arm. Sure enough, Destiny in the mirror raised her right arm too. You did the same with the left arm. That confirmed your worst fear: you were in Destiny's body.

"What the hell is going on?" You ask in Destiny's voice, freaked out and mad at the same time.

"That's what I want to know." You hear Destiny's voice again, but you didn't say that. you swing around, but don't see the real Destiny.

"Where are you?" You ask.

"Look in the mirror."

You turn back to the mirror. All you see is Destiny.

"I'm right here." Destiny says. To your shock, you saw Destiny's, or your, mouth moving, but you didn't say that.

"What- what-" You try to say, but your mind just can't form the words.

"Congratulations Wade. I don't know how you did it, but from the looks of it, the two of us are sharing MY body." Destiny says.

You're still trying to process this. "That potion did this?" You finally say.

"What potion?" Destiny asks.

"Guess there's no point in hiding it. When I was in Shelly's cell, she gave me a blue potion. I drank it, blacked out, and woke up in your body." You explain.

"Great, so thanks to that con artist and your stupidity, we have to share my body." Destiny says. "Fantastic."

At that, the door to the infirmiry swung open. Walking through the door was...
---------------------------------
From this point onward, Wade and Destiny will have different fonts to show who's in control of Destiny's body. Wade will be in bold, Destiny will be in italics.
1532212211.title: Sharing a Body with the Enemy

15322122112.content:
Before we being, I need to change something. Whoever's in control speaks in a normal font, but Destiny and Wade can talk to each other by thinking. They will have different style based on who is talking. Wade will have bold, green font, while Destiny has italic, purple font. Also, when you see this: "", the character is talking. When you see this: '', the character is thinking. Just clearing that up.

--------------------------

For once in you're life, you felt relief at seeing a monster.

The woman was an 800 foot tall living mannequin. Her skin was made of a red plastic. She had blonde nylon hair and green eyes. She had a slim figure with slight curves. She was wearing a lab coat and glasses. Since she was a mannequin, she had stiff, almost mechanical movements.

This woman was the prison doctor. Everyone in the prison barely knew anything about her, other than that she was good at her job. Even her name was unknown, so everyone called her The Doctor. She was known for being cold, almost emotionless.

"Ah, Ms. Sirtis. Good to see you here." The Doctor said in a British accent. "Sorry it took me a little bit to get her. The lift's down."
"No problem." You reply, trying not to have a total freak-out.

'Oh no. Why did The Doctor have to show up now?' You heard Destiny say. But it sounded like she was echoing. 'And don't reply to me by talking. I think I'm speaking in your, or my, head. So just think what you want to say to me.'

'Alright' You think back.

"Are you ok, Ms. Sirtis? You look distracted?" The Doctor asked you.

"No, I'm fine. So what's wrong with Wade here?" You reply.

"Well, I've gone over the charts, and it looks like Mr. Wilson is in a coma. Whatever he drank stopped all brain functions." The Doctor explained.

'Damn it!' You think.

'Well, there's one good thing coming out of this.' Destiny replied.

'Quiet Demona!' You snap back.

'You want me to rip you apart?'

'You'd only rip yourself apart.'

"Ms. Sirtis?" The Doctor asked.

You snap back to reality. It must have looked like you want blank. "Sorry, what?" You ask.

"I was saying that it would be best to keep him in a hidden place in the infirmary. The other inmates my try to take advantage of this." She replied.

"Uh, sure do that." You quickly say before exiting the room in a flash.

'Crap,' You think as you walk down the hall. 'Not only am I stuck in YOUR body, Demona, but MY body's in a coma. What the hell do I do now?'

'Don't know, don't care. All I know is I'm taking over for now.' Destiny replied. Then it suddenly felt like your were flying backwards. When you stopped, you notice something. You are still seeing through Destiny's eyes, but you're not in control.

'What the hell was that?' You ask.

'I took over. I think that's how it works. But it doesn't matter. What matters is I have my body back, and you just have to watch. Besides, I need to be somewhere.' Destiny replied.

'Where?' You ask.
15322122112.title: 'Ello, Doctor

153221221123.content:
"Home," replied Destiny. "I'm expecting company tonight and you had better not say anything you'll regret or else." "Or, else what, Demona?" Destiny then grabs a pen and then stabs herself in the fingertip with it to make you both grunt in pain.

"Remember Wade," said Destiny. "I am expecting my sister and her family. They're gonna be in town for a few days. If you make any trouble, there will be consequences once this nightmare is over." "Bitch, bitch, bitch. That's all you ever do." "Don't try my patience you scummy human."

It isn't long before Destiny punches out and the both of you in Destiny's body are walking out. "Where is the ****ing car, Demona?" "In the shop," said Destiny. "We'll have to fly. Ack!" You take control of the body and flap Destiny's wings. "What the hell are you doing?" "I'm taking control. How hard can it be. You can do it fine without a brain. "Wade, quit being an idiot and let me fly."

But you don't heed Destiny's words and fly off. Or try to. You keep bumping into the wall of the mountain and yelling in pain before you finally crash land on the ground, landing on a peluda camper in the process, snatch first in the process, prompting Destiny to scream in pain. (in case anyone didn't know, a peluda is a French monster resembling a cross between a dragon and a porcupine). Soon, you're limping in Destiny's body all the way to Destiny's house. "Damn, getting all those needles out, hurt," says Destiny out loud. "That is the last time you fly." You stick out your tongue as Destiny is walking home.

You then decide to look into Destiny's mind. There has to be something in her that explains why she acts like she's got a you-know-what up her you-know-where. You start to laugh because you learn that Destiny was rather overweight in high school and in college. She looked like a blue skinned and red haired version of her daughter with longer horns. Then you see Destiny accompanying another female gargoyle, you learn that this is her sister. From the looks of it, Destiny's sister is a brown-skinned gargoyle with curved horns and ridged pink bat-like wings and long blonde hair. She appeared to be five years younger than Destiny given that you see an image of her as a child while Destiny is a teenager. Apparently her sister's name was Fortuna. "Fortuna?" you ask. "Was your mother a fortuneteller or something?" "Yes," says Destiny in annoyance. "She was. Wait? Are you looking at my memories?!" "Yeah and unfortunately I found one from spring break on your last year of high school. That bikini bottom might as well be dental floss, fatass" "I swear I am going to put you to sleep if you so much as touch anything else!"

You disregard Destiny and see one memory that depicted her apparently on a date during what you think is her last year in college with a large purple-skinned gargoyle with brownish blonde hair. That must've been her ex. Then you see one morning with the two of them in bed with Destiny having motion sickness and her boyfriend with an "Oh Crap" look on his face as he appears to be getting ready to scram. Given that the next scene shows Destiny at the doctor learning of her pregnancy, you take it that schlub knew what was coming. Then you see an image of months later with Destiny holding Fate's egg and appears to be crying. You let out a laugh as Destiny is getting more and more frustrated with you.

Then you decide to see how that Fortuna bimbo turned out and see Destiny playing the best woman at Fortuna's wedding, albeit with a bitter look on her face and a glare at the groom who appears to be a black skinned gargoyle with rose colored hair. Fat appears to be a flower girl at the wedding which would mean that Fate had to be at least six when Fortuna and her husband were married. "I take it you have issues your brother-in-law. Kinda looks like..." "I know what you're gonna say Wade, but I don't care. I don't like any man and I'll be crucified if I let some bum take advantage of my sister. So far he's been responsible, but I swear, if he tries to pull anything, I'll skin him alive." You learn that Destiny's brother-in-law is named David. Kind of ironic when you think about it. "And don't you compare by brother-in-law to that bearded pig. If that scummy son of a bitch you're thinking about were at Under Gloom, I'd feed him to Persephone." You mentally give Destiny the finger as she pulls out the last quill and grits her teeth as she approaches her door and tries to unlock it.

However, the door is already unlocked and Destiny groans before she opens it to see Fortuna and David inside. "Well, look who's back," says Fortuna. "Hey there, big sister. I thought that you were going to be late, so we let ourselves in." Destiny lets out a mutter. "You know," she says. "In some parts, that's considered a crime." "Lighten up," says Fortuna with a smirk. "Demona." Fortuna laughs and you laugh as well. "Ha! Even your own sister calls you "Demona", Demona." "Shut up Wade!" "Is everything okay, Destiny?" asks David. "You look more tense than you usually do." You then push Destiny out of the way in the mind. "What the?!" yells Destiny in her mind before you speak. "And you're just as ugly as ever, you failed abortion." Fortuna and David are both shocked at what "Destiny" just said. "You don't have to be a jerk about it," says David. "What crawled up your craw?" Destiny is visibly mad with you. But you smirk at her in the mind and flip her off. You made Destiny give a threatening gesture David's way as David looked on in confusion. But as you were walking, you let out a yell because you trip on something, or rather, someone."

You hit the floor and look in your surprise to see that you caused Destiny's body to trip on a younger gargoyle. You'd say a teenager that looked like a female version of David and was surprisingly only 450ft tall, less than half Destiny's height. "Ouch." Moaned the female gargoyle. "Destiny," says Fortuna. "Be careful. Pearl, are you alright, honey." You then cause Destiny's body to stand up and yell at Pearl. "Watch where you're going, shrimp!" Pearl does not take this well. "Watch where I'm going? You were the one not paying attention, Auntie D? Wait, what was that?" "You heard me, you undercooked runt, get out of my way." Fortuna is shocked at what she is seeing.

"Destiny!" she yells as she stand between her sister and her daughter, completely unaware of the situation. "What is wrong with you? You're acting really nasty today." Destiny then takes over and grunts. "Sorry about that, sis," she says. "I'm not exactly feeling myself today. Something happened at work that I'd like to forget happened." "That's no reason to be so mean." Mutters Pearl. Destiny is visibly mad at you. "The lousy brat started it. What's with that midget? I thought gargoyles were supposed to be huge?" "Pearl is a dwarf by gargoyle standards," says Destiny to you. "Show some sensitivity." You flip Destiny off and then she begins to wring herself by the neck.

"What the heck?!" yells Fortuna as she stops her sister. "Destiny, are you feeling alright?!" "I'm fine!" yells Destiny. David looks very worried. "I think she's finally lost her marbles." Destiny makes her eyes glow red." "I think I better get dinner ready," says Fortuna as she walks into the kitchen. "Let's just home you have something other than pre-cooked junk food in your fridge." "Oh no," says Destiny. "I'm coming with you. Last time I let you use my kitchen, you made a mess of things." Destiny accidentally runs into the wall and then begins to swear under her breath as you laugh at her.
153221221123.title: Destiny's Relatives

1532212211232.content:
While you and Destiny were confusing Destiny's relatives, back at Under Gloom, The Doctor was having her own issues. She had just hid your comatose body in a drawer a few hours ago, and was patching up Elaine's arm, which had been snapped.

"...so she called me 'Plastic Tits', I got mad, and punched Yuri in the face. Then she grabbed my arm-" Elaine explained.

"Alright, Elaine, that's enough. I can figure out what happened next." The Doctor interrupted her, bored with Elaine's story.

"Well, you're just a ray sunshine, aren't you?" Elaine asked, annoyed at being interrupted.

The Doctor finished the wrappings. "Keep weight off that arm for a few weeks. Then come back to me." She said, still bored.

Elaine thanked her and left. The Doctor sighed and walked over to a nearby radio, turning it on.

"You're listening to KRRZ-19. The home of classics and opera. It's almost 9 at night, which means in a few minutes, The Danielle Connor Show will be-"

The Doctor turned off the radio. She hated Danielle Connor. She was too energetic. She went back to her desk, but before she had a chance to sit down, Clover entered the infirmary.

"Doctor, are you alright?" Clover asked.

"Of course, why?" The Doctor replied, confused.

"Darcy just escaped the prison. Somehow, she managed to get through the walls." Clover explained.

"Darcy? The boggart?"

"Yes, why?"

Without saying a word, The Doctor got up and ran over to the drawer where your body was kept. Opening it, her fear was confirmed: your body was gone. Darcy had managed to get it.

"Well, crap." The Doctor said.
1532212211232.title: Body Snatcher

15322122112321.content:
Back at Destiny's house, you and Destiny are still stuck in the same body and Fortuna is going through Destiny's fridge. "Mother Rigby," groans Fortuna. "Don't you have anything other than tarantula and sea urchin pizza in the freezer, Destiny?" "Tarantula and sea urchins?" you ask in disgust. "What are you, a ****ing ninja turtle?" "**** you." Fortuna then sees that in the fridge there are several cases of instant ramen. "With your diet," says Fortuna. "It's a wonder you're not fat like you were in high school." "Don't start with that again, Fortuna." Warns Destiny. Fortuna then reaches into a basket of some kind and lets out a sigh. "It's a good thing I came prepared. Maybe a good meal will put you in a better mood."

Fortuna takes out what looks like a giant centipede and you reflexively force Destiny's body to grab her by the mouth. Destiny is more than a little annoyed. "What the hell is that bubble-butted witch planning to cook? It's a ****ing centipede for crying out loud!" "Centipedes are a good source of protein. We're monsters, what do you expect us to eat?" "People."

Fortuna then takes out a jar of ants and begins to stuff the centipede with the giant ants as you mentally gag. "Destiny," says Fortuna. "Could you be a dear and get me some cheese from the fridge." "I'll get you some cheese alright, Desdemona." You mutter in Destiny's voice. Fortuna stops what she's doing and then raises a... gargoyles don't have eyebrows but you get the idea. "Did you just call me Desdemona?" You root around in Destiny's fridge and see several bottles of green soda pop that looks somewhat like ooze and then you see an old leftover pizza covered in dead cockroaches (you don't know if they're eating it or just part of the food). Then you see some strange literally blue cheese and take a slice. Then you give a smirk and spit on it, only for Destiny to grab herself by the throat to make you gag. "I saw that, you three-layered little anus. Try something like that again and I'll guzzle an entire drum of dragon's blood. Maybe it'll kill you."

You mutter and then grab a piece of a purple spotted cheese to give to Fortuna. "Thanks, sis. You know, you're acting more grumpy than you usually are today. Trouble at work." "Wade," Destiny says aloud. "Very Wade." Fortuna let out a sigh. "You know, you're always complaining about that Wade character. I mean, he's only a human, how bad can he be." "You'd be surprised." Muttered Destiny. "What surprises me is how that loincloth stays onto your thunder thighs, you goat-headed...." Destiny covers her mouth to shut you up as Fortuna gasps and feels her thighs. They are rather large.

"Well excuse me," says Fortuna, obviously annoyed. "You know my butt slowly got fatter after a nineteen-year marriage. You're acting really nasty today. What did Wade do, crawl up your ass?" You shiver at that thought. "Don't start, Wade. I swear, once this is over, I'm going to put you in the ****ing iron maiden."

Outside the kitchen, David and Pearl are listening in. "What's going on in there?" asks Pearl. "Auntie D is acting like she's bipolar or something." "Good grief," says David. "Pearl! Stay away from there! She has easy access to a knife right about now." David shivered as he thought to himself. "I knew she had a dangerously psychotic sister when I married her. But it looks like the blueberry is about to pop. Violently."

"Fortuna!" yells Destiny. "You're using too much salt!" "It's only a little milligram more than what Grandma used. Geez, Destiny. You're really on a roll today. You need to seriously get..." "Don't even say it!" "What's the matter, Demona? Thunder thighs ho is telling you that you need a new dope stupid enough to..." Destiny gets so enraged that she pulls on her hair and then picks up a potato peeler, obviously ready to stick it in her ears before Fortuna snatches it from her.

"Have you lost your mind!" "From what I see, yes, Desdemona, she has." "Shut up!" yells Destiny as she begins to squeeze her head. Fortuna shakes her head. "This is why you're still single."

What happens now?
15322122112321.title: Fortuna in the Kitchen

choices: Something Happens Down Below that Stalls You
153221221123211.content:
Suddenly the phone rings and Destiny takes control of the body to answer it while Fortuna is busy getting dinner ready. "Saved by the bell, Wade. I swear that as soon as this is over, I'm going to take you apart." "Go ahead and try it, Demona." Destiny growls as she picks up the phone. "Good day, Warden." Says the Doctor on the phone. "Doctor," you say from Destiny's mouth. "It's go soak a monkey o'clock. Time for you to go to the bar and..." Before you could finish, Destiny takes control of the body and bites her tongue before groaning in pain. "I'm sorry," says the Doctor. "Am I interrupting something."

Destiny lets out a growl. "What's going on, Doc." "Well," says the doctor on the other line. "There appears to be a problem regarding Wade." "How do you like that?" mutters Destiny. "Somehow you don't have to be at Under Gloom to cause chaos." You stick out your tongue as Destiny's eyes glow red. "What happened this time?" "Well," says the Doctor. "It appears that Darcy Fenton, the boggart criminal, has somehow managed to escape from her cell and has absconded with Wade Wilson's unconscious body." "WHAT!?" You and Destiny both yell at once. "You mean I'm going to be stuck sharing a body with this bitch/asshole!" Destiny gives an angry roar and then tears the phone out of the wall and crumples it up. "Whoa!" yells Fortuna in shock.

Destiny then stomps into the next room as David and Pearl are legitimately scared. "Pearl," mutters Destiny. "Please leave the house for the next five minutes." Pearl obeys her aunt and leaves the house right as Destiny takes out a deep breath and lets out the loudest profanity you've ever heard. So much that it cracked every window in the house. Destiny pants as David gives a shocked face at what he had just heard. Destiny then turns to a very scared Fortuna. "Fortuna," she says. "There's trouble at work. I'm going to go sort it out and maim a certain ****ing ghost!" With that, Destiny stomps out of the house and slams the door hard, not realizing that David's tail is in the way. "Holy sweet lasagna," mutters David as he fights off tears. "That hurts."

Destiny then gets ready to fly off. "I'm flying this time, Wade!" she yells. "I don't feel like pulling peluda quills out of my..." "I get it." Destiny flies off as Pearl looks in confusion. "I think she's upset." She says as if it wasn't painfully obvious. Destiny is flying ferociously towards Under Gloom as she grits her teeth and her eyes glow red. "This is just great! Now that stupid ****ing boggart has my body and I'm gonna be stuck in the same body as a blue bitch with breath that could cause the apocalypse." "Believe me, maggot. This isn't any picnic for me either." "If Darcy eats my body, I swear..." "Darcy doesn't eat humans! Shut up and let me fly!" "You think maybe we'd be better off getting my body back before heading back to that hellhole prison!" "Shut up! Mother, Rigby! If I have to kill myself to do it, I will put you down, you little maggot!" "Blah, blah, blah! I hate you anyway! Go suck on a behemoth!"

As Destiny flies towards Under Gloom, she gets angrier and angrier to the point where you can hear a steam whistle.
153221221123211.title: The Phone Rings

1532212211232112.content:
Suddenly Destiny hears gunshots. "Good grief! What the hell was that?!" Down below, you both see that there is a jewelry store on the ground. Destiny flies down and as it turns out there was a robbery in progress. There were two bandits and they all both a strange symbol somewhere on their person. It looked like a checkered Jolly Roger. From the looks of it, they were pirates, yet none of them looked like the leader.

The first of them was a giant moth man who looked like an Atlas Moth who was wearing black leather with triangular sunglasses and appeared to be packing a pair of handguns like a biker would carry. Being a moth, he had four arms to hold the guns. The second of the duo was colored blue and from the looks of it, he was a kappa resembling a leatherback sea turtle. He was also wearing a suit of armor like one that a samurai would wear and was sharpening his sword to discourage anyone in the store from making any moves while his mothman teammate robbed the place. The samurai kappa held his sword dangerously close to the jewelry store owner's neck while the mothman shot a glass case to make it shatter.

Destiny crouched down to get a good look. "Well, I'll be turned to stone in the sunlight," Destiny says. "Those two are members of the Ouija Air Pirates. I was wondering when those parasite would come to town." "Who cares?" you ask. "Leave the stupid pirates be." However, Destiny just slinked in as she is very careful not to let either of the pirates see her. Since you were stuck sharing Destiny's body, you had no choice but to come along. This sucked. Destiny was risking both your necks while there was your body to get back. All because of two stupid jewel thieves." At that moment, the pirates had managed to clean out the jewelry store and were backing away when...
1532212211232112.title: The Commotion

153221221123212.content:
It isn't long until dinner is served. Of course, you were groaning in Destiny's mind considering the dinner consisted of stuffed centipede and grilled trilobites. "What's with all the bugs?! I would've thought you stone benders ate pigeons and garbage, not this crap." "Quit your complaining. All I want is to enjoy a nice dinner after this horrible day. And you had better not complain about Fortuna's cooking or so help me, I will sell your body to a Chinese restaurant." You just blow your tongue at Destiny while Destiny continues to fume and is sitting down with her family for dinner. Fortuna can't help but stare at her sister, wondering why she's behaving so strangely.

Once everyone else was eating, Destiny tried to bite into a trilobite but you caused her to gag and nearly choke herself as she was groaning, prompting Fortuna and Pearl to stare. Destiny then gagged and forced herself to choke down some water before breathing in and out. "Destiny?" asked Fortuna. "Are you alright." "You expect me to eat this poison!" you yell out, to Fortuna's shock. "Poison!?" yells Fortuna in outrage. "Wade. I am serious. I am going to make you into teriyaki." "**** you, you ****ing ****." Destiny then yells in frustration and grabs her fork and stabs herself in the thumb with it before screaming in pain. Fortuna is now more concerned than ever and Pearl drops her jaw and some centipede at the sight.

"Why did you just stab yourself with a fork?" asks Pearl. David actually backs his chair up out of fear. "You know," he said. "Maybe we should just let her eat with her hands. She's less likely to kill someone that way. Uh, did I just say that out loud." Destiny is fuming mad and then tries to butter a roll. "Watch it with the butter, Demona. You don't want to be Lady Broadway again do you." "Shut up!" "But I didn't say anything." Said a very confused Fortuna. Pearl then turns to her father. "Dad," she says. "Does Auntie D seem like she's acting strange...er than usual tonight." Fortuna glares at her daughter and husband before she turns to Destiny.

"Sis," she says. "I think that it's clear that you had a rough day. Care to talk about it." "I just need the right words to explain it." "Here's three," you say. "Go to...." Before you can finish, Destiny grabs herself by the tongue and squeezes it with her claws as you and her both grunt in pain. Destiny is now at this point force-feeding herself her dinner with her bare hands as Fortuna gasped. "Mother Weisman!" yells David. "I was just kidding!" As Destiny is eating, you taste the entire dinner and gag in disgust before you make Destiny cough and hold down her head as she all but vomited. "Des, are you alright?" asks Fortuna." Then Fortuna yells because you force Destiny to grab her by the horn.

"I'm fine! Why don't you mind your own business you ram-headed busybody!" you shout at Fortuna. "Why don't you and your boulder butt get out of my face!" Fortuna gasped and then Destiny's eyes turned red and she gets so mad with what you're making her do that she screams it out loud. "You leave my sister alone you little ****!" What Destiny says is terrible enough to force David to cover Pearl's ears. "What the?!" yells Fortuna. Then you make Destiny speak again. "Shut up, Demona! Your asshole sister has been sticking her nose into this all night and tried to poison us with such a horrible dinner!" "You are an ingrate, you know that, Wade! She should've been feeding you dirt!" "I hope you choke on all that centipede she feeds you!" "As soon as we get back to Under Gloom, I am going to put you through a meat grinder!

At this point, both of you were shouting out loud and switching between who was speaking, leaving Fortuna, Pearl and David very confused. David however, was completely horrified. "Oh good grief. She's going to explode. Why did I have to get stuck with her for a sister-in-law." "Shut up, David!" you and Destiny seem to both scream at once. "Say another word and you'll need a prosthetic.....!" "Have you gone mental!?" yells Fortuna. "You stay out of this!" you yell. "I warned you, Wade!" Destiny then glares at Pearl who is visibly intimidated. "Pearl! Hit me as hard as you can with that there plate!"

Pearl is very shocked at that request. "Are you sure, Auntie D?" "Did I stutter! Hit me so hard that that little creep will be left with only 12% of whatever he has for brains! Do it!" Pearl is so scared that she almost brains Destiny before Fortuna takes the plate from her. "What the hell is going on?!" Destiny then gets so enraged that to everyone's shock, she takes one of her own horns and tears it right off. Destiny then pants heavily and holds up the horn. "What are you up to, Demona?" Destiny smiles fiendishly and it looks like she is going to stab herself in the forehead with her own horn when Fortuna knocks it out of her hands.

"What is wrong with you!? You're acting like a lunatic!" Destiny lets out a groan. "It's Wade! He's in my head?" "Well," said Fortuna. "At least you admit you have..." "I mean, literally. He took some weird potion that put his mind inside my head and now we're stuck and he's driving me up the wall!" Fortuna, David and Pearl just stare at Destiny.

Does Fortuna believe Destiny?
153221221123212.title: Wade, Destiny and the Dinner

1532212211232122.content:
"O... M... G," mutters Fortuna. "You've finally done it. You've finally cracked. Wade has driven you so mad, in both senses of the word, that you're hearing voices in your head." Destiny is very distressed that her sister seems to think that she's gone daft. "I am not crazy, Fortuna! He took a weird potion and now we're stuck in the same bo..." Destiny then grunts as you take control of her body. "Don't listen to that stupid old crone, you fat-assed ram-horned blonde bimbo! I've had enough of..." Destiny then takes control and tries to strangle herself. "Shut up! Shut the **** up, you little bastard!" Pearl and Fortuna are now very afraid. "It was bound to happen sooner or later," says Pearl. "But this is just sad." "I'm NOT crazy!" yells Destiny in desperation. "What will it take to get you to realize that...!" Before Destiny could finish her sentence, both she and you grunt in pain as you hear a loud clang.

Destiny then collapses to the floor and you both fall unconscious. David had snuck up behind Destiny and assaulted her with a metal colander. Fortuna crosses her arms and glares at her husband who give s a sheepish look. "She looked like she'd turn violent." Fortuna lets out a groan. "Wade finally did it," says Fortuna. "He drove my poor sister over the edge." Pearl shook her head. "What do we do with Auntie D now?" "What can we do?" asks David. "That woman is dangerous. We can't leave her to her own devices. It's like giving a murderer the gun." Fortuna let out a sigh and walks up to the telephone. "I'm afraid we can't do anything to help her now. Hello, Kaiju Disarming Plant?"

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

The next day, Destiny is chained up and muzzled as Fortuna has dragged her into the back seat of her car. Before Fortuna drives off, Fate flies down from the sky and from the looks of it, she has a forlorn look on her face. "I'm really sorry, Fate," says Fortuna to her niece. "I thought this was something you needed to see." Fate holds her head down. "It's alright, Aunt Fortuna," says Fate. "You're only doing what needs to be done. I knew all that stress and anger would ruin Mom some day, but I didn't think it would happen like this." Destiny shakes in place and grunts as Fate looks on and even starts to cry. "I hate to do this to you, Sis," says Fortuna to Destiny. "But you leave me no choice. Without proper help, your mental health is only going to get worse." Fate gets into the seat and then looks back at her mother. "It's going to be okay, Mom. Dr. West is out sick, but Whitney should help you back on your talons." Fate kisses her mother on the forehead before she puts on her seatbelt and then Fortuna drives the car away.

Needless to say, within her own mind, Destiny is none too pleased with you. "Wade," she says. "You ass nugget. I hate you. You ruined my life. My family thinks I'm a lunatic, I've lost my job at Under Gloom and I broke one of my horns. You really outdid yourself this time, you heartless asshole." "Cry me a river, Demona," you snap back. "If you weren't such a psychotic bitch..." "Because you kept driving me crazy!" "You think I like this development!? Now I'm gonna be stuck in a house for monster-sized retards!" "I wish I had a gun so I could shut you up once and for all, you jerk! I hope that your body gets eaten by a dinosaur and that dinosaur gets eaten by a minotaur!" "It's go soak your head o'clock, you blue temper tantrum!" Destiny shakes angrily in the back seat as Fortuna and Fate look on in concern, not knowing it's you causing her distress. "Oh good grief," says Fate. "We can't get her to the K.D.P. fast enough. Damn that Wade. Even when he's in a coma, he wrecks Mom's life. I hope he never wakes up."

- - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Meanwhile, at Under Gloom, Aria is floating through the hallway when she catches two guards slacking off. "Up and at 'em," says the onryo. "The government isn't paying you to slack off." "Yes, Vice Warden." Groans the guards. In what was once Destiny's office, Belladonna is smiling blissfully as she twirls in the seat. Since Destiny has been declared legally insane, Belladonna has taken her place as the warden and the manticore was giggling to herself. "I didn't even have to do anything. The blue mutant just self-destructed." Belladonna let out a laugh and then took out her laptop. "Now," she says. "I need a new uniform, one that says "I'm the boss"." Belladonna just laughs again as she web searches.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - -

At that time, Fortuna and Fate have taken Destiny to the K.D.P. where they've met with the head orderly. She was an obese and albino skinned 975ft tall wererhinoceros who resembled a white rhinoceros in a silver bikini, a lab coat and a nurse's hat. She also wore a pair of glasses since rhinos have very bad eyesight. The rhino giantess had long orange-red hair and a blue tattoo of a rhinoceros' head over her right eye. "Well," says the rhino woman to Destiny. "Looks like that awful temper of yours finally boiled over." Destiny lets out a mumble. "We really appreciate this, Whitney," says Fortuna. "If anyone can get her to fly right again, it's you." Fate then hugs Destiny tight before Fortuna leads her out. "Don't worry, you two," says Whitney. "This time it's personal."

You let out a scoff. "I can't believe it. I've gone from one prison to another with Rocksteady's daughter as the new warden." "You had better be nice for Whitney, Wade. She happens to be my best friend." "I didn't know you had any friends." "Okay, now you're just being hurtful." Whitney then undoes Destiny's muzzle. "Whitney," says Destiny. "This is a terrible mistake." Whitney just blows on her finger. "I know what happened, Destiny. You've gotten so used to Wade that with him in a coma, you're now playing both sides of the argument. I'd even hazard a guess you've developed a split personality between the dedicated stone-faced prison warden and the obnoxious ne'er-do-well who pushes her buttons." Then you take over Destiny's body and snap at Whitney. "Why don't you mind your own business, Fox Xanatos?!" you shout. Whitney is confused at your statement and doesn't appear to understand what you said.

Whitney begins to wheel Destiny's body away. "Give it up, Wade," says Destiny. "Whitney has never heard of that TV show so you're wasting your breath. I don't think she even watches human TV. Besides, she barely looks like Fox at all.." It was there you and Destiny see a blonde-haired human girl in a cage on Dr. West's desk. "Slyvia? What the hell is she doing here?" "You know her?" You let out a scoff. "Well duh. She's a floozy I met in Kansas. I bet she still thinks I'm her boyfriend." You let out a laugh while Destiny is appalled. "You are going straight to hell, Wade, you know that, don't you?" You then give Destiny a raspberry and cause her to have a hissy fit as Whitney tries to hold her down.

Whitney just rolls her eyes as Destiny's eyes turn red. "This is gonna be hard."
1532212211232122.title: Two for the K.D.P.

1532212212.content:
((I'm working on the assumption that the potion's effect are variable, as long as Wade ends up in someone elses body. If that's not how it is, woops.))

You could not believe this. This couldn't be real! Could it? Is it possible? Fearing what you would see, you look away as you raise an arm, only to glance back and confirm that Lockette's reflection was doing the same. With a sigh, you look down at yourself, as if you needed any more confirmation. You were Lockette, completely and totally. That damn Kappa! This isn't what you wanted! And...what happened to Lockette? Because as much as you hated to admit it, you cared about her somewhat. You were cellmates after all.

As if on cue, your old body begins to stir, and you realize just how crazy the size difference was. Of course you were very aware of it before, but never from this angle. "Was I sleeping?" your old voice says lazily. It rolls off of its side and puts a hand to its head. "I don't remember going to sleep..." "Well, that's a funny story actually..." you begin to say shakily, unnerved by the fact that you sounded exactly like her. "Wait, I didn't say...Wade? Wait, what's going on?!" she begins to yell, now suddenly awake and looking around in a daze. As you shared an infirmary bed, she was shocked to have to crane her head up...and up...and up...to see the face of someone so ginormously huge she had a hard time comprehending it.

Her old face.

---

"...and that's what happened. That Kappa's potion must've swapped us around, or some shit." Lockette put her hands on her (your) head, letting out a much due groan of anger as you sheepishly rubbed your elongated neck. This wasn't exactly ideal for you either, seeing as how you were not only a giant Loch Ness Monster-woman, but you were also a woman and a monster. But your worries didn't compare to Lockette's. After all, she's now in a body that may be in prison for a long time, of which the warden hates with all her being. Whereas you were now in a body that might even be released soon!

...wait.

Lockette was always known for her good behavior...maybe...that's how you'll leave the prison? As Lockette? Is that even possible? Could you live like that? Could you live with yourself if you did that?

Neither of you had time to grieve over lost old-lives for very long, however, as the door to the infirmary practically burst open with the entrance of...
1532212212.title: Are you out of your mind?! ...Actually, yeah.

153221222.content: OK. So an unknown potion is a bad idea. How about a potion that she DOES know about?
153221222.title: I don't trust Lady Luck

1532212221.content:
You look at what Shelly has pulled out. It was a vial with a purple liquid in it. It was as big as you were.

"What is that junk?" You ask.

"Oh, I love this stuff. It's a special potion that can change the species of anyone who comes into contact with it. Be it drinking it or getting it on yout skin. All you need to do is think of the species you want. And you can dump on others, and they turn into the species you want." Shelly explains.

"You sound excited by it. Should that worry me?"

"Oh no. I used it a lot to evaid authorites. It works perfectly. Oh, and one more thing. If there is a disease or disorder specific to a monster, like Lactose Overload Syndrome for example, you can think of both the species and the condition, and the potion will give whoever comes into contact with it that condition."

You smiled. This could be your true chance. With the chaos this potion causes, you could slip out unnoticed.

"I'll take it." You say.

"Great." Shelly replies before handing you the vial. The vial was surprisingly light for have a potion in it.

"Before you go, let me suggest something." Shelly says. "If you want to cause maximum chaos in here, try putting the potion in the prison sprinkler system. Every inmate will get soaked, and in the confusion, you can slip out."

You had to admit, that sounded pretty good. So you waited for a guard to come back to check on Shelly. When one did, you ran out the now open door.

After a few hours of running and hiding, you made it to the sprinkler control system in the basement. Climbing up, which wasn't easy with a vial on yout back, you went to an opening on the water tank where you could dump the potion. Now all you had to do was think of a monster type. But what?
1532212221.title: Species Shift

15322122212.content: What else could everyone turn into?
15322122212.title: Another species

15323.content:
Things seemed quiet as you came to the next floor down stairs. You weren't quite sure what was down here but at least for the moment, you thought you could make it back into the hallways safely. So, on the next opening you jumped through the grate and landed on the floor.

One problem. You weren't in a hallway, you were in a room. But which kind?
15323.title: Shoulda looked first.

choices: You begin your new escape plan
Destiny takes you to her office
1533.content:
You wouldn't like this suggestion anyway, but it was heard that you can get parole or something for good behavior at prison. Maybe if you just play it cool and calm with the staff and other prisoners, especially Destiny, perhaps there could be some hope you might get out of prison one day. Besides, many escape plans would and might have failed somehow in some way, so perhaps being a good prisoner could win you some brownie points with the others.

"Screw this. I might as well be a good prisoner and perhaps I might get out of here one day. Just got to avoid causing any trouble for now." you suggested to yourself, and it is quite a plan. Staying on good behavior could help you build relationships or so, and doing that might mean one day you might just leave prison. It's not the best plan in the book in any sort of way, but it's one worth trying. You then decide to just sit around, letting the hours go by and all, and then Destiny comes to the prison cell you are in. She is as strict as always on you, and kept her eye on you.

"Alright you no good escaper, it's lunch time." Destiny told you and Lockette. "And try not escaping this time." she also told you. You replied to her almost mad, but decided to be nice for once. "I won't. In fact, as of now I am going to pay my debt to society by doing my sentence to the fullest. I swear." you told Destiny, and this kinda stuns her. Normally you hate monsters, but you know what, to survive, you got to be a good prisoner for once. "Lockette tells me not to escape, I wouldn't listen, but now I am listening to her."

What happens now?
1533.title: Good behavior (Taking Lockette's Advice for Once)

choices: She Puts You Under House Arrest with a New Guard
15333.content:
As Lockette is being lead out to lunch, Destiny snatches you up. "Lockette," she said. "I think I'll be taking Wade if you don't mind." "Uh," says Lockette. "Yes ma'am." Destiny gives you a glare and you give the best fake smile you could muster before the gargoyle giantess stomps away, carrying you back to her office.

Once in her office, Destiny picks away at a jalapeño salad as she looks down at you. "What's your game, Wade?" asks the warden as she bites into a hot pepper. "No game this time Destiny. I'm beginning to think Lockette was right," you lie through your teeth. "After all, all my escape attempts got me nowhere. Maybe serving my time, good behavior..." Destiny drinks from a water tower sized bottle of soda pop before she answers you. "You aren't a fertilizer salesman, Wade, so don't go selling me 1500 tons of crap. You and "good behavior" go together like donuts and mayonnaise. What do you think I am, an idiot?!" "You don't want me to answer that." You think to yourself.

This was just great, Destiny was skeptical. Makes sense. She wouldn't be the warden if she fell for lies like the one that you're telling her right now.

Destiny taps her claws on her desk as she picks up a tomato from her salad and bites into it. "I know you're lying to me, somehow Wade. But if you want to show good behavior, I know the perfect way."

"Huh?" you ask somewhat worried.
15333.title: Skeptical Destiny

choices: Siobhan Takes You Back to Her Place
153331.content:
( Special Thanks to Dylan M for letting me use his character )

"I know what I'll do," said Destiny with a fanged grin. "I'm going to change your sentence to one year of house arrest with a new guard I just hired." You mentally gulp. You didn't count on Destiny having an ulterior plan." "Come on, Dem.. I mean, Warden Destiny. How do I know they won't eat me." "You'll know," says Destiny as she finishes off her salad and then picks her fangs with one of her claws. "You'll know because this guard's taste for humans depends on whether or not they're good humans or people like you." Destiny then presses a button to call one of the guards. "Siobhan. Get in here."

Siobhan? What kind of dumb name is that. "In case you're wondering, Wade," says Destiny. "It's Irish. The new guard's mother was a banshee. A good friend of mine I might add. Siobhan." The door opened but from your spot on Destiny's desk, you didn't see anyone. You walked to the edge of the table and look down in surprise. The guard was a pandaren, a panda-type were bear but she was only 100ft tall, 1/10th Destiny's height. The smallest adult monster was 300ft. Destiny wouldn't hire a kid, would she?

"A panda?" you ask. "Destiny, are you serious?" You have to fight back the urge to laugh or you'll blow your cover. "Besides, don't you know there are child labor laws." Siobhan gives an angry roar that forces you to cover your hears. "Watch what you say!" yells the panda. "I was born in 1988. I have a condition! Since my body can only accept meat, I have a growth deficiency." "Meat?" you ask. You thought pandas only ate bamboo, but then you gasp because Siobhan shows her teeth and you see that they look like those of a mako shark.

"Siobhan will be your warden for the next 365 days," said Destiny. "And remember. If you aren't truly reformed, she can eat you." You begin to shiver as you notice that Siobhan is staring at you and the panda/banshee hybrid is drooling. Destiny even smiles smugly. Maybe this con was a bad idea.
153331.title: Siobhan

choices: Refuse. You're trying to go straight, remember?
153332.content:
“Since you want to prove you can be a model prisoner, I’ve got the perfect way to help you prove it.” At first you think you must have misheard Destiny, because you thought she said she would help you. “Come again?” You say “I said I’m going to help you become a model prisoner.”

“How’s that?”

Destiny grins, which makes you very nervous. “I’m going to remove the temptation to escape for you, by placing you in solitary confinement.” The next thing you know, you’re in a cell where the floor, walls and ceiling are all lined with mattresses, and you’re the only one in the room. You sigh “Well, I probably should have known she’d pull something like this, but at least I can just relax until they let me out.”

You lay flat on your back on the spongy surface of the floor and close your eyes. But not long after you do so, you feel something light drop onto your chest. You sit up to see a notebook with a black cover just landed on top of you, seemingly out of nowhere. “What the? Where did this come from?” You pick up the book and open it, only to see it is completely blank.

You suddenly get the feeling that you’re being watched, and look up from the book, nearly jump out of your skin as you see that where there once was nothing now stood what looked like a young man with long dark hair, dressed in a black suit and red tie. He would have looked human, if it weren’t for his chalk white skin, glowing red eyes, and black lips.

“Who the hell are you?” you say “Better yet, where did you come from?” The young man smiles wickedly, “My name is Renn, and I came from the realm of Shinigami.” “ Renn, huh? Where’s Stimpy then? The realm of what?” You ask, confused “Shinigami, that’s what me and my kind are called.”

“Are you a monster? No, you can’t be. you’re way too small to be a monster, you’re practically the same size as me.” Renn chuckled “It depends on how you look at it. Anyway, that book you’re holding is a death note and if you write somebody’s name in it, that person, or monster, will die.”


You look down at the book in your hands in shock “You’re saying this book can kill absolutely anyone, just by writing their name in it?” Renn nods “Yes. That’s why I dropped it on top of you, to see if you would use it, and so you could see and hear me. You see, even by monster standards, Shinigami are considered myths. Only those who have come in contact with a death note can see them. I’ve been watching you for quite sometime, Wade Wilson. It would seem you’ve made quite the number of enemies, such as the warden of this facility. I’ve decided to give you the opportunity to rid yourself of them.”


“Why? Why would you help me?”


Renn shrugs “Boredem mostly. To be honest, I just want to see what you’ll do with the death note.” He reaches into his pocket and pulls out a pen, offering it to you. “So, will you accept my little gift?” You hesitate. You may be a criminal, but you’ve never actually killed anyone. You can’t deny that the thought of being rid of Warden Destiny once and for all is tempting, but are you really willing to kill her?
153332.title: Solitary Coinfinement and Shinigamis

choices: "I guess i'll tell Destiny you are being sincere about seving your sentence."
1533322.content:
"No, I won't use it. Even if I have enemies out there, it isn't right to kill them," said Wade. He was right, he had no real reason to kill anyone, even Destiny. "Sure, i've made mistakes, and alot of them ended badly, but that's it, they were my mistakes. It was my mistake to burn that mummy, and it was my mistake to try to escape all those times. It was even my mistake to antagonize Destiny all those times. Sure, i still dont like her, but I don't want to kill her or anyone else. All I want to do now is serve my sentence and leave this place."
"Are you sure?" Renn said. "This may be the only time you'll be able to have this choice. Come on, think about it. No longer having to worry about anyone coming to you for revenge, and getting away with it, too," Renn said temptingly.
"I'm sure." Wade said. He was tired of this prison and wanted to go home, and not deal with these monsters for the rest of his life. "Even if it will take years, I'm willing to wait until the end of my sentence. Heck I might even get lucky and get out on probation in a couple of years for good behavior. So sorry, but i'm not gonna take the notebook"
"Well, if that's your final choice..." said Renn.
What happens next?
1533322.title: Refuse. You're trying to go straight, remem...

choices: Destiny has you do some favors to prove your worth (Sucker!)
154.content:
Just then, an idea comes to your mind. Some of your best buddies have also spent time in prison. They were able to get out early on account of good behavior. If there was one thing in this world you hated, besides monsters, it was a goody two shoes. But, if this works you'll be out of here and home free, with no worries of Destiny or anyone else coming after you.

Of course, your plan meant that you would have to play suck up to Destiny. Just the thought of it made you cringe and gag at the same time. But if you played your cards right, and made her think you were truly sorry for what you did (-which of course was a lie) then you'd be out of here in no time.

You get back in your cell, and wait for Destiny to make her daily rounds, going around and checking all the cells. When she walks past you, you yell out "Destiny! Wait a minute!" Destiny turns to you with a scowl. "What do you want, Wade? I have more important things to do than chit chat with a criminal like you."

This is it. Time to put your acting skills to the test. You pretend to hang your head in shame and say "I've had a lot of time to think while I've been here, and, well, I kind of regret setting that mummy on fire, along with the other stuff I've done. Getting into fights, stealing cars, too much stuff to list really. I just though you should know, you won't be hearing about any more escape attempts from me. I'll serve my time."

As you expected, Destiny is skeptical. "Why should I believe you? After all the times you've tried to escape, you're lucky I don't have you executed just to get out of my hair. Give me one good reason why I should believe that you've really changed?"

"Give me a chance, and I'll prove it."
154.title: Aiding Your Enemy

1541.content:
You cross your arms and hope that Destiny believes you. She's staring down at you with her hands on her hips and her tail wagging back and forth. That's when she grins and shows her fangs, much to your discomfort.

"Okay Wade," she says. "I can think of three things to do to prove yourself right off the bat. But I'll be generous and give you the chance to pick your poison... er... I mean, community service." "Yes." You say as you rub your hands. You're sure that you'll be able to con your way out of prison now. "So Demo... er... I mean Warden, what do I have to do?

Destiny smiles and clears her throat. "Well for one, you can spy on Gnarly Nani." "Gnarly Nani!?" you shout. You heard about Gnarly Nani; she was a nandi bear, a monstrous beast resembling a one eyed cross between a baboon and a hyena. That woman was one of the more hot-tempered inmates. "I heard that Gnarly Nani was building a tunnel," says Destiny. "Perhaps you could infiltrate her gang and see if the rumors are true?" There was nothing you hated more than a fink, but to fink on a giant monster? Gnarly Nani would kill you if you ratted her out. But maybe you could use her alleged tunnel to escape yourself.

"Or," says Destiny. "There's a second option. My little sister, Fortuna, in Dreadberry said that there's a bank robber on the loose called Specter and the sheriff is having trouble catching them. Maybe it takes a crook to catch a crook." Was she kidding? You hated the country. There's no way you're going to a backwater town with giant monster hillbillies. And to stay with Destiny's sister?

"Then again," says Destiny. "Fate's old college roommate, Odile, I think she was that ogopogo girl, has a job at Summer camp this time of year. I believe it was a girl's camp, Darkly. Yes Camp Darkly. I could change your sentence to community service. Believe me, it wouldn't be the first time somebody chose camp over jail." That choice sounded the worst of all. You hated kids and to act as a counselor to a bunch of giant brats? Something told you that Destiny didn't really trust you after all.

"Well Wade?" asks Destiny with a smirk. "What's your decision?"

(Note: The Summer Camp Path will be reserved for me. It was meant to be for a new interactive for the Summer called Monster Hollow but it's not going to happen now because somebody (Not me) has made it impossible. I'll add to that path once I'm in a better mood.)

Here are the Choices

1. Spying on Gnarly Nani and acting as a fink
2. Going to Dreadberry to help with the Specter case.
3. Spending the Summer as a counselor at Camp Darkly.
1541.title: The Favors

choices: You Stow Away in Pearl's Backpack and Follow her to School
Fortuna Takes You to the Sheriff's Office
15412.content:
You seriously don't want to be in the boondocks with a bunch of monster yokels, but perhaps this could be your chance to get so far away from Under Gloom, Destiny would never follow. "You know what," you say. "I think I'll go on ahead and take the second option. Maybe I can pay my debt to society by catching Specter was it?" Destiny nods her head and unlocks your cell before she grabs you.

"If that's the case, you'll be staying with my sister and don't you make any trouble for her, her husband or my niece or you're gonna get it." You groan. Terrific, your one chance to get out of Under Gloom and you have to stay with Destiny's relatives. This sucked, but at least there was a chance you could escape. A few hours later, Destiny has locked you up in a cave with your arms crossed as you pout. She is speaking to Belladonna, the vice warden manticore. "I won't be back until tomorrow Belladonna," says Destiny. "So I need you to temporarily be in charge of things until I come back from visiting my sister. I don't want to hear about any problems while I'm away."

Belladonna lets out a snicker and salutes Destiny. "Don't worry Warden," she says. "Nothing will go wrong." Destiny just gestures to her second in command that she is watching her and then flies off, carrying you in the cage. There's a strange collar that Destiny put around your neck. "Hey Demona," you complain. "What's with the collar? And why don't we take a car?" Destiny's eyes light up. "Call me Demona one more time and I'll drop you. As for your question, I don't own a car. What would a flying monster need with one?" You knew this was going to be a long trip.

Soon, the two of you are flying over a small town with homey looking buildings in contrast to the skyscrapers of Fearfield. There is a sign that reads "Welcome to Dreadberry" and the skies above are unusually sunny and unclouded for being an area in a monster world. Destiny flies to the ground and holds her wings into a makeshift cape as she walks down the street carrying you. She eventually comes up to a pinkish colored two floor house and walks up to the door. Destiny knocks on the door and you look up to see somebody opening it.

This gargoyle girl was slightly shorter than Destiny with smaller horns, albeit curved downwards and with tan skin and long blonde hair. Her wings were a pinkish color and she was wearing a shirt shirt and blue skirt with an apron. You take it that was Fortuna given how she smiled at the sight of Destiny. "Destiny!" yells the other gargoyle as she hugs Destiny to the blue gargoyle's discomfort. "What's shaking big sister?" Destiny shoves her sister off before walking in. "Hello Fortuna," she says. "I can't stay long, this is a work related visit."

Fortuna shakes her head. "You're no fun Sis. It's all work and no play. Relax once in a while." Destiny lets out a scoff. "With my job, every second counts. I already regret leaving that backstabbing arachnid Belladonna in charge. By the way, Fortuna, I need to ask you a favor." "Shoot." Destiny holds you up in your cage and Fortuna looks in confusion. "Take a picture horn head," you say rudely. "It'll last longer." "You must be that Wade character my big sis is always complaining about," says Fortuna with a chuckle. "I can't believe this is the guy who causes you so much grief Destiny. He looks harmless."

Destiny pounds on the wall to get her sister's attention. "Don't be a fool Fortuna," she says. "This, this Wade has been driving me crazy since he came to Under Gloom. I'm ready to pull my hair out and floss with it because of this rule breaking little creep. But the punk says he's learned his lesson. Since I highly doubt it, I've taken him here to help your sheriff catch Specter." Destiny hands Fortuna your cage and Fortuna looks dumbfounded. "Destiny, even Maggie hasn't been able to catch Specter. And you're trusting a human to do it?"

Destiny takes out what looks like a remote control with only one button and gives it to Fortuna. "Trust him? Yeah right, I'm giving him thirty days to catch Specter before I haul his carcass back to Under Gloom. If he gives you any trouble, press that button, it will give the malcontent a nasty shock." You couldn't believe it. Destiny put a shock collar on you. "This is an outrage!" you yell. "Talk about mistrust you big blue son of a..!" Destiny presses the button and you let out a scream as the collar sparks electricity and zaps you. You pant as Destiny nods her head.

"Don't get fresh Wade," she says. "You will behave for my relatives or I'll dismantle you." As Destiny is saying this, you move your lips to mouth her words, just to mock her. Fortuna notices this and holds her finger over the button to gesture to you to stop. "What's going on here Fortuna?" asks a male voice. Into the room walks a tall pitch black skinned male gargoyle with light rose colored hair. Destiny just rolls her eyes at the sight of him.

"Hello David." Says Destiny. "Destiny?" asks the male garg. "Hey, hey, how's my favorite sister-in-law doing." Destiny reluctantly shakes hands before David notices you. "Fortuna," he asks. "Dear, what exactly is going on?" Fortuna lets out a smile. "Oh nothing David," she says. "Destiny just brought one of her prisoners to help the sheriff with the specter case." David lets out a sigh. "Well, he better catch him, or her or whatever Specter is. The bank manager threatened to can me if I let that ghost get in one more time." You take it Destiny's brother-in-law was a guard at the bank. You almost laugh at how a relative of that blue nightmare was having trouble with specter just as Fortuna opens the cage to let you out.

"By the way," says Destiny. "Where's Pearl?" "In school," replies Fortuna. "Our daughter is still a teenager you know. How's Fate doing? I take it she's still single." Destiny nods her head. "And I plan to keep it that way." You let out a scoff. "Marriage is a scam," you say. "Take you for example Goliath, you get stuck with that big blue harpy as an in-lAAAA!!!!" Fortuna presses the remote again to zap you. "Geez," says David. "That human is not like Neil at all. Could stand to learn some manners." You flip off the male gargoyle before Fortuna glares at you and shakes the remote.

"Well, I'll leave him in your hands," says Destiny. "And I'm really sorry for the horror I've unleashed on you." "Up yours Demona." You say to Destiny as you flip her off. Destiny gets so mad that she almost pounds you into paste but David grabs her by the arm to stop her. Fortuna breaks into laughter. "Oh. That's what they've been calling you since they noticed the resemblance." Fortuna laughs but Destiny is unamused. "It's NOT funny!" she yells. "You gotta admit it's a little funny." Says Fortuna.

Destiny leaves in a rage and slams the door. "Good riddance." You say. "I'd behave myself better if I were you," says David. "You're not in Dreadberry even ten minutes and you've been nothing but rude and insulting. And I used to wonder what crawled up that woman's craw." You stick out your tongue as Fortuna picks you up and shakes her head. "I hope for your sake you don't act like this when we take you to meet Sheriff Reaver." "Another gargoyle?" you ask. "Nemean lion actually." Nemean Lion?! That woman clearly sent you here to get eaten.

Before you can complain, the door opens up and Fortuna turns her head. "Hi Pearl," she says. "How was school today?" You look forward but don't see anyone. That's when you look down to see Pearl, Destiny's niece and you were surprised. She was barely half the height of either of her parents, which surprised you greatly. She had to be 450ft tall which was unusual given that gargoyles were usually the biggest monsters there were. Destiny herself was the biggest monster you've ever seen. Pearl looked like a female version of her father with white hair that had pinkish tints.

"School was okay. We're starting a project tomorrow and Mrs. Keys is assigning us partners. I just hope I don't get stuck with Onyx again." Pearl looks up and notices you before Fortuna explains everything. "You just missed your Aunt Destiny. She's arranged fro one of her inmates to stay with us and help the sheriff with Specter." Pearl blinks slightly. "A human in a monster jail? I'm surprised he isn't bones." "And I'm surprised your species is smart enough to talk shrimp boat." You say.

Immediately Pearl lets out a growl and hovers in the air as she glares at you. "What was that?" she asks in a threatening tone. "You heard me you rabid midget. I've seen leprechauns bigger than you." Pearl is about to attack you when David grabs her by the tail. "Calm down Pearl," he says to his daughter. "Geez, that bugger is provocative." "Wade," says Fortuna in an annoyed tone. "Don't make fun of Pearl's height. The doctor said she had a growth defect and she's rather sensitive about it." "I can see," you say mockingly. "She's almost as fiery as that crone sister of yours." Fortuna shocks you again as you scream and Pearl manages to calm herself down.
