"This is going to be a long month." The teenage gargoyle mutters.

The Next Day...
15412.title: The Boondocks

154121.content:
That night, after David, Fortuna and Pearl were asleep, you decide that shock collar or no shock collar, you were not staying under the roof of Destiny's relatives another second, so you hatched a plan to get out of the house. You notice that Pearl left her backpack right outside her bedroom door and slide down the table you were sleeping on before you walk towards the backpack chuckling to yourself. "Stupid gargoyles," you say to yourself. "Destiny's sister has got to be as empty headed as that big blue bitch herself. Now, here we go."

You unzip the front zipper to Pearl's backpack and then you slide right in. You laugh to yourself. "This is perfect. I'll follow the brat to school, hitch a ride on some unsuspecting sap and soon enough I'll be out of this town. I doubt that shock collar works beyond this hillbilly hellhole. Wade, you finally outsmarted that damn Demona." You were confident this plan would succeed.

The next day, Pearl is just putting on her backpack and is getting ready for school when Fortuna comes in. "Pearl," says Fortuna to her daughter. "Have you seen Wade today? I'm supposed to take him to meet Sheriff Reaver today." "No Mom," says Pearl. "I haven't seen Wade. And I don't want to see that insulting twerp." Fortuna lets out a sigh. "I know he was extremely rude yesterday, but your aunt is trusting him to help Maggie catch Specter." Pearl lets out a laugh at that thought. "Come on Mom," she says. "Aunt Destiny doesn't trust anyone." "She trusts me to zap him. Well, first things first. You better head to school. You're not forgetting anything are you." "No Mom, I'm perfectly fine. Checked everything before I went to bed last night."

You let out a sigh of relief. If Pearl double checked her backpack, you'd be toast. Fortuna bends down to kiss Pearl and smiles. "Have a good day at school sweetie." "I hope so." Says Pearl. With that Pearl has stepped out of the house and is flying off to high school, completely unaware of her passenger. You laugh to yourself and rub your hands. As soon as Pearl lands, you unzip the zipper slightly and see that she's at a school called Nightmare High. You look out and see all sorts of giant monster teenagers. Aside from the fact that the students are monsters, it seems to be an average high school setting, albeit with sasquatch jocks, gorgon cheerleaders and a nerdy sphinx or two. However, all the monsters are taller than Pearl. You even see a leprechaun girl who was slightly bigger than the gargoyle shrimp. You let out a chuckle. "How embarrassing," you think to yourself. "She really is a runt.

Pearl walks up and sees one of her friends waving at her. You look in surprise because this monster girl looked like a living rag doll. She had yellow eyes and long blue hair and a zipper for a mouth. She was wearing a patchwork dress and mittens and didn't appear to have fingers. "Hey Emerald," says Pearl as she shakes hands with her friend. "How're you doing?" The rag doll giantess smiles and nods her head as Pearl smiles at her. But then Pearl lets out a sigh. "Well, you're lucky. I've got company and he is the worst. You remember my Aunt Destiny? The prison warden?" Emerald nods her head. "Well, she sent one of her crooks over to stay with us. He's supposed to help your aunt catch Specter." Aunt? This rag doll was the sheriff's niece? But Fortunate said the sheriff was a Nemean lion. What was going on?

Emerald just raised an eye. "I know Under Gloom is a woman's prison. They made an exception for him since he was human. Just like your uncle." "Uncle?!" you think to yourself. From the context, the sheriff was married to a human. "Who'd be stupid enough to marry a monster?" you think to yourself. "Especially a big mangy man-eating cat? That's when you zip yourself back into the backpack and you feel Pearl moving as the gargoyle girl gets to class. But which class?
154121.title: Destiny's Niece

choices: One of Pearl's Classmates Grabs You
1541211.content:
From your spot in Pearl’s backpack, you open her zipper and she and Emerald take their seats among a class of monster girls and boys of different shapes and sizes. Aside from being monsters as big as skyscrapers, they all were dressed like the kinds of teenagers you’d expect from high school, to the overweight werelizard anime geek to the musclebound kappa jock. You then begin to climb out of Pearl’s backpack and take a look at the classroom. In the corner there’s a werewolf skeleton on display (You’re not sure if it’s real or plastic), on the back table there are several jars including one filled with dead snakes being preserved in chemicals and there was also what looked like the head of an anatomy dummy and a shelf full of beakers containing technicolor liquids that seemed to be glowing as well as what looks like several jars containing different types of molds, spores and fungi. “Oh great,” you mutter. “Science class. No way am I sticking around.” With that, you start to make your escape as Pearl takes out her science textbook.

- - - -

Meanwhile, back at the Sirtis residence, Fortuna is turning the house upside-down looking for you as David looks on, eating a piece of leftover pizza. “Where could one human disappear too? Doesn’t that Wade know he’s supposed to meet with the sheriff?” David let out a scoff. “Do you honestly think that somebody like that would hold up their end of the bargain. You heard the nasty things he said at dinner last night.” Fortuna growls as her eyes glow red. “Don’t remind me, David. That rude little punk has only been here for one day and I already can’t stand him. No wonder that sister of mine is so ill-tempered.” “Yeah,” says David as he rolls his eyes. “I’m surprised she hasn’t killed him by now. Wait. I just had a thought; maybe he followed Pearl to school in an attempt to escape.”

Fortuna punches the wall, leaving a large dent in it, startling her husband. “And that’s another thing. Pearl’s Napoleon complex had her touchy enough but that ****ing Wade had her almost as angry as Destiny with all those insults he hurled. The last thing we need is for our daughter to be tormented by someone that obnoxious in our own home. Now he’s going to cause an uproar at Nightmare High.” “Look on the bright side, Fortuna,” says David as he shrugs his shoulders. “Maybe somebody will eat him.” Fortuna gives a scoff. “With his bad attitude, they’ll get indigestion. Destiny won’t be happy when she hears what happened.” David gave a scoff. “Are you kidding? I’ll bet that fire eating sister of yours doesn’t care what happens as long as she’s dumped that creep off on us.”

Suddenly, Fortuna has a flash and a sinister smirk appears on her face that intimidates David. “Oh, David,” says Fortuna. “How is that sister of yours doing?” David gives a look of concern. “Oh no,” he says. “Fortuna, you’re not seriously thinking of dumping Wade off on Catherine. The last thing she needs is someone ridiculing her about her condition.” Fortuna gives an evil smirk at her husband. “Au contraire,” says Fortuna. “If memory serves, every monster that lives above the gym your sister owns has Glutos Syndrome, including her. And if memory serves, when all those girls see a human man, they get more than a little excited.” Fortuna gives an evil laugh that would make Demona herself blush and David lets out a groan. “My mother told me she was insane,” he muttered under his breath. “But did I listen?” 
- - - - - - -

Meanwhile, you have managed to free yourself from Pearl’s backpack and begin to move towards the door. “See you later, you angry dwarf.” you say. However, before you could leave, into the room waddles an obese gryphon woman with the lower body of a reddish brown lioness and the upper body of an American bald eagle. She wore rectangular glasses and a white labcoat, which meant that she was clearly the science teacher. “Good morning, class.” Says the gryphon giantess. “Good morning, Mrs. Keys.” Says the entire class. Mrs. Keys adjusts her glasses as she steps forward with what looks like a cooler. You have to move out of the way to avoid being stepped on. “Today,” says Mrs. Keys. “We will be reviewing what we’ve discussed about anatomy. It’s that time of your school career when you have to get down and dirty. There will be no squeamishness in this class today.” As Ms. Keys is saying this, the mer-lioness in the corner looks nervously at the cooler and you move your hand to mock the bird teacher without her noticing.

Mrs. Keys then opens the cooler to see that it is full of dead cycloptic frogs with six legs, each frog the size of a parade float. “Ugh,” you say. “They’re dissecting frogs today? Now I remember why I hate school.” “Each pupil, take a frog and return to your seats for dissection.” The entire class moves forward, in the process, pushing Pearl to the side. Pearl grunts as she tries to move about, but the rest of her classmates utterly dwarf her. You can’t help but laugh as she struggles. By the time Pearl reaches the cooler, every other student has already gotten their frog and Pearl looks in the cooler in confusion. “Uh,” she says. “Mrs. Keys. “There appears to be a frog missing from the cooler.

Upon further inspection, Mrs. Keys realized what Pearl was saying was true. “What?!” yelled the gryphon giantess to herself. “I would’ve bet money that there was one more frog in that cooler. I told that husband of mine those were for my class, not for dinner.” Mrs. Keys grumbled to herself and even plucked out one of her own feathers. “Does this mean I’ll have to do the dissection tomorrow?” asks Pearl. You let out a scoff and just continue to walk towards the exit. What was going on, clearly was no skin off of your nose. While those monster teens were busy with their experiment, you’ll just walk out the front door.

“Think, Ophelia,” thought Mrs. Keys to herself. “I’m not one to let one of my students fall behind the others. Then again, Pearl’s so short, who would notice if she was held back? Okay, that was a mean thing to think. I just had to use frogs. If I could find enough humans, I’d have the class dissect them.” Of course, you have no idea what this massive obese gryphon lady is thinking and your only concern is escaping.

But just then...
1541211.title: Weird Science

choices: The School's Fire Alarm Goes Off
There's an Explosion Outside that Interrupts the Class
15412111.content:
You're about to reach the door when Mrs. Keys spots you. "Aha!" she yells. Mrs. Keys snatches you up and you grunt. "Hey!" you yell. "Watch those claws feather face!" "A human!" yells the gryphon. "Did you figure that out for yourself," you mutter. "Or did you have help." Mrs. Keys bites her beak at that remark. "An obnoxious human." You even spit in Mrs. Keys's eye, forcing her to wipe her glasses as she clicks her beak and the class looks on. "Where did that human come from?" asks the otaku lizard boy. "Who cares?" asks a werecrab boy with a sigh as he's already dissecting his frog. The merlioness turns her head and shivers as Emerald is so shocked that the zipper on her mouth comes undone.

But Pearl is the one most stunned. "What is that idiot doing here?" the dwarf gargoyle thinks to herself. "Oh man. If Mrs. Keys finds out I'm the one who brought him here, I'm in big trouble. If he makes her two mad, I might even get suspended." Pearl then looks in fear as Mrs. Keys turns to her and then looks at you with an evil smile. "Oh, Pearl," says Mrs. Keys. "I think that I found an answer to your problem." Pearl actually looks worried. "Yes, Mrs. Keys?" Pearl asks in worry. Mrs. Keys gives an evil laugh. "I may have one less frog than required for the class, but I found something just as good as a frog." Pearl gasps and the merlioness in the corner even outright faints and hits the floor with a thump. You look up and gulp because obviously there's nothing good in store for you.

- - -

In a minute, you are taped to a piece of glass by the limbs and placed on Pearl's desk. "No way," says Pearl. "Mrs. Keys. You can't be serious. You do realize that I'm a gargoyle, right? This is against my species' principles." "Like that's ever stopped that blue-skinned temper tantrum you call an aunt you living anthill." Pearl holds up a knife and stabs it right to your side as she growls at you. Mrs. Keys gives a blink. "Does this guy really sound like he's worth protecting?" "Shut your piehole Big Bird!" you yell. Mrs. Keys in response puts tape over your mouth and then walks back to her desk. Pearl looks down at you uneasily.

"What do I do?" asks Pearl. "If I don't cut him up, I'll fail. But gargoyles aren't supposed to kill humans. Then again, he's a colossal jerk. What do I care if he gets chopped up?" You look up at Pearl thinking it over and start to sweat as she holds up her knife. You could not believe this was happening. It would take a miracle to save your skin at this point.

Sure enough, at that moment...
15412111.title: On the Table

choices: You Reach Cryptfork with No Problem
Something Goes Wrong with the Delivery
154121111.content:
The fire alarm suddenly goes off, startling the entire class. Emerald in particular panics and jumps through the window causing it to shatter as she runs. Mrs. Keys grumbles. "Of all the times for a fire drill!" she yells. "Everybody out!" Everyone begins to leave the classroom, with Pearl pausing to pick up the piece of glass that you're stuck to. She gives a grumble. "Saved by the bell." She mutters before following the rest of her classmates. Pearl places you into her backpack, not even bothering to remove the tape as she leaves the building. It isn't long before all of the students in all of Nightmare High have evacuated and the teachers are in the front of the building.

Three in particular run forward. One of them is a large Ziz who resembled an anthropomorphic ostrich but with wings that looked like they were made for flight. Another was a fat mummy woman who looked like an undead Elisa Maza with her dark skin, raven hair and red jacket. The third was a werewolf who resembled an anthropomorphic collie with paint staining her fur. The Ziz is squawking as her knees knock. "I didn't know there was a fire drill scheduled for today." "There wasn't, Aziza," says the mummy woman. "There was mustard all over the fire alarm. I'd say somebody is pulling a rather distasteful prank." The wolf woman gives a growl. "I was just in the middle of a painting class," she says. "I had to send my students out with their artwork half-finished. When I get my claws on whoever pulled the fire alarm, I swear...!"

Once Pearl has nobody looking at her, she takes out her cell phone and calls her mother. "Hi, Mom. I know I should be in class right now, but some jerk pulled the fire alarm. As much as I hate to admit it, I'm glad they did. I almost carved up Wade like a turkey." Fortuna yells out some nasty swears from the other line. She clearly was pissed you followed Pearl to school. "Mom," says Pearl. "I think you've been hanging around Auntie D too much. You're starting to swear like her. Okay. I got it. Don't worry. The punk's tied up. Come over at lunch and I'll give him back to you." You just mumble from inside Pearl's backpack.

- - -

At lunch time, Pearl hands you to her mother who painfully rips the duct tape off your mouth. "Ow!" you yell. "Watch it, blondie." Fortuna makes her eyes glow red before flying into the air. As Fortuna flies away, you look down and see a police car being approached by the sheriff who is apparently a morbidly obese white-furred Nemean lioness wearing a green sheriff's outfit. She was parked outside the school and escorting inside a teenaged cyclops who had apparently pulled the alarm.

As you're flying, Fortuna gives a glare at you. "It's lucky for you that you didn't get Pearl suspended or expelled." "Like your brat was going to make it to college anyway." Fortuna squeezes you and makes you gag as she growls. "You're pushing your luck. I'm beginning to think that having you help the sheriff is a terrible idea." Fortuna then gives an evil smirk. "Which is perfectly okay with me." You give a look of skepticism at Fortuna. "What are you talking about?" you ask her. Fortuna gives a laugh. "I already talked with Destiny and she's agreed on a much more fitting punishment for you. I'm sending you to my sister-in-law, Catherine, in Cryptfork." You let out a scoff. "So?" Fortuna gives a smirk. "Well," she says. "Catherine owns a gym that doubles as an apartment building and all of the women have a certain condition. Catherine runs a tight ship and she has an unusual kind of house rule."

You give a gulp as Fortuna arrives back home and places you inside a box that she wraps up in postage and puts a stamp on. The gargoyle giantess then walks up towards the post office and hands you towards a gargoyle dressed in a postal outfit. You gripe from inside the package. This was going to be another gargoyle you'd be stuck with. You only hope she isn't anything like Destiny or Fortuna.
154121111.title: Fire Alarmed

1541211111.content:
It isn’t long before you arrive in Cryptfork. You look out of one of the airholes that Fortuna poked in with her claws and see that they apparently had to take a boat all the way to Cryptfork. From the looks of it, Cryptfork was on an island that was near Dreadberry. You can’t tell the species of the postal worker delivery you but from the looks of it, they’re bringing you to a strange looking apartment building that had a gym at the bottom floor, given the exercise equipment. Some of it looked expensive and there was one weight that looked like it weighed as much as the meteor that hit Russia. You look up at the sign on the top of the building. It read “Rolling Boulder Gym and Apartment”. Then you read another sign under it that reads “Amazons Only”. The mail carrier takes you into the building and takes the package you’re trapped inside into a room full of mail slots before placing you inside one of them. You grumble and cross your arms as you wonder how you’re going to escape Fortuna’s sister-in-law. So far you’ve gone from one gargoyle warden to the next and then to some other one.

“Wait a minute,” you think. “Fortuna said that all the girls in this apartment building have some kind of weird condition. You’re curious as to what exactly Fortuna met and decide to look out and wait until one of the female tenant came and it isn’t long before you hear loud stomping. You look out in surprise to see that walking into the mail room to check her mail box was a female werewolf who had bright purple fur but with red and yellow striped arms and long blue hair. She was dressed in a gymnastics outfit. But what really caught your attention was that this wolf woman had an enormous butt that looked like it belonged to a woman three times her weight. “What the heck?” you ask. “That wolf woman’s butt is big enough to eclipse the moon.” As the werewolf giantess was walking away from her mailbox, you look in surprise because she has a belly bag with what appears to be a male human and a muscular tan-skinned one at that, riding inside of it. “Huh?” you ask.

As the werewolf woman leaves, she passes by a harpy lady with the wings and legs of a scarlet macaw, tanned skin and an outfit that looked like the kind somebody from Brazil would wear. Her butt was just as big as the wolf lady’s and they bounced against each others as they passed and grunted. “Please watch where you’re going, Luana.” Says the harpy girl in a Brazilian accent. “Sorry.” Mutters the wolf girl as she walks away. You look at the harpy woman and shutter. “I’d hate to be an egg under that big harpy.” You then look in surprise again because the harpy lady had another human on her shoulder, in the same position a parrot would be, ironically enough. Once the harpy got her mail, a third giantess walks in.

This third giant lady was heading right towards the mailbox with you inside. You realize that this must be Catherine because from the looks of it, she was a gargoyle. This gargoyle girl was a yellow green-skinned gargoyle giantess with long light blue hair. She had a punk-like look with multiple facial piercings, including a pierced nose and a piercing under her chin. She wore yellow lipstick along with a tank top and a Hawaiian print sari. Her butt was even more enormous than the werewolf’s or the harpy’s, to the point it was two heads higher than her actual head. From the looks of her wings, she couldn’t fly. She also had a male human and a very skinny albino-looking one, riding in her hair. “Look at that, Magnus,” says the gargoyle lady. “That must be the package Fortuna sent. Let’s see the punk who’s been giving my big brother and his wife so much grief in so little time.” Magnus slid down to Catherine’s ear before speaking. “Better take him back to the office, dear. We need to tell him about the house rules.” Catherine turns her head and gives Magnus a large kiss before walking her huge frame into an office with a door that looked specially designed for her large behind right before plunking herself down in a chair that looked way too small for her right before she held out one of her clawed fingers to cut open the box and reveal you.

“You must be Wade.” She says. You give a scoff. “And you must be that sister-in-law that goat-horned moron told me about. I didn’t expect you to have two wrecking balls at the body of your back, fatty. What’s with all the girls in this building.” Magnus slides down his wife’s hair before speaking. “All women in this building, including my wife, have Glutos Syndrome. It’s a rare disorder that only affects female monsters and it’s incurable.” “Fortunately,” says Catherine. “This apartment doubles as a gym and all the women here take working out very seriously. I for example am as graceful as a ballerina.” You give a scoff. “Yeah,” you say. “A hippo ballerina.”

Catherine scratches her chin before continuing. “Fortunately for you,” she says. “I’m not like that sister-in-law of mine or that blue moron she’s related to. I don’t have a bad temper. However.” Catherine gives a laugh before you look up in confusion. “However, what? Continent thighs.” Catherine picks her fangs with a claw and then gives you her answer. “Men are not allowed in this building. House rules.” You then look in more confusion than ever. Besides Magnus, you saw several human men hanging around the pear-shaped residents of this building. “Then what’s he doing here?” Magnus lets out a chuckle. “Human men are the exception and even then there’s one condition.” You look up and glare at Catherine as she strokes her husband’s head with one of her claws as she gives an evil laugh.

“In order to stay here,” says the titanic gargoyle. “You have to marry one of the girls who live here.” You give a look of horror and clutch your chest. “What?!” you yell. Catherine lifts her husband up and they exchange in a kiss before speaking. “Oh,” says Catherine. “Don’t worry. I’m not so cruel as to rush it. There will be a 90 day courting period between you and the ladies in this apartment building. You have to pick one of them within that time period to marry.” “Are you kidding me!? I hate monsters! What makes you think that I’ll agree to this.” Catherine gives a large fanged smile and giggles. “You don’t have to. But it’s the house rules. If you’re not married to one of the tenants in 90 days, well, let’s just say you’ll regret it.” You’re fuming mad. This woman was even worse than Destiny. At least Destiny never tried to put you through a shotgun wedding.

Catherine then snaps her fingers to get Magnus’s attention. “Magnus,” she says. “Be a dear and get me the ledger for all the tenants. Remind me which ones are still single.” “Yes, dear.” Magnus climbs his wife’s enormous rear to reach a shelf with a ledger of some kind before pushing it down into Katherine’s hand. The pear-shaped gargoyle landlady flips through the book and then gives a smirk as she looks at you. “Lucky for you,” she says. “I know the perfect girl to start with.” You’re now suddenly very afraid. Exactly who is the first girl that creep tries to set you up with?
1541211111.title: Rolling Boulders

choices: Maggie Gets a Call From the Mayor
154122.content:
The next morning, you're pouting in your cage as Fortuna carries you off to meet with the sheriff you're supposed to be helping. Fortuna has a sour look on her face. "Couldn't this wait until after seven o'clock? At least I could've had a crappy breakfast to make up for that awful dinner last night." "You were unbelievably nasty at dinner last night. That was my grandmother's recipe. Not to mention I had to hold Pearl back twice before she killed you. I'm beginning to think Destiny only sent you here to get revenge on me for losing that scarf I borrowed from her years ago."

As Fortuna was speaking, you move your lips to mock her, only stopping when her eyes glow red. She then holds her forehead as she lets out a sigh. "The sooner I get you to Maggie the better for my sanity." Fortuna soon walks up to the sheriff's office and finds a pair of monster girls working on the sign on top. The monster holding up the ladder was a hunch-backed frost giantess with light blonde hair in a Viking ponytail while the monster painting the sign was a basilisk resembling a cross between Godzilla and a Giratina given her black and red striped underbelly and spiked back. "Jolene," says the frost giantess in a somber voice. "Didn't Maggie tell you not to paint the sign in gold letters. She said it was too gaudy."

The basilisk girl smiles down and holds up a bucket of paint. "She didn't say not to paint it in silver. Come on Irma, this will get people's attention and show them we mean business." "Pa-the-tic." Says Irma the frost giantess in response. That's when Fortuna rolls her eyes and watches as Jolene spills the paint on Irma right in the eyes. Irma yells and then covers her eyes before letting go of the ladder. The ladder falls and Jolene screams before she falls down on Irma. You let out a chuckle. "Idiot monsters." You say under your breath.

"Deputies." Says Fortuna. Both deputy monsters get up and notice Fortuna. "Hi Fortuna," says Jolene. "New pet?" "Not exactly," says Fortuna. "Is Maggie in?" Irma points inside and Fortuna walks inside. "Sheriff Reever." Says Fortuna. The sheriff walks out and you look up to see that she's an obese white furred Nemean lioness with green eyes and blonde hair that looked similar to mane. "Hi Fortuna," says Maggie. "What can I do you for today?" You look up in fear and begin to think to yourself.

"I can't believe it," you think. "A lioness. I'm not here to catch Specter. I'm here to be lunch for some bloated pussycat." Maggie looks down and is surprised to see you. "Do I even want to know?" asks Maggie. "You remember my older sister Destiny do you Maggie?" Before Maggie could answer, Jolene overhears and lets out a laugh. "I know her. That grumpy frumpy blueberry stick in the mud who looks like Demona. How's the cotton candy headed grouch doing Fortuna?"

Jolene continues to laugh before she gags as Irma pours paint in her mouth. Fortuna shakes her head. "This is Wade Wilson," says Fortuna. "The most obnoxious prisoner under her watch." Maggie shakes her head. "I don't approve of humans sharing prisons with monsters. So, what's he doing here." "Helping you catch Specter." Says Fortuna as she puts your cage on the table.

Maggie at first seems offended. "Look," she says. "I know we haven't had much luck in catching Specter, but to send a crook to catch a crook?" "You can send him back in thirty days if it comes up fruitless. I'll explain the situation to Mayor Yorkshire. See you at dinner Wade, and you better like it this time." Fortuna walks out and you stick out her tongue at her. After all she was Destiny's sister.

Maggie takes a closer look at you. "Do you mind Sheriff Furball?" you ask rudely. "Whoa," says the lioness. "That's a bad attitude." "Get used to it pussycat, and don't even try to eat me, I'll bet right now your ass is big enough to smash Jupiter." Maggie lets out a growl and shows you her claws. "For your information," she says. "I haven't eaten a human since I was a teenager and I don't appreciate cracks at my weight unless they're coming from my husband." "Is he blind?" you ask smugly. Maggie lets out a roar that rattles your cage before she sits at her desk. "You and me aren't going to get along well are we?" she asks. You just stick out your tongue at the Nemean lioness sheriff.

Maggie lets out a sigh. "Worse than the marshal." She complains to herself.
154122.title: The Sheriff

choices: Maggie Stops Prussia Before She Can Eat You
1541222.content:
As Maggie is glaring at you, somebody walks into the sheriff's office and Maggie lets out a slight snarl as she turns and faces who that someone is. In walked in a weretiger woman who was just as tall and obese as Maggie. She had bright blue fur with purple stripes and navy hair. The blue tigress was wearing a black cowgirl's hat with a blue rose on the side and vest with daisy dukes and a bandana around her neck. She looked like something out of a western picture and was wearing a silver badge that was similar to Maggie's, except that it read "Marshal" instead of "Sheriff".

Maggie lets out a slight growl. "Speak of the devil." The blue tigress walks in and lets out a slight arrogant sounding purr. "Howdy Maggie," she says in a western accent. "Finally catch that sidewinder, Specter?" "Shut up Prussia," says Maggie. "I've already got one pest to deal with." Prussia waddles up to Maggie's desk and then notices you. She licks her lips and you step back. "Are you going to eat that human?" she asks. Maggie lets out a growl as if Prussia offended her. "For your information, he is a criminal sent from Under Gloom to help us catch Specter. Wade, this is Marshal Prussia Kipling." As Prussia lowers her head and you look into her colossal eyes, you wonder why Dreadberry would need a sheriff and a marshal. You knew from experience one was just as bad as the other, so you walk up and spit in the side of Prussia's eye. Prussia roars and is about to slam down on you but Maggie stops her.

"Believe me," says Maggie. "I'm tempted to do that myself." You stick out your tongue. Prussia calms down slightly and then you see the blue tigress shaking her large tail and monstrous ass as she stares at Maggie. "You know Maggie," she says. "Why must we always be at each other's throats? You're a lioness, I'm a tiger. We should be friends. Maybe even more." Prussia lets out a purr and Maggie rolls her eyes. You have never been against girl on girl, but between giant monsters, that's sick.

Prussia leans on Maggie's desk and looks her eye to eye. "Perhaps you'd be interested in joining me for dinner Friday night? I know a place that serves the best barbecued humans. They're delicious." Maggie actually shutters at such a thought. "Prussia," the Nemean lioness says. "Do me a favor and watch Wade for me. I've got to go use..." "The litter box?" you ask smugly. Maggie roars angrily at you before stomping off. "Oh," she says to herself. "You will pay for this Fortuna. You will pay."

As Maggie is walking away, Prussia purrs and stares at the lioness's massive ass. "You know," says Prussia. "Maggie's mama is a splinter cat. They're known for their high behinds, if you know what I mean. Rowr. Some day that woman is gonna be mine." You let out a scoff. "Don't bet on it Lady Garfield," you say. "That hairball said she had a husband." Prussia growls and lowers her head to your level. "I've seen that wedding ring shrimp," she says. "But I don't buy it. Every time I ask Maggie about that so called husband of hers, she changes the subject. It's as if she's hiding something from me. I know she has a daughter, but I've never seen the father. I wonder what that implies?"

You honestly don't care. You just hope Specter shows up so you can get the heck out of here. Suddenly, you grunt because you feel something digging into your back. You turn to see that Prussia is lifting you by the shirt with her claws. She lifts you in front of her face before she smiles fiendishly at you. "What are you doing you damn tiger!" you yell.

Prussia licks her lips and then shows you her fangs. "Oh, nothing, just having a little snack." "You imbecile! I'm supposed to be helping your fatass and that fatass sheriff!?" Prussia lets out a scoff. "Sending a criminal to catch a criminal? That's the most asinine thing I've ever heard. We both know you humans exists so that monsters can eat you. If Maggie won't eat you, then you're gonna be yummy in my tummy." Prussia holds you up in the air and opens your mouth wide as you gasp and look down.

Great, you tried to con your way out of Under Gloom and now some overstuffed weretigress is going to eat you.
1541222.title: The Sheriff and the Marshal.

15412221.content:
It looks as if Prussia is going to drop you down her throat, but then Maggie comes out of the bathroom and gasps as she sees what's going on. "Prussia!" she yells. "What are you doing?!" Immediately, the Nemean lioness snatches you from the tigress's grip just as she's about to drop you and close her mouth. "What're you nuts?!" yells Maggie. "I told you he was helping us!?"

Prussia just lets out a scoff. "Come on Maggie," she says. "That little viddle is only lookin' out for his own sorry butt. I'll bet the sidewinder only lied so he could get out of Under Gloom." You flip off that were tiger for guessing the truth. "Up yours you bloated blue hillbilly!" "See?" asks Prussia. "I oughta wash the rascal's mouth out with soup before I chomp him. But if you insist, who am I to argue. See you later." Prussia taps Maggie's ass and Maggie grunts before she watches the marshal walk away. Prussia twerks slightly and blows a kiss at Maggie which Maggie proceeds to ignore.

"If you're expecting a thank you, don't hold your breath, Madame Catnip." Maggie just gives a glare. "You know," she says. "It wouldn't kill you to be nice." "Nice to monsters?" you ask. "That's a laugh. As Maggie is growling at you, Irma and Jolene are looking in. "Geez," says Irma. "And I thought Meagan had a rotten attitude. This guy doesn't know when to shut it." Jolene nods her head. "He's lucky the boss doesn't eat humans and that they give me heartburn." "Ugh," groans Irma. "No thanks. I don't like to eat anything that looks that much like my species and that guy would probably taste like sour candy that has been left out in the sun too long."

Maggie lays you back on her desk and then stares at you. "Look, you don't like monsters and I don't like you. So the sooner Specter shows up, we can bust him and then we never have to see each other again." "Fine with me, Furball." Maggie hisses at you and Jolene and Irma step out of the room. "I think I left the teapot on." says Irma obviously fearing her boss's anger. "Uh," says Jolene. "Yeah. I think I left her teapot on as well." You just roll your eyes. As much as you hated it, you only have 30 days to find Specter or you'll be sent back to Under Gloom. You really hope there's a Specter attack soon.
15412221.title: Maggie to the Rescue

154122212.content:
It isn't long until Maggie's shift is over and unfortunately, the phone didn't ring at all. Not that you should be surprised. In a town as small as Dreadberry, it's not as if there's a major crime wave. You get so mad you kick the phone. "Come on you stupid piece of junk!" you yell. You grunt in pain just as Maggie shakes her head.

"Well, looks like Specter is laying low for now. You have 29 days left to go, Mr. Wilson." You stick out your tongue at Maggie and she gives a glare. "I'll get you for this Fortuna," she says under her breath. "I'll get you." Speaking of Fortuna, you wonder where that bratty sister of your mortal enemy was? "Where is Fortuna?" you ask. "Not that I look forward to seeing her or her pint-sized brat." Maggie crosses her arms. "I think you should spend the night at my place," the lioness giantess says. "Something tells me I should keep an eye on you." "You're just as bad as Destiny," you say. "And what's with the name? Maggie isn't the type of name I'd expect for a ginormous cat freak." Maggie lets out a roar that stuns you and causes Jolene and Irma outside to freeze in fear like statues. "Thank Odin I'm made of ice." Says Irma. Maggie seizes you and then stomps out of the station before locking it up.

Maggie makes her way towards a giant car that looks like a silver colored hybrid of a Buick and a monster truck. It even has teeth on the grill Maggie lays you on the dashboard before she starts to drive away. You feel humiliated. You feel like one of those Hula Girls dudes put in their cars. "So where are we headed?" you ask. "Well," says Maggie. "I have to pick up my husband and daughter. Sapphire is already with Neil at work." You take it Neil was the idiot who married the skyscraper sized feline beach ball. Maggie pulls over to a salon that reads "Primordial Earth". "What the hell is this dump?" you ask. "This is where my husband works," says Maggie. "He does various odd jobs."

You let out a scoff. "You're kidding me?! What kind of fruit loop works in a place like this? It's emasculating." Maggie just glares daggers at you again. Out of the salon waving at Maggie is a blue lioness except this one looks like a teenager. She had the same face and body shape as Maggie but strange eyes. Also, instead of fur, she had scales like a fish and gills on her neck. She was a mer-lion. "Hi Mom," says the blue lioness. "How was work?" Maggie smiles at her daughter but then frowns. "I got a new partner and he isn't exactly working out." "A new deputy?" asks Sapphire. "Not exactly. Now, where is your father."

You take a look, curious as to what kind of monster would result in a mer-lion, probably a merman or some other aquatic monster. But to your surprise, Sapphire reaches into her purse and you see in her hand was an older looking human man, you'd say in his forties, with graying hair and a wrinkled face. He waved up to Maggie. "Hi Honey." He says. You couldn't believe it. Maggie's husband was a human?! A human monster marriage!? That was wrong on so many levels. Wait?! That meant that Sapphire was... Oh, how you want to vomit right now."

The Reavers get in the car and Sapphire takes her seat next to her mother before placing Neil on the dashboard. Neil looks at you and seems to frown. "So you're this Wade Wilson I've heard about," he says. "I hope you haven't been causing any trouble for my wife." "Shut it, you monster loving traitor," you say. "What could you possibly see in a mouse munching, mountain-sized pile of tapioca pudding?" Neil gives a look of shock and then crosses his arms as Maggie drives down the road. "Not to mention that fish stick? How do you know your so-called wife is even loyal to you, Old Man?" Maggie and Neil both take offense to that. "F.Y.I.," says Neil. "Maggie is a Nemean lion, the direct descendant of the original Nemean lion, which might I add, was a child of Echidna. Her genes don't work the way humans do. Before Sapphire was born, I didn't know what I was going to get. She could've been a sphinx for all I knew." "Well," you say. "Either way, she's an abomination."

Sapphire gasps and seems genuinely hurt at that remark. Neil on the other hand, grits his teeth and then decks you right into the car window, causing it to crack, leaving a Wade-shaped imprint in the glass. "You take it back!" yells Neil angrily. "You're calling my baby an abomination? You know, it's racists like you that are why some monsters hate humans. Ordinary racism is bad enough. You bite your tongue around my family, or being eaten will be the least of your concerns you little punk!" Maggie is at the moment both angry at you for insulting her daughter and annoyed for the damage done to her window. "You're paying for that." She says. "Your husband was the one who did it!" you yell. "Make him pay for it! I was just stating a fact." "Geez," says Sapphire. "And I used to wonder why Pearl's auntie was such a crank." So Sapphire was friends with that hot tempered runt. Big, fat hairy deal.

Soon, the Reavers take you back to their home. It looked like something right out of a sitcom in a Texas neighborhood out in the boonies. Once inside, Maggie puts you and Neil on the kitchen table before she opens the refrigerator, taking out what looks like a bag of giant clams. "Having a clam bake?" you ask. "We've been planning this for weeks," says Neil. "I live with two giant cat girls. You could probably tell that my two favorite girls love their seafood." "Well it beats the half-digested poison Destiny forces us to keep down back in Under Gloom." Sapphire sets the table as Maggie takes the clams out back. To your surprise there are only three plates. You know they weren't expecting you, but they could've at least had the decency to have a plate ready for you.

"Hey! Where's my plate?" "Oh," says Sapphire. "You'll be sharing my plate. All our human sized dishes are in the washer." "And get your monster germs in my mouth?" you ask. "I don't think so?" "You know," says Neil. "You are really close to a kick in the ass right now. Maggie and I don't have problems eating off the same plate." "That's because you probably already caught some nasty disease from sl..." Before you can finish your sentence, you wince in pain and fall on your knees because Neil literally just kicked your ass. Geez, the guy's pretty strong for a geezer.

"If you can't say anything nice," says Sapphire. "Keep your trap shut. But in your case, that would make you mute." You hold up your fist and rub your backside. "You're as bad as that stupid Demona back in Under Gloom." Neil raises an eyebrow before you realize who you're talking about. "Oh, you mean Destiny. I'll admit she does look like Demona, but I don't say anything about it." "And why not? That woman is biggest example of evil incarnate on this planet." Neil lets out a scoff. "You obviously haven't met Cattleya." "I heard that Neil!" yells Maggie from the backyard.

That's when you realize something. If Maggie and Neil shared a plate and there were three plates, they were expecting company that wasn't you. Suddenly the doorbell rings. "I'll get it." Says Sapphire.

Exactly who is at the door (See Monster Boondocks for details)
154122212.title: Clambake with the Reavers

1541222121.content:
As Sapphire answered the door, the monster that came in was a manticore giantess who had to be as tall as Maggie but from the looks of it, she was even fatter than Maggie was, much to your surprise. She was a green manticore with purple hair. Surprisingly, unlike Belladonna, this manticore had a pair of giant leather wings, though you highly doubted someone as obese as her could get off the ground. She had a sad looking expression on her face and she appeared to be wearing a tight white A-shirt and a pair of black shorts. Neil let out a groan as the manticore woman walked in but she seemed friendly with Sapphire.

"Sapphire," says the manticore woman as she hugs the teenage mer-lion. "I haven't seen you in weeks." Sapphire grunts before freeing herself of the manticore's grip. "I'm sorry, Aunt Fiona. I've been busy with homework lately. Ms. Khamen is out sick and the sub doesn't know what she's doing." Fiona and Sapphire seemed friendly with each other, but somehow both Sapphire and Neil were looking at Fiona with unease. Of course, you looked at her with pure disgust.

"Oh great! Another friggin' manticore?! I got enough of that from that bitch, Belladonna." Fiona then notices Neil and smiles. "Hi, Neil." She says with a creepy stare as she waves at Neil. "Wade," says Neil. "Meet my sister-in-law, Fiona." Fiona walks forward and smiles as she stares down at Neil. "What are you looking at, you 300-toothed freak." Fiona finally notices you and seems surprised.

"Oh," she says. "I didn't know, you had.... other company." Fiona then stares at you slightly. "What the hell is your problem?" you ask. At that moment, Maggie walks back into the room. "Good news," she said. "The clams will be ready in five minutes. Oh, hello, Fiona. How's life been treating you?" Fiona just lets out a sigh. "It's going." she says in a somber tune. As she slumps you can see her obese green stomach about to hit the floor. "What's with the sad sack?" you ask Neil. "I see her staring at you. Your sister in law is planning to eat you." Neil let out a scoff. "It isn't that kind of hunger, smart guy."

You then realize something, Fiona had one eye focused on Neil and another eye focused on Maggie's wedding ring. From the looks of it, her scorpion tail was twitching nervously on the ground and was even scratching the dining room table's leg. You shudder. "You incestuous freak!" you say. Fiona gasps and Maggie and Sapphire give reactions of horror. "Are you talking about me?" "Who else would I be talking about, scorpion butt!? You're looking at this digesting weirdo the same way that bitch Bebe looks at me back in Under Gloom. Hello, he's your brother-in-law for damn sake, which should give you a clue about his questionable taste in women." Fiona begins to frown even moreso than before and from the looks of it, neither Maggie nor Neil appreciate it.

"Show some sensitivity," says Neil. "Fiona behaves the way she does because she's divorced. Her asshole husband openly cheated on her and then the bastard abandoned her on Valentine's Day." "Neil!" yells Maggie. "Not in front of Sapphire!" "Shut up, mouse muncher!" you yell up. "If you ask me, the guy grew a brain." Fiona gasped again and it looked like her eyes were watering but you weren't done insulting her. "In fact, anyone who would even consider marrying a fat waste of life with snaggleteeth and a poisonous tail who looks like a Thundercat on a 20 year junk food and drug binge is a giant sucker! Your face is so ugly, it would turn a gorgon to stone and you smell so bad it would make a skunk ape lose their lunch! Any sane man would rather be dead than spend the rest of their life looking at you!"

The next thing you know, Fiona breaks down crying and you and Neil have to get back to dodge tears the size of meteors as Sapphire runs to comfort her aunt. "What is wrong with you!?" yells Sapphire. "Nothing is wrong with me, you insult to nature," you say. "You're as much of an abomination as that million ton pile of expired pudding." Neil is about to deck you but then suddenly you hear a loud roar and then Maggie snatches you up and drags you into the other room just as Neil hops into her other hand.

"You have the manners of a cow!" yells Maggie. "And you smell like one," you say. "So we're even." You then scream in pain because Maggie squeezes you in her hand. "Kid," says Neil. "You just don't know when to quit. What you said to Fiona back there was just plain nasty." "That's right, Dear," says Maggie. "I've put up with this little creep back at the office and even saved his ungrateful ass from Prussia. He was still rude to me. But what this... this... this waste of life said to my emotionally fragile sister, that was the straw that broke the yppotryll's back."

You give Maaggie the finger and the lioness giantess growls before holding you up to her face. "You listen here, Wilson, you are going to make up for this." "And how will I do that, Lady Garfield." Maggie roars and holds you in front of her sharp teeth. "You are going to ask Fiona out on a date for tomorrow night. Maybe with a new man in her life she won't be so depressed." "I'd rather be dead." "Funny you should mention that," says Maggie. "Because if you don't ask Fiona out, I'll eat you right here on the spot."

Neil is actually shocked that his wife would consider eating you. After all, he and you were the same species. "Maggie," you say. "You're not serious are you?" "I'll admit," says Maggie to you. "I haven't eaten a human in 23 years and I swore off them forever when I married Neil, but you are really tempting me to make one exception in my life. So what's it gonna be?"

What do you have to say to this development?
1541222121.title: Another Manticore

choices: Skip to Community Service at Maggie's Office
Skip to Tonight's Date with Fiona.
15412221211.content:
As much as you hated the idea of asking a monster like Fiona on a date, you hated the idea of being eaten even more. "Fine," you mutter. "Bitch. I'll ask your sister out." Maggie gives a vicious smile your way. "Good," she says. "Good. But remember, you make Fiona cry like that again, and it's down the hatch. Down the hatch." Neil actually seems intimidated that his wife would consider eating you. You must've really pissed her off.

Maggie walks you into the next room where Fiona was still crying meteors as Sapphire was desperately trying to comfort the manticore woman. "Come on," says Sapphire. "Aunt Fiona. Don't listen to him." "But he's right," moans Fiona. "Look at me. I could've had any man I wanted back in high school but I let my body go straight to hell after the divorce. A man would have to be crazy to want me now." You start to have second thoughts about it. "What a crybaby," you thought. "No wonder Fang dumped her." Then you feel a poke and then hear Maggie growl. "Fine," you say. "Fiona, was it." Fiona pulls her tear soaked face out of her chest and turns to face you as Sapphire herself starts to growl at you. "Sapphire," says Maggie. "No. Dining room. Now." Sapphire obeys her mother and walks to the dining room.

"What do you want?" asks Fiona through her tears. You turn and see Maggie glaring down at you and Neil waving his finger at you before you let out a sigh. "Fiona," you say. "Will you... ugh... go out with me, tomorrow night." Almost immediately, Fiona changes from depressed to happy and lets out a squeal before grabbing you and rubbing you against her face, all while giggling like a schoolgirl and crying tears of joy. You let out a groan as Maggie laughs at your expense. "Uh, Maggie," says Neil. "Are you sure that this is a good idea." "Please," scoffs Maggie. "It wouldn't be the first time Fiona went out with an oxygen wasting jerkwad."

It isn't long before you're eating clams and fries with the Reavers. Maggie and Neil are sharing the same plate while Fiona is laughing and force feeding you fries as you groan. Damned stalker. She was worse than Bebe. Sapphire just rolls her eyes and is focused on her food. "What are you looking at?" you ask Sapphire.

After dinner, Fiona is blowing you a kiss as she leaves and shaking her tail. "I look forward to tomorrow Wade-ums." she says. You mentally gag. "I was definitely better off in jail." You mumble. Maggie calls Fortuna to tell her that you're staying with her family that night. You find yourself staying in a cage in Sapphire's bedroom. "I sense a lack of trust." You say. "It's your own fault for being such a raging A-hole," says Sapphire. "It wouldn't kill you to be nice." "Nice to monsters," you say. "Phooey. The only reason I'm even agreeing to go on a date with your stupid aunt is because your asshole mom was going to eat me." Sapphire scoffs as she puts on her pajamas and tosses her shirt over your cage. "You'd give her keriorrhea with your attitude." Sapphire then sits in bed as she reads a comic book blown to monster size.

"You read comic books?" you ask. "What a geek. I'll bet you're still a virgin. You probably never even kissed a guy. And your dad doesn't count, so don't give me any of that bull..." Sapphire responds by throwing a cream puff at your cage and hitting you in the face. With that, she puts her comic book on her desk and turns out the light. "I guess being a bitch fat bitchy cat runs in the family!" you yell. But Sapphire has already fallen asleep.

The next day, you're in bed when Sapphire is tasked with waking you up. "Wade," she says. "Mom wants you out of bed." "How about you kiss my ass." "Do not try my patience today Wade." Says Sapphire as she shows you her claws. "Alright," you say. "I'm up. Brat."
15412221211.title: Between a Lion and a Hard Place

154122212112.content:
Today was as uneventful as yesterday. You get no further to finding any leads on Specter and the only thing that really happens is that that stupid basilisk, Jolene, tried to arrest the mayor for loitering and vagrancy while Maggie was tending to something outside of the office. It didn't help that Destiny called the office and told you the clock was ticking. 28 days left and you can trade hillbilly hell back for Under Gloom. And then like that Maggie's shift was over.

"Oh wonderful," you say sarcastically. "Hey, Specter! Come out so I can get out of freakin' jail already!" Maggie shakes her head as she hears you as she's washing her hands in the bathroom. "Whatever," you groan. "Hey, Nala, hurry up in there so I can end this crappy day already." "Oh," says Maggie. "The day isn't over yet, Wade. Remember, you have a date." That's when you remembered. That Nemean lioness press ganged you into agreeing to a date with her manticore sister. You stick out your tongue and Maggie gives a slight growl. "Okay, bitch," you say. "I'm going."

You then scream as Maggie grabs you and forcibly rips your jumpsuit off. "Hey! What's the big deal fatass!" Maggie then reaches into her desk and takes out what looks like doll clothes. From the looks of it, it's a tux. "Good thing Sapphire saved some of her own doll clothes." "What the heck?" you ask. "Why can't that blind-ass husband of yours loan me one of his tacky tuxes?" "Because the only tux Neil owns was worn at our wedding and I'd rather be declawed than let a miscreant like you desecrate it. Now, enough with the chit-chat. You have a hot date tonight."

You let out a gag. Hot date? That was a laugh. Fiona was no hot date; she was Belladonna plus 500 or so hamburgers, green skin, wings and bad hygiene. Her lousy sister had to threaten to eat you to get you on a date with her. You'd rather take your chances with the Creeper on the first floor in Under Gloom. But it couldn't be helped.

Maggie was driving you down the street in what looked like the west end of Dreadberry and you look out and see what you assume is Fiona's house. It was a crude-looking single floor house that looked like the paint was chipping away and the yard was an absolute mess with dead grass and weeds. "What a dump." You groan. Maggie lets out a growl. "Show some sensitivity. Since Fang left her, Fiona stopped bothering with appearances." "Cry me a river." Maggie holds a claw dangerously close to your neck. "Remember, Wade," the lioness says. "Fiona better be smiling by the end of the date, or you'll see how indestructible a Nemean lion is on the inside." You give Maggie the finger but she ignores you and picks you up to walk you up to Fiona's doorstep where she rings the doorbell.

The door opens up and you look in surprise to see Fiona was wearing a dark yellow cocktail dress and had her hair tied into a ponytail. 1541222121122.title: The Drive-In

15412221211221.content:
You let out a groan. “So what the mother of **** are we watching?” Fiona giggles and squeezes her breasts together, nearly smothering you in the process as you groan. “Finders Famous Five.” “Say what?” you ask. “It’s a detective film,” says Fiona. “The fifth in the Finders Famous series. This chapter is called, the Aviary of Death after the main villain, a terrorist creature known only as the Bird who is responsible for a string of fatal bombings from the air. Nobody knows who the Bird is or what he’s up to."

“A detective movie?” you wonder to yourself. “Just great.” You hated detectives. They already were natural enemies of criminals like you. From the looks of it, it was taking a while for the movie to actually start but Fiona was already starting to stuff her face with popcorn. No wonder that manticore was such a fatass. Of course, you couldn’t say anything. Normally, you’d have no qualms about hurting the big green crybaby’s feelings, but you didn’t want to provoke her sister into devouring you.”

“So, tell me, Fatas… er, Fiona, what is the Finders Famous franchise about.” Fiona gives a smile. “Oh, they’re the most popular movies to hit Dreadberry. The Finders Famous are a team of detectives called to deal with the most dangerous of criminals.” You hated the sound of it already. But then you realized something. This was a detective movie and the Bird in the movie sounded a lot like the mysterious Specter, the very criminal you were released to help find. Perhaps if you studied this movie more carefully, you would be better able to figure out how to capture Specter and then you can say goodbye to Under Gloom and jerk-face Destiny. Of course, then you’d have to escape from this over amorous fat cat, but you’ll cross that bridge when you get there. Of course, that would mean knowing more about the movie you’re watching.

“So, Fiona,” you say. “Before the movie starts, could you tell me more about the Finders Famous?” Fiona reaches into a glove compartment to show you a poster for the movie. From the looks of it, the main villain, the one known only as “the Bird”, was a shadowed out figure resembling a winged and possibly avian type monster given the shape of his face, but it didn’t seem to tell exactly who was playing him. You study the poster closer and see that there were six monsters that appeared to be the protagonists with the two main protagonists appearing in the center. The one on the right appeared to be a fat and red furred werecheetah woman who appeared to have some form of pyrokinesis. Beside the cheetah giant was a dark blackish skinned and red eyes Flatwoods Monster with bright red eyes that made him look like a Kamen Rider. He also appeared to be wearing a white fedora.

“I take it that those two are the main protagonists?” you ask. Fiona points to the Flatwoods monster giant. “The Flatwoods monster is called Zone. He’s the heart of the group and the one who started the Finders Famous. He tries to be hard-boiled, but half-boiled is more like it. However, it’s usually him who puts the mystery together, but acts like an all around clown. The cheetah to his side is named Brimstone. I actually know her actress. Deborah Sprinter. Her older sister is Maggie’s best friend. As for her character, she’s an amnesiac with pyrokinesis, but has no idea where it came from. Oh, and Brimstone is Zone’s love interest as well as partner.” “Fascinating.” You say sarcastically. It seemed simple enough, but then you noticed four other characters that were apparent protagonists in this movie.

One of them was a completely blue skeleton with a sniper rifle who appeared to be riding a motorcycle of some sort. He also looked very muscular, as far as skeletons could go. Next to him was a silver Frankenstein that had mechanical arms and a face that looked like a hockey mask as well as a yellow skinned female werelizard with crescent moon shaped horns. She looked like a mystic based on her attire. However, the protagonist that really caught your attention seemed to be a green skinned male sylph, a wind-elemental. From the looks of it, he had a prison tattoo.

“And the green man.” “Wildwind,” said Fiona. “He was the main antagonist of the first movie. Part of this movie involves a chance of redemption. In this film, they need an ariel monster to help capture the Bird. So they sprung Wildwind and gives him the choice; he can either go through with his 666 year prison term or he can catch the film’s latest dangerous criminal for a chance at freedom. However, Terra, the psychic werelizard member of the team doesn’t entirely trust him, but that also acts to hide her own feelings for Wildwind.” From the sound of it, Wildwind was like you. Perhaps this movie might be worth paying attention too. Just as long as the romance scenes don’t get Fiona too excited.

If this movie gave you a good idea on how to catch Specter, than hopefully it will be worth being stuck with Fiona.

—————————————

However, what you don’t know is that Maggie has already decided her plan for you and Fiona and it catches her friends by surprise. “You’re kidding!” yells Barbara Anne. Maggie just gives an evil smirk. “I don’t think she’s kidding,” says Penny with horror in her voice. “You’re serious.” Maggie nodded her head. “If Wade hasn’t found Specter by the end of the month,’ the obese lioness in the green leotard says. “Then he’ll have two choices; he can either go back and rot in Under Gloom or he can marry Fiona.” Everyone is unsure about that plan. “I don’t think that’s such a good idea, Mags,” says Barbara Anne. “Your last brother-in-law was a complete dick but at least Fang didn’t have a criminal record.” “Besides,” says Fortuna. “Wade is extremely annoying. I’ve only known him for two days and I already see why my sister is so grumpy all the time.”

Maggie just pours herself a glass of milk before giving a glare that proved she was serious and was going to go through with her plan. “I am not changing my mind, girls. This may be my only chance to find a husband for Fiona so she’ll leave Neil alone. Wade may be a jerk but given the right incentive…” Meryl just bites on her finger bones. “Cattleya is not going to like this.”

154122212112211.content:
Later at the movie theater, Finders Famous Five has ended and Fiona is walking back from the snack bar with more snacks. "That movie was so beautiful." Says Fiona as you ride in her cleavage. "Hey, fat cat," you say. "Don't you have costumed freaks to be chasing." Ava looks in surprise and then you flip her off. "Yikes," says Ava. "What a bad attitude. Where did you meet him?" Fiona let out a giggle. "Maggie introduced us." Ava raised an eye. "What did you do to Maggie?" she said below her breath. "Uh, what business is he in?" Fiona smiled and then explained. "He was doing time in Under Gloom and he's in town helping Maggie catch Specter." Ava's jaw drops. "YOU'RE DATING A CRIMINAL!? Old Mother Hubbard, Fiona! I knew you were desperate after that shipwreck of a marriage with Fang but I didn't think you were THIS desperate." Fiona just smiles. "What are you worried about, Ava. Him catching Specter is community service to get out of prison. After that, he'll be the perfect man." Ava lets out a scoff. "Sure," says the tiger giantess sarcastically. "And I've just been crowned Queen of Atlantis." You don't think you like this Ava girl and stick your tongue out at her. Ava lets out a hiss. "Enjoy the rest of your evening."

The tiger giantess just walks away and mumbles to herself. "What is Fiona thinking?" she asks. Suddenly, Ava's cellphone begins to ring and Ava reaches into her cleavage to take out her phone. "Hello? Oh, hi Maggie. Listen, Sheriff, I have a bone to pick with you. I know Fiona's a pain about Neil and all but what possessed you to saddle her with that creep? What?! Are you ****ing kidding!? I was already the best woman at her last wedding and I do not want to watch her marrying a jerk again. Besides, what if he catches Specter by then. I understand." Ava puts her phone away before she walks up to the snack bar. "Three large popcorns," she says as she puts money on the counter. "I'm going to need them."

Fiona then plops down in her car and starts to force feed you popcorn again as the double feature comes up. How do you get yourself into these messes? To make matters worse, Ava was sitting in the car next to you and was gesturing she was watching you as she stuffed her face. That cat was sure paranoid.

That's when the next movie comes up.

You could not believe it. You got away from being eaten by 2 cats today, only for some stupid mutt to make a meal out of you.

The fox giantess walks inside her home and then takes you into her kitchen before she stares down at you with the intent to devour you. "Alright, little human," says the fox. "Your choice. Either I swallow you whole, or it's right in the oven." "Go to hell, Carmelita!" you yell. "My name is Meagan." Says the giantess in annoyance. You let out a laugh. "A fox named Meagan. How disgustingly ironic." Meagan shows her teeth. "Listen here, Fido! I already escaped that stupid cat from across the street and I can just as...."

Suddenly, Meagan grabs her ears and yells into the air. "Maggie Reaver!? That damned man-stealing cat!" Meagan gives a growl and then smashes a plate. You look and see that she has a dartboard with photographs of Neil all over it and from the looks of it, she already stuck it with knives. "Huh?" you ask. Then you gasp because you see a photograph on the side with Meagan on the beach in a bikini and she's smiling with Neil on her knee. As for the real Meagan, she is staring at the dartboard. "You little worm," she says. "Are you happy with that fleabag!? Is she more woman than I ever was?! We could've taken it to the next level! You'll rule the day you married her instead of me!"

You couldn't believe it. Maggie wasn't the first monster Neil dated. "What is wrong with that man?!" you yell. You notice Meagan is still fuming mad. This gives you an idea. "Hey, Meagan, was it?!" Meagan growls at you. "I just happen to have a month to help Lady Lardass down the street to catch Specter to avoid jail time. But I hate her and that idiot who married her as well." "Yeah? You want a medal for it?" "Just here me out. I think we can help each other out. I want out of town so I can escape back to the human world and you want revenge on the monster loving piece of freak. Here's my deal. I help you get revenge on Neil and you help me escape."

Meagan actually pauses to think it over and you cross your fingers and hope she accepts. Sure it would mean dooming Neil to that monster's appetite, but better him than you. You'll worry about the details of trapping him later. Now your fate is in Meagan's hands.

Does she accept the deal?
15412221221.title: Hello Meagan

15413.content:
(Note: This was going to be an interactive called Monster Hollow but because of a grave injustice, this is all anyone's ever going to get to it.)

You see Destiny impatiently tapping her fingers before you're forced to make the decision. "You win Destiny," you say with a sigh. "Send me off to Camp Darkly." Destiny nods her head. "Good, you'll be on your way first thing tomorrow. I recommend you behave yourself Wade. There are children present and twelve camp counselors who know how to deal with pests like you. If I hear any trouble, it's back to jail with you."

Well, the good news was that you could get out of this crappy prison. But now, you'd be spending the summer babysitting giant monster brats. The next day at the camp, the head counselor had gathered the staff to anticipate your arrival. There were nine other counselors, all women, mostly on the heavy side. First was a bright red skinned gargoyle woman with long purple hair worn in a ponytail. She was very pear-shaped compared to the rest of the staff.

Next was a chubby, pale skinned blonde girl with a white jack o'lantern for a head. Next to her was a big-bellied, black furred and red-haired hellhound with long horns and a devil's tail. Next to the hellhound was a BBW kappa woman with yellow-green skin and green hair. The kappa girl was eating a bag of marshmallows as a heavy set weresheep with golden wool took her seat next to her.

In the second row there was an hourglass shaped ogopogo woman, she looked similar to Lockette except more eel like with bright yellow fins going down her back and neck. Her skin looked like the color of an aurora. She must've been Odile, Fate's former roommate.

Next to her was a brocken specter, a rainbow colored ghost who looked like she was rising from the floor. Her face looked like a Haunter's and she had empty eye-sockets. Next to the brocken specter girl was a manticore woman in an apron. The manticore girl looked like Belladonna, but had purple skin, horns and leather wings as well as tattoos all over her body. The last monster was an obese creature that resembled a reddish brown furred lioness with the shell of a tortoise and six arms. She was a tarasque and from the looks of it, she wore a nurse's outfit.

The head counselor was a bright blue skinned qilin with grayish pink hair and golden antlers. She looked in better shape than the rest of the counselors and had a grim expression on her face as she was taking attendance of the staff. "Nat." She called. "Here." Said the jack o'lantern girl. "Venus." "Here I am Kaylee." Said the winged manticore. "Dolly." "Here." Said the weresheep. "Miranda?" The qilin paused and then looked around in annoyance. "Where are Miranda and Edgar?"

Suddenly the last two counselors ran forward; first was an obese, bright yellow furred werewolf girl wearing a red hood over her head and the other surprisingly was a human young man with bright silver hair and tanned skin. "Sorry we're late Kaylee." Said Miranda, the werewolf." The human stopped to pant while the weresheep, pumpkin girl, gargoyle, tarasque, kappa and hellhound all looked at him with lust. "Hi Edgar." They said in a singsong voice.

Edgar walked forward before the kappa girl finished her marshmallows and bent over. "You look beat Edgar," she said. "You can ride in the dome on my head. It's full of cold refreshing water." "UH thanks Skyla." Replies Edgar nonchalantly. That's when Dolly, the sheep giantess knocked Skyla out of the way. "Why take cold water when you can have warm wool Eddy." She says in lust. That's when the hellhound girl tried to push Dolly away only for Dolly to bite her and make her scream. "Hey!" "Hey yourself Heloise," says Dolly. "You're just gonna shove him down your purse. You know Edgar hates that." "Too bad," says Heloise. "I'm his fiancee." "Funny," says Nat, the pumpkin girl. "How can you be his fiancee when I'm his fiancee?"

Odile lets out a sigh as Venus picks at her teeth with a spatula. "Yikes, Summer's just started and they're already at it." The tarasque girl stepped in and tried to make a grab for Edgar but Heloise breathed fire on her back. "What do you think you're trying to do Martha?" asks the hellhound giantess. "Edgar's tired and bruised from his run here. I'm the nurse," says Martha, the tarasque, rather angrily. "And more important, his future wife." "You're gonna need some medical treatment yourself nurse." Says Skyla the kappa.

That's when the girls heard a whistle. The gargoyle giantess had picked up Edgar and placed him in her cleavage, much to her rivals' dismay. Martha in particular was enraged and showed her claws. "Curse you Janet! Just because that gargoyle hussy has the biggest rear of the staff, she thinks she's got the only hot guy in camp in the palm of her hand." "Technically," says the brocken specter. "She does." "Bettina," says Miranda. "Don't encourage them." "Will you stop it!" yells Kaylee as a storm suddenly appears in the sky.

All the counselors settle down and take their seats before Kaylee calls the meeting. "Okay, Camp Darkly opens tomorrow. But as for today, we're expecting a new counselor to the staff." Edgar lets out a gulp. "Oh," he groans. "If it's another stalker." Nat however smiles from cheek to cheek. "A new face in the camp. This is gonna be so fun! I'll get the confetti!" "It better not be a succubus," says Skyla as she opens another bag of marshmallows. "We've got enough competition here." Edgar looks at the girls nervously. Obviously he didn't exactly like all the attention.

"Actually," says Kaylee. "We're expecting a human. Another boy." Venus spots a bug on the table before squashing it with her spatula. "That's actually a good thing. Now Skyla, Dolly, Janet, Martha, Heloise and Nat will be fighting over two hotties." Odile however is outraged. "What?! Another human? You might as well fire us all and replace us with humans Kaylee! Is that it?" "Odile," says Edgar. "Why are you always so paranoid. "There's a human right here you know." "Shut it shrimp." says Odile. "No," says Kaylee. "You shut it Odile. This counselor is a prisoner from Under Gloom undergoing rehabilitation."

Heloise lights herself a cigarette with her fire breath before speaking. "Been there," she said. "Done that." Kaylee glares at Heloise and suddenly the cigarette turns into a candy cane, much to Heloise's dismay. "Really Kaylee?" she asks. "Think of the children Heloise," scolds Janet as she bounces her breasts and Edgar between them. "You're setting a bad example." Kaylee then focuses on Odile. "Odile, you don't have any right to complain. This is an order from Warden Destiny herself. You remember Destiny right Odile? Went to college with her daughter? Didn't you borrow money from Fate years ago to buy a textbook?" Odile groans and slaps herself in the face. "I should've paid her back when I had the chance." The ogopogo complains.

Edgar and Miranda share a laugh before Kaylee turns to Miranda. "And Miranda," says Kaylee. "Do not eat him when he arrives like you do with Edgar all the time." Miranda blushes slightly. "Come on Kaylee, why pick on me?" "Because A)," says Kaylee to the werewolf. "You're the only counselor who eats humans. And B) Unlike Edgar, this guy can't regenerate." Miranda glares at Edgar as he ducks down between Janet's breasts. "Can I help it if I'm immortal." Edgar grumbles to himself.

"So Kaylee," says Venus the manticore as she proceeds to scratch her belly button with her spatula. "Who's the new counselor." "His name is Wade Wilson." Says Kaylee. Janet's eyes pop upon hearing this. "Wilson?" the gargoyle giantess asks. "My big sis Petra told me about him." "What was he in for?" asks Bettina the brocken specter. "He's a career troublemaker with a rap sheet as big as a phonebook," says Janet. "But specifically why he's in Under Gloom, he set a mummy on fire for accidentally stepping on his car." "Yikes," says Edgar. "And he's coming to a camp for little girls. Robyn's not gonna like it."

Kaylee grabs her hair. "I don't care what that bureaucratic bigmouth hobgoblin likes." "You kinda have to Kaylee," says Miranda. "She's the inspector and she's coming in a few days." Kaylee then makes her eyes glow before she grows tens of thousands of feet tall and storm clouds fill the air. The rest of the counselors cower before her. "Quiet!" shouts the qilin giantess. "He's coming at noon and we are to make sure he doesn't cause any trouble! I have enough to worry about regarding this camp so it is up to each of you twelve to keep an eye on Wade. Got it!" The other counselors nod their heads nervously before Kaylee shrinks down to normal size.

"I hate it when she warps reality." Groans Martha the tarasque. At that time, you're on a bus heading for the camp. Destiny has one of the guards escorting you because she obviously doesn't trust you. This guard was a gigantic cyclops woman with bright red skin and orange hair and a blue tattoo around her singular eye. The cyclops has you stuck between her breasts as you're shaking. "Hey Iris," you say. "You don't have to hold me all the way to the camp." Iris just shakes her head and glares at you. "The Warden doesn't really believe you've changed. She sent me to accompany you because unlike the other guards, humans upset my stomach. You better behave yourself for the counselors though. Remember, there will be children present. At the first sign of criminal behavior, you'll be sent back to Under Gloom."

You just stick out your tongue. You heard about Edgar, the other human counselor and couldn't figure out why he could possibly enjoy being around monster brats. But soon you'd be in Horrorville and reach the camp.

Which point of view to follow now?
15413.title: Trading Prison for Camp

154131.content:
Soon the bus arrives and Iris walks out carrying you. Kaylee is there waiting for you with Edgar on her shoulder. Iris hands you to Kaylee and then starts to walk away. She however, glares before she does so. "I've got my eye on you Wade. Warden Destiny told me to come once a week to see how you're doing." As Iris walks off, you secretly give her the finger as Edgar looks at you in surprise. "Dude!" he yells. "That was so uncalled for." Kaylee just snarls and looks down.

You however aren't intimidated. "I take it you're in charge here horn head." "As a matter of fact," says the qilin woman. "I am. The name's Kaylee and let me assure you, I don't like this any better than you do. I hate humans." "And I hate monsters," you say. "Let's get this over with." As Kaylee walks towards the camp, Edgar looks on at you. "Don't tell me you're some monster lover?" you ask. Edgar shakes his head. "No wonder you got in prison. That attitude won't make you a lot of friends." "Blah! Blah! Blah! Why are you hear? You rob a bank?" "Actually," says Edgar. "I chose this job. I was raised in this area. My mom's a monster."

You're actually appalled at that. A human raised by a monster? That's sick. "Anyhow," says Edgar. "My name's Edgar. My mom named me after Edgar All..." "Who cares." Edgar just shakes his head. "I wonder if the warden sent you here just to get rid of you. The werebear that ate me last week had better manners than you." You just stick out your tongue. "Whatever. What's the deal with this camp."

Edgar smiles and begins to explains. "Camp Darkly is a summer camp for young monster girls. We accept from any species. There are ten counselors besides Kaylee and me. Most of them want to marry me. For some reason big fat monster chicks find me attractive." You almost gag in disgust before Edgar explains. "First off is my best friend Miranda the werewolf. She's really cool and always has my back. Of course she does eat me on a regular basis and she stole my bahamut girlfriend, Gia, but I don't hold that against her. Then there's Janet, a big red gargoyle and pretty much the most maternal mons...." "Gargoyle!" you yell. "Gargs are the worst." Edgar just ignores you. "If you saw a can like hers you'd change your tune. Of course Nat is a close second. She's a jack o'lantern girl who makes it feel like a party everyday. I wonder if she's got sugar for blood or something." Edgar laughs at her own joke as Edgar clears his throat.

"There's also someone you might like. Her name's Heloise. She's a hellhound who was given the choice of Under Gloom or here. Of course, she keeps me in a purse like a chihuahua when I work with her. It's so humiliating." "Another reason to hate monsters." You say. Edgar gets slightly annoyed before continuing. "There's also a kappa called Skyla. Nice girl, but don't ever take her out for lunch, you'll go bankrupt. Then you can meet Dolly the weresheep." "Weresheep?" you ask. "You made that up." "No, they're a legitimate species. Dolly was raised by humans and her folks still live with her." You let out a scoff. "If I found something like that in my backyard, it'd be lamp chops for a year baby."

Kaylee looks down and growls. "You two better get along down there," she warns. "Or I'll eat you both right here." Edgar shakes his head again. "Okay. Then there's Venus, a manticore who works as the camp cook. Of course, I'd never tell it to her face, but she's the worst cook I've ever met. She doesn't seem to know what she's doing most of the time. We gave her a job after the health inspector closed down her cafe." "Can't be any worse than prison food." You say. Edgar coughs slightly. "Next up is Nurse Martha, she's a tarasque." "What's a tarasque?" "It's a big tortoise with a lion's head and multiple arms. I'd watch your mouth around her, she's got quite a nasty temper. Janet beat her in a beauty pageant years ago and she's held a grudge ever since. Then there's Bettina, a brocken specter ghost in charge of campfire stories. I don't like her much because she loves to scare me."
