You roll your eyes and wish that you'd just reach the camp sooner because Edgar's descriptions of your new coworkers was making you crazy. "And last is that jerk Odile," says Edgar with venom in his voice. "That big ogopogo thinks my kind are out to steal her job. Her, you can be rude to as much as you want."

You look and see the camp up ahead as you sigh. Only three months as a counselor here and you never have to see a monster again.
154131.title: Arrival at Camp

1541311.content:
Soon, Kaylee reaches the camp carrying both you and Edgar. Once she steps foot on the camp soil, there's a loud explosion and confetti fills the air. Kaylee even swallows some of it before she coughs. Nat the pumpkin headed girl runs out with a smile on her jack o'lantern face and is carrying a cake. "Welcome to Camp Darkly!" the pumpkin girl yells in an excited tone. You roll your eyes as Edgar lets out a laugh. The rest of the counselors come forward and Heloise the hellhound girl looks directly at you.

"He's not as cute as Edgar." "Oh really?" you ask with a smug look. "Well you're not as ugly as Destiny dog face." Heloise gives an annoyed look before the brocken specter Bettina floats forward. "Ooh," she says as she waves her fingers. "So we have a tough guy here." The rainbow ghost lets out a sinister laugh and makes a frightening face that you just blow your tongue at. "He just doesn't know us," says Nat with that annoying smile still on her face. "Let's be friends Wade. Cake?"

You gag in disgust. "Are you kidding me?" you ask. "It's probably made of toxic waste." Nat actually looks saddened and her eyes well up with tears as the manticore Venus shakes her head. "He'd probably like it better if I made it." As Nat is crying, Skyla, the kappa woman decides to help herself to the cake as Martha the tarasque girl lets out a roar. "How dare you make Nat cry like that?" she asks. Martha growls and tries to come after you but Janet the gargoyle woman and Miranda the werewolf grab her by all six of her arms. "Let me at him!" yells Martha. "I"ll show him." "Leave him alone Martha," says Janet. "That temper of yours is out of control." "You want to start something beauty queen?" asks Martha angrily.

The ogopogo girl Odile lets out a sigh and then slams herself in the face. "Why me?" she asks. "Am I the only one here with any sanity." Dolly the weresheep giantess taps Odile on the back as you quickly grow impatient. "Come on!" you yell. "Let's get this started before I go brain dead from being with these monsters any longer than I have to." Edgar at this point becomes so fed up he punches you in the face. "Dude!" he yells. "What's your problem! You haven't said anything nice since you arrived. "Oh grow up!" "Silence!" shouts Kaylee as she makes thunder appear in the skies. All the giantess counselors stop and look at Kaylee.

"Wade will be staying at Camp Darkly serving community service until Summer ends. Since we don't have any human sized cabins, for each week of the camp session he will stay at a different counselor's cabin. His roommate at the end of the week will report to Iris, the cyclops Destiny sent to act as Wade's parole officer. If Destiny receives three particularly bad reports it will be back to Under Gloom for Wade." As Kaylee is speaking, you move your lips to mock her and she makes your mouth disappear. You groan before the qilin giantess continues. "And I want you to at least try to get along with him, even though he's a jerk. Which means no eating him Miranda." The werewolf giantess shakes you head. "Eat one immortal human one thousand times and you're branded for life." "Next time," says Edgar to Miranda as Kaylee hands him to the werewolf giantess. "Cut back on the garlic. Your insides smell bad enough."

As Miranda puts Edgar on her shoulder, Kaylee gives you your mouth back as you breath in deeply. However, Odile has a question. "Wait," says the ogopogo. "There are twelve weeks of Summer and only eleven counselors here that are monsters. What about the remaining week." Kaylee points up to the sky and you hear wings flapping. You look up and see another monster giantess. This one looked like a cross between a hippopotamus and a dragon with leather wings. She had gills on her neck and long blackish blue hair and was wearing a red jacket, black shirt and blue jeans. The strange giantess lands with a thump on the ground and then smiles at Edgar before blowing a kiss. "Uh-oh." says Edgar.

Immediately Heloise, Martha and Dolly growl at the new giantess. "Hello Elisa." Says Dolly in an angry tone. "Sorry I'm late Kaylee," says Elisa. "I overslept." "What the hell kind of monster is that?" you ask. "I'm a bahamut," says Elisa. "Basically a hippo combined with a fish, but with a dragon added in. Dungeons and Dragons, what are you gonna do?" "And all ugly." Elisa snorts angrily and blows black smoke out of her nostrils. "Listen," she says. "I may be used to humans and I work with one at my winter job, but I'm just starting work here today and I don't expect to make any enemies." You shake your head. "Whatever hippo face."

Elisa walks up to the other counselors with only Odile, Venus, Miranda and Bettina being welcoming towards her as Edgar hides in Miranda's hood. "Just what we need," sighs Odile. "Another suitor for the one guy counselor. So who gets stuck with Wade the first day."

Kaylee snaps her fingers and summons a jar out of thin air with papers inside. "I've taken the liberty of putting numbers in a jar for the weeks at camp. There are 12 monster counselors, this will decide the order in which we put up with the twerp." You couldn't care less and just wish that Kaylee would get it over with. Kaylee reaches in first and draws the number 6, meaning you'd stay with her on the 6th week of camp. You could've sworn it was a 1 a second ago though. She probably cheated with her reality bending powers.

"Alright." Nat and Odile walk forward next and Odile lets out a sigh. "I bet I get stuck first," says the ogopogo. "I never had much luck gambling." Odile and Nat draw their cards. Nat gets a 4 while Odile gets a 9." "Aw," groans Nat. "I wanted a 1. I got off on the wrong foot with him and..." "Next!" yells Kaylee impatiently as you grab your ears. Miranda and Martha draw next. Martha draws an 8 while Miranda draws a 10. Next up is Heloise and Skyla. Skyla draws a 2 and Heloise draws a 7. "Ooh," says Heloise. "My lucky number." "Crud!" yells Skyla. "I get stuck with that grouch on the second week."

Bettina flies forward and draws a number as does Venus. Venus gets a 5 and Bettina draws an 11. "Hey, hey, hey," says Bettina. "It's my lucky day." Venus shrugs her shoulders because she doesn't care. Dolly is next to draw and Edgar asks her a question. "What did you get Dolly." "A 3. That leaves only a 12 and a 1. The first and last weeks of Summer." Janet and Elisa look at each other and glare slightly. "You go ahead Janet," says Elisa. "After all, you are my friend's kid sister." "Uh uh," says Janet as the gargoyle giantess gives a fanged smirk. "Age before beauty." "Ha, ha." Says Elisa sarcastically. "Just draw!" yells Kaylee.

The bahamut and gargoyle reach in and draw numbers. You don't know which is worse because whoever draws a 1 will be your roommate for the first week of camp. Elisa already didn't seem to like you and she was a cross between a dragon and a hippo. That bahamut would probably get real mad if you tick her off. Then there was Janet the gargoyle. She's the last species you want to be stuck with during community service, especially after your experiences with Destiny.

So who drew the 1?
1541311.title: Camp Darkly

15413111.content:
Elisa looks at her card and gasped. "Oh no!" she yells. As it turns out, it was a one. She would be watching you for the first week of the Summer. "Ooh," says Heloise."Bad luck Elisa. You get the jerk first." Elisa groans again and that hippo dragon giantess shakes her head. "Whoop de doo," you say. "I get to spend the first week with a fat smelling, hippo dragon fish." Elisa growls and breathes fire over your head before you're forced to duck.

"So it's settled," says Kaylee. "For the first week of camp, Elisa will be in charge of our new counselor. For the second week, Skyla will oversee Wade. In the third week, Dolly will be in charge. Week four, Wade will be Nat's responsibility and for week 5 he bunks with Venus. I'm in charge of him for week 6. Week 7, he's your problem Heloise, Martha will take him on the 8th week Odile will be in charge of week 9 and he'll be staying with both Miranda and Edgar week 10. Week 11, Wade stays with Bettina and finally, Janet is in charge of him."

Janet is secretly laughing at the development before Kaylee hands you to Elisa. "Keep an eye on him Ms. Starkings," says Kaylee. "We can't have him acting up around the campers." "Don't worry chief," says Elisa. "I know how to handle humans." Kaylee nods her head. "I like you Elisa. You have a good work ethic. For a Terrordale dweller." "Terrordale?" you wonder to yourself. You had heard monsters from Horrorville and Terrordale were bitter enemies for some reason. This might be interesting.

Elisa folds down her wings before she walks you to a cabin with an orange colored version of the camp logo on it. It had the number 12 printed on the side. Elisa opened the door and brings you inside. You look around and see the interior of the cabin. There is a skiing poster on the wall and there appears to be a stack of superhero comic books on the side of a shelf. Looks like the bahamut giantess is an otaku. Elisa puts you on a table before she walks to her dresser. "Wait here," she says. "I'll get your bed ready." You roll your eyes and see that Elisa placed you in front of two photographs in frames. One showed Elisa snowboarding down a hill along with a fat yellow skinned gargoyle giantess with black hair. On the gargoyle girl's shoulder was a young human man with purple hair and a well toned physique. The second photograph showed Elisa with who you assume was her family.

From the looks of it, her mother was a royal blue skinned bahamut with her black hair worn in a bun and her father was a muscle bound reddish skinned bahamut with graying hair. She also seemed to have two sisters. One was an indigo skinned bahamut in a gothic style outfit with a beret while the other was a cyan skinned bahamut who appeared younger than her sisters. What was weird was that there was another monster holding hands with Elisa's youngest sister. She was a white skinned behemoth with a pair of glasses and blonde hair. You're guessing that behemoth was Elisa's sister-in-law. You mentally gag. Girl on girl is hot, but with monsters?

Elisa then comes forward and you see that for your bed, she's brought out...
15413111.title: Elisa the Bahamut

1541312.content:
Just as Kaylee is about to reach the camp, she sees an unpleasant sight. A giantess in a black and purple gothic lolita outfit complete with a thorn tiara was walking forward. She had long black hair with primrose highlights and was carrying a purse and clipboard. She looked human except for her pale skin, snub nose, pointed ears and red eyes.

"Oh no," says Edgar. "It's Robyn." Robyn comes forward and Kaylee bears her teeth. "What are you doing here you hobgoblin hussy?" she asks. "You're not due to inspect the camp for a few days." "You need a new calendar Kaylee," says Robyn. "I prefer to start before your incompetence gets children hurt. The campers aren't due until tomorrow, so I'm going to run a quick check." Kaylee lets out a groan before Robyn notices you.

"What's this?" the hobgoblin girl asks. "Oh him?" asks Kaylee. "This is Wade, our new counselor." Robyn shakes her head and lowers a finger to stroke your head to your annoyance. "That is really abusive," she says. "It's bad enough you expect Edgar to keep up with the rest of the counselors." As Robyn strokes you, you get annoyed and bite her on the finger as she yells in pain. "OUCH!" Edgar gasps and Kaylee looks at the inspector in fear. Robyn in retaliation reaches into her purse and takes out a squirt bottle before spraying you with it a few times. "Bad human," she says. "What an ill-behaved creature you are!"

"What was that about?" you ask Edgar. "Well," says Edgar. "Robyn keeps humans as pets at home. She thinks that we're adorable." Pets? That goblin saw you as nothing more than an unruly hamster? That was insulting. Robyn puts her bleeding finger in her mouth and glares at Kaylee. "Not coming to a very good start are we Kaylee?" she asks. "If I'm met with any more hostility from your counselors, consider this camp shut down." "Good riddance." You think. That's when you realize something. If Camp Darkly is shut down, you'll never be able to fulfill your community service and it's back to Under Gloom for you.

Kaylee bites her lip, but then gets an idea. "Uh-oh." Says Edgar. "Say Robyn," says Kaylee. "We need a little time to get the camp up and running. Perhaps I can interest you in a deal. You give us more time to set up and I give you Wade." "What?!" you yell. Kaylee then gives a smirk. "Perhaps a little loving discipline from you would be enough to fix his attitude?" Edgar actually laughs as you glare at Kaylee and Robyn seems to think this over.

What does Robyn think of this idea?
1541312.title: The Inspector Strikes Back

15413121.content:
“That is an interesting idea Robyn. I can always use another human pet. I always adore them.” Robyn said with a snickering grin to some degree, but it was quite cute none of the less. For you, this means one thing, oh the hell no in every possible way. Kaylee just sold you out to Robyn, and you would probably know that Destiny would eventually check the place to see how you are doing, and if she finds out that you aren’t there, she would guess you escaped then, and if that happens, then more likely you are going back to the Under Gloom. Man this day just couldn’t get any worse for you. “And perhaps I can work out that Wade who has problems.” She giggled kinda bit as she pokes a finger at you, making you really irritated.

“I would like to state something though that explains why I should not go.” Wade stated to everyone, and this kinda gets Robyn and Kaylee listening for a moment, although Kaylee was kinda reluctant. “If by some time or reason Destiny comes to Camp Darkly, and sees that I am not there doing my community service. She will think I escaped, and then she will look for me as I bailed on community service, if that happens, or the place gets shut down, then I go back to prison, and I don’t want that. So I say let the inspection happen and just get it out of the way.”

Robyn then thinks this over and “Well… to have a good working environment, I need everyone being positive, and your negative attitude is the problem, so I am doing what is needed (off camera scene, Destiny allows Kaylee to give Wade to Robyn to fix his attitude although it won’t be revealed to him), and that means you need to start manning up for once.” Kaylee smirked.

“Fine, I’ll do it. Robyn, take me to whatever place and let’s just get this over with.” Wade grunted, pretty mad that Kaylee just made his day gone from bad to worse. This might as well not be pretty. Robyn then grabs you, puts you into her bag, and then she drives off. “Alright, have fun getting your attitude fixed.” Edgar waved goodbye to his new friend who gives him the middle finger from the window (it was really for Kaylee).

“Say… Edgar. There is way that she cures humans and makes them positive. She is actually a spell user, who casts a spell on the humans she keeps as pets, and that makes the pets obey their masters. Perhaps we might be having a fully complying new worker when he gets back.” Kaylee said to Edgar. “Thanks for telling me. At least I am not like him.”
15413121.title: Sold me off!

154131211.content:
The hobgoblin Robyn is sure to enjoy having you as a pet, and you basically are the opposite of that case, and boy would you not like it at all. You were in Robyn’s pocket, just relaxing and moaning in complete boredom and anger as you wait for your new home. It was a few miles away from her house, plus with all of the usual stop light and crap that she has to stop every once in a while, you know that this is going to be a long ride. “Oh this is going to be so much fun. I am going to be able to feed you, let you play with the others, tell bedtime stories with you, and all sorts of other stuff, and I know you won’t be able to resist them, as I have something cooking up for you, and it’s waiting for you.” Robyn said with a nice and calm voice, as she seems to be a charming woman. You are just hoping that she isn’t some sort of a witch (stated in last chapter by Edgar and Kaylee as he left that she is a witch) that could put you under some spell that will make you do some weird things. If it is, you would rather go back to prison.

Eventually, they reach Robyn’s home, which kinda looks like an evil witch castle by some means with all the dark and spooky creatures that just give you the jaspers. They were like dead souls, zombies, and all sorts of other stuff. Somehow coming out of the house to see Robyn is some sort of a young daughter hobgoblin. It was a cute young girl with black hair, and was wearing a pink shirt with a white skirt, and she had some sort of a magic wand in her hand. “Ah… and guess my little helper in magic is going to join along with us. Ah that Soya.” Robyn smiled just as her daughter comes up to the vehicle. Great, just looking at her, now you got two problems to worry about. Robyn, and now especially Soya. “Say, I will be right in there in just a moment sweety, just get ready to cast your spells as soon as I am done with this fella.” Robyn told her just as she gets out of the car, and Soya smiled. “Alright mommy, I will be ready.” Soya said (note that she appears like a 9 year old) and then she runs up into the house. Robyn then takes you out, and sprays some sort of a pixie dust from her can of something onto you, and it got you itching as it was not pleasant at all.

“Hey, what in the heck is that?” you shouted up to her just as you were sprayed by the pixie dust thingy. “Well, you will find out as soon as you get in there.” She said just as she walks into the main room where the daughter is ready with the wand. “Alright Soya, I have brought our latest recreation toy right here, I like to see you work your magic right now.” Robyn smiled for her daughter, just as the daughter begins some sort of spell casting like stunt. “Oh hello there human, you and I are going to become best friends, who are you?” she asked you just as she begins using her magic.

“I am…” you said before she puts some spell on you right then with the magic student that forces you to say. “Wade.” In a happy voice, and then you suddenly gasped. You were angry enough to be brought here, but now you are saying your name and agreeing to be her friend happily. Well that is just creepy. “Say, would you like to be my friend?” she asked you and then you angrily shouted “No… I will not…” you said before Soya casts another spell again that forces you to happily say. “Yes, of course I will be your friend Soya.” You said in a controlled happily state. Robyn was just laughing. “It worked, it… worked!!!!!!!!!” she laughed, happily that her spell is working perfectly.

“Say Wade, do you like to?” Soya asked.
154131211.title: Under a Spell

choices: Edgar Waits for Wade to Arrive
154132.content:
(While we're waiting for Wade to arrive, why not shift to Edgar's P.O.V.)

After the meeting, Edgar was relaxing underneath a giant daisy as his werewolf friend, Miranda walks forward. "You know," says the wolf giantess as she shows her teeth. "That daisy would make great seasoning for you." Edgar lets out a sigh. "Please Miranda," he groans. "I don't feel like being eaten today. I spent six days in that wendigo, Desiree's belly just last week. She wouldn't let me out until I agreed to date her. And that's not getting started on the weretiger girl who bit my head off yesterday. It still stings." "Come on," groans Miranda. "I won't chew on you this time. You're the only human I know who can be eaten more than once."

Edgar rolls his eyes. "You know, it's kind of uncomfortable having a best friend who considers me to be food. I'm just relaxing until this new counselor shows up. "About that," says Miranda. "We're expecting two new counselors. "Kaylee told me Elisa is starting work here." "Oh no," Edgar groans. "Elisa is nice and all, but one more stalker? They're getting more bloodthirsty everyday. Just the other day, I was at the beach when I caught Nat, Skyla, Heloise and Dolly playing volleyball. Only Dolly saw me, and she hid me in one of the rolls on her belly to hide me from the other girls. Why do so many monsters consider me attractive?"

Miranda lets out a laugh. "Well," she says as she leans back so her head is above Edgar and the daisy. "What can I say. You're so cute they could just..." With that, Miranda snaps her friend and the daisy up in her jaws and devours the human before spitting out his bones. Surprisingly, the bones come back into place and Edgar's body regenerates no worse for wear. As Edgar recovers from being chewed to bits and holds his head, he looks up in annoyance. "Hey! You said you wouldn't chew!" "Can I help it if I'm a wolf?" asks Miranda before she lets out a burp. Edgar just turns his head and crosses his arms.

"Okay," sighs Miranda. "I'll let you decide how I eat you next time." "That's better. Speaking of Elisa, how's Gia doing." Edgar takes out his wallet and holds up a photograph of an indigo skinned monster girl resembling a cross between a fish, a hippopotamus and a dragon. She had long black hair and was dressed like a Goth girl complete with a navel piercing. "Relax Edgar," says Miranda. "Your ex-girlfriend is doing fine. She was asking about you over brunch and by brunch I mean..." "Miranda!" yells Edgar. "That's my ex you're talking about!" Miranda rolls her eyes. "By the way, what do you think of another human in the camp?"

Edgar lets out a groan. "Well, I'm not wild about having a criminal in the camp and he's from Under Gloom. My dad's killer is in Under Gloom you know. That gorgon Yuri, remember. Turned him from a wyvern to an overgrown lawn ornament. Rest his soul. That reminds me, I better visit my mom. She's gonna want to know about that. But she's been busy working on a difficult potion lately and then she might try to hook me up with another stalker. I've got enough of those. What to do, what to do?"
154132.title: Edgar's P.O.V.

choices: "Can I join you to Meet Wade?"
"How would you like a blind date?"
1541322.content:
Edgar gets up and starts to walk away. "If you need me Miranda, I'm gonna be visiting my mom. The old Nidhogg could use some company. Haven't seen her for a week." Miranda barks as Edgar walks away. Along the way he's thinking about your arrival to camp. "This Wade guy sounds like bad news. What is the warden thinking sending him to Camp Darkly?

As Edgar is walking towards his mother's hovel, he stops as a bright blue monster resembling a four-armed xenomorph girl walks forward. The alien giantess looks down and shows her monstrous teeth as she waves to Edgar and Edgar waves back as the giantess goes along her way carrying a toolbox. "Have a good day Xeno." Says Edgar unafraid of the giantess.

Edgar keeps on walking until he stops because he has run into a hissing Midgard Serpent that apparently has decided to make a meal out of him. Edgar just lets out a sigh as the giant snake lunges at him. But before the snake could get him, another monster intervenes and scares the snake off. This time it was an obese white furred giantess with long blue horns. She was a wendigo and was dressed like a park ranger. "Hi Edgar." Says the wendigo girl as she waves down and smiles with her large fangs. "Hi Desiree," says Edgar in annoyance. "As much as I'd like to be your dinner or your date, or both, I have to get to my mom's place. Thanks for saving me from that Midgard Serpent though. I'd rather be eaten by a sentient monster and preferably a girl."

Desiree pouts as Edgar walks away. "Next time," she says to himself. "I'm going to keep him in my belly until he proposes to me." As Edgar walked off, he saw his mom's place on the horizon. It looked like an old hovel and there were two other monster girls outside. First was an overweight purple furred monkey giantess who had giant white wings. She wore black shorts, a white shirt and orange cap and was sweeping the deck. Up on the roof repairing a hole was a giant pear shaped woman in silver armor who surprisingly didn't have a head. Her head in fact was tan skinned with long rose colored hair and was sipping a soda through a straw on a nearby table. She was a dullahan.

"Hi Fay," says Edgar as he walks forward. "Hi Katrina." Both apprentice monsters turn their heads and spot Edgar. Immediately they get excited. The dullahan girl's body even jumps off the roof and snatches Edgar up as her head squeals. Edgar grunts as the dullahan pushes her against her left breast. "How are you doing today little cutie?" asks the dullahan. "It's so good to see you. Your mom asked me to fix the roof and low and behold..." Katrina giggles as Fay, the winged monkey looks on in annoyance. "Hey Katrina," she says. "Stop hogging the hunk. I'm Nadine's apprentice. I deserve some time with her son." "Go eat a banana." Says Katrina. Fay lets out a monkey shriek and holds up her broom to whack Katrina's disembodied head when Edgar clears his throat. "Uh, is mom home." Both monster girls let out a sigh as Katrina puts Edgar down.

"Nadine's in her study working on potions." Edgar walks into the hovel and inside there was a strange monster brewing a potion. The monster giantess resembled a tyrannosaurus rex with dragon's wings and lumps on her yellowish-brown body. She had gray hair worn in a ponytail with tusks braided in the sides and was wearing a sorceress's dress. "Now," says the nidhogg giantess. "Mandrake sap, smilodon tears..." As the giantess puts the ingredients into the cauldron, it causes an explosion of magical smoke that forces Edgar to cover his mouth.

Nadine coughs and lowers her head before the smoke clears. "Mother Hubbard!" she shouts to herself. "By Odin's beard, I wish I held onto that recipe." "Mom!" yells Edgar up to the dragon woman. "Mom! Down here." Nadine lowers her head and smiles upon seeing her human son. "Edgar," she says as she bends over and rubs her head against the tiny human. "How good to see you. Tell me son, have you asked out any of your coworkers yet? Maybe Dolly or Janet? At this point, I'd settle for Martha." "Mom," complains Edgar. "Not that again. I just wanted to tell you we're expecting a new counselor. Nadine picks Edgar up and places him on the table as she starts to go through the rest of her ingredients.

"Well," says Nadine. "As long as she's a nice girl. At least 500 stones. I know what my baby likes." "Mom," says Edgar. "You doubt understand. It's a boy and a human like me. His name's Wade Wilson." Nadine nods her head. "That's nice dear. I just hope Miranda doesn't eat him. You don't have any friends your own size." "I doubt I'll be friends with Wade. He's coming in from Under Gloom."

Upon hearing this, Nadine drops a bottle on the ground because now she's horrified of your arrival. "They're letting a criminal work in a camp for children?! Are they nuts!" "Well, they already have Heloise." "Heloise is a minor offender," says Nadine. "What is this guy in for?" Edgar nervously rubs his head. "Arson." "Arson!?" yells Nadine. "You've got to be kidding me!" "Calm down Mom," says Edgar. "it's only for 12 weeks." Nadine lets out a growl and then turns her head around to speak with her son.

She asks him a question?
1541322.title: Mother Nidhogg

choices: Edgar Is Going With Someone Else
15413221.content:
"Do you think I could meet this Wade?" Nadine asks. "What do want to meet him for?" Edgar asks. She folds her arms and grunts a little. "I just want to see what kind of criminal they've let into the camp." she says. Edgar sighs and shakes his head. "Okay, but I have to warn you, I've heard he's kind of a a jerk. Seems like he hates monsters." he warns her. "Thats okay, I just want to be up to date on whats going on in your life." she tells him. Edgar doesn't exactly know what she plans on doing, but at least she's not on his back about women. He waits for a second as she gets ready, then she picks her son up and places him on her shoulder. "All right, lets go." she says and heads out. On the way out the door they wave at Fay and Katrina, who both look up from their work to stare longingly at Edgar. "Goodbye Edgar! See you next time!" they both say in unison. When they hear each other they shoot the other a glare and get back to work. "You know, one of them would be good for you sweety." Nadine says. "You could come to work with them and I'd get to see you all the time!" He rolls his eyes at this. "Come on mom, I'll find the right girl eventually." he tells her. "I feel like "eventually" should have passed a long time ago." she counters.

When the two of them arrive at the camp all of the girls present rush over to them. "Hello ma'am! How are you today?" Skyla asks sweetly. "How's the sorcery business doing?" Heloise butts in. Its usually like this when Edgar's mother shows up. All of the girls try to suck up to her to get a better standing. "Oh, I'm fine, everything is great." Nadine answers them. "I trust you all are taking good care of my son?" They all giggle and blush. "Of course!" Venus says. Your mother proceeds past them and looks around. "Now I don't mean to cut you girls off, but I'd like to meet this new counselor of yours." she announces. "Oh that would be Wade here." Dolly tells her as she walks up with the human in hand. Wade regards the nidhogg and groans. "Another one? Who's this hag?" he says spitefully. Nadine's eyes narrow and she frowns. "Hey, watch it! This is my mother!" Edgar calls to him. "Mother? More like keeper. How can you call yourself human with a mother like that?" he calls back. "I think I've seen enough." Nadine says. "He certainly is rude, but he's just a loudmouth." She turns to walk away, probably to prevent herself from getting worked up.

Just then they hear a flapping sound and look up. Descending from the sky is a pear shaped gargoyle with red skin. When she lands she looks around. "Whats with the little get together?" she asks. Then she sees Edgar and his mother and straightens up. "Oh! Hello ma'am! I didn't see you there!" Nadine smiles at her. "Hello Janet. I was just here to see the new counselor, and I think I've seen more than I want." she says. "I'll be on my way now, so why don't you take Edgar here?" She hands him to Janet, who squeals a little in glee. The other girls all stare with jealousy. Wade however, is not very pleased to see Janet. "Oh great, a gargoyle? This just keeps getting better and better." he moans. Janet turns to him in Dolly's hand and responds. "Do you have some kind of problem with gargoyles?" she asks. "Yeah, considering my life is hell thanks to a certain blue warden." he answers. "Well Janet's really nice, so could you at least try to be nice?" Edgar says. "Fat chance." he spits back. "Almost as fat as that flying tomato." Janet frowns at him. "Well we can always send you right back to that "blue skinned warden" you love so much" she tells him. "Red or blue, you're all just big dumb rocks. Well I guess in your case I'd say boulder." he says. The girls who have already got acquainted with Wade all groan at his attitude, but Nadine turns to him in frustration. "You should really watch your mouth criminal. Any of these girls could be my daughter one day, so don't insult them or my son!" she says. The women present all gasp when she says "daughter". Wade just sticks his tongue out at her as Kaylee walks up. "Okay, lets break it up, we have a camp to run." she says aloud. She then tells everyone her plan for the day.
15413221.title: Meeting Wade

154132211.content:
(From this point on, it will be a first person narrative. You can either follow Wade or Edgar but refer to them by their names)

As Nadine walks away, Kaylee gathers all the counselors together. Wade watches from Dolly's palm and starts picking his nose. The weresheep lets out a groan. "Why do I get stuck with him while Janet gets to hold Edgar. It's not fair." "You're dog gone right it isn't fair Dolly," says Skyla. "Hand him over here Janet." Janet just waves her finger and shoves Edgar down her cleavage as Miranda lets out a laugh. "Boo! yells Nat, Venus and Skyla at the same time. Odile rolls her eyes as Miranda smiles smugly. "Man, am I glad that Gia's the only girl for me." Bettina snickers herself as Nat, Venus, Martha, Heloise and Skyla form a huddle.

Martha lets out a growl and crosses all her arms. "That tomato red hussy," she grumbles. "First she steals victory from me at the Ms. Horrorville Pageant and now she's hoarding the hottie all to herself." "I'll bet that b... boulder, slipped a love potion into his drink last summer," says Skyla as she reaches into her shell to take out a bag of potato chips. "Still," says Heloise. "How can we compete with a can like that." "Bah!" scoffs Venus. "No way it can be natural. I'll bet she's been taking nebutori on the side." Nat just lets out a giggle. "That's okay. It just means I'll have to eat twice as much marble cake to be on par with Friend Janet." "You better share," says Heloise as she rubs her big belly. "I mean, this is promising, but Edgar loves his monster girls with lots of meat."

Wade just lets out a scoff. "What would any sane man want with any of you giant freakish blobs?!" Dolly grits her teeth and looks down at you. "What was that?" Dolly asks. "Well," says Wade. "Look at you all. You're ugly monsters, especially that blond freak with the sagging stomach and vegetable face." Nat gasps and rubs her pumpkin head, but Venus snatches Wade up and growls. "You're lucky humans give me gas," she says. "You're playing with fire."

"Shut up!" yells Kaylee at the top of her lungs. "Geez. Okay. We need to get the camp ready. The campers arrive tomorrow and more importantly, Robyn will be here in a few days to inspect the camp. Wade, you're new here, so I'll explain the camp rules. No swearing, no smoking, no drinking and overall, don't behave in such a deplorable way that little kids could imitate." "Up yours horn face." Says Wade. Edgar slaps himself in the face.

"By the way, Wade isn't our only new counselor. You all remember Gia's twin sister." From the sky flies down a brown skinned monster resembling a hippo with gills and the wings and skin of a dragon. She was wearing a red jacket and scarf with a black shirt and blue jeans. "Hi Edgar," she says dreamily. "I'm back." "Elisa." Groans Janet as she shoves Edgar deeper down her cleavage. "Oh great," says Wade. "Another freak. Hey Big Bertha, to the side! I can barely see!" Elisa is not amused and the bahamut responds by breathing fire on Wade. Wade coughs up smoke as the counselors take their seats.

"Okay," says Kaylee. "We've got until tomorrow to get this camp ready. Janet, Skyla, Edgar, Dolly, Nat and Venus will join me in preparing the east side of camp. Oh, and Venus." "Yes Kaylee?" the manticore asks as she uses a kitchen knife to cut her toenails. "If it has blue spots, throw it away. The last thing we need is a camper getting food poisoning and a lawsuit from her parents. Now, Heloise, Elisa, Martha, Odile, Bettina and Miranda will take Wade and cover the west side of camp." "What?!" yells Odile. "You're sticking us with that crook. But why." Kaylee levitates Odile in the air and Odile grunts as she holds her neck. "Because the warden knew about the camp through you, because you owe her daughter money and because I'll turn you into an aardvark if you don't Ms. Pogo!"

Kaylee drops Odile and Odile snatches Wade from Dolly. Wade sticks his tongue out. "Listen here lady. I've had to spend six months in a cell with a Loch Ness Monster and I don't want to stay with an ogopogo either." Odile squeezes Wade before she puts him on her shoulder. "Come on girls," says Kaylee. "And Edgar, and Wade. Let's go."

Who's P.O.V. do you follow?
154132211.title: Edgar Sticks With Janet

1541322112.content:
Edgar goes with Janet as Skyla, Dolly, Nat and Venus follow behind, all with jealous looks on their faces. Janet smiles and looks down as she strokes Edgar on the head. Edgar smiles as Venus lets out a growl. "The nerve of that Janet," she says. "Well, just wait who's laughing when Nadine tries my stuffed tarantula soufflé. I'll show up Janet, and that jerk Circe as well. Let's see that pig deal with some competition."

Edgar climbs out of Janet's cleavage and looks at the four other girls before shaking his head. "When will it end?" he asks. Janet lets out a laugh and then shoves Edgar back down between her titanic breasts. "Well that's an easy answer, the gargoyle giantess says. It'll stop when we're married." Edgar rolls his eyes. "I'm still worried about having Wade around Janet," he says. "Can you believe he insulted my mother, to her face?" Janet nods her head. "Don't forget he insulted me and my species. Doesn't he know gargoyles have an instinct to protect humans? I'm terrified to see what he says around the little ones. He looks like he's bad with children."

Edgar nods his head. Suddenly his cellphone rings. Edgar grunts and tried to move his hands through Janet's breasts and then takes out his phone to see it is depicting an image of a bixie, a stone lion with winged shoulders. This bixie was a woman, very chubby with gray hair and thin glasses along with H-cup breasts. In the image on the phone, the bixie woman was wearing a bikini top that read "Make me Purr" and had a seductive look on her face.

Edgar sighs and answers the phone. "Hi Celadon," he says. "Yes, I'm doing well. Is Nala ready for... oh good. We really enjoy having your daughter at Camp Darkly. She always has a good, uh no, I'm gonna be busy this week and..." Janet looks down and glares as her eyes glow red. "Celadon," says Edgar. "I'm gonna have to call you back." Edgar hangs up and lets out a sigh. No sooner does the phone ring again and he grits his teeth.

Edgar sees that this time the phone showed an image of a titanic crimson furred wereboar girl who was dressed similar to Wonder Woman and even had star shaped tattoos on her large hips. The caller ID identified this wereboar as "Circe". "I'm just gonna ignore her." Groans Edgar as Janet continues to glare.

Once "Circe" has given up, the phone rings once again and Edgar groans. "I'm cursed," he said. "It must be a curse." Edgar nervously lifts up the phone and it shows an image of a heavyset Frankenstein's monster giantess with lightning bolts in her black hair and electrical wires in her back. She was smiling seductively and holding out her belly. Edgar answers the phone and groans. "Fanny," he says. "How's the modeling business going. That's great. How's my big sis Sora doing? I haven't seen her in..." Before Edgar could saw another word, Janet picks up the phone and lifts it up to her mouth. "Edgar will have to call you back," she says. "He's working."

Janet then proceeds to toss Edgar's phone into her mouth and crush it between her teeth. "Hey," says Edgar. "Do you know how hard it is to find a cellphone store that caters to humans in Horrorville." "No offense Edgar," says Janet with a smirk. "But I have enough competition in camp with seven monsters." "I think you mean we have enough competition Friend Janet," says Nat. "But Fay, Fanny, Katrina, Celadon, Circe, Desiree and Dixie have an extreme disadvantage. We see Edgar everyday, so we have a better chance. Even with that stinky mouth Wade around." Skyla lets out a laugh before the girls and Edgar stop to dust off a cabin. "Man, how much do you want to bet that Wade gets himself eaten on the first day. Maybe Miranda will make lunch out of him." "Maybe you'll eat him Skyla," jokes Dolly as she applies some paint to the door. "You eat everything else."

As Dolly is saying this, Skyla is picking away at a nearby pear tree. She glares at Dolly as if she's offended. Janet places Edgar on the windowsill as Edgar tears off some cobwebs. However, he has a look on his face. "Mom sure was mad when I told her about Wade," he says to himself. "And she was even madder when she met Wade. I really hope that she doesn't do anything drastic. She looked ready to eat him alive. Well, at least it takes her mind off of my woman trouble."
1541322112.title: Monster Girls Aren't Easy

15413221122.content:
At this moment, Nadine was angrily stomping back to her hovel. "The nerve of that Wade. He was so rude to everyone. I'm not gonna let my son, or any potential daughter-in-law put up with that crook all Summer. Nadine you old girl, I think you've got an idea." Nadine lets out a cackle, revealing her hundreds of sharp tyrannosaurus like teeth as she makes her way home. On the way, she passes by another hovel where a golden skinned mock turtle with long blonde hair and the shell of snapping turtle, an enormous udder and a mole on her chin, was busy washing a window.

Another monster, an obese chimera with the head of a lioness, cobra and goat wearing a spiked iron bikini was harvesting a strange fruit from a small tree. The chimera woman turns and glares at Nadine while her mock turtle apprentice stares at Nadine and bites her lip. "Look away Dixie," says all three of the chimera giantess's heads in unison. "Ignore that eyesore." Nadine growls at the chimera. "Get off my case Tricia," she says. "I'm in a bad mood today and I don't need some second string sorceress getting in my craw." "How's that boy of yours doing Hofferson?" asks Tricia in a malicious tone. "Still single is he? At least he tastes good. Ironic, he won't die in a monster's belly, but he will die a vir..." Nadine roars at her rival. "For your information, he will marry one day and unlike you, his bride will have class. One would think a monster with three heads would have at least one brain between them." As Nadine and Tricia growl at each other, Dixie, the mock turtle giantess lowers her bovine head and secretly looks at a photograph of Edgar in her cleavage with a lustful look.

Once Nadine is done arguing with Tricia, she returns to her hovel to find Fay washing dishes and Fay looks in surprise. "Oh, Mistress, you're back. How was the camp?" "Dirty," says Nadine. "The new counselor they hired is atrocious. But I'll fix him. Fay looks in confusion as Nadine holds up her cane and makes the eyes on the head decoration glow. Nadine draws a magic circle in the floor before she begins to cast a spell.

"Through the sounds of flames and thunder, take the power sent asunder, like an earthquake on a roll, I'm the witch who's in control. A human named Wade has been quite brash, but I'm the one who'll laugh the last. He sees all monsters as a disgrace, so let's give him a change of face. Twelve titanesses west and east, when morning comes, man turns to beast." Nadine cackles as the magic circle lights up and sends magical energy in the air.

The next day in Odile's cabin where Wade was staying, the ogopogo giantess was still fast asleep. Wade however was just getting up. He lets out a yawn and gets up from the window he was sleeping in. "And today marks the first day as babysitter to monster brats. No thanks. Huh?" Wade looks closer into the window and as he sees his reflection, he lets out a loud scream that wakes up all the other counselors.

Nadine had cast a spell on him and transformed him into a human sized...
15413221122.title: Don't Mess with a Witch

154132211222.content: If not a gargoyle, how about turning Wade into a werewolf?
154132211222.title: Something Else

1541322112221.content:
Wade looks and see that he's been transformed into a light gray furred werewolf with pure white hair and gold eyes. His resulting scream was so loud that Odile leaps out of bed and hits her head on the ceiling of her cabin. The ogopogo mutters to herself and rubs her head.

It isn't long before several of the other counselors, including Kaylee, barge in. Kaylee is the first to enter and is wearing hair curlers as she gives an angry look. "What the Sam Hill is going on in here? It's only five in the morning Next, Miranda walks in half asleep with Edgar on her shoulders still wearing his pajamas. Edgar lets out a yawn and then finally notices Wade and wakes right up. Janet comes in and gasps. "Is that Wade?" she asks. "Of course it's me you dumb tomato!" yells Wade rudely. "More importantly, what happened to me?!"

"Oh no," groans Edgar. "Looks like Mom's been playing with magic again." "What?!" yells Wade. "Oh," says Heloise as she wipes off her facial mask and walks in. "Didn't you know. Edgar's mom is a witch. She must've put a curse on you after you acted like such an ass to her face." "Language!" yells Kaylee. Wade is now so mad that he drives his new claws into a window.

Miranda being a werewolf doesn't see the big deal. "Personally," she says. "You've never looked better. Not that I'd be interested. I already have a girlfriend." "Yeah," says Edgar under his breath. "My ex." Wade climbs down from the windowsill and angrily growls as he walks forward. "That old bag!" he says. "I'm gonna..." Before Wade can say another word, he starts to scratch himself. Miranda puts Edgar on the ground and Edgar walks up to the human sized werewolf before picking off an unusually large flea. "Yikes," says Edgar. "Mom went all out this time." "That hag gave me fleas?!" yells Wade. "Why I oughta..." "Fleas?!" yells Kaylee. "Martha! Do you have any flea repellant in your office?"

Martha's eyes actually pop before she slaps herself in the face. "Aw man, that's the one thing I forgot." "Edgar," says Kaylee. "I want you to take that mutt..." Before Kaylee can finish that sentence, both Heloise and Miranda growl at her. "Uh," says the qilin nervously. "That is to say, Wade, to your mother's hovel and get her to make a potion that will kill those blasted fleas. Do you have any idea how many furry monsters come to this camp?" Edgar nods his head but Wade angrily storms off as he growls. "Just wait until I get my hands on that old witch."

Edgar runs after Wade before the two of them are nearing the outskirts of the camp. Odile rubs her head in pain and mutters to herself. "I'm okay," she says sarcastically. "Thanks for asking." "Should one of us go with them?" asks Miranda. "Edgar is immortal but as for Wade..." "No," says Kaylee. "We only have three hours until the campers arrive and with the humans going to Nadine's place, we only have twelve counselors. Say what you want about Elisa but if she hadn't started work yesterday, we'd be in big trouble if Robyn showed up and saw us understaffed. Besides, I doubt that Wade will survive out there, very highly." Martha lets out a scoff. "I bet my shell that warden sent him here just to get rid of him."

Meanwhile, Wade is stomping out of camp as he growls in his new werewolf body as Edgar follows. "Get lost monster lover." Says Wade. Edgar lets out a grunt. "Dude, lighten up. That attitude has caused you nothing but trouble so far." Wade just growls and shows his fangs. Edgar rolls his eyes before the two of them keep walking. "Listen Wade. This mountainside is extremely dangerous for people our size. There are Midgard serpents, giant insects..." Before Edgar could continue he hears his cell phone ring. In case anyone asks, he keeps a spare.

Edgar takes out the phone and it shows the image of a great white landshark girl who was very pear shaped, almost as much as Janet and had long flowing orange hair. "Huh," says Edgar. "Lucy's up early. I'll just let it ring." Edgar puts away the phone and he and Wade continue walking. Once they're out of the campgrounds and on the trail to Nadine's house, Edgar's phone rings again and Wade growls as he grabs his pointed ears. Edgar looks at the caller ID and it shows an image of the wendigo girl Desiree. Like with Lucy, Edgar chooses to ignore it.

Edgar and Wade just about reach a large sign when the phone rings again and Wade gets more annoyed than ever. "Dammit! Again with that stupid phone!" Edgar looks at the caller I.D. and it's that wereboar Circe again. He lets out a sigh. "Circe," he says. "I'm gonna have to call you back." Wade glares at Edgar. "More dumb monster chicks?" "What?" asks Edgar. "I'm popular. They're all real friendly. Even the carnivorous ones." Wade just sticks out his tongue. "That's disgusting. How many of those stupid fangirls do you have." "16." "Huh, you have enough for a harem... if they weren't BUTT UGLY FREAKS OF NATURE!"

Edgar shakes his head. "I feel very sorry for that poor warden." Wade starts to walk forward but Edgar grabs him by the shoulder. "That's not a good idea Wade," he says. "That way leads to Skellington Lake. That's where Wanda the vampiress goes fishing." "So?" "Wanda loves to chomp humans," says Edgar. "Them and fish are her favorite food. If she sees you, she'll use you as bait, reel in a big fish, eat the fish and then eat you." Wade grunts and then tries to walk the other way. "I'd advise against that path too. That way leads to Tricia's place."

"Tricia?" "She's a nasty three-headed chimera and my mom's worst enemy. She hates people who trespass in her garden." "So she's a witch too?" asks Wade. "Maybe I can find a cure from one of the fatass's spell books." Wade pushes Edgar and lets out a growl. "Stay out of my way Mama's boy." With that, the human turned miniature werewolf walks off...
1541322112221.title: Wade the Werewolf

choices: Wanda Hears Wade and Catches Him
15413221122211.content:
"Bah," scoffs Wade. "I've got a score to settle with that dragon witch." Wade walks towards the lake and Edgar gets up and tries to warn him of Wanda. "I wouldn't go that way if I were you. What if Wanda sees you." "I'm not human right now dumbass!" yells Wade. "I highly doubt fang face would eat a werewolf." "Wanda hates werewolves," warns Edgar. "You'd be no better off."

Wade just gives Edgar the finger and runs off on all fours. "You ain't the boss of me Mama's boy," he says. "You're just as bad as Demona back in Under Gloom." Wade actually raises an eye in confusion. "What's a Demona?" he asks.

Wade continues to run as he passes a bright bluish green lake. Inside the lake are all forms of monstrous looking fish. One of the fish even has three eyes and another had two maws. Wade takes a look at a pink urchin swimming down the water and sticks out his tongue. "That stuff would make some real ugly sushi. Now, I wonder where that old bag lives. She'll pay for hexing me."

That's when Wade stops in his tracks and his tail sticks up straight. A large shadow is cast above and Wade looks up to see a large heavyset vampiress with hot pink skin. The vampire giantess had huge E-cup breasts and black hair worn in an oversized ponytail with bright pink highlights. She wore a reddish pink Gothic Lolita outfit with pink stockings, high heeled boots and a white skirt. Lastly there was a red heart shaped monocle over her left eye. She was carrying a black umbrella, obviously to protect herself from the sun which would no doubt kill her on contact. What was really strange was that her feet weren't even touching the ground. She was levitating.

"Crap." Mutters Wade. This was obviously the fisher Wanda that Edgar warned him about given that she had a fishing rod in the other hand and was holding a tackle box under her arm. However, she didn't seem to notice him yet. Instead Wanda smiles and licks her fangs as she floats above. "That camp opens today," she says in a Transylvanian accent. "I wonder if I'll see that delectable Edgar today. If there's anything yummier than fresh fish, it's fresh human filling. His blood tastes sweeter every time I chew him to bits. The best part is he's the one human I can chomp more than once."

Wade lets out a sigh. "That stupid vampire didn't even see me," he says. "Maybe if she's too busy looking for that mama's boy, I can sneak past her. I hope that wet blanket gets munched but good." Wade sneaks underneath Wanda, only to look up and gag as he looks at a pair of black panties covered with pink bats. But he couldn't think of that now since he had to get past the vampiress to get to Nadine's place.

But does he make it?
15413221122211.title: Vampiress of the Lake

15413221122212.content:
Wade starts heading toward Tricia's place with Edgar not too far behind. "I really don't think we should be doing this. Tricia can be very nasty when she finds trespassers." Edgar warns. "Then I just won't get caught, so stay out of my way." Wade says while he continue to walk. They walk a little more with Edgar still trying to convince Wade to turn back. Eventually Wade turns on him with his teeth bared. "Listen, I'm going and you can't stop me. So leave me alone or I'll actually use these stupid things." he says loudly as he brandishes his claws. Edgar shakes his head with a sigh and turns to leave. He doesn't want to get caught by Tricia and he can't stop Wade, so his best bet is to just go. "Don't say i didn't warn you." he mutters. Before he can leave though a booming sound approaches. "Uh oh." Edgar says.

The booming gets closer and closer until two huge paws come into view. Tricia is coming! Looking around Edgar realizes that they're in her garden. He prepares for the worst but Tricia stops at a nearby plant and begins tending to it. Thankful that she's only doing some gardening he tries to sneak away. Looking over his shoulder he sees Wade heading in the opposite direction, toward her house. Edgar shakes his head and keeps going, but is stopped by the massive chimera. She steps over him to get to another plant, and is now directly in his way. He holds his breath in shock and tries to find somewhere to hide. Tricia hates trespassers, but it would be especially bad for him since she hates his mother. He quietly sneaks away, trying to keep his distance from the giant chimera.

Unfortunately he hears a sniffing sound and looks up. Tricia's lioness head is sniffing around and eventually zeroes in on him. She growls at him causing the other two heads to look his way. "You!" they all say at once. Edgar takes off running but Tricia catches him easily. She simply brings her hand down and swats him into the ground. Inspecting her palm she sees the remains of the human reform and return to life. "I knew it was you. You're lucky your mother made you immortal." she says. Edgar gets his bearings and looks into Tricia's three faces. "Please, I can explain." he says, but she won't hear it. "I don't care, you were in my garden. I'll deal with you how I want, and then maybe I'll send you back to your hack of a mother. Just be thankful you won't die." she says. She walks to her house and places Edgar inside a jar. She bends down so she's eye level with him to gloat, but her lioness head suddenly sniffs again. The cobra head sticks its tongue out as well. "It seems there's one more intruder around here." Tricia says. "I'll find him and punish you both." You assume she just smelled Wade running around. After a little while someone walks over. Who is it?
15413221122212.title: Towards Tricia's Hovel

1542.content:
Destiny stares down at you and you pray that she believes you. However, Destiny just lets out a scoff. "You'll prove it huh? Yeah right! I'd sooner trust Loki than you. I know a liar when I see one. You must think that I'm a complete idiot! Forget it! You're staying right where you are and for every escape attempt, you'll add more time to your sentence. I better not catch you trying anything funny today, or mark my words, Wilson, you're gonna regret it." Destiny even gestures that she's watching you and then walks away.

"Shit!" you yell. "That damn gargoyle saw right through my act." Lockette lets out a yawn as she stretches her neck up. "Well," says the Loch Ness monster giantess. "At least you tried a less provocative method of trying to escape for once." You stomp your fault. "I swear," you say. "If it's the last thing I do I'll get my revenge on that Demona! I'll never be able to escape with her big blue butt on my back all the time." "Wade," says Lockette. "Didn't Destiny warn you that she'd boil you alive if she heard you calling her "Demona" again. She's getting really sick of that nickname." "Well it's her fault for looking the way she does. All she needs is that stupid tiara. Damn! I've got to find a way to get past that bitch. Every time I've tried to escape, she's shot my attempt down. Just yesterday she ruined my rocket to the moon plan." "You tried to build a rocket out of a beer bottle. Boy did Destiny chew that guard on Level 1 out for sneaking booze into Under Gloom." You then bang your head against a bar. "If only there was some way I could get back at Destiny for all the hell she's given me."

As you're trying to think, you hear wheels moving. It was the day of the week where one of the guards brought books to the prisoners. Not that you were interested in anything. This week it was Icy's turn and she wheeled the cart in as Lockette looked at the choice of books. "Hmm, which of these looks interesting, Wade." You let out a scoff. "You're an idiot, Lockette. Wasting time reading instead of trying to bust out." Lockette browsed through the books. "Hmm," she said. "Don't you have any new Cadence Deadman books? Or anything by Olga Rowling?" You roll your eyes but then you notice something and climb up Lockette's tail and slide down her neck and see one book in particular that stands out. It was a dusty book wrapped in mummy gauze with an angry face on the spine. The spine read "The Catalog of 1000 Curses". "Lockette!" you yell. "That book over there!" Lockette noticed the Catalog and realized something. "How did that book get in..." "Who cares!?" Lockette shrugs her shoulder and takes out the book.

Lockette then holds up the book and blows off the dust as Icy leaves. In the process, Icy unknowingly drops her cellphone. Lockette looks through the book and is shocked. "Oh my gosh," she said. "This is a magic catalog. It says here that all you must do is call the number on the first page and tell them the curse you want cast on your enemy." You give a smirk. You look in to see that there are some particularly nasty curses in this book. "This is perfect," you say. "Perfect." Lockette just raises an eyebrow. "There's just one problem? We don't have a phone." You then notice Icy's phone on the ground. "Icy dropped her phone!" you yell. "Grab it you reptilian cretin!" Lockette let out a sigh. "He treats me like a dog," she thinks to herself. "But he's the one who barks."

Lockette grabs the phone with her tail and pulls it into her cell. "Game over, Destiny," you say wickedly. "It's time for revenge. But which curse." "I don't know Wade. A lot of these curses are nasty. First there's Curse #29: Yo Mama. The target of this curse for every time they hear a joke beginning with "Yo Mama So Stupid", the target will perform the action mentioned in the joke and progressively get stupider. Note: This curse only works if the target is indeed a mother." You let out a laugh. "Perfect. Destiny's a mother."

"Wait, Wade, there's more curses. Such as Curse #10: Junk in the Trunk. This curse will cause the target's rear end to rapidly expand and become larger." That sounded good to you too. Which curse sounded better?
1542.title: Magic Catalog

15421.content:
You think your options and then smirk. "I think I prefer the Yo Mama curse," you say. "If Destiny was stupider than she already is, then escaping will be a walk in the park." Lockette gives a look of concern. "I'm not sure about that, Wade," said the Loch Ness Monster giantess. "Do you really think draining Destiny's intelligence is such a good idea." You give a glare. "Do it," you say. "Raise that phone up here." Lockette let out a sigh and dialed the phone before holding it up to your level. There is a slight ringing and then you hear a female voice. "Catalog of 1000 Curses. How may I help you?" You give an evil smirk. "There's a curse that I want placed on Warden Destiny Sirtis of Under Gloom. Give me Curse #29." Lockette shakes her head. "This doesn't sound free to me," she thinks to herself. "I wonder..."

At that moment, Destiny was walking down the hall. "Wade's escape attempts aren't nearly as offensive as the credit he's giving my intelligence," says Destiny. "If he thinks that I'm going to believe ay of his lies, he has another thing coming." Destiny then hears a growl and realizes that it's coming from Cree who is walking down the hall. "Eyes open as always, Cree," said Destiny. "No prisoner with any common sense would break free with a brute like you walking the halls." However, Destiny notices that Cree is in a bad mood for some reason. "What's the matter, Cree?" Cree let out a growl. "It's that idiot sister of mine." Destiny rolls her eyes. "Don't get me started," she says. "Fortuna drives me crazy."

Cree grit her teeth. "Easy for you to say. Summer called earlier this morning for whatever reason and..." "Why did she call you so early?" "I don't know," says Cree. "I didn't get to answer the phone. Aurelia beat me to it and as usual, Summer became enraged." Destiny rolled her eyes at that thought. "Your wife and your sister just can't seem to get along. Sure, I'm not much for that brother-in-law of mine but with Aurelia and Summer, it's all out war. What exactly happened?" Cree let out a sigh. "Summer said something really nasty about Aurelia's mother. She told her, "Yo Mama So Stupid...."
15421.title: Yo Mama

154211.content:
"Yo Mama so stupid, she tried to use her car keys to get into her house." Destiny shook her head. "Your sister is a real comedian, Cree," she says sarcastically. "Now get back to work. I'm not paying you to make joke." Destiny scoffed as she walked away. Then she heard snickering and then turned to face you in your cell. She then glares at you. "What are you laughing at Wade?" "I'm laughing at a big dumb blueberry-skinned creep." Destiny makes her eyes glow bright red. "I knew it, you didn't reform after all. You're lucky I have bigger fish to fry." With that Destiny walks away as Lockette lets out a groan. "What are you worried about?" you ask. "It could take years before she finds out about this curse.

- - - - - - - - - - -

Later that day, Destiny is flying home. "I wish my car wasn't in the shop. I told Fate I didn't want Beth to drive it. Why does my daughter have such an idiot for a friend." Destiny lands in front of her house and tries to unlock the door, but the lock doesn't budge. Destiny gets slightly annoyed and tries the same key again. It still doesn't work. "Come on you stupid lazy piece of crap metal!" yells the gargoyle growing more and more impatient. What Destiny doesn't realize is that she's trying to use the key used to turn on her car in an attempt to unlock her front door. Destiny soon becomes too enraged to speak as she keeps trying the key.

"I am going to melt you down and make you into...!" Destiny then sees that the car is her car key and groaned before she used the correct key to unlock her door. "Idiot keys!" she yells. Destiny lets out a sigh as she takes off her shirt. "What a day. I need a drink." Destiny then walks into the kitchen and rubs her head. "Now, where do I keep the drinks again?" Destiny looks into the oven and then into the bread basket before she remembers the fridge and opens it to grab a bottle of soda. However, she forgets to take the cap off and then she realizes this before going in to get a bottle opener. As Destiny is rooting around, she hears shouting coming from next door.

Destiny lets out a growl. "It's those idiot neighbors again. Those Grundies argue so much it's a wonder how they got married in the first place. Hey Paige! Shut the hell up before I throw you in prison for disturbing the peace!" "Stay out of this you a-hole!" yells a female voice from next door. "I'm an a-hole!?" asks Destiny. "At least I have a job." "Then why do you eat microwave pizza all the time." "I live alone and don't have to cook for anyone else! What's your excuse?!" "You're just a big blue bag of hot air!" "At least my mother raised me right!" "Yo mama so stupid..."
154211.title: A Stupid Destiny

1542111.content:
"...When she heard it was chilly outside, she ran and got a bowl!" Paige yelled, then began laughing. Destiny just growled and shut the window.

"One of these days..." Destiny muttered. Just then, she heard the door open. She turned and saw Fate walk in.

"Oh, hey Fate." Destiny said. "You're home early."

"Work got out early today. Tim spilled a potion on Aurelia that made her ass gigantic and sent her crashing through 4 floors, so no work until the floors are fixed." Fate said, not looking up at Destiny. "Geez, it's chilly out. I thought the weatherman said it would be warm today. Eh, guess you can't-"

Fate was cut off by the sound of the door slamming. Confused, she opened it again and walked out. To her confusion, she saw Destiny standing in the walkway, bowl in hand, looking around.

"Mom? What are you doing?" Fate asked.

"You said there was chili out here." Destiny replied.

"No, chilly as in low temperature." Fate said, eyebrow raised.

Oh." Destiny said, a little embarrased. She looked and saw a werecow staring at her confused, so she raced back in. Fate followed.
-----------------------------
An hour later, Fate heard her mom yell. She went into the living room to see Destiny on the couch, fiddling with something.

"Fate! The damn remote's broken. None of the buttons work!" She yelled.

"Mom, that's the phone." Fate said.

Destiny looked closer. Sure enough, it was the phone. She set it on the table. "Then where's the remote?" She asked.

Fate looked at her mom, then at the couch. She saw half of the remote under her mom's ass. "You're sitting on it."

Destiny pulled the remote out. "Oh."

"Are you ok mom?" Fate asked.

"I'm fine." Destiny replied, turning on the TV. Two rappers showed up on screen.

"Oh yeah?" One of the rappers said. "Well, Yo Mama so Stupid..."
1542111.title: Chill Out (bad pun, sorry)

15421111.content:
“... when she makes sponge cake, she uses actual sponges!” Destiny turns off the television and lets out a groan. “Ugh. What trash. No wonder people think TV makes you stupid. Enough for now, I’m hungry.” Fate smiled and nodded her head. “I’ll start dinner. It’s about time that you ate something that takes more than a minute to prepare.” Destiny lets out a sigh. “Alright. But I’m preparing dessert.” Fate and Destiny entered the kitchen and then Fate gets to work chopping up a swordfish. She then sniffed the fish and poured some alcohol onto it. In the background, Destiny was rooting through the lazy Susan.

“You know, Mom,” says Fate. “I’ve noticed that you seem extra stressed lately. Is Wade bothering you again.” Destiny let out a scoff. “Don’t get me started on Wade, Fate. That idiot actually tried to convince me that he had gone straight and learned his lesson. I’d have to be a complete idiot to believe anything that comes out of his lying mouth.” “I don’t know why you put up with him,” said Fate as she continued to stir the seafood bisque. “If he causes you that much stress, why don’t you just feed him to one of your more unpleasant inmates.” Destiny lets out a scoff as she puts some flower on the table. “Why don’t I do that?” she asked sarcastically. “Because I’m an idiot! That’s why!” Fate just rolls her eyes. “All that stress isn’t good for you. I wonder how Aurelia’s doing. I’ll bet that Cree’s gonna be surprised.” Fate laughed at that comment.

Of course, Fate wasn’t laughing at dinner time because Destiny repeatedly tried to eat her soup with a knife and was becoming increasingly frustrated as she kept trying. “Uh,” said Fate. “Not to sound preachy, Mom, but shouldn’t you be trying to use a spoon? I’d say it would be easier.” Destiny realized her mistake and grumbled but instead of heeding her daughter's advise, she simply put the bowl to her face and drank it. Fate rolled her eyes and ate her own dinner.

After dinner, Destiny brought out a sponge cake for dessert and cut Fate a slice. "Thanks, Mom. Man, this is going to taste so good." Fate took the first bite of cake and then her eyes popped out of her head as she gagged. "Ugh! Gross!" Fate coughed and spat up bits of yellow kitchen sponge. Fate then picked up one of the pieces and gagged. "Mom," she said. "Did you use actual sponges for the cake?" Destiny looked at the inside of the rest of the cake and gasped. She reached in and even pulled out some steel wool. "Good grief!" she yelled. Fate made a face of disgust. "That is so nasty. Did you use these things to clean the kitchen or the bathroom?" Fate then choked slightly, reached into her mouth and pulled out a pair of brown shorts. "I don't even want to know why these were in there. Mom, are you alright?" Destiny slapped herself in the face. "I don't know, Fate. What possessed me to do such a stupid thing."

There was then a knock on the door and Destiny went to answer it but she tried to push on the door rather than pulling it and was grunting as she tried in vain to open it. Fate let out a sigh. "Uh, Mom. You're doing it wrong." Destiny grumbled and then opened the door. Into the house walked Fate's friend and coworker, Beth Forte. Beth was a type of hippopotamus-like monster called a behemoth. She was 1000ft tall like Fate and Destiny and had tan yellow skin with long light brown hair and was just as fat as Fate was, though that had more to do with Beth's species. At that moment, Beth was wearing a black t-shirt and red jacket along with a tight pair of jeans that and a belt that did nothing to hide the skull tattoo on one of her butt cheeks.

"Hey, Fate," said Beth. "I was in the neighborhood and thought I'd stop by." "Hi, Beth." Said Fate with a sigh. Beth spotted the cake on the table and licked her lips. "That looks good." Beth picked up the whole cake and was about to bite into it when Fate stopped her. "Don't eat that! It's not edible!" Beth put the cake down and then saw Destiny get out a broom as she grunted. "You could've at least wiped your feet before you walked in, Beth." Destiny grumbled and tried to sweep the dirt but was holding the broom upside down to the concern of her daughter and Beth.

Beth couldn’t help but stare at Destiny. “Fate,” says Beth. “Is your mom feeling okay?” Fate scratched her head. “She has been acting weird today. She went outside with a bowl looking for chili, tried to change the channels with the phone and then she made a spongecake using actual kitchen sponges.” Beth then spotted Destiny using soda to water a potted plant. “I see,” said the hippopotamus-like giantess. “Fate, did you hear that stress destroys brain cells? I think that dealing with Wade all day is making your mom dumber.” Suddenly, the lightbulb burnt out. Destiny let out a grumble and then took out a package of batteries as she tried to stick them in the socket.

"Uh," said Fate. "Mom, I think you should take a few days off." "I'm not ain't isn't stupid, Fate!" said Destiny. "Wade ain't the boss of me, I'm the boss of him! I can work all 32 hours a day if I has to!" Fate was now more concerned than ever and she and Beth each took Destiny by the hand. "Let go of me," said Destiny. "I'm ferfectly pine." "We're taking you to a doctor, Mom," said Fate. "You're stressed out." Beth let out a sigh. "I never have these issues with my mother." Beth and Fate come to a traffic light that reads "Don't Walk" and had to wait as they were taking Destiny to the hospital. Beth then spotted a vending machine. "I'm going to get us some drinks."

Beth waddled to the vending machine and bought three bottles of a drink labeled Polter Cola." Of course, immediately afterwards a rather nasty looking gremlin came up and saw the machine empty. "Hey fatso!" he yelled at Beth. "What's the idea taking the last bottle of Polter Cola in the machine?!" "Chill out," said Beth. "Just get a bottle of Orange Crash or something. I was just buying drinks for me and my friends." "Butt cheeks don't count as friends you obese pachyderm!" "Bitter attitude," said Beth. "It's people like you who are ruining society." "It's mothers like yours that are ruining society."

Beth then loses her temper and puts the bottles of soda into her cleavage before looking down at her antagonist. "What did you say?!" she asked angrily. "You heard me, lard butt. Yo mama so stupid..."
15421111.title: The Cake is a Lie

154211111.content:
"... She accused her reflection of identity theft!" Beth gives a snort of rage. "Let me tell you something, pipsqueak," says the behemoth angrily. "You're the idiot if you think you can pick a fight with a werehippo, a bahamut or a behemoth like me and get away with it!" Beth then proceeded to deck the insulting gremlin and sent him down the street.

Fate gives a glare at Beth. "Geez, Beth," she says. "I already have one crank to worry about today." Destiny's eyes glow bright red. "I am not a crank!" Fate then slapped herself in the face. "Good grief, maybe I'm the stupid one. Come on, Mom." Fate flaps her wings and has to tug her mother into the air with her talons as they both flew over the traffic. Beth gives a groan as she has to wait for the sign to change. "It must be nice to have wings.”

Fate and Destiny arrive outside the Fearfield hospital as Destiny crosses her arms. “Wait right here, Mom,” says Fate. “I’m going to check you in.” Destiny grunted and Fate walked to the front desk to speak with the Cat Sith receptionist. “I’d like to check in my mother,” said Fate. “Destiny T. Sirtis. I don’t know what’s wrong with her but I think she’s literally losing her mind.” Fate then heard Destiny scream in anger. “I want this gargoyle arrested!” Fate immediately goes up to her mother who is staring angrily at her reflection in the window.

 Fate gives a look of surprise as Destiny continues to argue with her reflection. “You have a lot of nerve trying to impersonificate a prisoner warden like me! Stop repeating everything I say! I’m warning you!” Out of rage, Destiny punches the window and yells in pain as she cuts herself on the broken glass. “Fate! She scratched me!” But Fate was trying to wrap her head around the fact that Destiny had once again did the very stupid thing somebody described.

It wasn’t long before Destiny’s arm was bandaged and both mother and daughter gargoyles were waiting in a room for the doctors. “Dr. Coward, Dr. Spine, Dr. Coward.” Says a voice over the intercom. Beth finally arrives and gives Fate and Destiny their sodas.
