Lockette gives a gulp as she holds up the phone and dials it. You walk up to the phone and smirk. "I'll take Curse #107. Place it on Destiny Sirtis. It's payback time."

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

At that time, Belladonna is sitting in Destiny's chair in Destiny's office and was drawing on a sketchpad while speaking on her own phone. "I'll be warden any day. Destiny ain't getting any younger, that's for sure." As Belladonna laughed to herself, she was sketching a rather unflattering drawing of Destiny that appeared to be drawing her as a cross between a gargoyle and a cow. "Everyone on the outside is afraid of her. Can you believe it. I work with her everyday and I know for a fact that Destiny is nothing more than a complete and utter..." "A complete and utter what?" asks a confused voice.

Belladonna stops and then looks in horror as Destiny enters the office. Normally Destiny would be triggered at Belladonna sitting in her chair and insulting her, but instead the gargoyle giantess had a goofy smile on her face. Belladonna gasped and fell back. She turned and saw the sketchpad on the floor with the unflattering drawing of Destiny as Destiny calmly helped Belladonna up. She then held up the sketchpad and surprisingly she wasn't insulted in the least. "That's quite an interesting drawing, Belladonna. Perhaps you should paint." Belladonna is understandably baffled.

"Are you feeling okay?" Destiny just gives a smile and shrugs her shoulders. "I'm feeling good. It's a wonderful day." Belladonna drops her jaw and swings her tail, accidentally knocking an entire pot of hot coffee all over Destiny. Belladonna gasped and recoiled, expecting Destiny to clobber her like she normally does for her transgressions. However, Destiny still was as calm as ever and left her office peacefully, leaving Belladonna very afraid. "What is wrong with you?" asks Belladonna. Destiny just raises a horned brow in confusion and shrugs her shoulders. Belladonna then rubs her chin.

"Hey, Destiny," says Belladonna. "Isn't that annoying sister of yours coming over. And her husband." "I know," says Destiny calmly. "I hope everything is in place back home." Belladonna then bit her lip. "By the way. That gargoyle guy who works at the donut shop. The red one with the beak. I saw him wink at Fate the other day." "Oh, good," says Destiny. "I'd say that Fate's old enough to date by now." Belladonna's jaw drops in surprise. "Are you ****ing drunk!?"

Destiny just taps Belladonna on the head. "I never noticed before, Belladonna, but you seem stressed out. Maybe you need a vacation." Belladonna just grabs Destiny's arm and starts to forcibly pull her to the doctor's office.
1542322331.title: Anger Away

15423223312.content:
Belladonna took Destiny to see the prison doctor. The Doctor was an 800ft tall living mannequin with skin made of red plastic, blonde nylon hair and green eyes. The Doctor had put her stethoscope to Destiny who at this point was so calm that she had a rather loopy look on her face. The Doctor shifted her head and spun it around a few times before speaking to Belladonna. "There don't seem to be a bloody thing wrong with the old girl." "Nothing wrong?!" yells Belladonna. "She won't get mad no matter what." "And at's a problem, how?" asks the Doctor. Belladonna just stomps her foot on the ground. "I'm serious! This is Destiny Troi Sirtis! She can't go a single day without getting pissed off at something going on around here! Can't you check her blood pressure or perhaps run a urine test or something?! This isn't healthy." "Well I says she's as fit as a fiddle." "And I say she's a sick puppy!" yells Belladonna in retort. "I don't feel like a sick puppy." Says Destiny. "Shut up!" yells Belladonna.

It isn't long before Belladonna is walking Destiny through the hallway. "That wooden quack doesn't know what she's talking about." "Please leave the Doctor alone, Belladonna," says Destiny. "She said that I was fine and I trust her 100%. Although I worry about you. You're acting unusually short-tempered today." Belladonna grits her hundreds of teeth. "What the heck is going on?" asks Belladonna to herself. "Has she got Sunshine Banjo Face disease or something? Destiny's acting so sweet my teeth hurt." Suddenly Destiny gives a grunt. Somebody had tossed a plate at her head. Belladonna gasped and turned to see a rather rude looking female prisoner. She was a wereboar girl with tanned skin, long tusks and black hair that was worn in an Asian bun. "Excuse me," said the wereboar inmate. "What kind of cheap prisoner are you running here? The eggs were upside down." Destiny didn't even respond to the heckling. "Hello! Are you like, totally deaf or something?" Destiny still didn't respond. "I heard you perfectly well the first time. I"m sorry, but that's beyond my control. I'm not the cook." The boar woman stuck her tongue out but surprisingly it was Belladonna that was upset and then grabbed the girl by the tongue and made her squeal.

"Listen here you annoying waste of space!" yells Belladonna. "It's your own fault for being here for kidnapping that pop star. Destiny is the warden and you will treat her with respect or I'll make you eat your own nose!" Destiny had to pull Belladonna away. "Belladonna," she says calmly. "Might I recommend anger management." Belladonna just screamed into her chest in frustration. The fact that Destiny couldn't get enraged ironically pissed Belladonna off. Suddenly, there was loud yelling. "You're a rotten sneak! I don't drink! That wasn't even my beer!" "Then what was it doing in your lunchbox. Besides, that's payback for last week." "I oughta brain you, you stupid dog!" "I'm not a stupid dog! I'm not even a dog! Hyenas aren't dogs!" Belladonna recognized the yelling as Clover and Cree in the middle of an argument. "Not those two again." Grumbled Belladonna. Destiny walked right down the hall to see Clover and Cree ready to clobber each other. "Hold on you two," said Destiny. "Hug it out. Don't slug it out." Clover and Cree turned and looked at the warden in surprise. "What appears to be the problem?" asks Destiny calmly. "Cree told Belladonna I was drunk because she saw me throwing away a beer bottle that wasn't even mine." "And last week, hose nose told the rest of the guards I had fleas." Destiny just gave a chuckle. "I'm sure it's just a big misunderstanding. We're all friends here so I expect you to act like it." Both Cree and Clover were understandably okay. "Are you feeling alright, Boss?" asks Clover.

Several inmates saw what was going on and were surprised. "What's wrong with the warden?" "Have you ever seen Destiny smile?" "Not like that. Last time she smiled, there was a scowl on her face as ell." "I think she's lost her marbles." "Maybe Wade finally drove her over the edge." "Hey, Demona! Nice hair! I can only see one gray light!" Destiny didn't even respond and it made Belladonna's eye twitch. "Destiny! Priscilla just called you "Demona"!" Destiny shrugged her shoulders. "To be fair, I do look a lot like her." This act of OOC caused Belladonna to struggle to close her jaw again. Cree and Clover were both surprised. "Belladonna," said Clover. "Can I go home early today? I think that megalosaurus sandwich I had for lunch went bad." Belladonna was at this point spewing like an angry cat and even started to rip up and eat her own shirt. Belladonna saw Aria floating by and then grabbed her by the shirt. "Aria," says Belladonna. "I need you to cover for both of us. Something is seriously wrong with the warden."

Belladonna soon is in her car driving Destiny into town. Belladonna's car was a car that resembled the Thundertank, except with skeletal designs on it. "Destiny," said Belladonna. "You're obviously not in your right state of mind." Destiny just continued to smile goofily. "I appreciate the concern, Don-Don," she says. "But you're worrying over nothing." "Don-Don?!" yells Belladonna in anger and surprise. Belladonna let out a yell as she honked the horn on her car. As Belladonna comes to a four way intersection, who should she see walking down the street but...
15423223312.title: The Diagnosis

154232233121.content:
Down the street was Destiny's daughter, Fate Sirtis. Fate was the same height as Destiny but in contrast to Destiny, she was somewhat on the heavy side. Ironically, Fate resembled Angela in the same way that Destiny resembled Demona. Fate worked as the night security guard at the Daily Tombstone, however, the editor asked Fate to take a few nights off as they were breaking in a new guard and Fate was at that moment apparently walking from the grocery store given the bag in her hand and was wearing a white loincloth and tank top.

As Belladonna spotted Fate, she drove the car right to the side of the street and parked, to the younger gargoyle's surprise. "Belladonna?" asks Fate. Destiny notices Fate and smiles. "Hi, Sweetie," she said. "How's work been doing." "Shut up," says Belladonna. "I'll talk to Fate, thank you very much." Belladonna drags Fate into the other side of the corner to explain the problem to Fate as Destiny turns on the radio in Belladonna's car.

"Fate," says Belladonna. "There's something seriously wrong with your mom. No matter what happens, she won't get mad." Fate blinks. "Isn't it a good thing that she's started to control her nasty temper?" "Are you kidding me!? What is wrong with your family!? Don't you see that this is completely unnatural. Priscilla called her the D-word and she didn't even get mildly annoyed." Fate was slightly concerned at that. "O-kay." She said. Belladonna let out a sigh. "Come on," she said. "I'll give you a ride home." Fate nodded her head and got into the back seat of the car where she put down her groceries. She saw Destiny's goofy smile in the mirror and gave a look of surprise.

"Mom?" asks Fate. "Is everything alright?" Destiny gave a slight giggle. "Oh, everything's fine, Fate. Don't worry. Did you hear that your Aunt Fortuna and her family are in town." Fate let out a scoff. "Uh, yeah. They're staying with me. And I'll bet right now she's already been messing with my curtains." "Mind your aunt, Fate," says Destiny. "By the way, how is that husband of hers doing?" "Since when do you care what goes on with Uncle David?" asks Fate with suspicion in her voice. Destiny shrugs her shoulders as Belladonna drives the car. "I'll admit, I've had my differences with my brother-in-law, but he's still family." Fate then scratches her double-chin before Destiny says something that really makes her worried.

"By the way, Fate. Aren't you at the age when you should be married? Belladonna told me about a nice sounding boy who works at the donut shop." Fate's jaw drops and she has a look of pure shock on her face. "Mom," she says. "You are definitely not well." Destiny gives a chuckle. "Oh," says the blue gargoyle giantess. "No need to worry Sweet Pea. The Doctor gave me a clean bill of health." Fate however, isn't so sure and takes her cell phone out of her cleavage to call somebody.

Fate had contacted Destiny's old friend, Whitney Steranko, a giant albino redheaded wererhinoceros who worked as the head nurse at the K.D.P., a mental hospital. At that moment, it was Whitney's day off and she was eating a pizza with her human husband Xander who was sitting on her shoulder. Fate explained the situation to Whitney who was confused. "What was that?" asks the were rhino as she bites into a slice of pizza. "It's like I said, Mrs. Steranko," says Fate. "Mom isn't getting mad no matter what. She even said that I should get married. Mom hates men, she'd sooner die than let one get close enough to propose to me." Whitney let out a sigh. "Methinks that you're overreacting. I'll come by in a few days. But I hardly think that Destiny Sirtis calming down is anything to worry about. If she can control her temper, maybe there's hope for me." Whitney let out a laugh as she hung up and ate another slice of pizza.

Back at Under Gloom, Aria is going through the books from the book cart and comes across that catalog of curses that you used to hex Destiny. The onryo picks up the book and curiously begins to read it.
154232233121.title: Strange Case

1542322331212.content:
Belladonna is fuming mad as she drives down the road. "Belladonna," says Fate. "You're driving too fast!" "Shut up, Fate," says Belladonna. "I'm in a real bad mood. First the Doctor and now Whitney. Are they giving a doctorate to anybody these days? Isn't that rhino rump supposed to be Destiny's best friend? Some friend she is when she can't see a major problem." Destiny just gives a giggle. "Oh, that Whitney," she says. "I wonder how she and Xander are doing. I sure hope Susan isn't giving them any grief. When is that younger sister of hers getting married?" Even Fate seems worried. "Mom?" she asks. "Did you by any chance take a serious head injury earlier?" Destiny just smiles at her daughter. "Oh, no. Nothing like that at all, Fate."

Fate bites her lip and scratches her chubby cheek. "Oh dear," she says. "I hope this is nothing serious." Belladonna arrives at Fate's house. It's a modified clock tower and from the looks of it, there is a veritable rock garden to the side and a stained glass window of a spider's web. Belladonna and Fate step out of the car and Fate takes her groceries and Destiny's hand. Destiny is wobbling as she smiles blissfully. "And she doesn't get mad no matter what?" asks Fate in concern. Belladonna turned her head and showed her teeth. "Haven't you been listening, you purple idiot!" Destiny continued to smile goofily and holds up a finger. “Now, now, Belladonna. If you can’t say anything nice, don’t say anything at all.” Belladonna was at this point jumping up and down. “I just insulted your daughter, you blue dummy! Don’t you want to strangle me or yell my head off or something!? Belladonna pulls on her hair as Destiny ignores her rant and continues to smile. “I’ll have your hug when you’re ready.” Belladonna gets so mad that she kicks a potted plant by Fate’s door. Unfortunately for her, it’s a rose plant and Belladonna then yells in pain as she then spouts out bad words.

Fate gives a sigh and opens the door. Like Fate said, Destiny’s younger sister Fortuna was inside. Fortuna was a brown-skinned gargoyle slightly shorter than Destiny with curved horns like that of a ram, large hips and long blonde hair. She had been accompanied by her husband and daughter. Fortuna’s husband David was watching television. He was a pitch black-colored gargoyle with rose-colored hair and muscular build. Fortuna and David’s daughter, Pearl was there as well and was reading a comic book. Pearl looked very much like a female version of her father. However, unlike other gargoyles who were among the tallest species of monster, Pearl was only 455ft tall, making her puny by gargoyle standards, something she was touchy about. Fortuna turns her head and sees Fate bringing Destiny in.

“Why, Destiny,” said Fortuna. “So glad that you could join us.” Fortuna was glad but David turned his attention to Destiny and looked nervous. Not that anyone could blame him given that his sister-in-law had quite a nasty reputation. He was even cowering as Destiny walked in the room. “Good afternoon, Fortuna. How are you doing? And how is that husband of yours?” Fortuna and David are both very surprised, though David seems more afraid than anything. Fortuna notices her sister smiling and her jaw drops just as Fate is putting the groceries away. Destiny was still smiling as Belladonna came in. “Belladonna,” muttered Fortuna. “It’s a surprise seeing you here. I thought you’d be out trying to steal my sister’s job.” “Hey, Fortuna,” says Belladonna. “It’s go soak your head o’clock! Time for you to go to the bar and....” Destiny then stood between Belladonna and her sister. “Now, now. You two get along now. Nobody likes to be angry.” Fortuna’s eyes pop out of her head upon hearing this.

Pearl takes her head out of her comic, really confused and surprised about her aunt’s mild attitude. “Auntie D?” asked Pearl. “Are you feeling alright?” “I think it’s perfectly clear that she’s not!” yells Belladonna. Fate opened the freezer to put away some ice cream as Fortuna walked up to her. “Fate,” said Fortuna. “Is your mother drunk? I can’t recall the last time she was this cheerful.” “I don’t know, Aunt Fortuna,” says Fate. “Belladonna said that no matter what happens, Mom won’t get mad.” David gave a scoff. “Are you kidding me? She can’t go a day without something pissing her off.” “Oh yeah?” asked Fate. “She suggested that I get married.” Pearl then drops her comic book in shock as Fortuna drops the cup of coffee in her hands on the floor. Fortuna sees Destiny smiling goofily and watching TV. David himself gets up and is utterly shocked.

Fortuna turned to face Belladonna. “Is this true?” “Does a splintercat have a big butt?” asked Belladonna in annoyance as she stomps her foot. “And that stupid wooden toy and pizza gobbling rhinoceros gave her a clean bill of health!” David then walked up behind Belladonna. “Uh,” he said. “Correct me if I’m wrong, Belladonna, but you said that she doesn’t get mad no matter what?” Belladonna let out a yell. “Are you deaf!? What did I just say!” Belladonna in rage took a lamp that was on Fate’s table and smashed it on the ground. “Hey!” yelled Fate. “You poison-tailed jerk! That lamp cost me 60 skulls!” “Leave her alone, Fate,” said Destiny calmly. “I’m sure she didn’t mean it.” “Shut up!” shouted Belladonna. Belladonna punched the wall but got her hand stuck between two gears and grunted in pain as Fate had to pull her out. Fortuna was baffled at Destiny’s new behavior. David on the other hand, gave a sinister smirk. “Wait right here,” he said maliciously. “I’ve got something for my favorite sister-in-law.”

Fortuna was really surprised but then smiled. “Well,” she said. “Let’s see if Belladonna is correct. Uh, Destiny.” “Yes, Fortuna, what is it.” Fortuna gave a sly smile. “Isn’t today the anniversary of the day you met Mason.” Fate and Belladonna both gave looks of horror upon hearing that. “What are you doing, Aunt Fortuna?” asked Fate. Destiny scratched her chin. “I remember that.” “Then you also remember what an animal he was. Remember, the Leaning Tower? That was a good night.” Destiny nodded her head. “I suppose it was.” “But,” said Fortuna. “You were real sick the next morning and the next thing you knew, he was gone.” Fate was biting her fingers nervously and Pearl covered herself with her wings, sure Destiny would get mad.  But Destiny just shrugged her shoulders. “Well,” she said. “It just didn’t work out.” Fortuna gasped and stepped back. “Oh my,” she said. "Belladonna wasn't kidding. If that doesn't trigger her, nothing will. I guess she's finally started to..."

Before Fortuna could finish her sentence, David snuck up behind Destiny with a smirk. "Oh, Destiny." Destiny turned her head. "Yes, what is it, David?" Without warning, David splattered a boysenberry pie in Destiny's face. "David!" yelled Fortuna in horror. David just gave a smirk. "That's what you get for all those years of intimidating me and making me feel so small! You've had that coming for a long time you blue battle-ax!" Belladonna is just about ready to attack David but Destiny stops her. "Now, now," she said as she was wiping pie off of her face. "He has every reason to want to do that to me." Fortuna gave a nervous laugh and Pearl actually fainted. "Well," said Fortuna. "If Destiny can calm down, maybe there's hope for Pearl."

Belladonna was fuming mad and then she heard her cellphone ring and picked it up. "Belladonna," said Aria on the phone. "There's something you should know. Somehow a catalog of making curses got mixed in with the prison books." "What?!" yelled Belladonna. "According to the book, you can order any of the curses in here to be placed on an enemy. One of the curses has the power to take away a victim's ability to get angry." Belladonna gave a growl. "I should've known! Who placed that curse on Destiny?! As if I didn't already know! Bring Wade here immediately, Tazel!" With that, Belladonna crushed her cellphone in her hand and threw it into the wall as she screamed in anger. "You know, Belladonna," says Destiny. "You have a terrible temper." "Shut up!" yells Belladonna. "As soon as Wade gets here, I'm going to roast him alive!"

Belladonna then grabs Fate's coffee table and proceeds to smash it into the wall. Fate's eye twitches. "I hope Aria gets Wade here so Belladonna can punish him while I still have some furniture."
1542322331212.title: Mellow Blue

choices: Fortuna Runs Out to Stop the Fight
15423223312121.content:
At that time in Under Gloom, Aria unlocks your cell and snatches you up. However, you look as smug as ever. "The vice warden would like a word with you, Wilson." Hisses the onryo. "Oh," you say. "I'm so scared. She doesn't scare me. She's not like that big blue crabapple who just got de-crabbed." You even stick your tongue out at Aria and she gives a hiss as she closes the cell door and then floats off. Lockette lets out a gulp. "Oh no," she says. "This is not likely to end well."

Back at Fate's house, Belladonna is so mad as she waits for Aria to bring you to her, that she has resorted to clawing at Fate's wallpaper as Fate gives a look of annoyance and Destiny is laughing at something funny on the television. "When Aria brings Wade over here, I'm going to put him to sleep!" yells the irate manticore. Fortuna rolls her eyes. "Belladonna," she says. "I think you've been hanging around my sister too much. "You're starting to act like you." Belladonna then points her tail dangerously close to Fortuna's face. "Say one more word, Fortuna," warns Belladonna. "And I'll see to it that your face is as puffy and swollen as your butt!" Fortuna gasps and looks back at her round butt before giving an indignant look at Belladonna. Pearl gives a hiss at Belladonna for insulting her mother, to which Belladonna responds with a lion-like roar that intimidates Pearl into submission.

The angry manticore then starts pulling springs out of the walls of Fate's clock tower and Fate grits her teeth. "Belladonna!" she yells. "Quit dismantling my house!" "Get off my case Fat Angela!" yells Belladonna. "Why do you even live in a clock tower anyway!? It's a bad place to live! Don't those grinding gears keep you awake at night!? Tick tock, tick tock, tick-tock, tick-tock! That would make me psychotic! And what do you do when your skirt gets caught in the gears!" "Chill out, Belladonna," says Fate. "Just because Mom can't get anger doesn't mean you have to scream everybody's head off." "If you weren't Destiny's daughter, I'd shove my stinger tail so far up your large, overstuffed and purple backside that you'd see it come out your mouth!" "You're acting like a complete jerk, Belladonna." Fate gets so frustrated that her eyes glow bright red.

"Oh!" yells Belladonna. "Go eat a rice paddy, you fat purple clone of that blue scarecrow!" "Don't cheese me off, Solanaceae," says Fate. "I can get pretty nasty myself!" Fortuna lets out a gulp. "Oh no." David wisely takes cover behind his wife as he watches Belladonna and Fate argue. "Shut your trap, Fate!" yells Belladonna. "The sooner Wade gets here, the sooner I can clobber him for breaking your Mom!" "Breaking my mom? You mean finally getting her to calm down for once? I'd think you'd be happy about it since she can't get mad at you for all the times you've tried to stab her in the back." "It goes against the natural order! Destiny Troi Sirtis is supposed to be the angry jerk who yells at everyone! What fun is it to antagonize her if she isn't going to explode!" "I'm about to explode at you!" "Like you're as intimidating as Destiny, you hippopotamus in gargoyle's clothing." "What was that, twig?" "Your butt is so big the moon orbits around it! In fact, you are so fat, the last time you went swimming, Captain Ahab went after you!" "I am not taking that kind of sass from somebody who can't decide if she's a feline or an arachnid, goes to the bathroom in a sandbox and sustains herself on rodents!"

Fate and Belladonna at this point are so mad at each other that they'd be ready to clobber each other at the drop of a hat. Destiny is as calm as ever and just smiles and waves. "Now, now. Let's not let anybody get overheated. I'm sure neither of you mean any malice." "Shut up!" yells Belladonna. Fate then slaps Belladonna in the face and makes her growl. "Don't you tell my mom to shut up, fleabag!" "Maybe if I pound your chunky butt, it will get a rise out of her!" "I'd eat you alive!"

At that moment, Aria floats in carrying you and you're laughing at Belladonna and Fate getting mad at each other. Aria looks in concern as Belladonna and Fate are getting even angrier. "You know," says Fate. "You've been acting like a complete jerk ever since Mom lost the ability to get mad. The problem is that she can't beat you back into your place. Looks like I'm going to have to do it for her." "I'd like to see you try, Princess Thunder Thighs!" "Excuse me," says Aria. "Belladonna, I have Wade with..." "You stay out of this, you cow! This is private!" Suddenly, Aria lets out an angry shriek and Fortuna, David and Pearl retreat into the kitchen to watch the conflict from a safe distance as Destiny is still laughing at the television. "This is gonna get ugly." Says Pearl.

Aria then shoves you between her breasts and you grunt and look in fear as Aria floats up to the other two angry giantesses. "What did you call me!?" "I called you a cow!" yells Belladonna. "And I don't have time to deal with a ghostly cow and a purple hippopotamus at the same time!" "You're really pushing your luck here, Belladonna!" Destiny smiles and rolls her eyes. "You three oughta try painting. I hear that's a good way of dealing with stress."

You look in horror because Aria, Fate and Belladonna are so mad at each other, they'd be ready to start a fight and you'd be caught up in the middle of it. At that moment...
15423223312121.title: Titans' Temper

154232233121211.content:
At that moment, Belladonna holds out her stinger tail and swings it at Aria, nearly hitting you as Aria uses her enormous breasts as a bludgeon to smack Belladonna into Fate. Fate herself grabs Belladonna in a choke hold but Belladonna bites her in the hand to force Fate to let go before she slugs Aria one, causing her breasts to shake and send you into the air as you scream. Aria lets out a scream and picks up a floor lamp to try and bludgeon Belladonna (batting you into the air in the process as you have to grab onto the ceiling fan) but Belladonna ducks and Aria hits Fate by mistake, shattering the head of the lamp.

Hug it out, don't slug it out. You're letting your tempers get the best of you." Belladonna turns her head and grits her teeth. "Like you're one to talk you big blue... Ouch!" You let out a muffled scream as you're sandwiched between Aria's boobs and Fate's butt cheeks. Belladonna is pressed into the wall so hard that she leaves a Belladonna-shaped imprint in it. Belladonna in retaliation, stings Fate in the buttocks, pushing you further into the gargoyle's butt in the process and making Fate scream in pain as she's forced to jump out. Fate feels her butt in pain from Belladonna's poison but the manticore only injected enough poison to temporarily burn her. Belladonna then nearly steps on you and jumps up and kicks Fate to the floor, nearly causing her butt to reduce you to paste. You even clutch your chest. Maybe this wasn't your best idea. The three of them were acting as hotheaded as Destiny was before the curse. Aria then rips a few gears out of the wall and tosses them like shurikens at Belladonna, provoking Belladonna to tear out a spring and start beating Aria with it right before Fate gets back up and slams both of their heads into each other.

At this point, Fortuna has had enough and then starts to walk into the scrap. "Fortuna!" yells David. "Don't! You'll get creamed!" "This is getting out of hand," says Fortuna. "This is the kind of savage behavior I'd expect from Destiny." Destiny had at this point fallen blissfully asleep, not even caring about the chaos going on around her. Fortuna stomps off as Aria, Fate and Belladonna are trying to choke each other. "Will you three knuckleheads cut that out!" yells the brown-skinned gargoyle in rage. Belladonna in response slaps Fortuna. Fortuna's eyes glow red and she slaps Belladonna back. Belladonna then punches Fortuna in the fork and Fortuna grabs the newspaper to hit Belladonna in the foot with. Then Belladonna pulls on Fortuna's hair, provoking Fate into smashing a vase over Belladonna's head before Aria tackles Fate.

Fortuna gives a roar and body slams Aria, all while you're trying to avoid getting crushed by four giant women having a free-for-all and have to run from Aria and Belladonna rolling on the floor. In the confusion, Pearl notices the catalog of curses laying on the ground. She picks it up and flips it to the page with the Angry Away curse and reads it, when she notices the obscured print and takes out a magnifying glass to take a look at it and drops her jaw. "Uh-oh." "Uh-oh?" asks David. "What uh-oh?" "I don't think Wade bothered to read this curse all the way through," says the teenaged gargoyle. "It says here that while the curse takes away the victim's ability to get angry or fight back, it also has a 50% chance of causing any monsters near the victim to become as surly and ill-tempered as they once were." David's jaw drops in horror.

Fortuna and Aria have reduced to screaming swear words at each other while Fate and Belladonna have taken their cat fight outside with you caught in the middle, all while Destiny wasn't doing anything to stop the fighting and just relaxing in the background. You were immediately starting to regret this decision.
154232233121211.title: Titans' Throes

choices: Nope, look for another curse to use.
1542322332.content:
"'Anger away'? Pfft, yeah right. I bet if we put that on Demona, she'd probably inflate like a balloon, holding all that anger in." you chuckled, as Lockette continued flipping through the pages. "Eventually, she'd pop, and I know I'd be the one taking the brunt of the explosion."

"You know, Wade, you wouldn't be so hated if you tried being the better person." your companion sighed, and you were about to give her a nasty retort when something caught your eye.

Something... interesting.

"Wait! Flip it back, I saw something good back there!" Lockette did as instructed, regrettfully, and you took a good look at the curse description. "Curse #138, Reverse Gluttony. Anyone marked by this curse will always be hungry and will gradually lose weight. Huh, it gets better... the more they eat, the thinner they get until they resemble corpses with nothing but skin and bones. It's perfect." you mutter, a sinister smile curling your lips.

"Wade, I don-" Lockette was about to say something, but you cut her off abruptly.

"Seriously, this curse! Listen to this, it's probably the best part! If the curse happens to be removed, then all the weight they lost will pile back on their frames, PLUS the weight from all the food ingested!" you rub your hands in antecipation. "Like I said, it's perfect."
1542322332.title: Next Option

15423223321.content:
You give a smirk that horrifies Lockette. "Wade," says Lockette. "You're not actually thinking about hexing Destiny with that Reverse Gluttony Curse. What if it backfires in some way? These curses always come back to bite the caster in the end." You give a scoff. "Who cares. I can't wait to see Destiny shriveled up like a corpse, or better yet, bloated to the point of immobility." You laugh wickedly. "Dial the phone!" you yell. Lockette lets out a sigh before she thinks to herself. "He treats me like dirt but he's the one with the dirty mouth. Lockette dials on the phone and a female voice speaks to you.

"Hello Sir or Madam. What curse can I interest you in today?" "Give me Curse #138 and have it cast on Destiny Sirtis, Warden of Under Gloom. I have a score to settle with that blue troglodyte." As the spell was being cast, Destiny was walking by and scoffed. "Wade must think I'm a moron to believe that I'd fall for such an obvious ruse." As Destiny is walking by, she hears loud munching sounds and then sees Cree munching on a rather large piece of pterodactyl meat and saw several bones lying on the hyena's obese stomach.

"Mother Weisman, Cree!" yells Destiny. "You eat like a pig." Cree wiped her mouth. "I'd say I eat more like a hyena." "No wonder you're so fat. Your eating habits are more questionable than Fate's." Destiny shivered as she walked away. "What am I saying? I had the same disorder when I was younger than Fate is now. Speaking of which, it's about time I had my lunch." Destiny returns to her office and takes out a meatball sub that she tears into a lot like Cree, finishing it in seconds. "Jalapeño," groaned Destiny. "I must've been hungrier than I thought. Speaking of which." Destiny walks to her fridge and takes out a jar of jalapeños. While most gargoyles hate jalapeños, Destiny actually considers them her favorite food and was eating the peppers like popcorn. Perhaps her hot temper made it impossible for the peppers to burn her.

As soon as Destiny finished the peppers, she resorted to licking the jar. "What is wrong with me?" asks Destiny. "I'm still hungry." Destiny then walks out of her office and for some reason she looks skinnier and her hips looked smaller. The gargoyle soon reached the vending machine at the end of the hall and put her money into the machine to purchase a bag of chips and then quickly ate them. As she did that, her cheekbones were more and more visible. She then bought a candy bar and ate it as well but that still didn't do anything for her monstrous hunger and she bought another bag of chips. It continued on until there was nothing left in the vending machine and Destiny was groaning as she ate another bag of peanuts and she looked slightly thinner.

Belladonna came in and looked in surprise and horror at the wrappers and empty bags littering the ground. "Son of a bitch, Destiny!" yells Belladonna. "Don't tell me you ate all that junk!" Destiny let out a slight belch. "I can't help it, Belladonna," said Destiny weakly. "It feels like there's a black hole inside of my stomach." Destiny heard her stomach growling and Belladonna gave a look of concern.

"Food," said Destiny as she begun to drool. "I need food." Destiny's stomach groans and then she decides to....
15423223321.title: Monster Munchies

choices: How many more curses can there be
15423223322.content:
"No, Wade." Lockette said as she flipped the pages again.

You frowned. Lockette was not being very helpful. You then spotted another curse, but it confused you.

"Why did they print the same curse twice?" You asked.

Lockette looked. "Wade, this is a different one. Curse #735: All You Can Eat. Seems this has a similar effect: endless hunger. But instead of getting thinner, the cursed gets fatter and fatter, and eventually become purely obsessed with food." She said.

You grinned. "That actually sounds more fun."

154232233221.content:
You climb down Lockette's arm and type numbers onto the phone. "Oh man," you say. "Wait'll Demona gets a taste of this. I hope she eats so much that she drowns in it." Lockette bites her lip. "Wade," she says. "I don't think that this is such a good idea. What if she decides to eat you?" You give a scoff as you hear a dial tone. "Don't be ridiculous," you say. "Those flying lawn ornaments don't chomp on humans. Now shut up so I can place the curse." "Hello?" asked a voice on the other side of Icy's cell phone. "Catalogue of 1000 Curses Hotline."

- - - - - - - - - - -

While you were busy ordering the curse to be place on Destiny, the big blue gargoyle was trying to open a jar of jalapeños as she growled and fiddled with the lid. "Why do they make these lids so freaking tight? Aha! Got it." Destiny smirks as she plucks out one of the jalapeños from the jar. Belladonna is walking by and takes a whiff before grabbing her nose and holding it in pain. "Whoa!" yells the manticore as Destiny bites into a jalapeño as if it were nothing. “Geez, Destiny. How can you eat those things? It’s like putting firecrackers in your mouth. You know, gargoyles normally hate jalapeños.” Destiny ignores Belladonna and devours each pepper one by one. “I’ve never found myself burned by jalapeños. Other gargoyles are just lightweights. My sister, my daughter and I eat these things everyday.” 

Destiny then does something that really surprises Belladonna. She places the entire jar of peppers to her mouth to devour all of them at once and even drank the brine they were soaking in. Belladonna makes a face as if she’s going to throw up before Destiny tosses the now empty jar into a recycle bin and then grabs another jar from underneath her desk and opens it to dine on more peppers. “You have got to be kidding me!” thought Belladonna to herself. “She’s going through another jar of jalapeños? I'd faint after just one.”

Destiny continues to stuff her face as she inadvertently drops a jalapeño on the floor. Out of curiosity, Belladonna picks up the dropped pepper and eats it herself. Immediately afterwards, her eyes bulge out of her head and she begins to sweat as her yellow-skin turns bright red and steam comes out of her nostrils before she lets out a scream and runs up to Destiny's water cooler before chugging the entire contents. "Good grief, Destiny," groans Belladonna. "What were those peppers soaking in? Black widow venom?" Then Belladonna looks in surprise as Destiny tosses away another empty pickle jar and then takes out a third jar of pickles.

"Okay," thought Belladonna. "Something is up. Even Cree couldn't eat three jars of jalapeños." Destiny shoved some jalapeños into her face before she spoke again. "Can you believe that Wade actually tried to trick me into thinking he'd gone straight? I know a liar when I see one. He's one of those people who would take a mile if you give him an inch. That human drives me crazy." Destiny's pours more peppers into her mouth and then drinks the brine before throwing the third jar away and taking out yet another jar of jalapeños. Belladonna is now very confused but then Aria flies up behind the manticore and accidentally knocks her to the ground with her enormous breasts.

Belladonna falls head first on Destiny's desk and grunts before Aria speaks. "Warden Destiny," says Aria. "I just got word that somebody managed to smuggle in a catalogue of curses. Somebody could order a dangerous curse if they only had a cellphone." "Well then." said Destiny as she shoveled in jalapeños. "I want all guards to keep a close handle on their cellphones and make sure nobody finds that accursed book."

Destiny then holds her stomach before she gets up and walks by Belladonna who is holding her head. "Where are you going?" "Out to lunch," says Destiny. "I'll be back in an hour." "Lunch!? You just ate four jars of peppers!" "And for some reason, I'm still hungry. Belladonna, watch after things while I'm gone. And if you lock me out of my office again, I'll clobber you." Destiny walks off and as she's walking away, Belladonna notices that the gargoyle woman's behind looks rounder than usual and scratches her head.

"Damn," thinks Destiny to herself. "I'm starving. I need something in my stomach. Hmmm." Destiny reaches the outside of the prison and then opens her wings to fly off to find a restaurant. Before she does so, she takes out her cellphone to call her daughter Fate. "Hello, Fate," says Destiny. "You did say that a new restaurant opened down the block from your clock tower, right?" "That's right, Mom," says Fate on the other end of the phone. "I was going there myself." "Well," says Destiny. "I'm coming myself. I've got an appetite all of a sudden."

Destiny flies down from the sky and lands in front of...
154232233221.title: All You Can Eat

1542322332211.content:
Destiny looked at the pizzaria. The sign read "Jenny's Pizza Buffet". The building was a simple, two-story brick building. Destiny could feel her stomach roaring in anticipation of the pizza.

Just the, Fate landed behind her. She smiled when she saw her mom.

"Hey Mom." She said. "What do you think of-"

Fate didn't get to finish her sentance when Destiny marched in. Fate was surprised. "Guess she's in a hurry." Fate muttered before walking in.

The inside was just as simple as the outside. It looked like any other buffet restaraunt. There were only a few other customers. Destiny had already made her way to the checkout counter. Behind the counter was a chubby toucan harpy girl.

"Hello, and welcome to Jenny's Pizza Buffet. My name is Lara. How many will be eating today?" The harpy asked.

"Two." Destiny said, looking more at the buffet then Lara. Fate walked up behind her.

"OK, just follow me." Lara said. She then proceded to lead Destiny and Fate to a booth near the back of the restaraunt. "Here you go. When your ready, just go get-"

Lara couldn't finish before Destiny made her way to the buffet counters and started filling plate after plate with food. Lara and Fate looked at her surprised.

"Well, guess she's ready." Lara said before walking back to the cash register. Fate just kept looking at her mother.

Eventually, Destiny came back to her seat, somehow carefully balancing 20 plates of food at once. She sat down and, without even saying anything, began tearing into her food. Fate just looked shocked as she got up and went to the buffet counter to get her own food. As she filled her own plate, she started thinking.

'Mom never eats this much. Wade must have done something.' She thought. By the time she had filled her own plate and gotten back to her mom, Destiny had already cleaned of 12 plates and started her 13th. Now Fate was really shocked.

"Aren't you full yet?" Fate asked her mom, now a little worried.

"Not even close." Destiny said, her mouth full. She just continued to devour pizza, cheese-sticks, salads, and so on. Fate just started eating her own food. By now, the whole restaraunt was looking at Destiny.

Eventually, Destiny finished all twenty plates. Fate was barely even done with her first plate. Destiny then got up and went right back to the buffet. After a little bit, she came back with 20 more plates.

"You just ate twenty plates of food!" Fate yelled. "How are you still hungry?"

Destiny looked at her daughter. "I actually don't know. I ate 4 jars of jalapeños and was still hungry. Guess I've just built up an appetite." She said, before going back to her mountainous meal.
-----------------------
This went on for two hours. Destiny would finish her massive meal, only to immediatly get back up to get more food. The only reason she and Fate left was because the owner Jenny, a fat cobra naga with purple scales, asked them to. They also had to pay almost 500 skulls for all the food Destiny devoured.

But even leaving the buffet wasn't enough. Almost immediatly after exiting, Destiny flew of to a nearby corner store and started buying as much food as possible. Fate was now worried. Fate also noticed that her mom seemed to be getting fatter. She had a obvious pot belly, her breasts shot up several cup sizes, and her butt was tearing her pants.

"Um, mom, don't you think you should be getting back to Under Gloom?" Fate asked.

Destiny went wide-eyed. "Crap! I was supposed to be back an hour ago!" She yelled, before flying off. "See you at home!" She called down to Fate.

Fate just watched her mom fly. "OK, something's wrong. I should call Ororo." Fate said, before fishing out her cell-phone.

Meanwhile, after flying and eating for a while, Destiny had landed in front of...
1542322332211.title: Cleaning out the Buffet

choices: Cut Back to Belladonna and Destiny Gorging
15423223322112.content:
Destiny lands in front of a restaurant that read "Caligula Dogs" and licked her lips. From the looks of it, it was a hotdog-based restaurant. Down the street, Belladonna was walking down the street looking for any sign of Destiny. "Where is Destiny?" she asks. "It's been 2 hours. It's not like her to abandon her post. Not that I have any problem with it, but I'm curious. It's no fun locking Destiny out of her own office when she isn't back when she says she's going to be. Oof!"

Belladonna bumps into Destiny from behind, causing both of them to groan. "Hey," says Belladonna. "I'm walking... huh?!" Belladonna saw Destiny and from the looks of it, she was as fat as Fate was. "Hello, Belladonna." Grunts Destiny. Belladonna drops her jaws as she saw how huge Destiny had gotten. "Good gracious me!" yells Belladonna. "All we need now is Captain Ahab! What did you eat?!" "If you must know," says Destiny in annoyance. "Fate and I went out for pizza and the owner asked us to leave before I could eat my fill." "You mean you emptied out a pizzeria and you're still hungry!?" asks Belladonna. "Even Cree's not that big a glutton." "Hey, if you're here? Who's running Under Gloom!?" "I left Aria in charge. I'm hungry too." Destiny just gives a scoff. "You'll have to pay for your own hotdogs."

Belladonna saw that Destiny's pants were tearing and beginning to show Destiny's pixel-print panties. "Looks like big blue has some junk in the trunk." says the sneaky manticore. Destiny responds by slapping Belladonna with her blue tail and making her grunt. "Jerk." Mutters Destiny. At the counter of the restaurant was a male weretiger with bright golden fur but surprisingly no stripes. He couldn't help but stare at Belladonna before Destiny grunted to get his attention. "Oh," says the tiger man. "Welcome to Caligula Dogs. Table for two?" "Make that table for two dozen." Smirks Belladonna.

Destiny shakes her fist in front of Belladonna. "One of these days, Belladonna," she warns. "One of these days. Pow! Right to the moon. She's with me. But she's paying for her own meal." "Right," says the weretiger. "What can I get for you." Destiny smirks as she takes her order. "I'll have an order of 2 dozen Italian foot longs on pretzel buns topped with ketchup, mushrooms, pickles and jalapeños with a large kettle popcorn and a Hauntling cola." Belladonna's jaw drops at that order and the tiger man is surprised as well. "Did I hear that correctly? You want jalapeños? But gargoyles don't like jalapeños." "Well I do." Says Destiny as she hands the tiger man a large row of skulls. The weretiger nods his head to take Destiny's order and then turns to Belladonna who is deep in thought. "And this beautiful creature?" "I'm thinking it over." Says Belladonna

- - - - - - -

Meanwhile, back at Under Gloom, you get an idea and dial on Icy's cell phone again. "What are you doing, Wade," asks Lockette. "You already placed the curse on Destiny." "Yeah," you say with a vicious smirk. "But why should we leave Belladonna out of this? She's Destiny's right hand attack cat. And even if she does manage to steal Destiny's place as warden, I'm not taking any chances." You hear the dial tone as you're getting ready to hex Belladonna as well.

- - - - - - -

Back at Caligula Dogs, Belladonna is just about to make her decision. "As for me," says Belladonna as something comes over her. "I'll have 3 dozen foot long linguisa dogs on Chicago buns topped with bacon, onions, chili and tomato wedges with a large cinnamon swirl popcorn and an Orange Crash." Destiny seems surprised but shrugs it off as Belladonna is about to pay the weretiger. "Ah, ah, ah," says the tiger man. "It's uh... Manticore Day. Manticores eat free." Belladonna smirks at Destiny as Destiny rolls her eyes. "Manticore Day?" she asks. "More like Bonnacon Day."

As Destiny and Belladonna were waiting for their orders, Fate was on the telephone with the library in Screamtown several towns away. The librarian, Ororo Parker was an obese 950ft tall cobalt-skinned wereboar woman with long white hair and sharp teeth. She was gorging on donuts as she spoke with Fate. "And you say she cleaned out an entire pizzeria, ate 4 whole jars of jalapeños and was still hungry? Wait, a gargoyle ate jalapeños?" "Focus, Ororo."

Ororo gave a snort and then threw away her first two boxes of donuts before taking out another box and messily devouring a chocolate donut. "It sounds like she got hit by a curse from the Catalog of 1000 Curses. It's an evil spell book that was stolen from my library 10 years ago. Specifically, Curse #735: All You Can Eat. Anyone hit by that curse will have a hunger that could never be satisfied no matter how bloated they get and eventually they become obsessed with food." Ororo is so busy talking to Fate that she grabs her library stamp instead of a donut and eats it by mistake without realizing it.

"Good grief," says Fate. "Wade must've found that book and used it to curse Mom. I gotta go warn her." With that, Fate hung up and flew off to find Destiny. Back at the Screamtown library, Ororo was sucking her fingers. "I think that last jelly donut was stale."
15423223322112.title: Fat Cats and Hot Dogs

choices: Seriously, how big is this book, and how many curses are left!
154232233222.content:
As you're looking at the All You Can Eat curse, another curse directly below it catches your eye.

"Look at this." You say. "Curse #736: Bloated Gravity. Victim becomes extremely fat, but also loses control of the own gravity. Either gravity decreases and they float uncontrollably, or gravity increases and they become extremely heavy. The gravity changes at random, and also affects things within 10 feet of the victim."

You grin madly. Imagine the chaos this could cause.
154232233222.title: How many more curses can there be?

1542322332221.content:
You give a smirk as Lockette blinks. "I don't think that this is a good idea, Wade." You smirk and then crawl up to Icy's cell phone."Of course it's not a good idea, Lockette. It's a terrific idea. I'm going to do it." You dial the numbers on the phone to order the curse. "Hello," says a female voice on the other end of the phone. "Catalogue of 1000 Curses." "I'd like to order Curse #736: Bloated Gravity. I want it cast on Warden Destiny Troi Sirtis of Under Gloom. I have a personal beef with that oversized lawn ornament."

- - -

At that moment, Destiny was dressed in a tight black dress with a red jacket and was applying lipstick on in her office. "Punching out early?" asks Belladonna as Destiny puts on a pair of pearl earrings. Destiny let out a sigh. "A friend of mine and Whitney's from college is getting married." "That's great." Says Belladonna. Destiny gave a scoff. "And when I get there, I'm going to tell her what I told Whitney when she got married." Belladonna rolls her eyes before speaking. "Men are poison. You know, Destiny, that misandry of yours is getting old. You're going to hate all men forever just because of something that one man did to you?" "Don't judge me," mutters Destiny. "If I ever see Mason again... oh, it's just lucky for him that Persephone doesn't have a taste for gargoyle." Belladonna turns her head and just laughs smugly.

Destiny punches out and then exits Under Gloom before flying down to a bus stop where a friend of hers is waiting for her. This friend is an albino white wererhinoceros with long red hair (though more orange in comparison to Destiny's) with a bright blue tattoo of a rhino's head over one of her eyes. This ironically made her look like Fox as much as Destiny's appearance made her look like Demona. The rhino woman was wearing a blue cocktail dress with a blue rose corsage and she was wearing a golden necklace with ivory earrings and bright blue lipstick when Destiny flew down. "Hey, Des," said Whitney. "Can you believe that Lark Canmore is finally getting married." Destiny gave a scoff as she failed to notice a purple aura around herself that flashed and disappeared.

As Whitney came close to Destiny, the aura cast over her. "You know," says Destiny. "I don't see what the big deal is." Whitney gave a scoff. "I'm married and Xander and I are very happy." Destiny gave a scoff. "Where is Xander?" Whitney let out a sigh. "Xander has a terrible cold. He couldn't make it. You know, Destiny, you should get back in the saddle again. Just because Mason was a deadbeat..." Destiny hisses at Whitney as her eyes glow bright red. "Don't mention that piece of detritus in my presence. I hate him more than I hate Wade and that's saying something. Let's just get to the wedding so we can watch Lark get saddled with a loser." Whitney lets out a sigh.

What she and Destiny don't notice as they're talking, they are getting fatter and fatter. Their bellies, breasts and butts expand as their clothes grow tighter on their body and with each step they seem to be getting...
1542322332221.title: The Gravity of the Situation

choices: Hitch a Ride on Destiny (You read that right)
It's Visiting Hours, Escape on a Guest
155.title: How About These Choices

choices: Destiny Stops to Visit her Daughter
1551.content:
You heard that Warden Destiny was supposed to be taking a vacation today. You know it sounds risky, but perhaps you could stow away on the big blue hag and escape. Talk about the biggest irony.

Suddenly you hear footsteps and hide to the side where you find Destiny walking down the hallway and she was grumbling to herself as Belladonna walked alongside her. "Of all the ridiculousness," groans Destiny. "Stupid quack. There is nothing wrong with my blood pressure." Belladonna gives a smug grin. "Come on Warden, you haven't taken a vacation for decades. You heard what the doctor said, all that stress is eating you alive inside." Destiny lets out a grunt. Looks like you finally drove her over the edge.

You see Destiny's tail moving and run quickly so neither the warden nor the vice warden can detect you before you begin your climb. Destiny lets out a sigh. "I'm only doing this because that quack told everything to Fate and got her on my ass about it." Fate was Destiny's daughter, you had never met her but given that she came from such a nasty womb, you'd prefer not to. If anything she'd be just like her mom.

Belladonna smiled wickedly because with Destiny on vacation, it meant she was the boss, not that you'd care since you'd be safely out of this hellhole.

At this point you've climbed up Destiny's tail and were standing on one of her butt cheeks as you reach for her shirt. It isn't long before Belladonna and Destiny are out of the prison. "I'm leaving you in charge while I'm away Belladonna, don't make me regret it." Belladonna smiles and puts one hand behind her back. "Oh you won't Destiny. I know you won't." You assume that Belladonna has her fingers crossed but you couldn't see a thing with Destiny's ass it the way.

Suddenly you hear flapping and feel wind beating down on you. You look up to see Destiny is flapping her wings and flying away. You yell and tumble before you're forced to grab hold of Destiny's skirt. You look up and cringe at the sight of your archenemy's panties. Wait, you couldn't worry about that, from the looks of it, you were a million feet up in the air. A fall from there could be bad for you. Then there was the fact Destiny could find you and then you're toast. Why couldn't she drive a car like everyone else?

What happens now?
1551.title: This is Risky

choices: Destiny Decides to get Dinner Ready
15512.content:
You hold on tight to Destiny's skirt as the giantess gargoyle flies. You cross your fingers as Destiny flaps and comes across a strange house that had strange statues on the sides and a demonic face on the door. It looked like some place Dracula's daughter would like. Destiny flies down to the front door and then reaches for her keys. At that moment, you climb her belt and see her keys right next to you. You have to climb out of the way as the blue gargoyle grabs the keys and unlocks the door.

Miraculously Destiny didn't notice you as she walks in the front door. On the inside you see that Destiny's house has quite a gothic design. The furniture has spider web designs and there appears to be a glass menagerie of different mythical monsters and heroes in the side of the room. You never knew Destiny collected glass animals. Maybe you'd smash one of them to make her really mad. That's when you notice Destiny's mantle with several photographs.

One of them depicted Destiny as a teenager and you have to hold your mouth to keep from laughing at how fat she was back then and from the looks of it, she used to wear braces. There was another photograph of Destiny with a younger gargoyle; a blonde with brown skin, you guess Destiny's sister. You had no idea she even had one. Then there was a photograph of Destiny with a friend of hers in college. Destiny's friend in the photograph was a pudgy albino skinned wererhinoceros woman with long orange hair reaching to her behind and a blue tattoo of a rhino's head over one of her eyes. The rhino woman appeared to be wearing glasses. It was kinda funny. The rhino woman sort of looked like Fox in the same way Destiny reminded you of another blue gargoyle. From the looks of the photograph, they were both in the same sorority.

Then you see a photograph that was attached to a dartboard. It had a purple skinned male gargoyle with brownish blond hair and the photo appeared to have been stabbed several times with knives. Then you turn your head and see a photograph of Destiny holding a female infant gargoyle with the same skin and hair. Then you put two and two together. That baby garg in the photo had to be her daughter, Fate. From the looks of it, Fate was born out of wedlock. You're not surprised, who would want to be married to that blue barracuda.

You slide down Destiny's tail and hit the floor as Destiny lets out a sigh. "I'm terrified to think of what will become of Under Gloom in my absence. High blood pressure my shiny sapphire ass. Destiny then opens the fridge and takes out a can of soda that she opens with her claws before she pours into a glass. As she opens the freezer to take out some ice, you see microwave pizzas. You weren't surprised. From the looks of it, Destiny lived alone and given the kind of hardass she was, she'd probably prefer something she wouldn't have to waste time cooking.

Destiny comes back into the living room and you duck under a recliner as she sits down in it. "Terrific." You mutter to yourself as Destiny looks at the TV guide. "I wonder what's on. Young Justice marathon on channel 60. Hmm, Young Justice. Wait a minute, didn't the guy who worked on that also... oh heck no. I ain't watching that. Not after the humiliation I suffered from his previous work." Destiny turns the TV on and flips channels. It was lucky for you that Destiny hadn't seen you yet, but you're right under the gargoyle's chair. If she sees you escaped and in her house, she'd roast you alive. All you can do is bide your time and wait for a chance to escape before Destiny realizes you're here.
