She appeared to be a titanic and obese bright violet-red koala bear with hot pink spots on her body and a whitish pink under belly. She and violet hair worn in a bob cut an usual for a koala, she had large fangs at the sides of her mouth.

She was wearing nothing more than a red loincloth and bra that leaved little to the imagination. "He Destiny." Says the koala giantess. You can't help but break into laughter. "A koala bear? Are you serious Destiny? No wonder she handed the keys to you." "Oh," said Marina showing her fangs. "I'm not a koala bear, I'm a drop bear." "A killer koala bear," says Destiny. "I have to warn you, Marina, this little jerk is the bane of my existence. I've taken a day off for the first day because this creep has done a number on my mental health." Marina just lets out a chuckle before snatching you and squeezing you. "Oh, don't worry about me. I ran Under Gloom when you were just my second in command. I can handle this."

The drop bear giantess looks at you and shows her fangs as you shiver in place. "Now," says Marina as she walks out of Destiny's door. "Where to put you?" She lets out a cackle and you're suddenly very afraid.

Where does the giant killer koala girl put you for the ride back to her house?
1551212222.title: The Warden Before

choices: Marina's house, now you're REALLY in for it!
15512122221.content:
Marina smiled at you, exposing her fangs, as she considered where to keep you until she got home.

"...Ah that'll work!" she said at last, eyeing you hungerly as she made her way to her car.

You felt a moment of dread. WHAT would work? This was insane! You had already met her and you were already shaken up by this titanic and obese bright violet-red koala bear with hot pink spots on her body and a whitish pink underbelly.

You shake your head, you could handle this Marina. She was just another monster!

Climbing into the driver's seat of her car, and buckling up, Marina snickered. "Tough guy trying to steel yourself huh? Think you can handle me? Well, you might, if only just, you bounced back no matter what happened in my old workplace, and not just anybody can do that. Now...to put you away!"

You were dropped and plunged into darkness. You gasp in air but without a moment to rest the floor or whatever you're in starts moving and you stumble and are tossed around. Every once in a while light shines in and you can see your in what seems to be a fuzzy, fleshy material.The air was humid and stuffy. It felt like a sauna to you.

Where was this place?

Just then the sky opens up, and you can see up....all the way up to the giant killer koala girl's face! You were in your pouch.

"Enjoy the ride!" she said.

Oh, hell no! You grab onto the inside of the pocket-like skin and start pulling yourself up.

Seeing you try to climb out, the drop bear threw back her head and laughed, "Already trying to get away? I can see why Destiny can't handle you! I've actually been bored out of my mind since retirement! Now I want to pin her wings to the wall since she didn't give me you to keep my occupied until now! I can already tell that you'll be FUN!"

You pale, not liking that at all. If she really was among those no longer in the working class, that meant she had a lot of time on her hands and nothing to do with it. That was REALLY bad for you, because from what she was saying, YOU were going to be her entertainment!

The monster woman, who looked like she was in her early 50s. (It's kinda hard to pinpoint monster ages), smacked her pouch, right where you were currently climbing, stunning you and causing you to drop back to the bottom. Marina cackled again "Your climbing and the way you went tumbling down both really tickled!" she said, grinning. "Say, tiny... wanna know why my kind are called "drop bears"? We inhabit treetops and attack our prey by dropping onto their heads from above, usually ass-first!"

"So, I take it you wanted to jam me up your fluffy ass and grind my bone to make your bread, Eucalyptus-breath?" you snapped up at her from her pouch.

Far from being insulted, Marina hooted with amusement, "Scrappy little troublemaker AND headstrong with going against the better judgments of common sense by insulting a giantess? I'm REALLY going to enjoy every last second of messing with you! I never had to deal with someone like that at my old job, and no doubt it'd gratt my nerves if I was still working at the hoosegow. But since I need to keep busy since I have too much time on my hands and nothing to do with it all, you're PERFECT! As for what you said just now...I could have, but I prefer formal introductions with my big butt. When I get home, you can bet you will. And F.Y.I. shortie: If you thought Destiny was bad, when I ran Under Gloom, the safest places for the ones in there were the cells! Even the guards felt that way! And that was about the idea of my shadow being over them! Like I said, we drop bears attack our prey by dropping onto their heads from above, usually ass-first!"

SAY WHAT?! Oh...that wasn't good! If the guards felt threatened by the idea of her shadow...no wonder Demona gave you to this psycho marsupial! You scramble to climb up the interior of the pouch again, but the pouch suddenly opened wider and you saw the silhouette of what looked like a giant misshapen spider enter the pouch, heading for you.

Her hand!

"Gonna getcha, you little amusement! Ha! Not even home yet, and you're already breaking my boredom! I love it! Damn Destiny should have sent you to me long before now! I can't even decide if I WANT to tame you, you're so fun!"

In all of your over 9000,000, 000,000, 000, 000, 000, 000, 000, 000, 000 times you had attempted escape from Under Gloom, you never even imagined things would end like this! The ennui-repellent of a carnivorous koala-woman! You ran as much as you could. Occasionally you had to climb the inside of the pouch again, only to have to go sideways or diagonally or even let go and drop to the bottom to avoid this crazy monster's grabbing you.

"Your scampering feels good in my pouch, little bug! Come to mama!"

This was a nightmare!

Eventually, she started her car and drove off, heading home. The G-forces of that made it so you were instantly propelled to the back of the pouch and Marina grabbed you with her free hand that she had stuck into her pouch. "Sorry bug, as fun as you are, we'll need to wait a bit, now that we're heading to your new home with me."

The drive took hours while you sweltered from the mixture of the heat from Marina's fur, the warmth of her hand around you, and the heat of her pouch.

"Gotta say, I'm glad you're not boring, bug, otherwise I'd just kill you. I live alone and have been needing something to keep me busy, and you're it." Marina chatted absently as she parked and got out of her car, then climbed up a set of what felt like stares and you heard heard a lock click open before she entered and you heard a supersized door shut. As soon as that was done, you were pulled out of the pouch to see you were in...
15512122221.title: Deep, Stuffy Pouch

choices: She Decides to Introduce You to Her Ass
155121222211.content:
You were now at Marina's house. From the looks of it, it was a one floor house near the forest at the outskirts of Fearfield. There appear to be eucalyptus plants in pots at every corner of the house and a chandelier made of human skulls attached to the ceiling much to your surprise. There was one shelf that had a few dolls of yowies that appeared to be there for simply decoration. The floor was covered in a carpet that looked like the flag of Australia and in the center of the room was a glass coffee table. You even see a photograph on the mantle that depicted Marina as the warden with Destiny in a uniform that was identical to Belladonna's albeit with holes for her wings.

You turn your head to see your drop bear captor smiling fiendishly at you. "I knew that Destiny had what it took when I made her my successor. A warden who inspires fear. The fact that she was the only gargoyle on the staff at the time sealed the deal. Everyone knows gargoyles have an instinctual drive to protect the helpless and punish the wicked. It's in their genes. Although what possessed Destiny into giving her previous position to that two-faced scorpion cat, I'll never know."

You try to fake bravado and grit your teeth. "You don't scare me, you overgrown teddy bear!" you shout. "I'll be out of here in..." Marina just laughs so hard that it shakes her jiggling body. "Oh no, oh no, oh no, my little entertainment, you're never getting out. In fact, you'll be staying with me, for the rest of your life. Just deal with it, criminal." She then pokes you in the throat with one of her claws as you gag. This was just great, stupid Destiny. Thanks to her you were going to be a slave to this giant killer koala.

Then Marina got an evil idea and she spots a jar of gum on her coffee table. Marina took a handful of the gum and tossed it into her mouth, with you screaming afterwards. You look around just as Marina closes her mouth. It smells like eucalyptus and carrion in there but that was the least of your worries as you see the gum all around yourself. "No! you yell. "No, no, no, no! Ah!" Marina begins to rapidly chew the spearmint gum, tangling you in it. You try to move but it's far too sticky and you can't even scream because some of it got into your mouth. Marina is careful not to chew on you but then the koala wraps the gum around her tongue and blows a bubble with you screaming inside as she looks in amusement, pops the bubble with a claw and then slurps you back into her mouth to blow another bubble.

This goes on for twenty minutes before Marina pulls your sticky body out. You're screaming because your eyes were stuck with the gum. Marina lets out a laugh as she holds you up to her mouth and then licks the gum off. "You are one sick bitch!" you yell. Marina let out a laugh. "Ooh, you're really fun, insect. I guess Destiny was too uptight to enjoy you herself. Her lose. Now the real fun can begin."
155121222211.title: Attack of the Killer Koala

choices: Marina's playing makes you shift to where you're under her buttcrack
Marina gets up to "play" with you some other way
1551212222112.content:
Marina smirked at you as she carried you into the bathroom and tossed you into the sink and turned it on. Hot water started to fill the sink. With no concern whatsoever she pushes in the stopper and lets the water fill up into a nice steamy pool and then takes you and drops you in.

You feel it getting warmer but you can’t turn to look around. Then without warning something grabs you by your legs and then you are turned upside down and carried over a pool of water and then you drop. You hit the scolding hot water face first and sink. You tried to get some air but you can’t, you're drowning. You struggle to move your arms and kick your feet…your legs break free.

You can’t breathe but your legs are now breaking free and you kick your way to the surface. You break the surface and your arms like magic spread out to keep you up. Air. Sweet air fills your lungs then you are sucking in water. Large objects are drowning you and then you are grabbed and nearly pulled apart as your legs go one way and your torso is pulled another. You try to make it up for air but only get a gulp before you are cascaded down again and rolled into a ball and squeezed then wiggled out then rolled again and squeezed. OH, AH, AAAH, you scream losing all your air as your arms and legs are bent back and forth and strained.You yelp, wriggle and flinch in the water and the subsequently added chemicals and vigorous scrubbing via stiff bristle-brush.

Your clothes fray quickly under this stress, and you realize that Marina's deliberately removing them when she starts to peel away the more stubborn pieces, like your shoes. Finally, she seems satisfied, as she pulls your naked form from the sink.

You’re beaten and you give in ready to die when a vice grip grabs you by the head and starts lifting you up out of the water. You can’t move. You’re too badly hurt as Marina dries you efficiently and roughly with a hand towel.

"There we go, my little entertainment incest. Now to get rid of those covers you were wearing...you'll never need them again." Marina cooed laying you on the counter, smirking.

What did she mean by that?!

The violet-red koala bear took your clothes up in one hand and raised them over her head and looked up, opening her mouth and dumped them all down into her waiting mouth. You stared as the former warden gulped down your clothes. WHAT THE HELL?!

After her little snack, Marina turned and smirked down at your prone form.

"Now...Remember what I told you about why my kind are called "drop Bears", my bug? Time to feel it all over!" she cooed wickedly.

You pale. Oh CRAP! THAT'S what she meant by the bath from hell?! Marina cackled as she swept you up into her hand and carried you to the love seat that she had instead of a couch and dropped you onto the cushion, making SURE you were face up, and turned around.

You gape at the sheer size of her butt as it looms over you. Even for a monster, saying she was bottom heavy was an understatement. How could ANYTHING that massive even exist!

"Ready to be formally introduced to your owner's booty, my eeny-weeny buggy?!" she laughed, shaking it over you. You couldn't answer. you were too shocked. Then the Drop bear started singing softly to you.

"The itsy-bitsy buggy
Made Destiny Shout
Down came Marina's booty
And knocked the buggy out!"

At that last line, Marina slammed her booty down on you like two meteors of Armageddon and starts wiggling and bounce her rump on top of you and causing you pain. You try to bite her but that only makes the Drop Bear giggle.

"So feisty! I'm NEVER gonna tire of you, bug! NEVER!" she hooted as you felt yourself baking underneath her from the combination of Marina's body-heat and her fur. It felt like an oven! Marina's fur was everywhere you could see, and since you were bare butt naked, it feels like the bristles of a broom are running all along your body.

After who knew how long of being ground into the cushion by her massive ass like a stain...
1551212222112.title: Introducing You to Marina's Ass

15512122221122.content:
Marina gets up off of the cushion and looks back with an evil grin as you're plastered beneath her fur to her left butt cheek. You're even gagging and gasping for breath as the drop bear lets out an evil laugh. She peels you off and brings you up to her face. "Have enough yet, mate?" asks the koala giantess.

"Screw you." You say weakly. Marina just lets out a vile sounding laugh and shows her fangs. "You really don't learn your lesson at all do you. No wonder Destiny couldn't handle you. She was always so uptight. That's why I made her my second in command. Good for demoralizing the criminals, but she never did know how to have fun. I wonder how that daughter of hers is doing. Let's hope that apple fell far from the tree."

Marina lets out a laugh and you respond by giving her the finger. The drop bear responds by giving a grin and scratching you in the crotch to make you scream in absolute pain. "I could almost strangle those walking garbage disposals, Cree and Clover. It was Destiny's idea to hire those two but I wish that they left some human prisoners alive so we could've had some fun. Oh well, I guess one is better than nothing, especially when that one is a puissant who just can't learn his lesson. I've got a chillingly good idea for some further torture."

Marina lets out a laugh and you're in too much pain from your wounded crotch to care. You were legitimately scared for your life. The previous warden was an even bigger bitch than Destiny was. You really hope that Marina's predecessor wasn't still alive because if you had been given to whatever bitch was around back when this killer koala was only the vice warden, you wouldn't even last one second. You were shaking as Marina puts you in the kitchen and taps you to a cutting board. She then slams a large knife dangerously close to you and you scream right before she laughs.

"Oh," says Marina. "Don't you worry. I've got something more delicious in mind." Marina digs into her cupboard to take out a large glass that she slips some cubes of ice into. Then she opens the refrigerator and takes out a carton of a strange aqua blue liquid you can't even identify and then puts in more ice and then a giant straw.

Marina twirls the straw around and gives an evil look your way before she painfully rips off the tape and makes you scream as your skin is nearly torn off. It is so red and irritated that you're convinced that she even took off the muscle. You're sweating bullets as the koala woman lifts you up and tapes you in front of her grinning mouth and you see her fangs. No koala should have teeth that sharp. Then Marina drops you into her drink and you scream because the drink was colder than a frozen hell. Marina sticks in the straw and spins in around to create a whirlpool that sucks you screaming under.

You were bounced off of the ice cubes and whatever that strange liquid was, you were forced to close your eyes as it irritated them. It was so cold your blood was frozen and you couldn't move your limbs. You can even feel suction and you gasp as the liquid is being sucked into the vortex in the straw. You are sucked into the steam and in Marian's mouth. You're powerless to stop Marina's tongue as it swishes you around the cold cold liquid that seems to bubble in the koala woman's mouth. She wouldn't swallow you, would she?

Marina swishes the liquid around for ten minutes before blowing you out through her straw and swallowing that cold liquid. You lie motionless on a giant cube of ice and gasp for breath as Marina licks her lips.

"Now," says Marina. "What to do with you next?
15512122221122.title: Koala From Hell

choices: Destiny Decides to Eat You for Dessert
Before She Can Torture You, There's a Knock on the Door
155122.content:
As you ponder a way out, you hear creaking and realize that Destiny is walking out of her chair and into the kitchen. "Well," she says. "Better get dinner ready." You rub your hands and run out and see Destiny reaching into the fridge. You're gonna go to the door but Destiny steps in the way and you have to hide under her kitchen table. You hear a grunt and sure enough, Destiny stops in her tracks.

"I thought I heard something for a moment," she says in a suspicious tone as she walks to the microwave with a frozen pizza. "I was sure the exterminator got rid of my ant problems." Looks like you have to lay low. "Oh well," says Destiny as she puts the pizza in the microwave. "A tarantula and sea urchin pizza should fix that." You mentally gag. Monster food was always so gross. You have to hold onto the table leg as Destiny taps her foot, waiting for her pizza to heat up.

You soon hear a ding and Destiny brings the pizza back to the table. "She's gonna eat that whole pizza?" you ask yourself. "Pig." However, as Destiny is about to cut the pizza, the pizza cutter falls out of her hand and near the floor. You scream as the pizza cutter nearly falls on you and cuts you in half.

Unfortunately, Destiny heard your screaming and grunts in confusion. As she reaches down to pick up the pizza cutter, she looks at you and her eyes pretty much pop out of her head before glowing red with rage. "WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAADE!" she shouts at the top of her lungs. "Aw crap." You say.

///////////////////////////////////////////////

It isn't long until Destiny has you trapped under a wine glass on her kitchen table as she angrily bites into a slice of her pizza. "So," she says with a mouthful of pizza. "You tried to escape by hitching a ride on the warden to her own house. I don't know if you're ballsy or just stupid." "Well the fact is I'm the first prisoner to escape from your Under Gloom craphole, Warden Demona." Destiny pounds her fist on the table before chewing on a second piece of pizza. "You're walking on thin ice Wilson! I just got your record from all the crimes you committed in the human world. Grand theft auto, arson, destruction of property, bootlegging. There's enough here to keep you locked up for at least a decade and trying to escape doesn't win you any brownie points."

Destiny eats a third slice of pizza and you just have to take a jab at her. "Oh yeah, we'll you're nothing more than a real life Demona who hasn't done anything but eat pizza since the show ended and it's all going to your ass!" Destiny grits her pizza sauce covered teeth and glares at you. "You're playing with fire Wade." She says as veins appear on her neck and her blue skin turns more purple. "On thin ice, playing with fire. Make up your mind you stupid gargoyle bitch."

Destiny gets so frustrated, she shoves two more slices into her mouth and chews ferociously. "You should consider yourself lucky that I am a gargoyle. Did you know that gargoyles are the monster species least likely to eat humans? We have an instinct to protect humans, which unfortunately, extends to people like you. If you ask me, they should've dropped that bearded pig to his death. But you're seriously pushing your luck Wade. You're really tempting me to reconsider my diet."

"Go ahead and try you big blue cow!" Destiny rips the slice of pizza off of her latest slice and chews angrily and while her mouth is too filled with pizza to yell back, you decide to really insult her. "And while I'm at it, I saw your school picture, Demona! Nice mouth metal! And also, I've seen a lot of ugly babies but that eggplant skinned horror you unleashed on the world takes the cake! I'm surprised you didn't have to pay somebody to get that close to you!"

Destiny swallows her pizza before responding and she lets out a angry Godzilla style roar as she holds up her claws. She's so angry that she can't even speak clearly. You let out a laugh as you watch her lose control but then you hear scratching and see her digging her claws into the table as she looks down at you, growling and drooling like an angry dog with eyes glowing red. You actually gulp.

Oh, you did it this time, now Destiny's more pissed at you than ever. What now?
155122.title: Someone's in the Kitchen with Destiny

1551222.content:
Destiny's eyes are seething with rage as she looks down on you and bares her fangs. You're now really afraid. Perhaps insulting her in her own home was a bad idea. But before Destiny can punish you, there's a knock on the door and she lets out a groan before getting up out of her seat "I'll just answer the door," she says in a voice filled with fury. "AND DEAL WITH YOU LATER!" Destiny stomps her way towards the door and you blow a raspberry at her from inside your glass prison.

This prompts Destiny to turn her head and roar at you. She's beyond pissed. You wonder why she's even bothering to answer the door when she's angry. You doubt she was expecting company. But then again, who's to say her company won't assist her in torturing you.

Destiny finally reaches the door and answers it to see...
1551222.title: Knock on the Door

choices: To Her Job at the Daily Tombstone
To Her Clocktower House (It's Her Night Off)
15512221.content:
As Destiny opens a door, you see something that immediately gets your attention. There was a young gargoyle girl, you'd say in her twenties (though you knew absolutely nothing about how long monsters lived). She was the same size as Destiny and looked like her in the face except she had purple skin, long brownish blonde hair and smaller horns than Destiny's. Additionally she was very fat in contrast to Destiny's hourglass figure. Then you remember that baby gargoyle from the photo. That must be Destiny's daughter and from the look on her face, she did not expect to see Destiny fuming mad.

"Fate," says Destiny trying to stay calm. "This is not a good time." "Geez, Mom," says Fate. "You needed a vacation worse than I thought. What the hairy heck has you so steamed?" Destiny points to you in your glass prison and Fate walks forward to get a closer look, only for you to flip her off to her surprise. Destiny turns her head and lets out an angry roar as Fate is forced to hold her back. "Mom! Calm down!" Fate turns her head again and glares at you. "You must be Wade," she says. "So I finally meet the jerk who's always driving my mom crazy." "Drop dead." You say.

Destiny really doesn't appreciate that comment and grabs your jar before shaking it up a few times and banging it on the table to toss you about. After Destiny resets the jar, she begins to pant heavily before speaking again. "Listen here Wade, you better watch what you say to my daughter, or so help me, I will drop you IN MY BLENDER!" Fate just grabs herself by the chin and shakes her head.

"Really?" she asks. "Now you're so angry, you're threatening him. That little creep is making you crazy. All that anger is going to eat you alive. Your temper is out of control." "I DO NOT HAVE A TEMPER!" "Better listen to the whale, Demona," you say. "Wouldn't want you to get anymore gray hairs and look like the hag you are!" Destiny roars again and from the look on her face, she almost looks ready to breathe fire if she could.

Fate slaps herself in the face. "Oh, I get it. Another wise guy. Listen here, Wade, you're not the first person to compare my mom to that fictitious maniac. Apparently they didn't know real gargoyles actually existed and happened to design a villain who turned out to look almost identical to somebody who was nothing like her personality wise. It wasn't very funny. Do you have any idea how humiliating it is to know you look just like a cartoon villain?"

"Go sit on a church, Angie!" you say as you give Fate the finger again. Destiny at this point is about ready to metaphorically and possibly literally explode. "Fate," says Destiny. "Please, go get Mommy her sledgehammer." However, it would seem that Fate is pretty peeved herself. You didn't know her, but from the looks of it, she was definitely calmer than that bitch who brought her into the world. Yet she was glaring at you with glowing red eyes as well.

"Enough!" shouts Fate before turning to her mother. "For crying out loud, Mother! That creep is the reason why you need to take time off in the first place! Until you started babysitting the troublemaker, I've never seen you this pissed off. The closest thing to your current level of anger is a crocodile with a toothache being repeatedly poked with a stick. If he's that annoying, you should just feed him to Cree and be done with him. Instead, you're letting him get you so riled up that you're ruining your health. At this rate, he's going to give you a heart attack!"

Destiny lets out a growl but starts to calm down before you grunt. Fate unceremoniously seizes your jar and shoves it in her cleavage. "You need a break from this S.O.B. Which is why I'm going to torture him for you." You couldn't believe it. "Like jerkass mother," you mumble to yourself. "Like jerkass daughter."

However, Destiny doesn't completely agree with the plan. "You have no idea what you're doing Fate," says Destiny. "He'll drive you mad." "He's already done that to you," says Fate. "I'll take my chances. I can handle him, I'm not a hatchling anymore. I have a job as a guard." "A guard for a newspaper. Fate, that man is the most obnoxious and annoying inmate I've ever dealt with. What makes you think that you can handle him?" Fate rolls her eyes. Guess the blue bat is just as overprotective with Fate as she is nasty to you. "Mom," says Fate. "Do yourself a favor and relax. I'll deal with him.

Destiny lets out a sigh. "Fine. Just keep your eye on him." Destiny kisses her daughter and then looks down on you. "And Wade," she says. "You better behave for my daughter or else. And if you give her the finger just one more time, just one more time, I'll bite your head off." "I'd like to see you try, Demona!" you yell. Destiny snaps her teeth at you and grabs her hair before yelling cueing Fate to get the heck out of there.

Fate spreads her wings to fly as she carries the jaw with you in it in between her giant purple boobs. "Good grief," she says. "You know, you're a real piece of work. It's lucky for you that Mom and I like humans." "Yeah right," you say. "Bite me, Angela." "How is Angela supposed to be an insult." asks Fate. You try to speak again but you're at a loss for a proper comeback. "You're fat." You say with all your spite. Fate grabs herself by the forehead and grits her teeth. "Laugh it up, shrimp. For all the trouble you've caused my mom, I'm going to put you through hell. By the time I'm through with you, your first instinct will be to rub my talons rather than insult me. Normally I'm nice to humans, but you, I will break you." Fate makes her eyes glow red to show how serious she is.

Well, whatever she has planned, it can't be any worse than what Destiny would do for you. So where does the big eggplant take you?
15512221.title: Destiny's Daughter

choices: She Makes You Give Her a Talon Massage
She Sis Her Large Butt Down on You
155122212.content:
"Tonight I'm gonna be able to fly straight home to deal with you. They're breaking in a new female night guard and want me to stay home." That's what Fate says as she flaps her wings through the air. "Whoop de doo," you groan. "Now I get to spend the night with a fatass purple accident." Fate gives you a glare and presses her boobs together to rock the jar you're in. "You know," said Fate. "We are rather high in the air. I could drop you from here." "You don't have the guts, Angela." Fate bites her lip. "I already told you that that's not an insult. Shut your trap until we get home." You just stick out your finger at Fate. You had a feeling you'd hate her as much as you hate Destiny.

Soon, Fate flies over her house which appears a rather old looking clock tower that appeared to have been modified to be inhabitable. Fate lands with a thump at the front door and reached into her panties for the key before she unlocks the front door. You give a smile. "A clock tower?" you ask. "How appropriate." Fate ignores you as she walks inside and then lays you on the table. She begins to unscrew the jar as she glares down at you."You know," says Fate. "You have quite the mouth on you." "And you have quite the ass on you. You're not a gargoyle. You're a baby hippopotamus." "Now you're making fun of my weight?" asks Fate. "Just reduce yourself to a neanderthal. I'm not some thin-skinned monster who blows her top just because somebody points out her waistline."

You scoff and then look at your surroundings. Being a clock tower there were gears in the walls and a collection of cuckoo clocks at the side of the wall. Then you see a mantle with several photographs. One depicted Fate as a schoolgirl beside her mother. Back then it appeared Fate was chubby but not as huge as she is now. Then you see a photograph of Fate with a friend of hers who appears to be a behemoth, a hippopotamus-like monster with brownish yellow skin and brown hair. Then you turn your head and see that Fate has quite a collection of crime drama DVDs and you also see what looks like Fate's security outfit hung up. From the looks of it, it's a black outfit that comes with a cap. You read the shirt to see that it says "Daily Tombstone" which is most likely where she works. There also appears to be a tomato plant of some kind in the kitchen.

"What a dump," you say. "Who would want to live in a clock tower anyway?" "Somebody who hates to be late for work," says Fate. "And speaking of work, I fully intend to make you suffer for all you've done to my mom. She doesn't deserve what you put her through." "What I put her through!? What about what she puts me through!?" choices: After An Hour You Arrive in Terrordale
155122222.content:
"I swear, Whitney," says Destiny. "That little jerk is gonna be the death of me!" You give Destiny the finger as the gargoyle's eyes glow redder than ever. You even see veins appearing on her neck and laugh. Whitney however, grabs her friend by the shoulders. "Destiny, calm down. You're letting that creep ruin your health." "It would serve Demona right for ruining my life all the time." You say. Destiny lets out a growl and is just about ready to kill you, but Whitney is confused. "Demona?" she asks. "What's a Demona?" "Shut up!" yells Destiny. "At least tell me why he calls you that." "Because she's a real live Demona," you shout. "All she's missing is the crown!" "If you don't shut up, Wade," says Destiny as she bears her fangs and holds up her fist. "I'll crown you!"

Destiny is all but ready to kill you but Whitney grabs her by the fist. "And I used to wonder why you were always angry," says the rhino woman. "With this guy provoking you all the time, it would be impossible for you not to get angry. I'll tell you what, I'll take Wade back to Terrordale. Since Under Gloom isn't helping his behavior, the Kaiju Disarming Plant will probably do him some good." "That place isn't for people like Wade," says Destiny. "The KDP is for psychos and vegetables." "Exactly," says Whitney. "If Kaguya can't fix him, hopefully he'll get eaten. This isn't for his mental health, it's for yours. You'll never recover if you have to worry about Wade, 24/7. Trust me."

Destiny is reluctant but she turns to you in the jar. "Congratulations, Wade," she says. "You just got a new warden." You stick out your tongue at Destiny right before Whitney picks up your jar. "You know," says Whitney. "You're walking on thin ice." "Blow it out your tail horn face." Whitney gives a glare before walking out of Destiny's house to let her gargoyle friend's temper cool off. Whitney walks into a strange green car that looks like a cross between a 4x4 and a monster truck and places your jar in a upholder as she starts the car. "So how's Destiny doing?" asks a male voice at your side. You turn and look in surprise because next to your jar was a tan skinned human man with brown hair worn in a ponytail and a beard.

"As hot tempered as ever, Xander," says Whitney. "Right next to you is the root of her anger issues." "Aha," says Xander as Whitney drives down the road. "So this is the infamous Wade Wilson." "Stow it, Xanatos." You say. "That's pronounced Xander," says Whitney. "Not only is he rude, but he's stupid. The guy can't even tell the difference between a rhinoceros and a fox." Xander has to fight back the urge to laugh at his wife's ignorance. "He also called Destiny a weird insult," continues Whitney. "I don't know what it meant but from context, he was comparing her to a really nasty cavity." Xander at this point can't hold back his laughter and you just glare at him.

"What could you possibly see in that bulldozer?" you ask Xander. Xander shrugs his shoulders. "I happen to have a thing for SSBBW redheads with fiery tempers. That reminds me, given how much Whitney says you fight with Destiny, the two of you should be married. It wouldn't be fair if she won the fight just by outliving you." You shiver at that thought. The idea of marrying a monster was blasphemous enough, but marrying Destiny would be a nightmare. The very idea might even be why her boyfriend split for the hills. "You can't be serious!" you yell. "They're monsters! They're lower lifeforms!" Whitney gives an angry glare as she keeps on driving. "Listen here, Wilson," she says. "It's an hours drive to Terrordale and I would appreciate it if you didn't act like a jerk for the entire drive."

"Up yours sandpaper thighs." You say. Whitney gives an angry snort and grits her teeth as Xander shakes his head. "You're a glutton for punishment aren't you?" "Shut up, Zoophile." You say. Whitney comes to a stoplight and snorts. "We're not even halfway to Terrordale and he's already more than I can handle," she complains. "If this keeps up, I'm gonna be as bilious as Destiny by the time the day's over." You give Whitney the finger and she grinds her teeth before Xander calls up to her.

"Don't blow a fuse Whitney! It's never a good idea to drive while angry." Whitney snorts again and seems to calm down, but then as the light turns green she glares at you briefly and feeling particularly belligerent, you pull down your pants and moon her. She lets out an angry rhinoceros like roar as she turns her attention to the road. Xander rolls his eyes. "This is gonna be a long drive back to Terrordale." He gripes. "You are so lucky I'm a nurse and a vegetarian, Wade," mumbles Whitney. "Otherwise I'd kill you right here and now." "You don't have the guts, you pachyderm."

While you and Whitney are exchanging cross words, Xander shakes his head and takes out an iPod to drown out the angry unrepeatable words filling the air.
155122222.title: Change of the Warden

choices: Mail You to her Sister in Screamtown
1551222221.content:
After an hour, you have managed to anger Whitney to the point where she could barely speak, just in time for the batteries in Xander's iPod to run out and for him to see just how mad you made his wife. "Geez," he said facing your direction. "And I used to wonder why that gargoyle was such a grouch." You flip the man off. "Go to hell, monster lover." "No thanks. If you're gonna be there, I'll find some way to gain immortality." Whitney arrives in her driveway and places Xander on her shoulder before taking the jar and walking out.

You look forward and see that the Sterankos' place was a two floor house that wasn't that far from the beach. It looked like something out of a 90s sitcom. "What a dump." You say. Whitney just lets out a snort. "I would've thought you'd find anything to be adequate given you were in prison this morning." "You belong in prison!" you yell. "Correction. Make that a zoo!" Whitney takes out her keys and angrily opens the door as Xander rubs her in the cheek. "Calm down, Whitney," says Xander. "Jeekers. I didn't think he'd be that volatile." Whitney walks in and sets both you and Xander on a glass coffee table before walking towards the kitchen.

"I'll be getting dinner ready," she said. "And Wade had better like it!" Xander let out a sigh before turning to you. "Dude," he says. "Why did you have to make her this angry? When she gets this steamed, sex is out of the question." "I did you a favor," you say in response. "That's bestiality! I really hope you two don't ever have children." Those words actually get to Xander. "I would like to be a father, but Whitney doesn't want any kids. She says with the mental patients she deals with everyday, a child would just be one more thing to take care of." You let out a scoff and give a smug grin at that. Xander just turns his head. "I hope you get eaten by a hydra." He says.

You just turn your head and look around the place. As much as you hate to admit, Whitney's place was pretty nice. You see several photographs on a mantle. One was a wedding photograph of Whitney and Xander. You mentally gag. "Isn't it illegal to marry a monster?" you ask. "You should be in prison." "Funny thing about that," says Xander. "Humans are considered food almost everywhere in the monster world, but nowhere is it illegal for a monster to marry a human. I'm from New York, I've seen stranger." You then see a photograph of another were rhinoceros, a blonde with grayish green skin and a hunched back. In the photograph with this older rhinoceros was what looked like a male fairy, less than half her height but with a disfigured face and skin that was white on one side and black on the other. "And I thought Darcy was ugly." You say. "Those are my in-laws," says Xander. "Susan and Grayson. Don't get me started. The only cons I can see in marrying a monster is a supercilious mother-in-law and a mistrusting father-in-law. Thankfully Whitney's sister is more bearable.

You turn and see another photograph, another rhinoceros, except this one looked younger than Whitney and resembled a black rhinoceros. She was dressed like a goth girl. "Looks like Shego." "Funny you should mention that," says Xander. "Noreen hates her real name so she'd rather go by Shego instead." That's when you hear Whitney calling. "Dinner's ready!"

It isn't long before you're joining Whitney and Xander for dinner, albeit it isn't what you'd call dinner. It was mostly grass salad with fried dandelions and thorns and even some flowers you couldn't identify. Xander didn't mind eating it but you sure did. "You call this dinner?" you ask. "This stuff looks worse than prison food! Where's the meat?" "Wererhinos don't eat meat." Whitney says. "You expect me to believe that snow job? There's no such thing as an herbivorous monster!" Whitney just glares at you. "Then maybe I should go carnivore right now and eat you, if I wasn't afraid of poisoning myself." You just stick out your tongue at the rhino giantess.

"Listen here, you little jerk. I told Destiny I would take you to the KDP to fix your attitude so you better behave yourself until then or so help me, I will give you to Cassandra." "Who the hell is that? One of your retard patients." Whitney snorts angrily and then places you in a smaller jar that the one you were in before. Whitney lets out a yell of frustration. "Son of a bitch, Xander!" yells the rhinoceros giantess. "If this keeps up, I'll have to admit myself into the KDP." However, Xander rubbed his chin. "Maybe we don't have to send him to the KDP after all."

Whitney snorts in confusion before Xander climbs her hair up to her ear. "Your sister lives in Screamtown, right? Perhaps a positive environment would do him some good." (For information on Screamtown, see this link, http://www.writing.com/main/interact/ite...)

Whitney actually seems to consider her options? What does that rhino giantess finally decide to do?
1551222221.title: House of the Rhino

choices: You and Sylvia Come Up with An Escape Plan
Dr. West Checks Up on You Both
15512222211.content:
Whitney thinks over her husband's words before deciding. "Sending Wade to Screamtown sounds like a really bad idea," she said. "He'd just burn it down. I'm taking him to the K.D.P. and that's that. Maybe if we're lucky, Eartha will eat him alive." "Screw you F..." "I am not a fox!" yelled Whitney. "Dammit! Get your species correct! Do I look like a dog to you!?" You stick out your tongue and Whitney lets out an angry snort as veins appear to run down her neck. Xander shook his head.

That night, Whitney has you sleeping in a jar by her bed. You look out to see the rhino giantess sleeping on her stomach as her tiny human husband was wrapped up in her hair. From the looks of it, Xander is wearing earmuffs. You soon learn why because Whitney snores loud enough to wake the proverbial dead and you're forced to plug your ears.

The next day at the KDP, there appear to be twelve orderlies gathered in the office of the doctor in charge. There was an obese owl woman resembling a great horned owl with orange red hair and bright green eyes along with talons for hands. She was wearing a rose colored two-piece bikini. Next to the owlwoman was a chocolate furred BBW pegasus woman with long white hair and Oreos tattooed to her thighs. She was wearing a one piece pink bikini with a cowgirl hat.

Next to the pegasus and the wereowl was a cockatrice, an hourglass shaped creature with the lower body of a green dragon but upper body of a chicken. She was wearing an orange two piece bikini and was holding hands with her girlfriend, a muscular red-skinned Jersey devil with long pink hair and a blue two piece bikini.

After the Jersey Devil girl was a muscular blue skinned werecrab with violet hair and large eyestalks. She wore a red one piece bikini and one of her claws seemed bigger than the other. There were two more monsters holding hands. One was a white behemoth, a monster resembling a hippopotamus with the skin of a dragon and an elongated tail. She wore a two-piece yellow bikini and had long golden blonde hair with a pair of thin glasses. The behemoth woman was with her wife, a bahamut, a giant light blue monster resembling a hybrid of a hippo, a fish and a dragon. She wore her head in a bob cut. It was red but given the black highlights, it was clearly dyed and the bahamut lady also wore a purple two-piece bikini.

There was also a fat yellow skinned Shishi resembling a Chinese guardian lion. She wore thin glasses and a green bikini. Next to the Shishi was an obese silver furred werewolf in a two piece gray bikini. She somewhat resembled Persephone except older and fatter.

The final three orderlies were late arrivals. There was an elderly purple skinned European dragon resembling a female version of Spyro with long white hair, glasses and a black bikini. The dragon woman was using a cane to walk and she was assisted by a different kind of dragon, a black skinned six legged salamander with cyan hair and a bikini of the same color. From the looks of it, the salamander was the other dragon's granddaughter. The last one was a monster that looked like a strawberry blonde haired mock turtle. She had the scaly arms of a green sea turtle complete with the shell but the head, feet, legs and udder of a white and red furred minotaur. She wore a yellow-green bikini attached to her shell.

It was there the doctor in charge walked in. She was a violet haired Japanese woman with golden ears and feet of a fox with nine tails. She was a kitsune. "Alright everyone," she says. "I think you all knew why we're having this meeting?" "What meeting?" asked the werewolf woman. "What was that?" asked the purple dragoness as she put a trumpet to her ear. "Grandmother," said the salamander to the dragon woman. "Shush." "Thanks Tori," says the kitsune to the salamander woman. "Now, Whitney has made a deal with Warden Sirtis of Under Gloom."

The mock turtle woman dropped her cigarette on the ground and made a look of horror at that comment. From the sound of it, she was a born criminal and was hiding it from the other orderlies. "They'll be another addition to the K.D.P. Another human patient." The werecrab woman begun to drool and snap her claw and the behemoth licked her lips while the bahamut woman turned her head and started to sweat. Behind the kitsune woman was a cage with Sylvia, that blonde you seduced a long time ago and it looked like she was listening in on the conversation.

The were owl then gave a smug smile. "Excellent idea, Dr. West. I mean, after all. Another human might help to get Sylvia's raging psychosis under control. Might even cure both of their conditions. I have an idea, let's..." "Shut up Virginia!" yells the pegasus, shishi and cockatrice at the exact same time.

"Calm down, everyone," says Dr. West. "The patient is an inmate of Under Gloom who is being brought here for the good of the warden's sanity and mental health." The mock turtle woman gives a smirk upon hearing those words. The door opened and Whitney walked in carrying you in a jar. "Ladies," said Whitney. "This is Wade Wilson, the most obnoxious troublemaker in all of Under Gloom."

The crab, behemoth and cockatrice woman all give looks at you in the jar. The were crab woman even begins to drool as she looks at you and you give her the finger. "Don't even think about it, Lilith," says Whitney to the crab. "He'll probably give you food poisoning." "What's in the jar?" asks the werewolf woman. "Diana," says Whitney. "All you need to know is that this human is not to leave the KDP." You're about to badmouth Whitney again but you take a quick look at Diana's face and see that she looks a lot like Persephone. You even rub your eyes.

"Wade," said Whitney. "These are our orderlies; Virginia, Abilene, Gail, Charlene, Cressida, Tori, Cyprus, Tress, Diana, Jedda, Lilith and Tarja." She is referring to the owlwoman, pegasus, cockatrice, Jersey devil, purple dragon, salamander, behemoth, shishi, werewolf, bahamut, werecrab and mock turtle respectively. "And this," says Whitney as she shows you to Dr. West. "Is Dr. Kaguya West. P.S. That is what a fox looks like!"

Dr. West looks at Whitney as if she said something completely crazy. "Whatever, horn-face," you say. "In one day I'll be out of this freak farm. And that goes double for you. I'm surprised you could only fit nine tails on that bloated ass of yours." Dr. West gasps and looks back at her nine-tailed rear before speaking. "What a terrible attitude. Put him in with Sylvia and we'll begin the treatment in an hour."

Whitney drops you in the same cage as Sylvia and you turn to yell at the monsters. "Oh yeah, you ain't no prison guards like Cree or Clover! Just a bunch of nannies to a bunch of half brain-dead babies." "Wade?" asks Sylvia behind you. "Is that you?" You turn and face Sylvia and are surprised to see her. You seduced her a long time ago in order to break into a safe that was in her house in Kansas to steal her family's money. But there was too much heat so you abandoned the plan. But from the looks of it, Sylvia still carried a torch for you.

"Wade," says Sylvia. "I thought I'd never see you again." "Enough chit-chat, doll," you say. "We gotta get out of this nut hole." "I've been trying ever since I got here," says Sylvia. "Not exactly easy with Whitney around." While obviously you couldn't care less whether or not Sylvia escaped with you as long as you got out, but perhaps she could be useful in helping your escape.

"It shouldn't be a problem," you say. "All we need is to get past Fox Xanatos over there and the twelve terrors." "You don't know Whitney like I do," says Sylvia. "She.. huh, you're right. I never noticed how much Whitney looks like Fox Xanatos. But that's beside the point. You don't know how many insane monsters are in this building. If we're to escape. We need a plan." "So," you say. "Let's have it." "We have only an hour to come up with one," says Sylvia. "Before Dr. West checks up on us.

After one hour...
15512222211.title: The Kaiju Disarming Plant

choices: You Come Up With an Escape Plan
Sylvia Comes Up With an Escape Plan
155122222111.content:
"Listen Syl," you say. "Before we can get out, we have to know what kind of security we're dealing with. Does Under Gloom have anyone as security besides those twelve?" "No," says Sylvia. "Just them and Whitney. They act as nurses and guards. Eleven of them are very dangerous. First is Lilith, the crab woman. She's nice and courteous towards the monster patients, but there's nothing she likes to eat more than humans. She's even talked about eating me with melted butter." A crab eating a human in melted butter, how ironic. You just roll your eyes and look out the window to see that Tarja the mock turtle smoking.

"Tarja is the wickedest orderly," says Sylvia. "She doesn't care about her job and treats the orderlies like dirt. She's got the morality of a criminal. I've even seen her steal money and medication from Dr. West's safe." "A monster after my own heart." You think to yourself. "Then," says Sylvia. "There's Cressida, the dragon. She's the oldest orderly in the building. She celebrated her 1000th birthday a few months ago." "A thousand years old?" you ask. "She's ancient." "Dragons can live for a very, very, very long time," says Sylvia. "But Cressida's senile, arthritic, nearsighted and her nerves are shot. She can't even breath fire without hurting her throat anymore. She's the weakest of the guards."

You let out a laugh. "Then why do they keep her around. If you ask me, she's an old nag ready for the glue factory." "Cressida isn't going to quit her job until the grim reaper knocks on her door. That's why she has her granddaughter, Tori the salamander acting as her right hand. She's as fast a meteor with her six legs. Tori became an orderly to help her grandma keep her job." You stick out your tongue in disgust. Dragon sentimentality. Bleck!

"There's also that bigmouth owl woman, Viriginia," says Sylvia. "She's a no-nothing know-it-all who treats me like I'm some gormless cavewoman. She thinks she's so smart but I know she's just a birdbrain." "Then why not tell that bird to piss off?" you ask. Sylvia lowers her head. "She's the closest orderly to Whitney." "Figures," you say rudely. "She's no owl. She's a lapdog. Who else?"

"Well," says Sylvia. "There's one orderly I'm friends with." You couldn't believe it. Sylvia friends with a monster? That's appalling. "Are you kidding?! They're monsters! They're the enemy." "Not Charlene," says Sylvia. "She's the only one who knows the truth behind why I'm here." "Charlene?" you ask. "That Jersey devil woman? You're friends with that horse head." "That's the one," says Sylvia. "But I have to warn you. Charlene doesn't like human men for some reason." You let out a scoff and then Sylvia begins to shiver. "It's her girlfriend that's the problem. That horrible cockatrice, Gail. Gail wants to turn Charlene into a human-eater." You knew a monster that didn't eat humans was too good to be true.

"Speaking of couples, there's also the Starking-Potter couple. Jedda the bahamut and her wife, Cyprus the behemoth." "The hippo heads?" you ask. "Jedda is undergoing therapy," says Sylvia. "She wants to stop eating humans." "B.S." you mumble. "Well," says Sylvia. "She's not having much success. Not helped by the fact that her wife practically eats nothing but humans. Cyprus is the second biggest man-eater in this KDP. The only good side is that she's always losing her glasses."

"What about the pegasus?" Sylvia shivers and turns pale. "Abilene," she says. "That pony is anything but friendly. You see, there's a lifeguard on the beach, a human lifeguard named Stephen. I've never met him but he's got a large female monster fan base." You make a gesture like you're ready to throw up. "And I take it Abilene is one." Sylvia nods her head. "But Abilene is paranoid of human girls who would steal Stephen from her so she stomps any female human she sees into the ground. She hates me. She's even scarier than Tress." "The shishi?" you ask. "By the way, that's a dumb name for a monster species." "Tress is a nightmare," says Sylvia. "Every time she comes in, she rapes me. I once spent three hours stuck in her butt." Sylvia even breaks down crying. "Why do you let her do that?" you ask. "No monster is the boss of me." "I have no choice," says Sylvia. "If I don't comply, Tress will eat me."

"That only leaves the werewolf," you say. "What was her name again? Delia? Danica?" "Diana." Says Sylvia. Diana? That was the name of a Roman goddess. From the sound of it she was related to Persephone or so it seemed. "And what's her deal?" "Diana's a basket case," says Sylvia. "She's forgetful and clumsy. I can't even predict her. I'm not even sure if she eats humans or not. She wasn't always like this though. One of her daughters was sent to prison. Diana was so upset she had a mental breakdown." You were now more and more curious. "Diana's daughter wouldn't happen to be named Persephone would it?" You ask. Sylvia was surprised to hear that. "You know her?"

Your eyes popped. Diana was Persephone's mom!? She sure didn't look like someone who gave birth to a cannibalistic serial killer. You wouldn't believe it. Especially since Diana was so fat that her ass could deflect an asteroid and Persephone was so thin. Then again, Persephone is muzzled and it's doubtful Destiny feeds her that much. "Just out of curiosity," says Sylvia. "What was Persephone in for?" "She's a cannibal." You say bluntly. Sylvia's face turns white at that thought.

Once you knew how the orderlies worked, you and Sylvia decide to brainstorm a plan.
155122222111.title: Coming Up with the Plan

15512222212.content:
Whitney actually gives a smile before rubbing her finger against the side of Xander's face. "That's actually not a bad idea, dear," she says. "Screamtown is the one place in the monster world where no human has to worry about being smashed or swallowed. Perhaps if Wade could see humans and monsters living together in har..." "Hello!" you shout. "Didn't you tell Demona you'd take me to that home for retarded monsters?"

Whitney gives a snort in your face. "Think of this as some more extreme therapy. In Screamtown, all types of monsters get along with humans quite well. First thing tomorrow morning, I'm mailing you to Noreen and you had better not give her any trouble, Mr. Wilson." You just blow your tongue out. "In five seconds, I'll be running that backwater town, Fox." Whitney just grabs your jar and shakes it a few times before slamming it back down on the table with you in a daze.

"What the hell is wrong with that guy's eyes, Xander!?" yells your wererhino captor. "Why does he keep calling me a fox!? We're not even similar species for crying out loud!" Xander whispers something slightly into Whitney's ear and causes her to look in surprise. "That's ridiculous," says Whitney. "You're telling me he expects me to get offended because of that? Only a complete and utter hothead would blow their top about looking like a cartoon character. Exactly how does she look like me?"

While you're pouting in your glass prison, Xander walks up to one of Whitney's massive eyes and holds out his phone to run an image search. When Whitney does see an image of Fox, she just lets out a scoff. "That looks nothing like me. Idiot." Well, while Whitney does have a temper it turns out she isn't as easily pissed off as Destiny. Maybe you'd be able to get under his sister's skin. "Noreen," you mutter to yourself. "With a stupid name like that, it's no wonder she prefers Shego. Where the hell would their parents get a name like that?"

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

The next day, Whitney is driving to the post office with you in a jar and you've been fitted with a tracking brace around your ankle. Whitney had already told Destiny the plan and from what Xander told you on the way out, she was perfectly okay with it. You take it the old hag didn't care what happened as long as you were nowhere near her.

When Whitney arrived at the post office, at the front was a green haired banshee girl wearing heavy purple makeup and a white dress with polka dots under her postal uniform. From the looks of it, the banshee clerk was wearing chains wrapped around her body down to where her feet should've been.

Whitney hands you to the clerk before explaining. "I need this human mailed to Screamtown. 310 Autumn Avenue. Recipient's name: Noreen Steranko." The banshee looks down at you in the glass jar before you give her the finger. "You do realize that we're not usually allowed to mail live food through the mail." "He's going to Screamtown," said Whitney. "So he doesn't qualify as food. "We'll still have to charge an extra rate since you're sending a live package." You stick your tongue out at Whitney and cause her to glare at you. "I don't care about the extra rate," says the rhino giantess to the banshee. "Just get him to Screamtown. Hopefully it'll do him some good."

The banshee takes your jar and puts it in a postal box before using her long fingernails to poke holes in the box so air could get in. You're banging on the jar and yelling angrily but it's of no use and you're soon shipped off on your way to Screamtown, grumbling all the way. At that time, Whitney and Xander decide to drive away. "I hope I'm not making a terrible mistake," says Whitney. "After all, Noreen is the most even tempered of the family. It shouldn't be a problem." "Relax Whitney," says Xander. "I would've suggested sending him to your folks." Xander then turns away before speaking under his breath. "But I would not wish Susan on my worst enemy." "What was that Xander?" "Oh, nothing dear."

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

It takes an entire day for the postal truck to get to Screamtown and you're gasping for air and starving. Screamtown must be really far away from Terrordale and Fearfield. Soon, your package is delivered and you're placed in a mailbox that looked like it had a door shaped like a skull. It isn't long until you hear the stomping footsteps of a particularly heavy monster, you're guessing Whitney's sister, Noreen. The door opens and reveals a thick skinned hand that appears to be wrapped in a black and dark pink fingerless glove that pulls your package out of the mailbox before taking you inside a Gothic looking house that looks like something out of a Tim Burton film.

The package opens up and you look around to see that the place looked darker and more goth like inside. The rug looked like a giant spider web and the windows appear to be painted a sickly green that made them look like they were even glowing. Up above there was even a chandelier complete with candles that looked like they had anguished faces on them. There was even a shelf that had some rather spooky looking stuffed animals on it, including a stuffed skeleton of an elephant. You then look up and see that sister that Whitney mentioned.

She looked shorter than her older sister, but not by much. Noreen had dark a lost blackish gray skin and long black hair. She was wearing black lipstick and mascara and a pair of earrings that looked like alien skulls. Body shape wise, Noreen was just as fat as her sister and had enormous breasts to match. From the looks of it, she was wearing a black Gothic lolita style outfit complete with a large skirt with purple highlights, dark colored fishnet stockings and a black choker with a silver cross attached to it. She also had a pierced navel.

Noreen looked at you with dull surprise before reading a note that Whitney left for her. "Dear Noreen, This man is Wade Wilson, a criminal form Under Gloom. You remember my friend, Destiny? She is at her wits end with this lout and I volunteered to take custody of him. Xander figured that the positive environment of Screamtown will do him some good. Be warned, Noreen, this is a very volatile, rude and overall annoying creature. Do not let him out of your sight. Signed, Whitney."

Noreen just rolled her eyes. 'Well that figures." Noreen lets you out of your jar and you give a glare. "Like I like this situation any better than you do, Shego!" "Well, at least somebody called me by the right name." Says the goth goddess. "Listen here, you sumo-sized goth pachyderm!" you yell rudely. "You don't scare me like Demona and Fox did." Noreen just raised an eyebrow before realizing who you were talking about. "You mean Destiny and my sister? You know, Whitney doesn't think much of human pop culture so you'd be wasting your breath with that one."

You blow out your tongues Noreen starts to walk away for something. As Noreen is walking away, you see her ass shaking and she was wearing blue panties with white ghost faces all around. You couldn't believe it. You didn't even get a rise out of her. You thought wererhinos were supposed to have hot tempers. You let out a scoff. You'll get out of here soon enough. No goth goliath was going to hold you.

Suddenly you grunt and look down to see you were being pulled by a strange blue vine of some kind that was covered in spikes. You turned your head and saw that the vine belonged to a giant potted plant with a large head that looked like a purple tulip with a large mouth that had two maws, several razor sharp teeth and a large green forked tongue. The plant lets out a shriek and you yell and try to get away. That thing was obviously a carnivorous plant.

But no matter how much you struggle, it's of no use as the plant pulls you closer towards its maw. But before it could eat you, Noreen returns with a water bottle and sprays the plant to make it let go. "Delirium," she says. "You're a naughty girl. Mr. Wade is our guest. You will treat him no different than any of our human friends in town." The plant lets out a slight purring growl as it pulls back its vines.

You just turn and glare at the rhino girl. "Your plant is mulch the next time it tries to chomp me." "You don't have to worry," says Noreen apathetically. "Delirium only eats bugs, lizards and the occasional fish. I have her on a strict human-free diet." You couldn't believe this. You were under the custody of a 950 foot tap gothic pachyderm who keeps a man-eating plant as a pet.

You look out the window and you're confused. Outside the trees are covered in brown, yellow, red and orange leaves as if it were autumn. "How long was I in that box?!" you yell. "It was Summer in Terrordale." "Screamtown is split into five parts," says Noreen as she sits down and rubs her belly button. "First is the center. The other four are split into Spring Street, Summer Side, Autumn Avenue and Winter Way. The town is split between the four seasons. Autumn is my favorite." "That's great," you say rudely, I trade prison for crazy town. That's when you let out a gag because Noreen grabs you and stuffs you into her belly button as you stand on the piercing. "What are you doing?" "Whitney told me not to let you out of my sight so I'm taking you with me on the town."

This was just terrific. Where was the goth colossus taking you as she walked out of the door?
15512222212.title: Screamtown Here I Come

155122222122.content:
As Noreen steps out her door, you see sights that appall you. Everywhere, there were humans and monsters getting along. There was a female mandrake who was taking a nap as human kids played in her branches and from the looks of it, she didn't seem to mind it. Then you turn your head to see a bench with a werewolf, a kitsune, an orthrus and a were jackal playing a card game and from the looks of it, the werejackal had a human woman on his shoulder, apparently his girlfriend.

You were thoroughly disgusted. After all, the ideas of humans and monsters getting along was sick and wrong. You almost throw up in Noreen's naval as she walks down the street stopping as a male were lizard teenager skates by with a human girl on his shoulder. Then you notice the number of monster women. It would seem that in Screamtown, female monsters came in two types; first were obese sumo sized woman, some of which even heavier looking than Noreen as seen with a weretiger woman who was dressed as a steam punk mechanic, complete with a plumber's crack. The other type of women were muscle-bound amazons that put the Hulk to shame as seen with a yellow skinned argus woman dressed in a police uniform.

As Noreen walks through the center of the town, you can make out the corners in the distance. One corner looked like it was in perpetual winter and there were even some vampires skating on the ice as a frost giantess policewoman was on patrol. Another corner looked like it was in permanent summer given the beach and the large number of monsters in swimsuits. You hated monsters but you couldn't help but stare at monster girls in bikinis. There was one blue grootslang that looked like she was even bigger than Clover and then you turn your head to see a mixed human monster family. The mother and the oldest daughter were hellhounds but the father and the other children of the family were humans. It made you sick just watching.

Then you looked ahead to see where Noreen was heading. It was a section of the town that was covered in flowers and trees, obviously that was the spring section of town. There was a giant green minotaur woman tending to the flowers and a purple lou carcolh woman (a dragon/snail hybrid) delivering mail. As Noreen entered Springtime Street, you hear church bells going off.

You look in horror because walking out of the church is a newlywed couple. The groom was a human but the bride was an obese, five headed and pale blue skinned hydra woman. You look in disgust as all five heads of the hydra bride kiss the human groom. "Ugh!" you yell. "What is wrong with people in this town?" you ask Noreen. "Why are there so many monster loving humans here?!" "Because in Screamtown," said Noreen. "Monsters are forbidden from eating and otherwise killing humans. One of my closest friends is a wereboar with a human son and husband." "A pig giantess?" you ask. "Figures that a Rocksteady like you would have a Bebop to waste oxygen with. What are we doing here anyway?"

"It's flu season." Says Noreen. You scoffed. "Do you have a section of town for that?" Noreen rolls her eyes. "Which is why we're both visiting Dr. Desdemona Weisman." "Whatever." You mutter. But suddenly you realize something. The thing about monsters is that their names are usually a clue to their species. A name like Desdemona Weisman, practically screamed "I'm a Gargoyle". "Oh, no freakin' way!" you yell. "She's a gargoyle, isn't she?" "Is that a problem?" asked Noreen.

"You're damn right it's a problem!" you yell. "I hate gargoyles! Of all monsters, they're the worst! I should know, a certain blue gargoyle makes my life a living hell every time she gets the chance!" "What's worse?" asked Noreen. "Grendel Flu or gargoyles? And F.W.I. Grendel Flu is no picnic for monsters, but it's even worse for humans." You stick out your tongue as Noreen walks into Dr. Weisman's office. You look forward to see a gargoyle woman refilling a syringe, most likely Dr. Weisman. Dr. Weisman was a pink skinned gargoyle who looked even bigger than Destiny and that was saying something. She was also incredibly ripped. You could still see she was a woman but she looked like she had more muscle on her body than the world's strongest human bodybuilder. Dr. Weisman also had long white hair reaching to her lower back.

Then she turned around and you look in surprise. Dr. Weisman's face didn't look like any other gargoyle you've seen. Unlike Destiny's more humanoid face, Dr. Weisman's mouth was a large pointed beak, just like Brooklyn.

"Oh," says the doctor. "Hello Shego, you're the first one in today. This calls for my special needle." Dr. Weisman reaches into her drawer and you look in horror as she takes out a large syringe that appears to have several spikes going down it. She injected the flu shot into Noreen's upper left arm. Noreen didn't seem in any pain as the jagged needle went in. You're guessing that was a special needle reserved for thick-skinned species of monsters such as wererhinos like Noreen.

That's when Dr. Weisman turned her head to face you. "What are you looking at, banana mouth!?" you yell rudely. Desdemona turns to Noreen who explains what was going on. "This is Wade, Dr. Weisman. Whitney sent him to me as a favor for Destiny." "Destiny?" asks Dr. Weisman with a groan. "You mean Destiny Sirtis. That grump. Mother Rigby, that woman is the biggest hothead I've ever met. I'm going to level with you, with her blood pressure, this woman should be dead. She's too stubborn to take time off from that terrible job of hers. One of these days, all that stress is going to eat her alive from the inside."

You let out a laugh but then Dr. Weisman looks down at you. "Take a picture, Lady Brooklyn, it will last longer." However, Dr. Weisman gives a smirk and takes out a human sized needle but it looks elongated and the tip looks slightly bent. You gasp and try to run but the gargoyle giantess pins you down with her thumb and injects the needle into your ass as you scream in absolute pain.

The doc lets out a laugh before pulling back the needle as Noreen smirks. "Like it? That's my special needle for patients who try my patience." "Screw you!" you yell. "Ouch!" Dr. Weisman laughs again as you shake your fist at her. Noreen takes you before walking out with you. "Thanks for the shots, Desdemona. I'll see you later."

You let out a grumble. "Who's the idiot who gave a gargoyle access to syringes. I'd like to shove that beak of hers in her ear." Noreen just lets out a sigh.

Where's the goth colossus going now?
155122222122.title: Dr. Weisman

choices: Maddie Spots You in the Batter
Maddie Doesn't See You and Bakes You into a Pie (Non-Fatal)
1551222221221.content:
"Well," says Noreen. "Since we had our shots, I feel like some maple bismarcks. I think that Maddie's place is open." You're too enraged to speak as you rub your backside. That shot hurt like hell. At least it wasn't filled with mutagen. Up ahead, Noreen is walking towards what looks like a monster bakery. From the looks of it the proprietress was a gorgon like Yuri. This gorgon girl was a chubby woman with purplish skin and lavender rattlesnake's for hair. She was wearing nothing more than an apron and a pair of sunglasses. However, unlike Yuri, this gorgon had no legs. Instead she had a thousand foot long lavender tail with a rattle at the end. From the looks of it, the gorgon woman was making a pie while there was a young human boy with dark colored hair and a slight scar on his cheek who appeared to be helping her.

"Human and monsters in harmony," you scoff. "Yeah right." Noreen ignores you and walks in the front door. The gorgon girl's snakes let out a hiss and clue the gorgon that she had a customer. "Oh," says the gorgon. "Hi, Shego. Who's your friend." "He isn't my friend," says Noreen. "My sister sent him to me." The human on the counter raises an eyebrow. "Your mom must be real desperate for you to get hitched." You just stick out your tongue. "Real desperate." "I just came in here for two-dozen maple bismarcks." Says Noreen. "Got it," says Maddie. "I just made a batch. Help yourself Noreen... I mean, Shego!"

The were rhino places you on Maddie's counter and goes to place the bismarcks in a box as the human man walks up to you. "I'm Rick." He says. "Big deal," you scoff. "Lardbutt over there told me that it was illegal for monsters to mistreat humans in this stupid town but here you are." "What do you mean?" asks Rick. "That big fat gorgon," you say. "Look at you, you're that snake butt's slave." Maddie's snake hair seems to hiss at you as Maddie is busy mixing pie batter. "I'm not Maddie's slave," says Rick. "I'm her employee. She pays me." "Yeah right," you scoff. "How could you work for that snake girl? The gorgon I know is a serial killer. One day your boss is going to chomp your bones." You grunt and hold your rear in pain. "Damn that pink gargoyle!"

"Desdemona?" asks Maddie. "Jeepers. I hope you behaved for my sister-in-law." "Sister-in-law?" you ask in surprise. "That's right," says Rick. "Maddie is married to Dr. Weisman's brother, Othello." "Does she have another brother named Iago?" you ask sarcastically. Rick shakes your head. "Boy, you sure as nasty. Someone like you should be in prison." You then punch Rick and knock him to the ground just as Maddie continued to stir her pie batter. You're about to storm off, but you trip on the rolling pin the gorgon girl left out and you yell.

You wind up falling into the batter just as Maddie is it into a pie tin. You try to scream but the batter gets in your mouth. It tastes so strange that you have no idea what's even in it. As you're gagging on the batter, Noreen is too busy putting together a box of bismarcks to notice you. To make matters worse, Maddie is taking out a pie crust. You really hope that stupid gorgon sees you.
1551222221221.title: To the Bakery

15512222212211.content:
As Maddie is about to put the crust on the pie, she spots you. "Oh my!" she yells. Maddie immediately plucks you out as you cough up some cream from the pie. "I'm going to sue you, you enormous snake bitch!" "Dude!" yells Rick. "What's your problem?! You're lucky Maddie noticed you before somebody ate you. At that moment, Noreen places two boxes of maple bismarcks on the table before she pays Maddie for them. "I'm really sorry about bringing him here," said Noreen. "He's kind of a pain in the ass." "I don't mind," said Maddie pointing to her tail. "I don't have an ass."

Noreen takes you and her bismarcks and leaves the bakery as you grumble. "That's a lot of bismarcks, fatass." "I'm a wererhinoceros," said Noreen. "We tend to have large appetites. You know, you were very rude towards Maddie in there." "Go to hell!" Noreen just rolled her eyes as she was walking back into Autumn Avenue. Along the way, she passes by an obese gray furred were cat in a gothic dress and ankh necklace with spiky orange hair. "Hi, Shego," she says in a Cajun accent. "Who's your friend?" "Not a friend, Crimson," said Noreen. "He's trouble. My sister sent him to me to do a favor for that hot-tempered gargoyle she's friends with." Crimson just blinks a few times. "Damn," she says. "I hope that Susan doesn't find out about this." "Blow me, Lady Garfield!" you yell out towards Crimson. This actually irritates Noreen as she was walking into a fish market.

"You've got a bad attitude, Wade," said Noreen. "Even if Scream Town is a much safer environment for humans than the rest of the monster world, you're seriously pushing your luck." "This town is a travesty," you say. "It's unnatural. Humans working for monsters, humans dating monsters, humans marrying monsters. This town should be destroyed." Noreen just lets out a snort of annoyance. "You know, a lot of these monsters even if they are friendly with humans, they're still carnivores so I'd watch it." You let out a scoff and notice that the proprietress of the fish market was a landshark girl resembling a megalodon with golden red hair. "Hey, Nami," says Noreen. "I'll just take some octopus." You give a gag. "Octopus? Rhinos don't eat fish." "It's not for me, Wade," says Noreen. "It's for Delirium. You rather I feed her, you?" You just give Noreen the finger, to Nami's surprise. "When did you start dating?" You give a gag at that thought.

Soon, Noreen walks out with her bismarcks and octopus as you're riding on her nose. As she walks by, she passes a magenta skinned mock turtle woman with a huge udder and reddish hair worn in a braided ponytail and a rather large shell on her back. You then turn your head to see another sight that disgusts you. There was a human young man proposing to his girlfriend, a titanic and obese Jersey Devil girl dressed in a gothic outfit with a pair of large horn-rimmed glasses. You're thoroughly disgusted. "Oh my gosh," said Noreen. "I had no idea that Leelee was getting engaged." "What kind of an idiot would marry a monster woman big enough to swallow him whole? First that pachydermic Fox sister of yours and now an entire town that shares her insanity." "It's perfectly legal for monsters to marry humans. Even in parts of the monster world where humans are normally considered food. One of my close friends has a human husband and stepson." You gag at that idea. "I would rather be dead than a monster's husband." You say.

Noreen pays you no heed and unlocks the door to her house, puts her bismarcks in the kitchen and then throws Delirium the octopus she bought and the greedy plant sucks it down. Noreen then looks and sees that she has a message on her answering machine. "Uh-oh, somebody must've called me when we were out." You couldn't care less, but Noreen presses the button on the answering machine and hears the message. "Hi, Sweetie," says a female voice. "Hope you don't mind, but your father and I are stopping over. Now that I'm off work for the summer, I've found some photographs of several eligible bachelors around Direopolis that I can't wait to introduce you to. Love you. See you soon." Noreen's eyes popped after hearing the message. "Oh hell." she groaned. From the context, that had to be Noreen and Whitney's mother on the phone. You remember, Susan Steranko, that green-skinned blonde Sumatran wererhinoceros from that photograph in Whitney's house.

Noreen let out a groan. "I take it you're not pleased that your old lady is coming." "Not in the least. She's always busting my ass to get married and become a mother." "Well, you definitely don't have to worry about that happening." You say smugly. Noreen gives a grunt but then she realizes that her mom was going to be here soon.
