"I definitely can't let Mom and Dad see you. With that, Noreen proceeds to shove you down into her panties and you gag as you’re pressed against her large and thick-skinned love tunnel. Before you can complain there’s a knock at the door. Noreen lets out a groan. “Better get this over with.” Noreen walks up to the door and in walks Susan, her mother. From the looks of it, Susan seems actually taller than Whitney that made her tower over Noreen. Ironic since the Sumatran rhinoceros is the smallest species of rhino. "Noreen!" yells Susan as she tightly hugs her daughter, unknowingly pushing you further into the tunnel. "How nice to see you again." "Hi, Mom." Says Noreen.

After Susan walks in, next comes her spriggan husband, Grayson. While Grayson was a giant monster himself, he was less than half Noreen's height to say nothing of how puny he was compared to Susan. "Hi, Dad." Says Noreen. Grayson doesn't say a word and just gestures a hello before he sits on the couch and snaps his finger to turn on the television. Susan lets out a sigh. "Looks like it's another three months before I can return to work," says Susan. "At least I don't have to worry about grading papers like those academic teachers. Now, Noreen, I'm sure there are a lot of eligible men, both monster and humans, if you're into that, in Screamtown, but you don't seem to be taking the bait. Which is why I figured that some men from Direopolis might be more your speed."

Noreen rolls her eyes. "This again, Mom?" "Well, it's not like I have any choice. Whitney is in a position where she wouldn't be able to take care of children and with Xander working from home, there's no way it will be changing anytime soon. Now, I've got a few men in mind." Susan then reaches into her cleavage for several photographs. "First I have a were hyena comedian I found at the club. I know it sounds desperate but we have to work our way up to the top. Next, I've found a kappa lumberjack who is looking for female companionship. Oh, before I forget, I've also found a young up and coming software businessman who would love to be a father." You can hear every word Susan says as you're stuck in Noreen's private area. No wonder Grayson didn't speak. He couldn't get a word in edgewise married to this windbag.

Noreen lets out a sigh. "Mom," she says. "This is getting out of hand. I'm not seeking a relationship right now." Susan let out a scoff. "You expect the Steranko bloodline to die out so easily? You already have one carnivorous plant as a pet. If you don't get a man soon, I promise you there will be more where Delirium came from. Delirium just gave a hiss at Susan's words as Noreen tried to ignore her. However, at that time you were fighting to keep from sinking any further down Noreen's tunnel and your movement irritates the goth giantess as she groans. "Noreen?" asks Susan. "What's wrong, baby?" Noreen groans and feels her snatch area. As Noreen is scratching, you grab onto one of her black fingernails and she accidentally pulls you out.

Noreen and Susan both look in surprise. "Noreen?" asks Susan. "Who is this." Noreen let out a groan. "Mom, this is Wade." Susan then stares at you. "What are you looking at, broccoli face?" "You dishonored my daughter." Susan then gives a smile. "Noreen, where did he come from?" Noreen groaned. "Whitney sent him. He's a criminal from Under Gloom she took off Destiny's hands and sent to me to keep him from driving her crazy." "Uh-huh," says Susan. "Good old Whitney. Always looking out for her little sister. At least that blue idiot friend of hers is good for something. Congratulations, Noreen. I'll make plans for the wedding right away." "WTF!" you yell.

Surprisingly, those words cause the stoic Grayson's eyes to pop out of his head.. “ARE YOU OUT OF YOUR ****ING MIND, WOMAN!? YOU’RE TRYING TO PUSH NOREEN DOWN THE ALTER WITH HIM!? THAT MAN IS A CRIMINAL FOR THE LOVE OF MAB!” “Grayson,” says Susan as she looks down and stares at her much shorter husband. “Don’t ruin this. This could be our last chance to be grandparents.” “Are you kidding me, Susan?! That guy is obviously a child hater and I’m pretty sure that he’s a woman hater too.” “You’re just being fickle. You weren’t that happy when Whitney married Xander.” “Xander may be a viper, but he’s a much more decent son-in-law than that racist ne’er-do-well.” Grayson then grunted because Susan grabbed him by the wings and lifted him up. “Grayson,” says Susan. “I think I know what I’m doing here.” “You never know what you’re doing, Susan! You never admit when you’re wrong and this is the most blatantly bad decision you’ve made in all the decades I’ve known you.” “You know, Grayson, I think I like you better when you’re quiet.” “You know what, Sue, fine! If you want to give away our youngest daughter to that... that... I can’t even think of a demeaning enough insult, than do it yourself. I would rather eat Castle Wyvern brick by brick than watch a doomed marriage be born.”

With that, Grayson angrily storms out of the house and slams the door. “At least somebody in this family has brains.” You mutter to yourself. Noreen just lets out a moan. "I hate mondays." She says. Susan is too too busy planning Noreen's wedding in her head to pay any head.
15512222212211.title: From Bad to Worse

choices: Continue Back with Wade and Noreen in Screamtown
Continue with Whitney and Xander on the Way to Screamtown
155122222122111.content:
This was the worst day of your life. Destiny's frustration with you led to her sending you to her friend who sent you to her younger sister and now their busybody mother caught you in the act and you were engaged to a fat skyscraper-sized pachyderm goth. But as bad as you were taking it, Whitney didn't like it any better. Susan had called her first born to tell her about the ceremony and Whitney reacted the way you'd expect as she was speaking with her mother on the phone.

"ARE YOU OUT OF YOUR ****ING MIND, MOTHER!?!" Whitney yells sounding a lot like her father. "WHAT THE *****ING SAM HILL ARE YOU ****ING THINKING!?" "Whitney," says Susan. "This is a happy moment. Your sister is finally getting married." "Mo-om! This is a very bad idea. You're hooking her up with a criminal! He set a woman on fire! Do you have any idea what he could do to Noreen!" "He's less than 150 times her size, Whitney. You're making a mountain out of a molehill. The wedding is this Friday and I expect you to come. Who knows? By this time, next year, you could be an aunt." "Are you even hearing yourself! You've made some seriously bad decisions in the past but this takes the cake! This guy hates monsters, he clearly hates women and I'm pretty sure that he hates kids. He's only going to make Noreen miserable." "You know, Whitney, you're being a hypocrite. Your husband is a human." "Xander has never been arrested! Xander has a job! Xander is nothing like that son of a bitch. If you think that I'm going to sit idly by as my sister marries a colossal jerk, you have another thing coming! Good night!"

Whitney slams the phone back on the receiver and then pushes it to the ground before stomping it to pieces as she lets out a slight yell and pulls on her hair. Xander is on the coffee table as he looks up at his skyscraper-sized wife. "Uh-oh," says Xander. "Susan must've really done something stupid this time." Whitney gives a groan. "My mother is setting up Noreen and Wade to get married." Xander gives a look of horror. "Good grief. Son-in-law to Susan Steranko. I wouldn't wish such a horrible fate on my worst enemy." Whitney then lowers her head and glares at Xander who looks up in fear at the rhinoceros woman clenching her teeth. "Brilliant idea sending Wade to Scream Town, Xanatos," says Whitney sarcastically in a vexed tone. "Now my kid sister is going to be married to a viper." "How was I supposed to know your mother was visiting," says Xander trying to hold off his wife's wrath. "I couldn't plan for this to happen." "And now my mother is planning my sister's doomsday. Considering who she's about to marry, I don't know whether to fit her for a wedding veil or a hangman's noose." Xander turned his head to whisper to himself "She's too heavy for a noose to work."

Whitney gives Xander a glare and is about to make another call, only to remember that she destroyed the phone and go into the cupboard to get a spare phone to hook up. Once she has it ready, she decides to call Destiny. At that time, your gargoyle nemesis was in the kitchen cooking hot dogs. “Hello?” asks Destiny as she answers the phone. “Destiny,” says Whitney. “Your trash is poisoning my family.” “Huh?” “I mailed that nasty piece of pest to my kid sister in Scream Town.” “What did Noreen do to you?” “Shut up and listen, you blue asshole! My mother was visiting and now she wants Wade and Noreen to get married.” Destiny actually drops the bun she was holding into the hot dog water before bursting into hysterical laughter. “Oh good,” she said. “I couldn’t think of a more fitting punishment if I tried. Wade hates monsters so much that the worst thing that could happen to him is to marry one.” Destiny keeps laughing but Whitney is not amused. “This isn’t funny, Destiny! That monster happens to be my little sister! I don’t want that creep driving Noreen crazy.” “Relax, Whitney,” said Destiny. “At least Noreen will show him who rules the roost.” “I can’t believe you! I hope you choke on those frankfurters, Dominique!” Destiny lets out a sigh and rolls her eyes. “The insult you’re looking for is Demona.” “I don’t care! I’m not taking this laying down!”

Whitney then hangs up and then grabs Xander as he grunts before shoving her tiny husband between her breasts. The rhino woman then takes out her cell phone. “Hello, Kaguya. Sorry, I’m gonna have to take a week off. I’ll explain later. For now, I have to save my sister from making a horrible mistake. Goodbye.” Whitney hangs up and stops out the door to turn her car on. “Whitney,” said Xander. “You forgot to turn off the lights.” Without even turning off the car, Whitney goes back in the house, shuts off the lights and then drives away to head to Scream Town.
155122222122111.title: Engaged for Disaster

choices: Noreen runs into someone along the way.
1551222221221111.content:
*THWACK, THWACK, THWACK* Noreen's head banged against the wall again and again, her horns scraping the black paint off as she pulled back. The wall was starting to show a dent, and the headbutts were making the punk band posters she had on the walls rustle. As you watched from your perch on a black-painted bedside table, you couldn't help but laugh at the scene she was making....even if you were in the same mess Noreen was.

Between impacts she ranted, "I! Can't! Believe! This! How can! Mother! Be this! Pigheaded?!" With one last *WHAM!*, harder than the ones before, she finally stops trying to give herself a concussion, resting her head against the wall with a sigh. "She just seizes on the first excuse to marry me off to some guy...was she even hearing Dad when he stormed out yesterday?! And just because she thinks I got 'dishonored'..."

You flinch at the memory of how Susan discovered you. "Not like you helped your case by shoving me in your snatch, Goth Green Giant! What did you THINK would happen when you pulled me out of that death pit in front of your mother?!"

"I thought about just shoving you in my pocket or sitting on you, but with your loud mouth I was worried you could still be heard," Noreen snarks, pulling her head back from the wall. "Besides, I had to think fast, and putting you...there...was all I could come up with. And seriously, 'Goth Green Giant'? What are you, twelve years old?"

You just stick your tongue out at that, making Noreen roll her eyes. Damn, this girl was hard to rile; you almost missed how easily you'd gotten Destiny to flip out with just her hated nickname. "Whatever...so why not just tell Mumsy you don't want to go through with this? I don't think even an idiot windbag like her could force you into a wedding." Under your breath you add, "Not like you'd ever get a boyfriend anyway."

A growl escapes the pachyderm giantess's maw at the insult towards her mother, but she quickly deadpans. "You think I haven't, Wilson? Every time she just shrugs it off: 'Oh, he'll change his attitude after the wedding!' or, 'If he causes trouble, you can just sit on him!'; and, 'Don't you know what a hellhole Under Gloom is? You're saving him!' UGH! It's like she's ignoring me completely! Even if she does see reason she'll just try and set me up with one of the guys on her hit-list."

You belt out an acidic laugh at that last one. Not only for Noreen's imitation of her mother being pitch-perfect--you almost suspected she was lip-syncing to some hidden recording--but for the idea of this stupid wedding being a relief from Under Gloom. Ha, yeah right! Stuck in this stupid town of idiots and married to this big green bint? It was even worse than prison! At least there none of the monsters pretended to be anything but the man-eating sadistic scum they were.

Suddenly a muffled beepbeepbeep starts up, making both you and Noreen flinch. She fishes her cell phone out from a pocket in her tight black pants and glances at the screen before sighing. "Aaaand now it's time to meet Mom and her friends at the dress shop. Of course it is. Come on, squirt." She thuds over to your perch and snatches you up between two fingers before you can protest, then tosses you between her colossal breasts as she makes her way out of the house.

Naturally, you let loose with a torrent of profanity and slurs. Words so horrible, so utterly hateful and vile....that somewhere in hell, Satan sharpens his pitchfork and politely addresses one of his minions: "Do me a favor and let me know when THAT guy gets here. I have a special eternal punishment in store for him."

Your unholy rant is cut off when Noreen suddenly squeezes her cleavage together, cutting off your air for a second and giving you a face/mouth full of rhino-boob. She looks down at you and scowls like she'd found gum on her shoe. "...For your sake, I hope Mother comes to her senses."
1551222221221111.title: The Odd (and Unwilling) Couple

15512222212211111.content:
The gray goth giantess walks out and begins to make her way towards the dress stop in Summer Side. As she is walking by, several people who know her walk out and seem to already know the news. The first is a giant cobalt-skinned wereboar. She resembled a titanically fat warthog with four tusks and long blonde hair. She looked like a porcine version of Storm and she smiled at Noreen. “Hello, Shego,” she says with an African accent and a snort. “I heard you were getting married this Friday.” Noreen gives a nervous smile. “You know how pushy my mom can be, Ororo.” “And I hear that it’s a human of all things. Good choice. I’ll see you at the ceremony.” The boar walks away and then another giant woman comes forward. This one is a huge pink mock turtle resembling a minotaur with a tortoise shell, long pink hair and a big udder. “Congratulations on getting hitched, Shego,” says the mock turtle once again calling Noreen by her nickname. “Please save me a slice of cake at the wedding.” As soon as that giantess has her back turned, you give her the finger. “How the **** do so many people know about the wedding so fast?” Noreen lets out a sigh. “Word travels fast in Screamtown. Especially when Mom is involved. Let’s just get this over with.”

Noreen soon reached a shop in Summer Side that read Urameshi Bridal and outside Susan was waiting with another monster. First of them was a bright blue-feathered stymphalian bird with bright green wings and aqua-colored. She was very obese and had a scar on the edge of her beak and resembled a macaw. “Oh, Noreen,” said Susan. “You’re here. You remember my old friend, Cotton don’t you.” Noreen smiles and waves her hand as the Stymphalian bird smiles at her. “You are very lucky, Noreen,” said Cotton. “Screamtown is the right place for a human-monster wedding. All of my children-in-law are humans.” You stick out your tongue. Cotton finally notices you and then bites her lip. “Of course, there’s no accounting for taste.” “Shut your beak, parrot-face.” You say rudely. “I’m not a parrot,” said Cotton. “I’m a Stymphalian bird. I just happen to look like a parrot.” Susan lets out a laugh. “Well, we mustn’t keep the bride and groom waiting. Into the shop.”

The proprietress of the bridal shop was that hellhound mother from the other day. You take a closer look and see that she is a very pear-shaped woman with dark red skin and a skull-like face with sharp teeth and purple-red hair reaching down to her huge butt. The hellhound lady turns and spots Susan and is surprised. “Susan?” she asks. “I didn’t know you were in town. How’s everything in Direopolis.” Susan let out a laugh. “Oh not much going on. Trini’s still working on that rocket she mentioned. In my opinion, it won’t get off the ground. But enough about her. Noreen is finally getting married.” “Oh!” yells the hellhound woman. “OMG! I can’t believe it. Who’s the lucky man?”

Susan snatches you out of her daughter’s dark gray cleavage and holds you up in front of the hellhound woman’s face. “What are you looking at, Skull-Face?!” you yell out rudely. The hellhound woman sounded shocked. “Really?” she asks. “That’s who Noreen is marrying?” Noreen lets out a sigh. “It was Mom’s idea, Mrs. Urameshi.” Mrs. Urameshi lets out a sigh. “Why am I not surprised.” Susan just snaps her fingers. “Enough with the chitchat. The wedding is on Friday and...” “Friday!? It’s only Tuesday!” Mrs. Urameshi then lets out a sigh, no doubt realizing how stubborn Susan was and gestured for Noreen to follow her to fit her for a wedding dress. “Why are you even bothering?” you grumble. “She’ll look butt ugly in anything you choose.” Mrs. Urameshi then snatches you up and places you on Noreen’s shoulder. Noreen gives a snort and then grunts as Mrs. Urameshi takes her measurements.

Before long, Noreen is fitted with a long white wedding dress decorated with jasmines and bows. Noreen is grunting because it's somewhat tight on her. "Now this one is a very popular dress style. I think the jasmines give it a nice touch." "Does it come in black?" asked Noreen under her breath. "It looks like ****." You say. In response, Mrs. Urameshi snatches you and ties you into a bow on the end of Noreen's tail. "There," said Mrs. Urameshi. "Doesn't that look nice." "I wouldn't know," you grunt. "All I can see is rhino butt."

Suddenly, there is a loud stomping and then Whitney storms in unexpectedly and gives an angry snort. "I thought I'd find you here already!" yells the white rhinoceros giantess. Susan gives a smile. "Good girl, Whitney. The wedding isn't until Friday and here's the best lady ready and..." "Have you flipped your lid?!" yells Whitney. "I've come to put a stop to this insanity!" Susan just rolls her eyes. "Whitney," she says. "Please, do not ruin this. Your little sister is finally getting married." Whitney slaps herself in the face and grumbles to herself.

Whitney then proceeds to stomp forward and sees you tied in the bow on her sister's tail. "You little creep!" yells Whitney. "Don't blame me, Fox Xanatos. It was your husband's bright idea to send me to this hellhole freak farm town and get me engaged to this walking tank." Noreen actually laughs at that Fox Xanatos comment but her sister is less than amused. "No. 1," says the albino rhinoceros. "I DO NOT look like Fox Xanatos! What exactly is the resemblance? No. 2, you will not hurt my kid sister in any way. No physical abuse, no verbal abuse. I sure as hell won't sit by and watch Noreen spend the rest of her life with an asshole." "Why not?" you ask. "She already has a rather large one."

Whitney snaps her jaw as her eyes glow red (though not as bright as Destiny's red eyes). "You listen here, shorty. I might not be able to stop this dangerous and doomed marriage, but I can promise you, if you so much as call Noreen "Fat", I can be the worst sister-in-law you can imagine! If you make Noreen miserable, I will make you miserable!" At that moment, Xander is in Whitney's ear and crawls deeper to speak with his wife. "I'm pretty sure Susan doesn't need any help making him miserable." "Shut up, Xander! Don't think I've forgotten whose fault this is!" Whitney then gestures that she's watching you and then walks out of the store. "If anybody needs me," says the rhino giantess. "I will be taking out my frustration with this bad situation on the nearest donut shop." Whitney slams the door on her own tail and then grunts in pain before opening the door, pulling the tail out and then slamming the door again. Susan shakes her head. "That girl has quite a temper on her. I think she's been hanging out with Destiny too long." Rangiku nods her head. “Now,” said Susan. “On with the show.” You let out a groan.

- - - - - - -

At that time in Direopolis, there were two teenage monster girls in a restaurant with a gothic loxodon in the background taking the order of a weredolphin dressed as a Texas Ranger. They consisted of a heavy hourglass-shaped Jersey Devil who looked like a pink and white striped quagga with talons for feet, fangs and leather wings who was chowing down on garlic pizza and her friend was a big butted nue with the limbs of a white tiger, a snake for a tail, the body of a tanuki, the face of a lemur and cheeks of a baboon who was stuffing her face with donuts as she sat in two chairs to hold up her rear. The Jersey devil girl was reading a letter of some sort and gasped. “Oh my gosh! Juliana! This is a letter from Coach Steranko.” The nue just waved her hand. “Scarlet, it’s Summer. Coach Steranko isn’t the big bossity boss of us until September. It’s junk mail.” “Juliana, it says here that the coach’s daughter is getting married. She’s invited our entire class and anyone in Direopolis we can find to the wedding.” Juliana jumps up and smiles. “Well what are we waiting for? Wedding means party and party means dancing! And the dancing queen of all nue booty is so okay with that! Elisabeth! Perry! Akira! Come here!” Scarlet gives a smirk. “I hope the reception dinner has garlic shrimp on the menu.”

- - - - - - -

At that time, you have had to sit through Noreen trying on dress after dress and were quickly losing patience. “Can’t we get out of here already! Just pick a stupid dress!” Mrs. Urameshi simply stared at Susan. “Susan,” she said. “I know I’m somebody who sells bridal gowns for a living, but I really don’t think that it’s such a good idea to let this marriage come to be.” “Rangiku,” said Susan. “Just be patient. When are we going to get a chance like this again?” Cotton just rolled her eyes. “Are you really sure you want them to have kids?” asked the bird giantess. “Wade would make an awful parent.” “Then I guess it’s a good thing that he’s the size of an insect then.” Rangiku let out a sigh. “Why do I have the feeling I’m going to regret this?”

The hellhound giantess then reached into her cleavage to take out a pair of photographs. "At least Noreen narrowed it down to two dresses." The first photograph depicted a black and dark navy blue bridal dress that came complete with a tiara that resembled a bat. The frills on the skirt resembled bat wings The second photograph depicted a white and hot pink dress with pink designs made to look like stains of blood, a veil and skirt that resembled a spider web and a pair of opera gloves in the same design. "Both look gorgeous," said Susan. "And I think I hear the bride coming out right now."

Now which dress did Noreen choose?
15512222212211111.title: Dressed for Disaster

155122222122111111.content:
You give a scoff. “Both dresses look like garbage to me.” Mrs. Urameshi just snorts. “Well,” she says. “She has to choose one so I can make a matching tuxedo for you. Noreen rolls her eyes and point to the blue dress. “Well,” she says. “I think I’ll go with blue, since that’s how I’m feeling. Besides, the bat tiara is a nice touch.” You roll your eyes as Susan claps her hands and laughs. Cotton even gives a thumbs up as well. “Exactly what I would’ve chosen.” Said Cotton. “Now that that’s out of the way,” says Susan as she takes out a cellphone and presses on the buttons with her enormous fat fingers. “It’s time to order the second thing that you can’t have a wedding without. The cake.” You stick out your tongue. “I’ll bet it will be made out of moss and fungus.” Noreen turns to face you. “Would you stop your complaining, your unwilling bride says to you. I’m in the same boat as you.”

- - -

Meanwhile, at the bakery, Maddie and Rick had put together a rather large dessert that appeared to be made of pastry balls piled into the shape of a cone and covered in a thick caramel and whipped cream. Maddie places a cherry on top and smiles. “That has got to be the best croquembouche we’ve ever met.” Rick nods his head. “It’s like Mt. Everest,” he says to his boss. “I didn’t even know what a croquembouche was.” It was at the moment that the phone rang. Maddie hissed and then she slithered up to the phone. While she isn’t looking, Rick takes out a tiny piece of the croquembouche, not enough to be missed, and pecks at it. The giant gorgon answers the phone with her enormous tail before speaking.

“Hello,” she says. “Maddie’s Bakery. What?! Oh my gosh! That’s incredible!” Rick out of curiosity jumps and grabs hold of Maddie’s shirt before sliding down her tail before climbing up the other side to reach his boss’s face. “Where’s the fire?” he asks. Maddie gives a gasp. “Fire?! Oh my gosh, did somebody’s house catch on fire!” Rick lets out a sigh. “Why me?” Susan on the other line lets out a sigh. “There’s no fire, Maddie. Rick. In case you’re listening. Noreen is getting married.” “What!?” yells Rick in surprise. “She is? Who is she marrying.” “Well,” says Susan. “He’s a little rough around the edges, but I’m sure Noreen will show Wade who rules the roost.” “Wade?!” yells Rick. “You mean that jerk that was here the other day is marrying Noreen? Susan, you can’t let her go through with that marriage. They’ll drive each other crazy.” Susan gave a scoff. “That’s what married couples are supposed to do. I’d think you’d be more open-minded seeing that your parents are a monster human couple.” “That’s different,” says Rick. “My dad is not a monster-hating piece of trash. He and mom were married by choice.”

Susan gives a snort from the other line. “I didn’t call for marriage advice, human,” says the rhinoceros matriarch. “I got enough of that from Whitney. You are a bakery aren’t you? I need you two to make a wedding cake, one big enough for the entire town.” “Oh my,” says Maddie. “That’s quite an order.” “Don’t forget, Maddie,” says Rick. “It’s Noreen who’s getting married. She’ll want black icing rather than white.” Maddie hisses and nods her head. “And I’ll be sure to ask my hubby to carve a the bride and groom to put on top. Of course, he’ll need a magnifying glass to make the decoration for the groom. Now, what type of cake? I know Noreen hates coconut. We actually have a special on two kinds of cakes.” Susan gives a blink on the other line. “And what cakes would those be?” Maddie paused and then placed Rick back on the table.

“I’ll give you the choice. Chiffon or Red Velvet.” Susan actually has to stop to think about what cake. “Hmm,” she says. “Both are good choices. I’ll ask the bride. Noreen, what type of cake do you want Maddie to make for the wedding.” Noreen lets out a sigh. “Well,” she thinks. “I already chose my noose, so I’ll choose my last meal.” Noreen then clears her throat and decides on...
155122222122111111.title: The Blue Dress

choices: A Harpy with the Face and Feathers of an Ancient Bird
A Winged Unicorn in a Sorceress's Gown
15512222212212.content:
Unfortunately, as Maddie puts the crust on top, she doesn't notice you and the big fat rattlesnake gorgon puts the pie in a giant oven and turns it on. You let out a yell and try to break out but the pie crust and the filling (that you can't identify) is too thick for you to burst out of. What's worse is that Noreen has already paid for her bismarcks and is leaving. The goth giantess rubs her chin before she speaks to herself. "Hmm," she says. "I can't help but feel as though I'm forgetting something." You try and scream as loud as you can as the pie gets hotter and you gasp and even grab yourself by the neck as you're choking. You're forced to eat some of the pie filling so you don't pass out. You can only hope that either that gorgon or the human working for her hear you.

Outside of the oven, Maddie is trying to stir another batter and throws in some raspberries that Rick hands her. "Hey, Maddie," says Rick. "Why don't we cook some elephant ears?" Maddie gives a look of surprise. "I don't think Josephine would appreciate that." "No, Maddie," says Rick. "I mean the pastry kind." "Oh," says the ditzy fat snake-tailed giantess. "That makes a lot more sense. I love elephant ears. Not so much the rest of the elephant. They give me indigestion." Rick shakes his head. It must not be easy working for such a ditz.

After an hour, Maddie takes the pie you're trapped in out of the oven and inside the pie, unbeknownst to her or Rick, you're panting and gasping for air. "I thought I was done for." You groan. Maddie puts the pie right next to another one on the table and sniffs it. "I must say, this is the best toadstool pie I've ever baked." You give a gag from inside the pie and your eyes water. "Toadstools!" you think. "I just ate a filling made out of toadstools!?" You hold your mouth but then you hear footsteps.

Into the bakery walks...
15512222212212.title: Eyes on the Pies

155122222122121.content:
You look out from a tight hole in the top of the pie, one too narrow for anyone to see you and you see that the customer that came into the bakery was a harpy, but not an ordinary one. She had a bestial-looking face with a large beak filled with sharp teeth and leather ears that looked like bat wings. Her skin was bright red and she had long blonde hair with multi-colored wings and tail feathers. She was very obese with a huge protruding stomach and a massive rear and her hands had sharp talons. The harpy giantess resembled an anthropomorphic archaeopteryx, a prehistoric bird that lived during the age of dinosaurs. She was wearing a black business suit and tie like the kind a lawyer would wear and she also had a pair of sunglasses that looked like they were clipped onto a regular pair of glasses. She stood 1200ft making her even taller than Destiny.

Rick seemed to recognize her as he ran up as the harpy lady came up to the table. "Hey, Mom," says Rick. "How did the case go?" You give a gasp. "Mom!?" you ask to yourself. "That harpy is his mother!? There's got to be a mistake. Monsters eat humans, they don't raise them!" The harpy lowers her head to get a good look at Rick before speaking. "Everything went well, as always." The harpy then picks Rick up and gives him a kiss before putting him back down on the table. "How are you and Pauline getting along?" "Great," says Rick. "We've got tickets to a Vienna concert that's going to happen in a few weeks." "Just don't stare at her too much. I don't want Pauline getting jealous. Besides, I don't think Vienna is into men." Rick's mother then notices the pie that you're in.

"Hmmm," says the giant harpy woman. "That's a very fine-looking toadstool pie. I think I'll take it. I promised I'd bring some of Screamtown's local cuisine back to the office." "Got it, Kate," says Maddie. "I'll put it in a box." You gasp as Maddie picks up the pie and puts it in a box as Rick's mother, who you know now is named Kate, pays for the pie before waving goodbye to her son and his boss and walking out with the pie, not knowing that you're inside of it. You begin to sweat. You don't know if this harpy eats humans or not. "Too bad Jake doesn't like toadstools," says Kate. "His distaste for monster food is why I'm so fat." Kate places the pie into her purse before opening up her wings and soaring into the sky thousands of feet into the air.

You look out and can see nothing but her bright colored wings and long blonde hair. She flies for what seems to be 2 hours before you hear what sounds like an airplane. Kate appears to be landing and you hear a loud splash as her talons land in the ocean and she's up to her knees in water. You look out from your pie prison and are in disbelief. You see the Golden Gate bridge in the distance and realize that this monster lady has arrived in San Francisco. Kate walks further and steps into the city from the ocean.

As Kate walks further into the city, dozens of humans run screaming at the sight of a giant harpy stomping down the street. Kate lets out an indignant groan. "Oh come on!" she shouts. "I've lived near this city for years! I don't even eat humans! You should be used to me by now!" Kate grumbles to herself as she lifts the shades off of her glasses. Then you hear another stomping and from the other side of the city comes another monster girl who was as big as Kate. She was an enormous silver-skinned kappa resembling an archelon, a giant prehistoric sea turtle. This turtle giantess had large fangs protruding from the sides of her mouth and medium length midnight-colored hair worn in a ponytail. She was very heavyset and had a double chin with colored blue lips and a small nose that looked almost human-like. All she wore for clothing was what looked like a lei. From the looks of it, she was a friend of Kate.

"Hey, Kate," says the kappa giantess. "You're back early." Kate lets out a sigh. "It was a pretty easy case, Leah." Leah gives a scoff. "Hello! Every case is an easy case for you! I had to work my shell off investigating for the last client I was assigned to. It turns out that somebody tried to hide the evidence underwater. Not very bright when the lawyer you're up against is a giant sea turtle." You give a growl from inside the pie. Kate and her friend were lawyers. You didn't like lawyers because you could never find one that would help you.

Leah then eyes the pie and licks her lips. "Is that one of Maddie's pies." Kate nods her head. "Super," says Leah. "Everyone else is busy with cases, but that doesn't mean we can't dig in." Kate and Leah stomp down the street and each one sits on top of a skyscraper as Kate holds out one of her sharp fingers to use as a makeshift knife. To your dismay, it's the pie piece you're trapped inside that is being taken out first. You let out a yell and fall back to see you were approaching a monster's mouth, but whose?
155122222122121.title: The Harpy and the Turtle

choices: She Does and Spits you Out
She Doesn't. Down Kate's Gullet You Go
1551222221221211.content:
You see that Kate has cut herself the first piece of pie and you were almost in her mouth. "Oh no!" you yell. "Wait, you stupid harpy! Don't!" But Kate doesn't hear you and takes the entire piece of pie into her mouth with one bite. You let out a yell as Kate's enormous sharp fangs tear into the pie and break the crust. You have to move to the side to avoid being crushed by oncoming fangs big enough to destroy cars. "I'll bet that stupid gorgon's stupid assistant never so this side of his so-called mother." You growl to yourself. "I hope you choke on me, you birdbrain!"

It appears that Kate didn't hear you and Leah is already chomping on some pie as Kate is moving around the pie in her mouth. "That's odd," thinks the harpy giantess to herself. "This pie doesn't have as much filling as Maddie's usual work. She has been putting on weight lately. Maybe she's been sneaking toadstools and not noticing it. She's not abusive to Rick but I wish my son's boss was much smarter. Ugh. This pie tastes a little gamey today. Perhaps I should've bought a cake, instead." Leah munched on the pie before speaking. "What's the matter, Kate? Got a frog in your throat?"

Kate didn't have a frog in her throat, but you were beginning to slip as the pie begun to slide down the harpy's football-sized tongue and towards her esophagus. Her uvula was in sight and you have to jump from bit to bit of the pie and begin to shout. "Hey, you idiot! You've got a human in your mouth, you mutant turkey! If you dare eat me, I swear I'll tie your intestines in a knot! Hello!? I know you can hear me!" But Kate doesn't hear you and you decide to take matters into your own hands. You look down to see the harpy giantess's tongue was enormous, thick like leather and appeared to be forked like that of a snake. You climb down and decide to bite Kate on the tongue.

But does Kate feel you?
1551222221221211.title: Mouth of the Archaeopteryx

choices: Her Oldest Sister, Laurel the Canary
Her Youngest Sister, Pele the Pelican
15512222212212111.content:
As you bite down on the archaeopteryx harpy's tongue, Kate grunts in pain and stops chewing her pie. "What the?" asks the 1200ft tall lawyer. Leah looks in confusion as Kate reaches into her mouth and pulls you out. "Took you long enough to feel me!" you yell." Kate lifts the clip on shades on her glasses to take a good look at you and is stunned at what she sees. "A human in the pie!? What kind of place is Maddie running? She's not a man-eater. It's not even cooked right." "Go blow it out your tail feathers, Big Bird!" you yell at Kate. Leah looks on in surprise. "Did he just insult you? To your face? He certainly is rude."

"Shut up!" you yell at Leah. "Your friend here almost ate me!" Leah grits her teeth. "Yeah, Kate. If he's going to be ungrateful, you should've just swallowed him. I know you don't eat humans but some of them just ask for it." "That's a laugh!" you yell before turning your attention back on Kate. "What's this I hear about you being that Rick idiot's mother. What kind of human has a literal harpy for a mom?! I'll bet you only took him in was because you were planning to stuff and eat him." Kate gives you a death glare and hisses, showing her sharp teeth and forked tongue. "I didn't adopt Rick, I gave birth to him."

You look in confusion and disgust. "What?! Are you saying that kid is half monster!? That's disgusting! How is such a horrible thing possible!" "If you must know," says Kate. "Harpies are all female, so we have no choice but to mate with other monsters or in my case, a human, in order to reproduce. Normally harpies only give birth to female offspring, but nature can have a strange sense of humor at times and I became the first harpy to lay an egg containing a human child." You stick out your tongue. "That's revolting. Who's the moron who married such an ugly prehistoric nightmare such as you." Kate is now furious. "I am really beginning to wish I ate you right now," says the giant harpy. "Wait, you look familiar. Aha! I knew it."

"What is it?" asks Leah. "This is that infamous man from the Van Nuys, Wade Wilson." "Who would name their son after Marvel Comics' favorite idiot?" Kate picks her teeth with a claw before speaking. "Apparently, his father had the same name and from what I hear, he was scum. Rotten apples don't fall far from the tree apparently, because this creep committed a terrible crime against monsters. He set a mummy on fire and traumatized her for afterlife. I hear he was sent to Under Gloom, which doesn't explain why he's in a pie." Leah shivered. "Under Gloom. Don't remind me. Warden Destiny hates you." Kate puts her shades back on before speaking. "Wardens and lawyers generally don't like each other. But that doesn't explain why Wade isn't in Under Gloom."

You scoff. "That blue temper tantrum reassigned me to a fat rhino version of Fox Xanatos who sent me to her stupid goth sister in some backwater town where monsters pretend to be more than the man eating scum they are. Then your mutant's air headed boss made me into a pie! Now I'm hear speaking with you!" Kate rolls her eyes. "You know," she says. "It's not wise to argue with a giant harpy. That's why I never had an attitude problem from Rick. Even as a child he knew better than to give me hell. But you, you are incorrigible. And you're not very bright. I happen to be the best monster lawyer in the human world. You might be in need of my help one day." You give a scoff. "When pigs fly." Leah growls.

"Kate," she says. "Sit on that punk. Grind him into powder!" Kate then gives a smirk. "I have a better punishment in mind. You know, Wade. I'm the oldest of 8 sisters." You give a scoff. "You mean that there are 7 harpies as ugly as you?" "Which is why," continues Kate. "I've decided that I'm going to have you as a means of rehabilitation, spend 7 days each with one of the 7. Believe me. They'll drive you crazy before you can. But who to give you to first?" Kate thinks hard before she comes up with a solution.

She decides to send you to...
15512222212212111.title: In Harpy's Hand

155122222122121111.content:
Kate gave a smirk. "I think my oldest sister will do with an audience." "Audience?" you ask. "What are you talking about." Leah spits out bits of pie as she hears what Kate has planned. "You're not talking about Laurel are you? Nobody deserves to be stuck with her." Kate lets out an evil sounding laugh. "This man does. 7 days with that canary is the worst punishment I can think of at the moment." Kate then walks away, leaving the humans below to run and avoid being stepped on. Except for one jerk who drives into Kate's foot and causes her pain. "Hey, bird butt! Get out of the way!" Kate in retaliation, picks up the man's car and places it on top of a skyscraper before walking away and then opening up her wings to fly away.

You're beginning to wonder what could be so bad about Laurel. Perhaps she was a horrifying tyrant who conquered an entire human country and tortured her subjects for fun. Maybe she was such kind of gourmet who loves to fill her belly with people like you. Or perhaps she was another lawyer. You're wondering exactly what you're up against. Kate soon arrives near New York and lands right next to the Statue of Liberty. The passersby look up at her but instead of being afraid, they all groan. "Oh no," says one young woman. "Not another one." "I heard that she had sisters." "The last thing that we need around here is a duet." "I wouldn't mind if she came to eat us, as long as she doesn't sing."

You're confused at first but then you hear a strange sound that causes everyone in the city to hold their ears in pain. Kate herself takes out a pair of earmuffs and puts them on. It sounded as if somebody was singing the song "Dead Man's Party" horribly, horribly off key. The sound is so painful that you scream and hold your ears. "What is that awful noise?!" "Laurel is a canary harpy. Canaries sing." "Singing?! That's not singing! It sounds like somebody is strangling a moose!" You hold your ears in pain as Kate walks through the water and makes her way towards an island with a giant woman's house that was painted in bright colors that made it look like it came out of an 80s video. Inside, the house there was a shelf of records and a record that was playing. There were posters of 80s movies and rock bands on the walls and there was even a stack of pet rocks laid out on a coffee table.

Laurel was singing (if you could call it that) to a record playing Kid Video music. From the looks of it, Laurel was a very fat and bottom heavy harpy with the wings of a canary, tanned skin and platinum blonde hair. She wore a black unitard with gray leg warmers, making her look like Black Canary. Her warbling filled the air and made you wish you were dead as Kate entered the house and then waved at her sister. "Katie!" yells Laurel as she stops singing and hugs her sister. "How are you, Big Sister? Where's Jake and Rick?" "I didn't bring them," says Kate. "But I did bring somebody to act as an audience for your musical talents."

Laurel gives a squeal as she looks down at you. "Cutie." She says. You give a glare at Kate. "Take me back to Under Gloom," you mutter. "That singing is more evil than any torture that Demona could come up with." Kate gives a smirk. "Believe me, Wade, if anyone deserves this, it's you." Kate places you on the table and then runs out as fast as she can to get away from her sister's singing." Laurel tuns off her record player and then walks up to a nickelodeon before taking out a nickel and going through the songs. "Now," she says. "My little karaoke machine, which gem from the 80s should I sing first for my guest. Whatever it will be, it must be truly, truly, truly outrageous." The harpy laughs as you try to get away. Unfortunately, Laurel anticipates this and places a glass over you.

"I hope this glass is soundproof." You say. At that moment, Laurel's machine picks a song for her to sing.
155122222122121111.title: Laurel the Canary

choices: Pele Puts On Her Diving Suit
155122222122121112.content:
Kate gives a smirk. "I think I'll take you to meet my youngest sister, Pele Rowling. I hope you can swim." You give a look of confusion before Kate stuffs you into her purse before she opens her wings and flies up into the air. Along the way, she drops feathers as big as buses, forcing traffic to a halt. One man in a car shakes his fist at Kate as she flies away. You give a growl. First Destiny hands you over to Whitney who delegates you to her sister Noreen in Screamtown who then leaves you behind at a bakery where you are made into a pie and bought by this fat archaeopteryx and now she was going to send you to one of her sisters.

"Great," you mutter. "Another archaeopteryx." "Pele isn't an archaeopteryx like me," says Kate. "She's a pelican harpy. Funny thing about harpies, our genes have a good memory. The daughter won't necessarily be the same type of bird as her mother. Our own mother is a robin harpy." You roll your eyes. "By the way," says Kate. "Pele suffers from Glutos Syndrome, so don't you dare make fun of her." "Glutos Syndrome?" "It's a condition that only female monsters get. It causes their butts to grow to an immense size that dwarfs the rest of them. It's not contagious but it can't be cured." You stick out your tongue.

Kate flies over the ocean and sure enough, she arrives at what looks like a gigantic yellow houseboat that had a metallic hull. There was a mailbox at the side that was shaped like a pelican's mouth and what looked like a satellite dish on the top of the boat. It looked like a floating mansion. "That's where she lives?" you ask. Kate nods her head. "Pele is a diver by profession. Sometimes she finds buried treasure under the ocean." You give an evil smirk. If you play your cards right, you might to be able to milk this harpy for all she was worth.

On the inside of the houseboat, Kate was in the kitchen cooking an eel that was bigger than a blue whale in a skillet. Pele was a pelican harpy with long aquamarine hair and the face of a pelican with an enormous blue beak. She had white wings with blue spots and blue webbed talons for feet True to Kate's words, her butt was so big that it look up most of her back and was almost touching her neck. She had the radio on as she was cooking and swaying to the beat right before Kate came in and turned the music off, startling her as she turns around, sitting on the stove in the process and burning her buns, causing her to jump forward and squawk. "Kate?" asks Pele. "What a surprise."

As Kate hugs her sister, you look around and see that Pele had quite an opulent looking home. There were several expensive paintings hanging on the wall and a display case of all sorts of treasures including among other things, a shield made out of orichalchum, a golden dagger, a tiara shaped like a pair of dolphins and what appeared to be a black pearl that would be the size of a beach ball at human scale. The diving business must've paid off because this pelican girl was loaded. Perhaps it might pay to be nice for now. You then grunt as Kate grabs you and takes you out of her purse to show you to Pele.

"Pele," she says. "This is Wade. I've arranged for him to spend 7 days with each of my younger sisters and decided to start with the baby of the family, namely, you. After he's served his purpose, you can send him to Shanta. But for now, he'll assist you in your work." Pele picks you up and holds you in front of her beak as she squats down to rest her rear on the floor. "Hello," you say faking being sweet. "You must be Pele. Beautiful name for someone with the figure of a goddess. That is a lovely hair color. Is it natural? What a coincidence, pelicans happen to be my favorite animal." Kate gives a glare because she knows what you're up to and doesn't appreciate it. Pele however, doesn't notice your ulterior motives and just laughs. "Nice try, casanova," says the pelican harpy as she lifts her enormous webbed foot and shows an engagement ring on one of her talons. "But I just got engaged. My boyfriend and I are getting married as soon as the wedding dress is ready. It will be a while."

Kate nods her head. "I'll just leave you two alone." Kate flies off and Pele places you on the table before she takes out the eel from her skillet and places it on a plate before cutting it. "So," you say as Pele hands you a piece of eel. "You sure have a lot of valuable stuff here." Pele shrugs her shoulders as she plunks down in five chairs at once. "You never know what you'll find underwater. I'm a treasure hunter by profession. Some of the treasures I keep, some I sell to museums or collectors. Sometimes its not exactly valuables. Sometimes it's just a matter of photographing rare fish, mining rare minerals, harvesting deep sea plants. It keeps me busy."

You bite into a piece of eel and gag right before Pele swallows her eel with one gulp. She seemed friendly enough. Or gullible. Whatever worked for you. If you played your cards right, you figured you could escape and steal something valuable from her house boat. It was at that moment.
155122222122121112.title: Pele the Pelican

1551222221221211121.content:
Pele looked at her clock and gasped. "Oh! Time already?" She said. Then she got up and ran to another part of the boathouse as fast as her giant ass could take her.

You just stared. What was she in a hurry for? It didn't matter, though. Now you were alone with all this priceless loot. You looked around to see what was small enough for you to take. Before you could decide though, Pele came stomping back.

Somehow, in the short time she had left, she had changed into a black, high-tech diving suit with an odd looking mask. You snickered as you saw the suit was extremely tight around her gigantic rear.

"Well, I'm all set. I've got a dive to do. There's a pirate shipwreck a couple miles out loaded with treasure." Pele said.

Your eyes lit up. Maybe you could get this harpy to take you with her. You could take some of the loot out from under her nose.

"Why don't you let me go with you?" You say, in a fake nice voice. "I could squeeze into cracks you couldn't."

Pele thinks for a moment, then decides...
1551222221221211121.title: Off to a Dive

choices: You Make it to the Kitchen
15513.content:
As Destiny keeps on flapping, you hang on tight to her skirt, but the wind is too strong. But when it looks like you'd fly off and then fall to your death, you see Destiny's pinkish red hair flowing in the wind above you and get an idea. You grab the hair and start to climb. Miraculously Destiny didn't notice you. As you're snickering to yourself about the irony of the situation, you grab hold of a gray hair, Destiny's been getting a lot of them since you came to Under Gloom. Maybe all that stress you throw her way will give her a heart attack. Wouldn't that be wonderful.

However, you feel wind on you and look up to see that Destiny was flapping her wings harder and flying downwards. She flew over several skyscrapers as she was making her way to the street where she spotted what appeared to be an old clock tower. Destiny nods her head and flies closer towards the the side of the tower and you reveal that surprisingly the tower looked like it had been modified into a small house. Looked sort of gothic in appearance, was this her place?

You were about to get your answer because Destiny walked right up to the door and knocked on it. You climbed up and stood on the back of her bra to maintain your footing. You took it this far and couldn't afford to let that big blue bitch find you now or you're dead meat. Sure enough the door opens up and another gargoyle walks out, as tall as Destiny. Except this gargoyle was considerably younger. She looked similar to Destiny except for her indigo skin and the fact that her horns were smaller, almost underdeveloped looking. The younger gargoyle was heavyset in appearance in contrast to Destiny's hourglass figure and had brownish blonde hair rather than Destiny's pinkish red hair.

The younger gargoyle smiles at Destiny and gestures to her to come in. "Hi Mom." She says. "Mom?!" you wonder to yourself. "That must've been Fate." Destiny actually smiles herself as she kisses her daughter and walks in. You didn't think the old bat was capable of smiling.

"You've lost weight since the last time I saw you Fate," says Destiny. "Just don't go overboard." As you hang on tight to Destiny's hair, you hold your ears because the sounds of grinding gears filled the air. How could anyone stand living in a clock tower?

"Well," says Fate as she scratches her large stomach. "I see you're finally listening to the doctor." Destiny lets out a scoff and crosses her arms. "What does he know? If you hadn't given me hell about it, I would've never agreed to this." Fate crosses her arms and gives her mom a glare. "Well can you blame me? Since I hatched I can't remember a time when you took a day off from work. No one needs a vacation more than you." Destiny sticks out her tongue. Even when she's off work, that gargoyle is the most stubborn bitch you've ever met.

"Don't poke the bear Fate," says Destiny. "Ever second that two-faced viper Belladonna is in charge worries me." "Then why did you put that bitch in charge? She's after your job." "What choice did I have Fate? She's the only one even remotely qualified to be my successor." Fate gives a smug smile. "Successor? That won't be necessary. There's no way you'll willingly retire and you're much too stubborn to die." Destiny slightly scoffs at her daughter's joke.

Fate realizes that her mom isn't exactly in the mood for humor and lets out a sigh. "Perhaps some tea will put you in a better mood." As Fate heads into the kitchen, you get a good look at her and you're surprised. Aside from the colors of her skin and hair and obviously her weight... no way. How ironic given your nickname for Destiny. It was outright hilarious. Except that in this case they're on the same side. Better be careful, Fate could be just as nasty as Destiny.

Speaking of which, you turn your head and gasp because you see Destiny's blue, claw covered hand coming forward. You get out of the way as the warden scratches her neck and nearly feels you. If Destiny caught you out of Under Gloom, she'll hit the ceiling. You fall back on the top of Fate's couch and then make a run for the end to climb to the floor. As you pant to yourself, Destiny's ear twitched. "What the hell was that noise?" she asks. "A mouse running up the clock?" As Destiny turns her head, you hide under the couch.

That was too close, your most hated enemy almost saw you and you were in her daughter's house. If either of them saw you, it was game over. Destiny was going to check under the couch, but Fate saw what she was doing just as she put the kettle on. "Mother!" she yells out in an annoyed tone. "Relax. What is wrong with you." "Uh nothing sweetie," says Destiny. "I just thought I heard Wade. That man is the bane of my existence. Making a mockery of the justice system, attempted breakouts, calling me Demona! I've never had a more troublesome inmate in all my years of security. If he was a monster, I'd strangle him."

While she's ranting, you secretly give Destiny the middle finger. "Up yours Demona," you say. "You're in for a rude awakening once your "vacation" is over. I'll be long gone jerk face." Wait, now's not the time to be insulting Destiny. If she or Ang...er Fate saw you, you'd be back to Under Gloom, or worse. Destiny calms down and sits on the couch as Fate shakes her head. "I better get dinner ready. You're still on edge. It's always Wade this or Wade that. If you hate him so much, why don't you just squish him?" It shocked you that the nicer of the two gargoyles casually suggested killing you.

You definitely had to get out of this place. That's when you look forward and notice a back door in Fate's kitchen. If you could make it, you were home free. Of course, that would involve being in Destiny's line of sight. You were playing with dynamite today boy. But no matter, you inhale deeply as Destiny tries to calm herself by reading the newspaper and prepare to run for it. In an instant, you zip out from under the couch towards the kitchen, hoping for the best.
15513.title: Destiny and Fate

155131.content:
By some miracle you managed to reach the kitchen before Destiny could turn her eyes away from the paper. When it looks like Destiny is about to spot you, you duck to the side before she could realize what happened. "What was that?!" she yells. Fate at the time is busy with the oven when she hears her mother calling. "What was what?" "I-I thought I saw W-Wade." Fate rolls her eyes and lets out a groan.

"Mom," she says. "Relax. Wade is locked up in Under Gloom." The younger gargoyle shakes her head before she puts a pasta pot on the oven and starts to boil water. "She's getting worse. That Wade is going to put her in the K.D.P. if this keeps up."

On the ground, you're forced to roll out of the way just as Fate is about to step on you. You look up and have to cover your eyes as you gaze upon the biggest pair of panties you've ever seen. You shudder and avert your eyes, but you got enough of a glance to see Fate's tight black panties that looked like dental floss against her purplish skin. You feel like washing your eyes out given that was Destiny's daughter.

But you couldn't think of that right now, while Fate is busy chopping vegetables, you have to think of a way to get out of there As you ponder to yourself, you see an open window and there was a large tomato plant right next to it. "Perfect." You say as you rub your hands. While Fate is busy with some peppers and humming to herself, you make your way to the plant and jump up to grab a leaf to climb. As you look up the stem, you see that the plant is just tall enough to reach the open window. Soon you'd be out of there and neither Destiny or her daughter would be the wiser.

But you hear rumbling and hide behind the plant on top of a particularly large tomato. It would seem fate isn't on your side today (Literally) because Fate walks right up to the window. "Jalapeño," the overweight gargoyle curses. "I've got to remember to keep this window closed. It could let in those blasted pigeons." With that your window of opportunity is closed (again literally) and you groan to yourself and grab hold of your hair. Fate just ruined your escape attempt. You were starting to hate her as much as you hate her mom.

Just when you think things couldn't get any worse, Fate turns to her tomato plant. "Oh good," she says. "They're just ripe enough." Fate reaches down and you begin to sweat because she's obviously decided to make tomato salad. If she saw you you're through.

Just then, Fate grabs....
155131.title: Fate's Kitchen

choices: Fate takes you to work with her
Fate leaves and Destiny enters the kitchen
1551311.content:
Fate reaches down and you begin to sweat because she's obviously decided to make tomato salad. If she saw you you're through. Just then, Fate grabbed the tomato you were on and as she lifted it up, you lost your balance and fell off it and headed head-first towards the floor. As you fell, you shut your eyes you couldn't believe this! You were gonna die like this! A bitter smirk made its way to your face...at least you weren't rotting in a prison cell.

Suddenly the fall stopped abruptly and you landed with a WHAP! onto something large and warm...felt like skin.

Wait a minute! You open your eyes and look up. You were resting in the palm of a hand...no a claw! and you look up to see who held you and you saw it was Fate. She'd caught you before you'd splattered on the ground. She raised you to her face and studied you.
"A human?" she asked, as she carefully lowered to to her counter. "Who are you and how'd you get in my house?" she asked.

"David Xanatos" you said, saying the first name that popped into your head as you looked at this Angela look-alike.

Fate did something that shocked you at the false name: she giggled!

"You're kidding!" she laughed.

As a matter of fact, you were. But she didn't need to know that. You shook your head no at her question. "Least I don't have a beard...the multi-billion cooperation would be nice though..." you joke.

She laughed again. "Very! So...just how did you get into my place?" the gargoyle giantess asked, still smiling.

"Long story, monster-sized pidgions...please don't ask. Thanks for catching me from that fall."

Fate nodded at that "Welcome." She said before studying you a bit. "You know...if you're worried about things like that, my mom could probably help you, seeing as she's in law enforcement. She's here now, if you'd like me to take you to her. But she's really stressed out because of her job...some guy named Wade..."

"No!" you shout quickly, you couldn't let Destiny find you. Fate raises a brow and looks at you and you realize you need to cover your tracks, "Er...a stressed-looking gargoyle muttering about humans is your mom? Given her mindset right now, she'd probably think I'm this "Wade" guy she's complaining about."

Fate sighed and shook her head "...I can believe that, David. Wade's got my mom half-dead from stress."

Half-dead? Good!

Fate looked in the direction of the living room, looking worried. "You know, I hear this Wade guy is a real piece of work. It's lucky for him that Mom and I like humans."

"Yeah right," you think.

"...He'd be dead otherwise. But what I don't get is WHY this Wade guy hates monsters so much? We're not all bad. It varies with us as much as it dose with humans...why the grudge?" Fate was pretty much talking to herself at this point, but you still heard her. With how she looked and what she was saying, she really did resemble Angela. It made you wonder (in spite of yourself) if her dad had a personality like Goliath or one like Thailog...personally you were hoping for Goliath, but oh, wouldn't that be ironic!

As you thought about that, You find yourself looking at the young gargoyle girl, you'd say in her twenties (though you knew absolutely nothing about how long monsters lived). She was the same size as Destiny and looked like her in the face except she had purple skin, long brownish black hair and smaller horns than Destiny's.

"Look, I get it somewhat: he's a prisoner, she's the warden. They're not supposed to be on good terms, but why's he so out to get my mom killed by her stress? The break-outs are bad enough, but come on! Calling her that! Demona! Wade's not the first person to compare my mom to that fictitious maniac. Apparently they didn't know real gargoyles actually existed and happened to design a villain who turned out to look almost identical to somebody who was nothing like her personality wise. It wasn't very funny. Do you have any idea how humiliating it is to know you look just like a cartoon villain? The closest thing to mom's current level of anger is a crocodile with a toothache being repeatedly poked in the eye with a stick."

Fate turned to you, "David...you're human. Any ideas about this?" she asked, making you want to laugh. She was talking to the one who was making her mother so mad and didn't even know it! You shrug "Can't tell you what goes on in someone else's head." it was weird talking about yourself in the third person, but you couldn't drop the act.

She sighed and looked at you apologetically, "Right...sorry." she smiled at you. "Sorry...never really talked to a guy before." she sounded somewhat embarrassed.

"Huh? Why not?" you asked.

Fate rolled her eyes in exasperation, "Mom." she said as if that summed up everything. Guess the blue bat is just as overprotective with Fate as she is nasty to you. She clapped her hands as if she just remembered something.

"Ho, right...the Jalapeño tomato salad...need to finish that. Sorry for the sidetrack there, but I need to finish this first. Sorry David." she said and then went back to her cooking. As she did that, you look around for another exit besides the window that you could use since you were on the counter.

No luck. There wasn't one. Damn!

As Fate finished up the food, she pulled out something the size of a button, a human-sized plate, and set it in front of you and poured some of the freshly-made meal into it. You look at it, then up at her, confused.

"You did arrive in time for dinner, David," she told you, "if I can't at least introduce you and mom, I can at least offer my hospitality to you." Fate smiled.

You nod and thank her. Hey, it's better than prison food. You let the meal cool off as Fate loaded up two plates for her and Destiny, then took them out to her mom while you ate. Had to admit, Fate was a good cook. After a while, your hostess arrived and placed the dishes in the sink.

"Enjoyed it?" she asked.

You nodded.

Fate nodded, pleased with the news. Then her eyes brightened as if she had just thought of something. "Hey David, I need to head to work soon."

Ok. What did that have to dooo...OH SHIT! If Fate left, you'd be stuck here with Destiny! Not good!

Fate nodded at your look of panic, figuring out what you did. "Yeah, mom'lol loose it if she finds a guy in my house, but don't worry."
1551311.title: A kind Fate

choices: She Recognizes You and Freaks Out
15513111.content:
Fate tells you her plan. As much as you hated to do it, you had to accompany her to work. Sure, she didn't know you were the Wade Wilson who was causing her mother so much stress and it was kinda funny that the eggplant skinned marshmallow believed your lie about being David Xanatos, but being that close to your most hated enemy's daughter creeped you out.

You waited in the kitchen for Fate to get dressed for work, being sure to keep an eye out for Destiny. You don't know how she feels about Xanatos but you definitely know how she feels about you and would skin you alive if she caught you in her daughter's home. You hear tremors and hide behind a saltshaker before you see it was Fate entering the kitchen again. You look and see that she appears to be wearing a black shirt and pants like a security guard would wear complete with the cap and what looked like a taser and communicator in her belt. You look up at her name tag and it reads "Security, Fate Sirtis", making you laugh. Until now you had never heard Destiny's surname and oh the delicious irony.

"Listen, David," says Fate. "Mom won't like it if she sees a guy in my house, so I have no choice but to bring you to work with me." You roll your eyes. But then you realize that you could always ditch the gargoyle giantess and make a break for it first chance you got. "Proceed." You say. That was when Fate snatches you up and shoves you into her cleavage as you grunt. She shoves you in extra deep so there'd be no way Destiny would see you. You couldn't believe it, trapped between the boobs of your enemy's daughter. How humiliating."

Outside, Fate is getting ready to leave and her mother stands up. "I wish you didn't have a job where you had to work so late at night." "Mom," says Fate. "We're gargoyles. We're supposed to active at night. Some idiots probably think we spend the whole day as immobile rock." Fate lets out a laugh at that joke but Destiny isn't laughing. "Just, please be careful. You and that lamebrain friend of yours, Beth, are the only guards at the Daily Tombstone." "Don't worry, Mom. I'll be back home before you know it. Make yourself at home, relax and above all, don't think about Wade." Fate kisses her mother before walking out of the clock tower and spreading her wings to fly away carrying you between her breasts.

You finally surface and inhaled deeply as you grabbed your tongue. Your mouth tasted like gargoyle sweat. "Sorry about that," says Fate. "But you have to stay there until we land, David." You let out a laugh to yourself. The flying purple blob didn't know it, but she was about to help you escape. "So," you say. "What's your father like A... er... Fate." "Heck if I know," says Fate. "I never met him. He and Mom weren't even married and he headed for the hills the moment he realized she was pregnant." "Sounds like the sap grew a brain." You thought to yourself. You can't help but wonder where the blockhead was now. Probably having the time of his life without Big Blue to worry about.

Soon Fate arrived at her destination and you look up to see that it was an office building with the symbol of a gravestone on the side that appeared to have a bugle imprinted on it. "This is it," said Fate as she took you out and placed you on her shoulder. "The Daily Tombstone." "A newspaper?" you ask. "Doesn't sound too exciting. Why would they need a guard?" "Believe me," says Fate. "It's a cutthroat business. Just last year, I found out a leprechaun intern we hired was actually a spy trying to steal our byline. She wasn't feeling that lucky afterwards." Fate let out a giggle to herself at that joke. "However, I have to warn you Mr. X, there are a few monster girls you should avoid. The first is Grace Bass, a werecheetah who is the food critic." "So?" you ask. "Do you have any idea how many restaurants in Fearfield have humans on the menu." That was a good point.

"The next monster you have to avoid at all costs is Aurelia, a werejackal that works as the handy woman around here. She'd love to chomp your bones. I know her personally since her wife works for my mom; she's married to a rather nasty hyena." Your eyes pop at that thought. "Cree's married?!" you think to yourself. Huh, a jackal and hyena couple. This is getting more and more ironic.

"Especially beware of Ari," says Fate. "The meanest were sheep I've ever seen." You let out a laugh at that. Werewolves, werehyenas and werebears were something to worry about, but a sheep? What's she gonna do? Wool you to death? "Don't laugh, David," says Fate. "Weresheep are one of the top ten most predatory monsters in the world. The humans Ari doesn't see as food, she sees as slaves. It disgusts me. Above all, I want you to stay away from my boss, Lexi." "What is she?" you ask sarcastically. "A werehamster?" Fate gives you a dead serious look. "Lexi's a sphinx. If she catches you, you'll have to prove you're David Xanatos, because if you can't answer her riddle correctly, you'll get a full tour of a winged lioness."

This was terrific. You grab your hair. Escaping from this dump would be harder than you thought with at least four predators to worry about. But at least it was better than Under Gloom. Fate walks into the building's garage with you on her shoulder and the first monster you see is a fat yellow orange furred wereboar girl in black leather polishing a motorcycle with a warthog's head at the front. "Harley?" asks Fate. "What are you doing here? I thought your shift was over hours ago."

Harley, the wereboar girl, lets out a snort before answering Fate. "Emma asked me to give her a ride home," says Harley in what sounds like a Brazilian accent. "Her license was revoked." "Big surprise." Says Fate sarcastically. As Fate walks forward, a were bear approaches her. This bear was as big as Ursula but unlike Ursula, she was a polar bear and had blonde hair. The way she was dressed she looked like a furry version of Emma Frost. "Hi Emma." Says Fate. Emma squints slightly and smiles. "Oh, hey Fate." Emma walks up to a potted palm tree and tapped it. "Come on, Harley," she says. "I'd like to go home some time tonight." You look in confusion.

"Emma's blind as a bat," says Fate. "And yet she refuses to wear glasses." You can't blame the arctic fleabag. You didn't like the idea of looking like a nerd any better than she did. That was when you hear stomping and soon Fate finds herself face to face with a chalk white skinned vampiress, pear shaped in appearance with long blonde hair. She was wearing purple jeans that were tight on her fat ass and a bat girl T-shirt. You look up and gag. One side of her face was hideously scarred with charred skin, exposed muscular tissue and missing lips. It looked like half her face was made out of rancid bacon. It makes you want to vomit.

"Blind as a bat!?" yells the vampiress. "Are you implying I need glasses Fate?! Is that it, you fat purple church warmer!?" Fate lets out a sigh. "Tara," you say. "Lighten up. It's a figure of speech. You're the most paranoid vampire I've ever met." "Not to mention the ugliest." You think to yourself. Tara hisses at Fate before she gets into her car and drives away. Fate shook her head. "Tara was once the most beautiful reporter at the Daily Tombstone until half her face was caught in the sun. Any longer and she would've turned to ash. She's been in a rotten mood ever since. Oh. You better make yourself scarce. Here comes Cleotiti." "Who?" you ask. "Our fashion columnist," replies Fate. "The sweetest girl I know. Cleo used to love humans, especially human children. But when she was in the Van Nuys, some jerk set her on fire and traumatized her for life. Whenever she sees a human she panics and throws a screaming fit."

Your eyes popped. That sounded familiar. You look forward and your jaw drops. "Oh hell." You mutter. The mummy who walked forward was pear-shaped and was wrapped in bright yellow gauze up to her neck. She had dark skin with scarab shaped earrings and long green hair worn in a ponytail. You recognized her right away. That was the same mummy you burned! Just your luck; one of Fate's coworkers was the monster that put you in Under Gloom in the first place."

Cleotiti walks forward and you grab some of Fate's hair in an attempt to hide. "Hi Cleo." Cleo walks up to Fate as you begin to sweat. Will that mummy see the very man who scarred her for life and blow your cover?
15513111.title: The Daily Tombstone

choices: You Attempt to Escape when Fate's not Looking.
Something Shows Up on one of the Screens
155131112.content:
You hope to high heaven that Cleo doesn't notice you. If she saw you and threw a tizzy, Fate would know you were lying and you'd be back to Under Gloom, or worse. But surprisingly, the mummy giantess just waves to Fate and you let out a sigh of relief as she walks away. As Fate walked into the building you begin to laugh to yourself. From the looks of it, everybody is already leaving. It must be around quitting time for everyone else. After all, Fate is the night guard.

"Looks like you'll have the place to yourself tonight." You joke. Fate shrugs her shoulders. "My job is to make sure nobody suspicious gets in after everyone else has already gone home. But sometimes the others stay late." Fate points to a were jackal woman that was busy repairing a hole in the wall. You gulp and see that the were jackal was an hourglass shaped, teal furred jackal with one normal eye and one disfigured eye and for clothing she was wearing a necklace made out of human skulls. That must've been Aurelia. So that's the monster that married Cree. Well, she definitely looked crazy and brutal enough to be soulmate to that horror.

"Is that Aurelia?" you ask Fate as the gargoyle places you on her shoulder. "Yep," says Fate. "She and Cree have been married for ten years now. I'd stay away from her if I were you. The one thing they have most in common is their bloodthirsty appetite towards humans." You shiver but when you look closer, you see Aurelia is more focused on repairing the hole in the wall. "Where the hell did that hole come from?" Fate lets out a sigh. "Tim. Our photographer. The guy has more bad luck than a hellcat. That's why we had to hire Aurelia to undo the damage he did to the place." "Sounds like a real klutz," you say. "What kind of monster is he? A minotaur?" You let out a laugh. "See what I did there?" Fate just let out a groan. Guess the purple bimbo inherited her mom's sense of humor.

"Tim isn't a monster. He's a human." You almost have a mental stroke. A human working for monsters?! What kind of traitor was he? "You've gotta be kidding me?! A human in a work environment like this. That's stupid. The idiot could get himself eaten. I thought you said your boss was a sphinx? Why doesn't she munch him." Fate let out a scoff. "You don't know how sphinxes work, do you David? Lexi can't eat him. He answered her riddle, so she gave him a job instead. Once you answer a sphinx's riddle correctly, you're off limits to her stomach." You roll your eyes. Regardless of how it happened, in your mind, Tim's actions were treason.

As Fate walks forward, you see several of her coworkers who were still working late. One was an obese and naked weretigress wearing jewelry that was ironically made of tiger's eye. Another one was an elderly looking Chinese dragon with green scales and a Chun-Li style hairdo. Third was one just getting ready to leave. She was a fat black furred wererat with bluish black hair. She was wearing a gray shirt with blue jeans and a red jacket. On her shoulder was a goofy looking blond human boy wearing a green jacket, black shirt and a bow tie with cargo pants. That must've been Tim. Looking at him, you find it hard to believe the guy outwitted a sphinx. He looked like a real doof.

The rat giantess noticed Fate and smiled. "Hi Fate," she says. "Who's your friend?" "He says his name is David Xanatos." Says Fate. The wererat girl just rolls her eyes. "My condolences." She says. Apparently she doesn't think much of your fake identity. The rat girl walks forward with Tim on her shoulder as Fate lowers you to Tim's level. "Hi, David," he said. "I'm Tim. You know, I kinda pictured you differently." "Idiot." You think to myself." Tim then gestures to the wererat carrying him. "This beautiful mountain of rodent is my girlfriend, Mazee." You have a mental heart attack. GIRLFRIEND!? The rat was his girlfriend. The idea of a human monster romance disgusted you. And of all monsters, he had to be dating a skyscraper sized sewer dwelling vermin that eats toxic waste?! What is wrong with this guy?! Of course, the fact that she was named Mazee, only added to who her appearance reminded you of. If only it was spelled differently, it would add to the irony.

"He isn't your boyfriend is he, Fate?" asked Mazee. "Your mom would have a cow." You feel sick. The idea of being Fate's boyfriend frightened you. You have no doubt Destiny would be a horrible mother-in-law given how she treats you now. Fate just shakes her head. "Nuh-uh," she says. "A pigeon dropped him in my kitchen and I took him to work because Mom's stress has reached a boiling point. She'd blow her top if she saw a complete stranger in my house." "So she's finally taking a vacation?" asks Tim with a laugh. "That Wade must be a real jerk if he's got her so mad. Willa said the last time she visited Under Gloom, the old girl was spitting nails due to Wade blowing up the septic system in a misguided escape attempt."
